reviews.text: My Honey and I came here for a early dinner! Katelyn our server was fantastic,  very accommodating and friendly  We ordered Crispy Pineapple Chicken, and Crispy Fish Tacos! Our food came quickly and served warm just right! We sat outdoors on the patio! It was a bit windy but still pleasant! All of the staff here where very friendly and kind!

Update: Since this place is too popular, I often buy cheesecake to-go. I love almost every dessert, so it&#39;s really based on your mood or taste.  One thing to know is they are all very sweet. <br><br>---<br><br>We went on a Saturday at 2:30pm during a holiday weekend. We were lucky with a table of 14 to get seated within 30 minutes.  Cheesecake Factory does not take reservations and sometimes takes a 2 hour wait if you go during popular eating times with a group.  We were happy to get in and they have little benches you can sit on while you wait.<br><br>The food was good and bad.  My hubby ordered the chicken pot pie that wasn&#39;t good and a cold the first time. Otherwise here are some good dishes we like:<br><br>Jambalaya <br>Calamari<br>Chicken Madeira<br>Shrimp Scampi<br>Diane Steak<br><br>All of these cheesecakes and cakes are delicious. You just can&#39;t go wrong. The meals come also in big portions and we usually share one meal per person because it&#39;s hard to finish alone. This place is good for a date, but only if you come in during none peak hours.  Otherwise your date and you will to wait in the cold outside.

COVID-19: Social distancing is enforced at this establishment. All of the staff wears a mask. All customers are expected to wear a mask too. The staff also wear gloves. There are some hand sanitizers available for customers to use. This place is available for take outs and has some outdoor seating available with limited capacity. They are also sanitizing in between customers. <br><br>While I was grabbing my food from this establishment last month, I asked if they had any special offers and they weren&#39;t offering any at the moment. They currently don&#39;t have happy hour. They also do not allow pets in their establishment.<br><br>Parking: This establishment is located in a very popular and busy mall. Don&#39;t come here during peak hours or else you will struggle to find a parking spot. Come right when they open or one hour before they close to find parking easily. However, with COVID-19 going on, parking is quite easy to find. <br><br>Food: Big portions of delicious tasty food. Totally worth the price. My friends and I overstuffed ourselves. It&#39;s terrible hahaha. <br><br>Staff: Everyone is super nice and frequently came to check up on us. Our server actually forgot something that we ordered until we were done with eating and paid our bill, but she was very nice and gave it to us for free anyways. Sweet gal.

Been here many times since I live super close to the mall.  You really can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory  and their extensive menu. There&#39;s something for everyone even the pickiest eater.  I don&#39;t drink alcohol so I normally go straight for the food and desserts!  A few of my favs are: Bang Bang Chicken, Chicken Madiera, Cinnamon Roll Pancakes (weekends only), Avocado Eggrolls, and their endless basket of their wheat bread!  I really like most of the items from their Skinnylicious menu as well. This is a good balance since most of their entrees can easily be 2,000 calories per dish. <br><br>One time we had to send back our brussel sprouts order because it was 90% burnt, however the replacement was only a tad better. I think that&#39;s just the way they do their brussel sprouts here, so we won&#39;t be ordering that anymore. We recently visited twice in a week for their $20 Burgers/Drinks/Fries/Cheesecake special.  It was easy enough to order online for curbside pickup.  Whoa, it was a pretty chaotic! I think they had no idea how popular this deal would be. We choose curbside pickup but no one ever picked up the phone. So we waited close to 45 minutes passed our picked-up time to finally get our food. This is also AFTER some random lady decided to take our order.  However our food was delicious and it was such a good deal we decided to order it again 2 days later. This time they actually texted us and our order was ready at curbside.  Since it was takeout, both times we reheated our food in toaster oven and it was good as new.  I hope they bring back this deal again with other Happy Hour menu items.  <br><br>Overall I know the staff work hard here, and really appreciated everyone were masked up during Covid.  We will definitely be back once dine-in opens up again.  Just try to come early when it opens to minimize the wait time!

Their food is cooked well but the wait is ridiculous during the holidays you would expect them to be prepared and have everything handled people have waited at least 4 hours to pick up their food they had ordered earlier on..

Me and my girlfriend went to this location today. Sadly had to cancel our pick up order. It took 2 hours of waiting! People were standing outside all sad waiting for the food. I can tell the staff tried their best. But most of them rushed around and didn&#39;t make eye contact and barely helped ! I literally had to go to another location to get 2 slices of cake. Bad way to start new years.

Came here for my birthday dinner- since this is my absolute favorite restaurant! <br>The menu itself is basically a huge novel. Zack the greeter was amazing and was in such a great spirit mood. Our waiter Cody was the best waiter I have ever had at a Cheesecake Factory. Every time I come now I want Zack and Cody to help me. This Cheesecake Factory is my go to location. The Pasadena one is closer to my house, however; the extra mileage is worth it.

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times with really no issues. Food was decent along with the service. Up until the encounter during their two burgers deal for $20. I had ordered the deal online right around 12:10am on the last day of the deal for a curbside pick up. Everything was fine; got my confirmation for 1:00pm pick up. I didn&#39;t know exactly how this worked besides going step by step by their instruction to wait in the parking lot. I got to the parking lot about 12:55pm and waited a bit. I see cars lined up so I&#39;m assuming they got a text. However, it was around 1:15pm when I decided to call and ask what the update was as I haven&#39;t received any text. Was able to speak with someone and she said that they were backed up about 100 orders which is odd because I&#39;m not sure why they&#39;re cranking out so many orders especially if they knew even cooking would back them up. She got my name down and said she&#39;ll let the Manager know to text me soon. Waited another 15 mins and still nothing. I decided to ask one of the staff who brought out an order to someone else and I asked what their pick up time was. She mentioned it was 12:30pm pick up so ok, they are kind of backed up. So then about 1:45pm hit and so I decided to walk in.<br><br>I walked in and waited to talk to someone. I don&#39;t know if it was the heat or maybe the amount of orders (slowing down at this time because I didn&#39;t see as many people picking up) and asked where my order was. She checked in the kitchen once and came back empty handed and told me she couldn&#39;t find my order. So this is odd so I was kind of pissed at this point but I kept my cool and showed her my email confirmation. I told her this is ridiculous having to wait outside like this. She then proceeded back into the kitchen and grabbed a Grubhub order since she probably couldn&#39;t confirm. 1 hour later, I got my order (well, somebody else&#39;s order who ordered via Grubhub). No apology from the staff and just gave me my food with this mean look. Thanks though? Unbelievable.

This has to be the worst birthday to go order ive ever received from this cheesecake factory location! I asked for one order medium rare and one order medium well for grilled steak. They got the order wrong! <br><br>And again! No forks and knife?!?!?! How are we going to enjoy the meal without the utensils?!?! <br><br>I dont expect 3  resturant services from you guys but come on... are we going to eat this with hands? Or is it because we are asian,you guys EXPECT us to eat with chopsticks?!

We were at this place on Friday for lunch when they brought us to a table outside. After I set down I almost through up from the dirty patio table. It was filled with food droppings and also some hairs.  I complained to the waitress and asked for an another table. She said we have to wait 20 minutes. Forget it, we just left. <br>NO APOLOGIES FROM HER AND FROM THE MANAGER! INCREDIBLY RUDE.

If I could give this location negative stars, I would. Anyone reading this review, do yourself a favor and take your business elsewhere.<br><br>Ordered pick up this past Saturday at 6pm. Received an email stating that the food would be ready at 654pm. Made my way over to the restaurant, my pick up time came and not one text message received from the restaurant alerting me that my food was ready or that they were going to bring my food to me. I get out of my car and wait in line for over 30 mins to pick up my food. The food received was lukewarm at best. Dont know how food that came out of the kitchen can get so cold so fast. Spent over $90 on this order and I assure it&#39;ll be the last time I come here.<br><br>Before the person or bot replies to this post and gives the same generic response as it does to others, I have sent a email to that address before and nothing got resolved. Your restaurant keeps committing the same subpar service and serving the same subpar food at outrageous prices.
Their Banana cheesecake is a must try! They have a variety of flavors and dishes to offer. If you&#39;re craving for pasta, give them a try!

Woke up happy and thankful for Cheesecake Factory :) , had the best birthday I&#39;ve had yet! <br><br>- THE FOOD:<br>- actually came really fast, <br>- portions are big we definitely have rest overs <br>- macaroni burger is never a let down <br>- the meatballs in the spaghetti and meatballs are the best <br>- the salads are always fillings and big portions<br><br>- the birthday ice cream has this really good fudge chocolate stuff in it, and sprinkles on top <br><br>- we took home 4 cheesecakes :) the oreo, red velvet, mango, and lemon one :) all good of course<br><br>- made a reservation for 8, we didn&#39;t have to wait :)<br><br>- Our server Cody was the best! I really mean it, never had a better server, he was personable and made sure we got our food and drinks. He was attentive, also gave me suggestions when I didn&#39;t know what to get, and his choice was good. <br><br>Going on a date back to cheesecake this upcoming week! Probably will get the chicken Alfredo. it was my bfs first time here and has been my favorite since a kid, now we both love it! Excited for more food and I bet the service will be great too

Bummed about not getting our order on 5/31/2020.  Are order was placed online a little before 3:00 pm on the day of.  We scheduled it for pick up at 5:00pm. We arrived a little after 5:00pm to find out the restaurant is closed since 4:30 due to the LA county curfew set at 6:00 Thank you to the looters.  I get it the establishment is looking out for its employees.  The only thing that bothers me is at least give me a heads up.  Send me an email that your closing early or if we want to pick up our order at a earlier time.  I know I wasn&#39;t the only one.  There was a lot more people scratching their heads asking what&#39;s up?  Don&#39;t get me wrong foods great, just a notification would have been great about closing early.

I ordered the Santa Fe salad on 2 different nights last week and NO CHICKEN included as part of the ingredients.  After complaining, no problem with the next order - the protein was included, thank goodness. <br><br>Tonight, I ordered the Chinese Chicken salad, the protein was SKIPPED AGAIN.  Undoubtedly, major DISAPPOINTMENT ! ! !  Just, what is going on  ?  ?  <br><br>Have been a loyal fan of Cheesecake Factory for YEARS, YEARS &amp; YEARS. The recent SUBSTANDARD service discouraged my FREQUENT/ CONTINUOUS support. <br><br>Friendly advice to the restaurant - PLEASE REDO the menu if there is NO CHICKEN included in the salads.  STOP the MISLEADING / BAD BUSINESS PRACTICE.

We did an online order a couple weeks ago and it was horrible! The food would have been better if the service wasn&#39;t so bad!  Not sure if they had forgotten about my order but my husband shouldn&#39;t have to wait 30mins for our food when I expect to have it ready by a certain time. I gave them my feedback regarding the food and service and appreciate their general manager Ian following up, but unfortunately I&#39;m still waiting on that follow up! Please do not say you are going to do something and not follow through. So based on service I would rate this place as one star, considering it&#39;s all pick up order right now customer service should be a priority in getting those customers to come back again. Just very disappointed overall.

Do not eat the Sourdough bread at cheesecake!!!!!!!!!! I repeat!! Do not!!! I went there for dinner and when I was eating the bread... it was so hard it CRACKED the crown on my tooth! Now I have to get a replacement for $400 dollars!  <br><br>I didn&#39;t even get my meal covered! I had to eat with ONLY ONE SIDE OF MY MOUTH THE WHOLE TIME. <br><br>Honestly I love cheesecake but wtf. That bread was way too hard....

I&#39;ve been here many times and Cheesecake Factory never disappoints me. They updated their menu due to the Coronavirus and the limit of supplies they have. Their customer service is great and to go orders are always fast and easy. I&#39;m sad to hear from others about their experience. As much as Cheesecake Factory is a business, they are not used to so many online orders at once since they are used to customers coming into the restaurant. So, I would give them some time. The workers were really nice and they started to put up 6ft. apart lines from customers coming in and from the cashiers.

So. Slow. <br><br>Every time I try to get a cheesecake slice to go, they take the order but for some reason IT TAKES SO LONG to put it in a container and squeeze a dollop of whipped cream on it. <br><br>You can see everyone in the back taking 4-5 peoples orders and fulfilling them after. Somehow understaffed. <br><br>Chocolate truffle cake is way too sweet and steer clear of the white chocolate raspberry cheesecake. It&#39;s oddly mushy. The quality of them has definitely declined over time.

Night mere and ruined our christmas eve dinner.<br>Placed order by phone, went to pick up after more than an hour.<br><br>It was short handed, no one at the front to tell us where to pick up..waited very long time before we even get to talk to a worker to check on pur order...<br>Customers were all waiting but no one knows whsts going on.  Nobody knows whsts the line is for...<br>Why short handed on a Christmas eve?????<br>After waited for 40 mins still no idea if i can ever get my food, <br>I told one of the worker to cancel my order and left..<br>We had Panda express instead.<br>This is a lesson for me.   Should never order foid on occasion lije this.<br>They cant handle the task!!

This place is an all time favorite.  I&#39;ve always had a pleasant dining experience here.<br><br>When I do eat here, I always go for the Mac and Cheese burger.  If you haven&#39;t tried this, you don&#39;t know what you&#39;re missing.  It&#39;s a generous scoop of mac and cheese that&#39;s fried and placed on top of a hamburger patty.  It add just the right amount of crunch and creamy cheesy texture, and everything just melts in your mouth.  <br><br>We also got the pork belly sliders.  These are equally delicious as the mac and cheese burger, except you get FOUR OF THEM!!  The sliders came with deep fried pickles and covered with yummy goodness sauce that leaves your taste buds tingling.  <br><br>And their cheesecake is always in par.  It&#39;s in their name....you can&#39;t go wrong with their selection.  Every choice is a great choice.  There&#39;s no way to try every one of their tasty cheesecakes.  They&#39;re always creating new flavors, and they also have seasonal flavors for limited time.<br><br>Maybe they should create a variety pack, where you can choose up to 4 different slices for a reasonable price.....hmmm.....I&#39;m just saying.
100% happy with my Salmon &amp; Steak Diane  cooked to perfection. Service was excellent. Patio sitting available.

11/9/19 Like any other location of The Cheesecake Factory, this one is bustling with business and long wait lines. But wait! They have Yelp reservations! Yup! But you still wait for another 20-30 minutes. So while waiting and standing waiting to be called, you could check out the display of wonderful and delicious cheesecakes. Yummy to my tummy!<br><br>When called, we were lead to our table...it was clean and just right for the 2 of us. Our server was a sweet one and started us of with drinks and appetizers. Ok...the timing of the appetizers and your main entree will be really close so I suggest just get small bites plate or just nibble on the warm bread and who knows you can ask for one more haha!<br><br>We had the chicken sliders...though very tasty and comes with do it your own sorta kinda sandwich with tomatoes, pickles, lettuce, and mayo, the bread was greasy good. The sliders can already be the main meal for a person!<br><br>I had the shrimp scampi and herb salmon with mashed potatoes...heavy sauced, creamy, and loaded with calories! They were delicious.<br><br>Husband had the grilled pork chop which was a thick cut with apple sauce and mashed potatoes. Cooked well and just right.<br><br>We topped our dinner with the dulce de Le he cheesecake which was so good! <br><br>Will be back sometime again!

There&#39;s no cheese cake better than at the cheese cake factory, especially when they have their special promotion going that if you spend over $30 you get a free slice of any cheesecake per transaction. <br>   On behalf of me and my girlfriend I can not express enough at how delicious and scrumptious the peanut butter and chocolate cheese cake it. **its a must for all Reese&#39;s lovers** the fried Mac and cheese balls are something that you have to get when you stop by. They&#39;re perfectly fried with a soft yet crunchy outer, and a perfectly cheesy center. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich just want to let you guys know that it is 100 times better than anything from Popeyes. If you are still looking to dine in somewhere I would not suggest to Ming here as they are currently adhering to the states laws and regulations and following social distancing to help combat the spread of covid 19. They are currently still open for take out and pick up!!!  Enjoy everyone!!!&#39;

The Cheesecake Factory has been a stable for this Arcadia Westfield Mall for years, and till this day, it is still a very popular choice among the hungry shoppers. On any given Friday night, you&#39;re probably looking at a guaranteed wait, anywhere from 30 to 45 minutes to get a table...<br><br>...And I just don&#39;t understand why.<br><br>Simply put, I am not a fan. I still remember vividly today that years ago, I was served a entree of chicken parmesan at this very same location that was so exceedingly salty, I had to send it back. Thankfully, the restaurant did not charge me, (and I thank the staff for such great service,) but this less than pleasant experience had prevented me from venturing back to this eatery for years and years.<br><br>And yet, here I was just a few nights ago, thinking I would give it another chance. A little date night at TCF. Sigh. Spoiler alert: it wasn&#39;t the greatest decision. It certainly was not impressive to either me or my significant other.<br><br>To cut the story short: the food *still* sucks here.<br><br>And I am not talking about mildly unacceptable. It&#39;s actually grossly repulsive, especially considering the quality that this name brand should carry, and its corresponding price tags.<br><br>Well, let&#39;s walk you through this anyway.<br><br>First, the complimentary bread came in two variety: a brown one and a sour dough type of bread. The brown one tasted very good; it went very well with their savory butter, and it was easily one of the best parts of our meals. Quite sad indeed.<br><br>The appetizer, the crab bites, cost us $8, and was nothing spectacular. It&#39;s a miniature version of crab cakes kinda, but it&#39;s essentially crab meat rolled into balls then deep fried. There&#39;s nothing sophisticated about its execution or presentation, and you simply drench them in lemon juice, dip them into a tartar sauce, and enjoy. It tasted fine, but it isn&#39;t something you can&#39;t easily whip up at home, and it&#39;s way too overpriced at $8. I&#39;d skip it, had I known.<br><br>The entrees, however, were criminally expensive for the value (or lack thereof) we received. I ordered the truffle honey chicken, the better of the two choices, and my bf ordered the chicken bellagio, which I highly recommend *against* selecting.<br><br>My meal, the truffle honey chicken, was mostly redeemed by the delicious mixture of sweet honey and irresistible aroma of truffle oil, served alongside with pieces of respectably fried chicken. But let&#39;s be real, this is just fried chicken breasts dipped in a nice sauce or dressing. It isn&#39;t that hard to mess up on, and it&#39;d be great tasting no matter what: Fried stuff, plus honey, plus truffle? It&#39;s a winner... almost.<br><br>What convinced me that this was still an average product was the accompanying mashed potato (eh, it&#39;s ok) and asparagus (terrible). I could cook better asparagus at home! Out of the 6 stalks of asparagus stingily placed on my plate, 5 of them had tough-to-chew bottoms... You know, the parts that should&#39;ve been deemed too hard for most chefs (and their patrons), and therefore should be cut off, and not served? Yeah, they made their way to my plate. They really dropped the ball on that one.<br><br>The other entree, the chicken bellagio, was an even bigger fail. It&#39;s composed of 3 parts--pasta, chicken, and salad with prosciutto. The salad was fine. The chicken was a little dry, but passable, and seasoned quite sufficiently. The pasta, the main carb of the dinner, was unforgivably overcooked. It was dry as heck, without flavor, and an outright sin to retail restaurants. I am a pretty terrible cook when it comes to cooking spaghetti at home. (It requires good timing.) And this was about the same specie of abomination I would conjure up. It was horrid.<br><br>Come on, Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>The entire bill came out to be around $55ish or higher, and my bf and I both felt there was no justification, I mean seriously, none at all, for TCF to be charging this level of payment for subpar, marginally inedible dishes.<br><br>It was this bad years ago, and it&#39;s still this bad years from then. There&#39;s no improvement whatsoever in my experience.<br><br>All in all, the chefs were to blame. And if your business depends on FOOD to survive, that ain&#39;t good news.<br><br>The silver lining, if there was one, was that the portions were generous enough to match its prices. We had leftovers--leftovers that we weren&#39;t excited to revisit, tbh, since the dinner was overall such an underwhelming experience. Had the dishes been any smaller, however, and still charging at roughly 20-something dollar a dish, I would undoubted given this review a 1 star rating.<br><br>I do commend our servers, and all the associated staff, for working with their best attitudes and efficiency in serving us the customers. They were, for the most part, attentive and caring enough; and for them, I granted one more star on top of the abysmal performance from the kitchen. So 2 stars total.<br><br>Will not return, obvi. Sorry. (I do wish the company best of luck and much needed improvements in the future.)

Who doesn&#39;t love a good cheesecake? Portions are generous and the quality is quite good. <br><br>At working lunch today, we were greeted warmly and the server knew all her favorites to give us suggestions. I skipped the meal and went straight to cheesecake. Shared the mango key lime cheesecake and the red velvet cheesecake with my big brother who always seems to have an endless appetite. Thank goodness for that or else we would never have finished the mango key lime cheesecake given how sweet it was for my palette. But the red velvet cheesecake was seemingly perfect! <br><br>As always I will keep coming back here because of the little wait and the wonderful value here. Cheers!!
Giving 3 stars because customer service contacted me and rectified the situation in a timely manner.

Hubs and I went for lunch, Split the Bar-b-que ranch chicken salad, swapped Salmon for chicken (minor up charge) This is a 2,000 calorie salad. If you think salads will help you loose weight...don&#39;t count on this one. It was very tasty and one half (with bread) left me full.  What surprised me tho, was the &#34;No Handguns&#34; symbol in the window.

I arrived to pick up my food a few minutes before the time the website said.  Long line and no food walking out for a long time. When they finally got the food flowing out, the server was very helpful. But bottom line the food was cold!  I&#39;m not planning on using curbside again!

This place is better than the 3 stars on yelp. The food is good and they have a variety of menu items. They have a huge kids menu. Wife had the Impossible burger which was pretty good. As good as most regular beef burgers. I had the  chicken Parmesan pizza style which is a like a chicken parmigiana kind of. Except it looks like a pizza. A pizza shaped piece of chicken that is topped with a sprinkle of pasta, cheese and tomato sauce. <br>And of course they have their wide variety of awesome cheese cakes. <br>Our waitress was awesome. I wish I remembered her name. She checked on us often but not too often. Most of the staff greeted us warmly and with a smile. Pretty welcoming. <br>I would definitely come back. Only drawback is parking which can be a pain on weekends because the mall does get quite busy.

Big portions but service needs to improve. Coming here for a birthday for 6 and waiting a while before servers started coming to bring bread or drinks to us. Refills take awhile to get as servers are not around to check up on you. The food isnt bad but lots of butter.<br><br>Got the pork chop which was juicy and good with mashed potatoes.<br><br>The split steak and salmon combo is a little small in portions but mashed potatoes is like alot to help you fill up. Flavor is good and steak was cooked well at a medium rare. The salmon was flavorful but super tiny, asparagus that came with it is flavorful as well. <br><br>The pot pie was good but a mashed style crust and less of a bake pot pie style. <br><br>The spaghetti was super good and salty

I love the fact that The Cheesecake Factory takes reservations through Yelp. We decided to stop by here after shopping and had set up reservation through Yelp app and when we arrived our table was ready. It was nice walking by the crowd waiting for tables. I just love this place. Nice feel to it while dining. The only thing that was a negative was that there was a family of 6 with four little ones that were just a bit loud, but we all have been there as parents.

Don&#39;t order to go. Cheesecake was running a $20 special for 2 burgers. I ordered more than an hour in advance with a scheduled pick up time. The line was out of the door. And the curbside pick up line didn&#39;t move an inch for 30 minutes. I called for order status and was put on hold for over 2

During these crazy times when we are all working remotely I order food for delivery at least twice a week. Today I had the absolute worst experience in a long time.  The manager at this location was so rude when I contacted her to tell them the doctors office I sent food to only received 5 out of the six.  And by the way I used to order from this location a least once a month not any longer. How hard would it have been to offer to make another lunch the doctor could pick up...but all she said was I packed the bag myself and I remember putting all 6 in the bag....goodbye Cheesecake.... <br>No need to talk to me.. talk to your employees...Leadership is needed now more then ever !!!! Stand up and require them to take accountability...Those that don&#39;t lead will fail!

Pricey. Huge portions kinda scared when i see the calories per meal. But decent food. Can indulge in it once in a while, good service , grt interiors, i had crispy chicken tenders it was good , strawberry sauce cheesecake tasted good , crab cakes was a bit tooo greasy for me.loved the passion fruit fizz drink..Overall good place to chillout

I understand that during Covid there have been staff reductions, but there should be some sort of system in place to notify customers when their curbside pick up order will be delayed by an hour!  Terrible management of the situation and something needs to be put in place to email customers who have placed orders trying to support businesses during this time.  I will give my business to another restaurant to help them stay in business.

Inside Santa Anita Mall parking lot.. Monday lunch was empty and we got seated right away. Our server was friendly and helpful, but the food took a while to come out.<br><br>I got the Chicken Mango Avocado Lunch Salad ($12.95) and Mojito ($6.95 during happy hour 4-6pm M-F). My friend got the cheesecake that has Cherry Ghirardelli stuff in it. I forgot the name sorry.<br><br>Complimentary bread came out warm, along with the butter. As usual, one of the harder/crispy white french bread, and the other one was the brown with oatmeals on top that was sweet. Both were great.<br><br>The lunch salad was huge. It had greens, mango, grilled chicken, red cabbage, shaved green onions, crunchy onions/wonton strips, tossed in some kind of vinegraitte dressing. It was good and fresh, just the dressing overall was a bit too sweet for me. Also the mango was a bit too soft. No biggie though. I got so full.<br><br>If you have a birthday here you get a mini sundae with whipcream and a candle haha. <br><br>The Cherry Ghirardelli Cheesecake was okay. Not the type of cake I like. It&#39;s too creamy, soft and foamy. Lol. Some people love this kind of cake. So it just depends on your taste bud.<br><br>Mojito was refreshing. Came with cut lime and mint leaves. Very good. Not too sweet. Perfect taste for me.<br><br>Overall just like other cheesecake factory places. 4/5

The customer service center has contacted me and willing to fix the issue. Visited the restaurant in Pasadena location without a curbside pickup. The experience was great. I will come back for that location in the future.

This is one of my fav restaurant. We went back again  on Tuesday for the 7 item $20 cheese burger deal. <br>So pack that day. We still have to wait  50 for our pick up time.<br>But I understand, because the deal so many people come and they do their best to make everyone happy.

pretty consistent when it comes to messing up take out or delivery orders. ordered through door dash:<br><br>2 kids chicken strips with extra ranch and extra honey mustard on the side for both orders as well as 2 milks. <br><br>1 kids spaghetti and meatballs extra sauce on the side<br><br>factory burrito. <br><br>missing all condiments. missing extra sauce. missing both milks. missing bread. missing utensils. i&#39;m surprised I even got the right order. I only tolerate this place cause the kids like it.

I was pretty disappointed this time around at cheesecake. I&#39;ve been to this location before and it was great but this time the service wasn&#39;t as good as it was before. My friends surprised me with a birthday dinner and when we were ordering the server didn&#39;t have a very good attitude. The food was good though like it always is. I ordered the farfalle chicken pasta and the pot pie. They were both pretty good! When my friend asked them if there was anything special for birthday they brought out a small bowl of whipped cream, there was barely any ice cream under it. The table next to us had the free birthday ice cream too and it was the typical one. Cheesecake Factory has really good food but if they can improve on their customer service, I believe that more people would come by.

If you want to have Mother&#39;s Day ruined, this Cheesecake Factory is the place to go. No social distancing, no organization, no truthfulness in wait times, having us and many others wait over 3 hours and counting for food that was never prepared or accounted for, to be told they&#39;re still &#34;looking&#34; for people&#39;s orders. And, we already paid for it. How can an order that we paid for be lost?! Ridiculous, absurd, and fraudulent.<br>Update: we still waited, they said the order would be ready in 10 min. Another hour later they took the ticket back and lost the order. The manager asked if I had a copy of the confirmation which means after taking my ticket they still didn&#39;t start cooking!! What the hell is wrong with them, seriously.

Yesterday we decided to have lunch at The Cheesecake Factory Arcadia, and it was amazing! My wife had the Renés Special, I had the Turkey club, and my son had the kids grill cheese, everything came out exactly as we ordered and the curbside service was on-point! Keep up the good work in these trying times.

Happy hour drinks and food with complimentary cheesecake bread?? Sign me up! This review is just for their Happy Hour which is M-F from 4-6PM. Just sit at the bar/tables near the bar area and ask for the happy hour menu. Drinks and most food items are $6.95, which is honestly a steal for the amount of food you get. <br><br>We got the sweet corn tamale cakes, the perfect combination of savory and sweet, and was presented as a boat which I thought was cute. We also got the factory nachos loaded with delicious melted cheese, guac, sour cream, salsa, green onions, &amp; jalapeños. Both portions were hugeeee and more than enough food for my party of two! We even asked our waiter for extra salsa and jalapeños because the bottom of our nachos was looking kinda sad and he happily obliged free of charge. <br><br>Overall a fan of the service and food I received, will be back to try all the other items on their extensive happy hour menu!
Make reservations at 4.30 today for dining  . After they reopen from Covide 19 . Food still good and service excellent . helping waitress by give them more tip please .

I really hate to be this person but long story short i called in for curbside pick up. They one, did not have my order set for curbside, rather for pick in store up. So it was sitting there for however long before I had to call and ask what the status was. Two, I ordered chicken Madeira with a side of bow tie pasta and Alfredo (an extra $4 I&#39;m always happy to pay each time I order it). Opening my dinner after a long day to realize that the meal was entirely dry (no Madeira sauce, no Alfredo sauce. Just plain chicken and dry pasta) was incredibly disappointing. I know times are hard right now but I mean COME ON.

I&#39;m asked if I wanted the happy hour section - sure why not! Never ever sit in that section - no one EVER came to my table or said &#39;I&#39;ll be right with you nothing! I decided to be reseated in an area with wait staff. I sat here waiting for someone to come. Finally a waitress comes over and apologized. She stated the young lady who sat me in a section where it is hard to see if someone was seated. <br><br>The food was decent (my chicken piccata needed more sauce but still so good)  and my drink was delicious! The upside down pineapple cheesecake is worth another slice. I have no complaints except for the length I had to wait to be acknowledged to spend my money.

Made me wait for 15 minutes while my food was ready. Now I&#39;m eating cold food. Thanks for not being organized during the pandemic.  Ask me about the details and I&#39;ll explain it gladly to anyone.<br><br>I love the way guest services cut and paste the generic reply to all the unsatisfied customers.

Terrible terrible service!  I ordered food online for pickup at 5:00.  Got to cheesecake to pick up and the manager told me to wait in the car and I&#39;ll receive a text when my food is ready.  I went back to my car and waited and waited and waited and never got a text. I finally called to ask where my order was and Skyler told me it&#39;s here I&#39;ll bring it out.  When she brought it out to my car At 5:30 I let her know that I never got a text that my food was ready.  Her response I&#39;m not in charge of texts.

I will start with the food is always good. The service was abysmal, I ordered online for a scheduled pick up, and after arriving at the stated time i was waiting in a line outside for half an hour to be told my order had not been started yet. This is unacceptable service, if it will take that much longer to fulfill orders then your online system needs to be updated for the delays.

Well that was an absolute horrible curbside experience. Scheduled pickup for 12:30, received food (after 4 inquiries via telephone) at 1:26. This is just another review echoing everyone else&#39;s poor review regarding pickup service. If you have a chance to order from anywhere else, do it.
Tried all day to reach this place and the phone is busy. I paid for food I did not receive yet if I go to their restaurant eat and not pay I get arrested. I have been ripped off

not taking covid safety regulations seriously. went with my fiancé and the silverware was used and there were lipstick stains on the cups. The waiter was amazing, super nice and got us new ones. She&#39;s honestly the only reason this review is even getting a star at all. In a pandemic, things people put in their mouths should be given extra attention to when washing. Now my fiancé needs to self quarantine just in case he starts to develop symptoms, which if he does, they&#39;ll definitely be receiving a lawsuit on their hands.

Came to the Cheesecake Factory with my Girlfriend and decided to get two cocktails. No price was listed so I thought to myself no way these cost more than 6-10$ because of the externally small size eventually I found out that the mediocre drink was 15$ each for about 4oz didn&#39;t bother me much so I just ordered my meal which was carne asada steak once I got it the rice was externally plane and corn was watery the steak had no seasoning and was drowned in oil overall 4/10 for a 18$ meal. My girlfriend also said he enchiladas were cold and bland and they were also around the 20$ price point. Overall we spent 100$ after leaving a 20$ tip for the great waitress that served us. Covid or not I do not understand how a business can justify serving us that blow average of food for 100$. No quality at all do not waste your time here plenty of other small businesses will appreciate the money

I compared the salads between different chains, and Cheesecake&#39;s is a strength. I recommend trying the salad.<br><br>As far as the vinegrette, the only way I can describe it is a little too sweet and acidic so pour a little.

I have been several times and ordered different menus. Their Cheesecakes are awesome, unfortunately, other than that, I have not found other good regular foods. I order their meatloaf, it is meh. I ordered their Orange Chicken, also not good. I ordered their oriental salad... they forgot to put dressing. After I asked for the dressing, it is still not good. I mostly go there or take out food from there because my wife like it there. My wife tends to order seafood menus, but I am not a fan of seafood menu.
I had a great server, Melissa A. She was wonderful. Anything I wanted or needed she was right there with a smile on her face. I really enjoyed my lunch.
Cheesecake factory has always been consistent with their service, food, and price increase. Although it is a great restaurant for large party celebration, the mid-tier ($$) food is at most alright.

So disappointed with this Cheesecake factory today. It is my all time favorite restaurant and I was shocked with the service my brother and I received today. We both ordered pasta and with my dish I asked to switch the noodles. <br>My brother drove 30 minutes to Arcadia fyi and asked them to double check our order before going home.<br>When he got home we noticed that they did not only forget to switch the noodles BUT THEY ALSO gave the incorrect pasta. It was exactly the same as my brothers pasta with no chicken. I ordered something completely different. <br>Mind you this was a $40+ meal that we paid for... we have had no issues with Cheesecake factory until today.<br>So we wanted to call them and let them know. <br>The manager Tasha was so rude and took a total of 20-30 minutes to try and find a solution. She said she would refund us for the food but that&#39;s all she would do.<br>The refund was on our gift card. (she only gave us numbers for the card) we didn&#39;t even have our print out paper anymore. She also said that the food was sitting here waiting if we wanted to come pick it up.<br>We asked for an explanation on the staff and would not tell us any details.<br>Pretty pathetic for an hour round trip for food. This was such a horrible experience, I was blown away. It was so infuriating and the pasta was not EVEN GOOD! The quality was horrible, the sauce was so watery.... this just made our night so horrible.<br>Tasha SHOULD NOT be the manager and when we asked for the corporate phone number, she gave us ATTITUDE and told us to look online for the number.<br>Way to go Tasha! Great customer service! (Insert sarcasm here) <br>So so so so so bummed that this is what we tried to support!

I took advantage of their 7 for $20 to-go deal and i&#39;m very impressed!  First time ordering to-go from Cheesecake and they think of everything! From the complimentary bread, butter, ketchup and utensils, I didn&#39;t have to use any of my things. The food was as expected, always good.  <br><br>Only downside was the cheesecake. The deal stated oreo cheesecake but they ran out and instead of informing me and giving me an option, they gave me salted caramel. Not a fan.... wished they&#39;d ask before packing. <br><br>Just had to compliment how great their to-go was. Keep up the great work!

Been here maybe 7 times, not sure why I haven&#39;t written a review. I am not really a fan of the cheesecake factory but my family wanted to come here to celebrate my birthday for convenience. I ordered the fried shrimp. The shrimp was not nasty at all however there was absolutely zero seasoning on the shrimp. The fries were good and the ranch dressing was on point. <br><br>My dad ordered breakfast however, he didnt receive his eggs and potatoes the way he requested them. The waiter was super nice and accommodating. He had my dads food remade and he was satisfied. Everyone else in my party seemed to like their food so no complaints there.

I was here last tuesday with my friends, I tried their frozen iced mango smoothie, so far it was the best mango smoothie for me. And the good thing the server was nice,  forgot her name. Anyways. I&#39;m craving for this now.

Came here last night with my son, decided to try it out since all my friends rave about this place. Got the cheese steak and my son got the pepperoni pizza. Obviously they aren&#39;t known for their philly cheese steaks so I didn&#39;t expect much but it didn&#39;t let me down. Wouldn&#39;t say it&#39;s the best, my son loved his pizza . The service was good as well was the ambience . I&#39;ll definitely be back since I live so close !

Pretty good spot to have some decent food. This location here does get crowded due to being in the Westfield mall shopping center but still your wait time won&#39;t be that long, we waited for about 15 minutes so it wasn&#39;t that bad compare to other locations. <br><br>The waiting area inside it is pretty small not a whole lot of seating so you&#39;ll probably have to wait standing up. We were really only going there for the cheesecake who doesn&#39;t right? After being inside for a few minutes and smelling all that good food we said what the heck let&#39;s just eat here so decided to dine in. The food personally it wasn&#39;t bad but I think it could of been better my family liked it so they were good with it. Portion wise they were on point everyone got plenty. <br><br>I just think the food needs a little bit more flavor/seasoning some of it was pretty bland but again my family was happy with it. Also like others on here I think it is overpriced but hey it is what it is. The service was fair we did have to ask for refills but no attitude from the server so I guess that made up for it. The place was pretty clean inside and out in the patio area, the only thing some of our utensils were dirty so we asked for new ones. <br><br>Overall the family was happy with the food, as for me I&#39;ll just stick to what they are known for the CHEESECAKE!!

WARNING DO NOT GO HERE FOR TO GO ORDERS<br><br>they are clearly unorganized and can not deal with orders to go. I drove about 20 minutes each way to pick up my order, by the time i got home i found out orders were missing. Also when i was there i asked them to double check and she said they double always. So that is a lie of course.<br><br>I understand mistake happen and we are all human but what really prompt me to make the review is the rudeness of the manager  i spoke to. her name is Tasha, I explained the situation to her and her first reaction was to laugh at my misery.<br><br>she was &#34;oh yeah we were wondering why we have your extra order here hehehehe&#34; and continues to say &#34;hahah tough times so things like this happen&#34;  and &#34;oh well&#34;<br><br>i am quoting word for word. This kind of business or employee should not go on without notice. i hate to try to personalize this but at this incompetency but not be swept under the rug as who knows how many people she laughs at and take advantage of. <br><br>BEWARE OF TASHA the manager.

Waited exactly 8:29 minutes to get someone on the line to place an order. <br>When the bakery finally answered. I asked, are you guys very busy? She replied, &#34;no. We&#39;re quite slow.&#34; And I replied, &#34;well I waited over 8 minutes to place my order, in which she replied, &#34;oh. Well, someone just told me there&#39;s a call.&#34; <br>No apology, no nothing. <br><br>Cheesecake Factory!! Pull yourself together!

Not coming back here if I have to sit in the sun and get little portions of my breakfast order! Our waitress was kind enough to get my order right. Still not enough to convince me to spend full price on my food with a kids portion.

The hostess was horrible! She completely brushed me off and would ignore me &amp; my mom. When I emailed the company, because I was brushed off by the hostess, they didn&#39;t gave me excuses.  I mentioned she wouldn&#39;t even acknowledge me, she wouldn&#39;t make eye contact and dismissed me as if I was less than. The company&#39;s email said that they were probably just really busy. If I treated clients this way I would be out of a job. <br><br>Waiters and waitress here are beyond phenomenal. This used to be my favorite location.

Went to the chesse cake factory this Tuesday for lunch with my mama. Due to covid-19 we ordered by phone , so we can eat in the car,  though they provided seating with umbrellas in the parking lot and porch area.  We ordered a salad and a pasta,  they said it would take 30 min...went in after 20min to pay.  While I was waiting , there were people complaining left and right saying they ordered their meals online , and after 1hr, 2hrs their meals were not ready.  The bar area had a table full of bags with food,  waitresses were running with food orders out the front door,  It was just a big mess.  After another 20 minutes the guy at the counter came back,  said he could not find my order, it was never placed.  I hope they get it together soon.

Never AGAIN!<br>We ordered huevos rancheros only to discover that the eggs well-well done.  This dish is supposed to be served sunny-side up.  While they took the liberty to prepare a new dish, the rest of my party were finished with their meals by the time the new eggs were prepared.  The manager refused to remove the item from our bill.
We placed order to go and waited over an hour and than my husband ordered a slice of cheesecake and just that slice took over 20 minutes.  The service was terrible and the workers didn&#39;t care.

We placed an online order for pick-up. Although our meal was ready for pick up on-time and our order was accurate, parking really sucked. The staff was friendly, professional, and attentive. The restaurant is attached to a large shopping mall, with a parking lot that caters to compact cars. They should seriously consider incorporating designated parking for their establishment.

I do not recommended this location. Go to another Cheesecake Factory if you want your moneys worth. <br><br>I ordered the Chicken Bellagio, which is what I usually get and I was honestly disappointed with the portion size. In comparison to other Cheesecake Factory locations, there was less pasta and the chicken breast was smaller. Probably HALF of the size of what I&#39;d normally get at another location. <br><br>Also, it was national cheesecake day today. Not sure if they cut the cheesecake slices smaller to accommodate all the buyers, but this place gives the SMALLEST piece of cheesecake I&#39;ve ever received from a Cheesecake Factory restaurant. Why even have the calorie count on a menu if you&#39;re not going to portion it the way other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s do?<br><br>Also...it was my friend&#39;s birthday. And usually the birthday cup has a little ice cream topped with whipped cream. This place only served a cup of whipped cream with chocolate. Are you guys cheating out on customers and your portions now?<br><br>Never coming back to this location. My server was nice though :)

Terrible service. Seems understaffed and overwhelmed. Ordered of two slices of cheesecake to be picked up in 1 hour. When I went to pick up, it wasn&#39;t ready. Waited 50 min for my text before finally going inside to find it sitting in the table. I&#39;m sure the servers were all doing their best but management needs to do way better.
Good food and the service was great working hard the lunch special was delicious and the children menu great

I understand during these times of special offers that even in the pandemic, things can get disorganized but I tried this whole online ordering and curbside pickup for the first time and it was truly such a disaster. While I knew that the time they give you when the order would be ready is only an estimate, sitting in front of the restaurant for 30 mins (in a hot car) was a bit much. No text or any communication from Cheesecake. I tried calling and there were glitches where even when you chose to press #1 to speak to someone, it didn&#39;t even allow it to register that you pressed anything or if it finally after 3 times trying, you got through, it was a busy signal. After I finally went in after seeing all these people at chick fil go in and out in the same time I was waiting and asked about my order, it was apparently sitting on the counter the whole time. When asked why I didn&#39;t even get a text since I was suppose to be curbside, she made up some <br>nonsensical things about calling out my name asking people if they were me (what?!.. makes no sense). Even when I asked if utensils were included, she lied and said yes when there were no utensils. To make things worse. I don&#39;t know why they put butter in a folded foil square in this weather  cuz it was melted and leaked all over the outside of my food and the bag.<br>We have been loyal diners at this location for years but I hate that this recent experience has become now my lasting memory.

If you&#39;re thinking of ordering food using curb side pick up, STOP! I&#39;ll save you more than an hour of your life frustrated and hungry. I ordered for 1:15pm pickup on a Thursday which I thought wouldn&#39;t be so bad. I literally did not get my good until 2:30pm. I called them 3 times and they say the same thing. &#34;We&#39;ll bring your good out when it&#39;s ready&#34; By 2:30pm I was fed up and walked in. So many angry customers waiting for their food. Risking getting corona virus to finally speak with a manager and he had to re do my order. Not worth the effort for Cheesecake Factory. I should have just saved time and money at In N Out.

There&#39;s a reason so many recent reviews here are one star. Do not come here for food pickups. There is no streamlining, no efficiency, and terrible customer service.<br><br>Waited an hour after my designated pickup time and then was told to wait in line. This was all after I had already paid for my food.<br><br>There is literally no structure to how they are handling to-go orders. If you are backed up, then stop taking new orders
We love the avocado egg rolls, staffed mushrooms and mango cheesecake. We ordered them every time ,they all so so delicious

First and foremost they are doing a great job keeping social distancing practices and their staff and consumers safe. They have implemented digital menus as well as physical ones and the wait may be a bit longer but totally worth it. The food was delicious, big portions, and the alcoholic drinks were very tasty. We had ordered the brussel sprouts, calamari, and I had the Cobb salad. I had their tiki punch drink which you can really taste the ginger. I finished the meal off with a chocolate cookie dough cheesecake which I only barely tasted due to being so full from everything else. The food is worth the price and the service was excellent. I even brought enough home for another meal. I will be back very soon.
Nice staff.  Great Service.  Placed an order online,  waited less than 5 minutes in my car to get my order picked up.

I want to say first off I love Cheesecake Factory . It&#39;s one of my favorite chain restaurants. It has a wide range of food. There is definitely something for everyone. My complaint is with them at Arcadia . They were running a special. I called today to make sure they were still offering it, and they were . They told me the system is having difficulties , but to rest assure to fresh it. I go to order and having problems I call and they said we stopped offering it. Then I called again and got transferred to the bakery department. They said we can&#39;t do anything for you that they aren&#39;t part of it. What the heck then why offer it? The manager didn&#39;t seem sympathetic or could help me . Poor customer service . I&#39;m disappointed with them. :-(....Update :            I emailed you Cheesecake Factory and I still haven&#39;t heard anything from you guys !!

This was a very unacceptable experience<br>My girlfriend went to pick up a relatively large order for 3 of us for $158 &amp; came back with an incomplete order missing 3 beverages &amp; the fries to go with the fish &amp; chips.  When my husband called &#39;&amp; spoke w/Steve the mgr he was given the option of having to drive back to get the fries or get a refund for the fries only, tonight or tomorrow!!  No mention re the beverages.  No apology for the inconvenience nor an extension of complimentary food which would be the norm for a reputable &amp; respectable establishment which this obviously is not!!!

Horrible curbside pickup service.<br>Ordered for 11:30am pick up, it says on the website the food would be READY by then and ask customers to just wait in the car and you&#39;ll get a text when order is ready.<br>Arrived at 11:25. No texts as of 11:40. Call them, on hold and get transferred. After 5 minutes, someone told me they&#39;re packing the food up and ask me to pull over to the front of the restaurant instead of at the curbside slots. Rude and no apologies.<br>11:55 we are still waiting.<br>Called again and the person was a bit nicer, but we ended up walking in to pick it up. Total wait of 35 minutes - in person pick up required. <br>Btw we never received a text. <br>Horrible!

I&#39;m not sure what was going on, but since the reception lead us to the table, the server only show up like pass by &#34;I will be right with you&#34;. And 5 mins later we saw her and she wasn&#39;t even look at us instead to taking care of a party table which already middle of meal. That&#39;s already 10-15 mins when we be seated and I&#39;m starving and ready to drop an order. So I decided to leave since nobody taking care not even a cup of water or basket of breads. <br><br>***DON&#39;T EVER COME HERE WHILE YOU START FEELING HUNGRY, YOU WILL WAIT FOR GOD KNOWS HOW LONG BY SEEING YOUR SERVER SERVING THE OTHER TABLE MULTI TIME WITHOUT TAKING YOU ORDER ***

We were out shopping today and decided to come here for lunch.<br><br>The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The bring very good bread while you wait...a oat wheat bread and a crispy bread....with butter..nom nom<br><br>My daughters boyfriend got the wings for an appetizer...they were crispy and very large. Spicy but did not blow your mouth up. The flavor was so good.<br><br>He got a smokehouse burger. He loved it. It was huge came with fries.<br><br>My daughter and I shared a BBQ chicken pizza. It was o.k. i think bj&#39;s is much better.

Used to be a huge fan of this place, but now it just seems way too over priced. I came here with my boyfriend after the gym and wanted to get something on the lower calorie side so we opted for the skinnylicious menu. I got the lemon garlic shrimp pasta and my boyfriend got the creole dish. Both were delicious to be honest &amp; enough to get us both full. The prices however are ridiculous, it is basically the same price as the normal items on the menu, so we probably would just order the normal dish &amp; just portion the meal. The wait for the food took a long time too, but its always been that way so I wasn&#39;t too surprised. Overall would come back if we were craving pasta, but we rarely do.

In regards to my previous review, I decided to contact them on their site as they requested. It&#39;s been a week and they haven&#39;t replied. Their online customer service is identical to their pickup service. Zero consideration for their customer&#39;s time.

The Cheesecake Factory is opened until midnight on Fridays and Saturdays which is awesome for those enjoying late movies at the AMC theatre. By the time the movie is over, the mall food court is already closed so this is probably one of the most convenient options. <br><br>Pasta Da Vinci <br>* Madeira wine sauce was slightly sweet<br>* Sauce went really well with the mushrooms<br>* Chicken was a little dry <br><br>Crispy Chicken Costoletta<br>* Breading on chicken was not as crispy as it can be<br>* Lemon sauce gave it a good kick <br>* Mash potatoes tasted gummy (probably over mashed) <br><br>Both dishes were almost $20 each which is quite pricey considering the quality and taste of the food. <br><br>Customer service was average - the lights are very dim so it&#39;s hard to flag down a server when it&#39;s busy.<br><br>Overall, I appreciate the convenient location, delicious brown bread and good sauces.

The chicken enchilada with no beans, extra rice!!! <br><br>I&#39;ve tried so many dishes from Cheesecake and I&#39;ve never really liked them until i tried the chicken enchiladas and i completely fell in love.<br><br>Definitely not your traditional Mexican enchilada but the flavor is there and it&#39;s delicious so no complaints from me.<br><br>Also, the brown bread they bring out is hands down one of the best beads I&#39;ve ever had.

I don&#39;t know how we waiting a looooong time like over 50 mins for a table for 4 when theres lots of tables that are empty. So when we received a text, we can finally sit down but then the waitress might have forgotten us so we really had to call her to order food. Then we have to wait for over an hour to get our foods. We saw everyone who just came in already got theirs but us. The pasta is a bit hard. We were there for 3 hrs for 95% JUST waiting. Will not come to this place ever again.

I have never given a 1 Star review but today there was no social distancing at all. I placed my order online and it said ready to be picked up at 1:43pm. I waited till 3:43pm and still my order wasn&#39;t ready. I asked a hostess for help me with a refund and she ignored me. I left without a refund since everyone was literally 1 feet from each other. I have been trying to call them but they won&#39;t pick up. Also why can&#39;t you guys use your microphone when calling out orders. No one can hear you. At least have the crowd stand outside and bring the orders out. I had to leave because I have too many older folks at home and you guys ignored me 3 times when I asked for a refund.

I love The Cheesecake Factory and we came regularly pre-Covid.    However, based on my most recent experience, I will not be returning.  <br><br>As I am not comfortable with dining at restaurants (even though it is outside patio dining), we decided on take out again.  Although we have had issues with our take out orders in the past, I can only make excuses for so long.  I haven&#39;t wanted to post anything negative to give them the opportunity to work out the hiccups of operating with Covid restrictions. <br><br>We placed our order via their website.  We were received a confirmation number and a pickup time of 5:38P (about 30 minutes from the time we placed our order).  We arrived around 5:40P.  We weren&#39;t sure of the procedure so we stepped up to the counter and advised the server that we were here to pick up our order.  He asked if we had received a text about the status of or order.  We said no.  He said they will text when your order is ready and basically dismissed us.  At 5:50P we asked another server to see if our order was ready.  He checked and said our order was not ready and we would receive a text when it was.  At 6:00P we asked yet another employee who looked like he might be management, but he walked away and ignored us.  Finally at 6:15 another employee, possibly management asked if anyone was here to pick up an order.  This time he came back with our order.  This was 45 minutes after our order was suppose to be ready.  Why don&#39;t they inform you that your order will be ready in an hour instead of 30 minutes?  We never received a text advising our order was available for pickup.  I wonder how long we would have waited if we didn&#39;t keep asking.  <br><br>While we were waiting, we overheard a server telling a customer trying to place an order that it would be an hour and a half for her order to be fulfilled.  She walked out.  Can&#39;t say I blame her.<br><br>We arrived home 5 minutes later, our food was barely luke warm.  Wonder how long our food had been sitting out.  So disappointing!<br><br>I ordered the Shepard&#39;s Pie.  Although flavorful, you could see a pool of grease starting to form.  We also ordered a Cuban sandwich and Shrimp and Bacon Club sandwich.  Both were tasty, but once again greasy as well.  Presentation wise, the Chicken Pot pie wins the blue ribbon.  The crust was a nice golden brown and filled the entire container.  Unfortunately, there wasn&#39;t much filling underneath.<br><br>This entire experience was so disappointing that I am crossing The Cheesecake Factory off my list of favorite restaurants.

We have gone to this particular Cheesecake Factory on numerous occasions or just casual dinning. Given the pandemic, it is nice that they are even opening with patio sitting. Food was still on point, server was average, but the host was inexperienced and inconsiderate. We waited over an hour and an additional 30 minutes after the time we were promised. They didnt have a table for 5, we had to wait until someone leaves to combine the tables. Meanwhile, we insisted that we can use the table for 4 until a party leaves. Our family sat and placed our food order, while my husband stood next to our table and continue waiting. The host did not offer him a chair and did not attempt to check on us or him. It was all just awkwardly ridiculous. Our food finally arrived and I had to go flag down the host to let him know that someone was leaving. He came over to combine the tables but didnt not offer my husband a plate setting. Unbelievable! This dude is definitely not a good host. Note: we were there on Friday 10/9.
Came here during happy hour, grabbed drinks and a cheesecake. Miguel was our bartender , got Cosmopolitan  and Margarita and it was very good! White chocolate Raspberry cheesecake was to die for!

They just broke the rules for social distancing and accepted more orders for pick up then allowed. The police ‍ department cited them. On top of there is a long ass line to cancel your order. F this place man . It&#39;s packed. Super disappointed with this shitty place.

This review is strictly for their pick up order service. <br><br>We usually enjoy having dinner there, but on that day both my husband and I were super exhausted from work so that we barely had power to cook or eat outside. So we decided to order food for pick up, instead of eating in the restaurant. <br><br>We ordered through their website on Yelp, and it said the estimated time for pick up was 35 minutes after the order.  We arrived there on the estimated pick up time at the restaurant. Food wasn&#39;t ready but we paid the bill first and waited in front of their bakery spot where all pick up food is handed down to customers. <br><br>We waited for more than 30 minutes. During the time, no one seemed to care about us or our order even though we were standing right in front of them. The bakery cashier and the dinning were both not busy that night. Other customers for pick up were waiting for so long as well. A lady who worked there brought someone&#39;s pick up order and left it on the shelf next to the cashier for a while. I knew it was for one of us, but since we all were waiting in front of them, I automatically assumed that they would call the customer&#39;s name if it&#39;s ready to pick up. They didn&#39;t call anyone. The food was still left there for a while, around 10 minutes. They didn&#39;t look busy but just talking to each other. One customer asked whom the food was for. They checked the order and found out it was hers. This made me worry about their service. <br><br>After this happened, because we already had been waiting for more than 30 minutes since the estimated pick up time, we asked them about our order. One of them immediately asked us, &#34;oh you are the one who are waiting for cheese cake, right?&#34; <br><br>Again, we had been waiting right in front of them for more than 30 minutes and the cashier was not busy for the entire time. Not only they didn&#39;t care about our order, but also they remembered our order incorrectly. They went to the kitchen, and came back to us immediately with our food, which was cold already. We could tell the food was left in the kitchen for a while. <br><br>Well I know the estimated time for pick up is just &#34;estimated&#34; time, the actual time we can pick it up could be earlier or later than that, of course. But the estimated time was 35 minutes after the order plus we waited another 30 minutes at the restaurant. Of course, the food should be cold already by the time we could get it. If we needed to wait for so long, what is the point to pick it up instead of eating in? With this more than 1 hour, we could have finished eating somewhere outside quickly instead. <br><br>If we pay around 45 dollars, I still expect better service even if we ordered them for pick up. <br><br>We didn&#39;t feel like paying that money for the cold food after such a long wait (beside we needed to drive back for another 15 minutes to eat them at home). We didn&#39;t receive the food and asked them to refund. <br><br>I know we were just unlucky that night. But the way they didn&#39;t care about us for the entire time was enough for us to feel super miserable after the exhausting day. I hope they will improve the system for pick up order in some way. This was such a disappointing experience.

Just got back from the Cheesecake Factory in Santa Anita Mall/Arcadia - take out order and walk-in/pick up.  First trip there since COVID started.  Used to go, dine in, about once a month before COVID and customer service and the food had always been pretty good.<br><br>This time, not so much.  Wife ordered online and Cheesecake gave a 4:30pm pick up time.  Got there at 4:25pm.  Our food wasn&#39;t ready until about 4:50pm.  There weren&#39;t very many people at all there and it was (or should have been) pretty obvious that we were the only ones waiting around right there in the open area between the cheesecake display and check in desk.  A couple of managers walked back and forth past us several times but didn&#39;t bother to greet us or check on us until 4:45pm when one of them finally asked if we were waiting for something.  I replied that we had been waiting for 15 minutes (which was actually 20).  He  then went to check on our food.  Our food was ready and brought to us by another employee and then my wife told that manager that we had finally gotten our food.  He gave us two thumbs up.  <br><br>Really, two thumbs up?  SMH...  I&#39;ve worked customer service pretty much all my life and also in the food/service industry for a bit as well.  IMO, they should have at least offered us something to drink while we were waiting and/or offered to throw in some bread or maybe a dessert...  <br><br>Hopefully, everyone else&#39;s experiences have been smoother but if you order online these days and go pick up, be advised that your food may Not be ready when they said it will be and you might get ignored while you&#39;re waiting...

No social distancing and order is taking forever. Cant even use the mic to call out the names of the people with there food ready. I talked to manager and offer to help but he said cant allow. Use the mic to make your life easier. Jaime the manager was very rude. Ive been waiting and only offered me a refund no resolution.

Maybe 2 stars is too much but the second star is for the lemonade.  Went to celebrate my wife&#39;s birthday, they have the patio open because Covid-19 they told us that the waiting time was around 15 minutes.  We have to wait longer but is not a deal, when go got a table asked for a high chair.  The one that the gave to us was NOT CLEAN!! how come??! this was the first strike, are they cleaning enough? are we safe on their premises?  Second strike, bread like a rock.  I complaint the we got another one same thing.  The third one came ok.  We have flies everywhere, are they know about those UV lights who kill the flies? are they know that the flies are also focus of contamination? minimum citronella candles!!<br>Third strike, the temperature start going down, we asked the busboy to start one of those gas heaters.  None of those works.  This is an expensive place in a Mall, they charge a lot for the food, but they have no capability to provide comfort to their guests, this is not ok, if they cannot feel respect for the people who is taking risks to get a dinner out on their facility better close and reopen when they&#39;re ready.  <br>Food was not bad, expecting something better, it was a $74 dinner, 2 adults and 2 kids, price is not cheap, service need to be better.

Not only is the shrimp overcooked it&#39;s burnt you can taste the char. Couldn&#39;t finish it. And the shrimp Alfredos pasta was undercooked hard and chewy. Please properly train your cooks on simple cooking skills.

Do not online order! Times are not correct and they do not care about the safety of their customers or employees. They are not organized and they crowd everyone into a small room! They should be shut down!

I tried the famous Louisiana Chicken Pasta I always heard about today. It didn&#39;t taste bad but I definitely prefer the Angel Hair or Four Cheese Pasta. <br><br>The pasta needed more salt and some parmesan, and the chicken needed more flavor. There wasn&#39;t enough sauce to dip the chicken in so it was a bit dry. Ranch would be awesome with it though. <br><br>They also forgot to give me butter for my bread.

Have you read the Twitter thread on how The Cheesecake Factory is a  &#34;postmodern design hellscape&#34;? <br><br>Yeah, it&#39;s true. I went here with a friend who&#39;s never been to a Cheesecake Factory and I haven&#39;t been in years so both of us were hit by bewilderment upon entering.<br><br>Is it Egyptian? Greek? Mediterranean? We don&#39;t know. But that doesn&#39;t matter. The service and food was great.<br><br>Our server, Kei/Kay (?), was super helpful, accommodating, cheery, and made our dining experience very pleasant. <br><br>The fact that The Cheesecake Factory has lunch prices up until 5 PM is also a huge score. <br><br>We ordered the:<br>-Chicken Piccata:<br>-The chicken and mushrooms were super tender.<br>-Sauce was creamy and had the delicious zest of lemon.<br>-The angel hair pasta had the perfect chewy texture.<br><br>-Shepherd&#39;s Pie<br>-There was an abundance of meat, peas, and carrots.<br>-Super flavorful, huge portions.  We had to take a box home for this.<br><br>-Pumpkin Cheesecake<br>-Tastes just like pumpkin pie with the after taste of cheesecake. <br>-Lots of whip cream.<br><br>-Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple Cheesecake<br>-Jam packed with peanut buttery goodness.<br>-Even came with a peanut butter cream.<br><br>Overall a pleasant, bougie dining experience. Extremely filling, so come super hungry.

Everytime we order takeout from here the service is absolutely terrible. This isn&#39;t the first time this has happened- today we ordered dinner to be picked up at 6:15, knowing that there was already going to be a slight delay due to previous experiences. At 7:15, an entire hour of waiting later, they are still saying the food is not ready. This order was placed hours early in the day. There is absolutely no reason to have such an extreme delay, especially given that it is during covid and in-person dining is no where as busy as it normally would be. Even if there was going to be such a ridiculous wait time, it would&#39;ve been nice to have gotten a call or heads up, instead of making us stand there for over an hour and simply saying the food isn&#39;t ready. When we finally got the food, it was very subpar-the tacos had been in there for so long the shells were soft and broke apart, the steak was hard and overcooked, etc. Very disappointed in the service here once again.

The online order and pick up experience were extremely horrible at Arcadia location.  It is unusual to have 1.5-hour gap between order and pickup time, but understandable it was lunch hour.  However, order was not ready as scheduled, I was told it may take additional 30-45 minutes when I was already at the parking lot, multiple inquiring calls were transferred, hold and disconnected.  Finally I had a chance to talk the store manager (self-identified) and disappointedly cancelled the order.  Overall the quality of service and order system in Arcadia location is very poor.  Looking thru the reviews, apparently many customers have been experiencing the similar situation lately. To avoid further upsetting the restaurant fans and future customers, we hope the management team will make the proper improvements soon.

Good food and GREAT service!<br><br>No need to go into detail about the food here since most people have been to one already. What I will say about this particular location is the excellent service that went above and beyond what is normally expected. Frankly, I&#39;ve never been to a restaurant that treated us this fairly. Very pleasantly surprised.<br><br>Highly recommend!

I went to the cheesecake factory on Mother&#39;s Day and agree with what others have written about that dismal experience. I was able to cancel our order after about 20 minutes when I saw the line and sensed the chaos. <br><br>So I went back and ordered the same meal tonight so we could have a belated Mother&#39;s Day dinner. I&#39;m writing to say that the cheesecake factory has regained my trust. The order was ready within five minutes of when they said it would be, the order was correct, and the food was delicious. Good job!

OMG!! This is the worst Cheesecake Factory we have ever been to. To start our waiter, Anthony, came to us with a bad attitude, no &#34;hello&#34; &#34;how&#39;s it going&#34; went it &#34;what you want to drink&#34;. We got our drinks and appetizers in a fair amount of time. When it came down to our entrees, we waited for 30 minutes I had to ask our waiter how much longer. He gave me a look as if I had just insulted him and gave me attitude about how he was going to check on our food. <br><br>Mind you we were seated next to one of the waiters computer station. So we would see him looking at our table to check if we had food but yet never went to go check until I asked.<br><br>He came back with our food, I knew the food was going to be cold. I took a bite of my food and it was cold. As soon as the waiter finally asked us for a refill or even come by to see if we needed anything I said &#34;pack it up, the food is cold and I am not waiting other 30 minutes to wait for other plate&#34;. He gave me shocked &#34;I&#39;m sorry&#34;. As we paid the bill, the waiter took 10 minutes to bring back my card.<br><br>Long story short. The manager came and said sorry, he gave us two cheesecakes Slices for free. But still worst Cheesecake Factory experiences ever.

HORRIBLE service! Came here many many time and didn&#39;t  have any issue in the past but today was a very bad experience. Was told to wait in the car for our take out but had to call a couple times bc no one picked up. Finally was able to speak with someone then was told they were bagging out our order will bring it out shortly. 25 mins later, no food yet. Then I called and I got upset this time. Finally got our food in 1 hour and 20 mins after we ordered it and was told the food had been ready and they forgot to bring it out to us. Never want to order anymore at this place!!!!

A large group of 12 people, including myself, had dinner here last minute. We were seated after 15 minutes which was great considering it was busy. We were seated outside but there were heating lamps which were a life saver.  The only annoying thing was the gate would slam shut every time an employee exited from the side door. It was very loud and seems like a spring needs to be installed. The service by Stacy was great. The food was delicious and all came out at the same time. Overall great, other than the gate that needs to be fixed.

Very bad service. Waited a long time for drinks. Waited a long time for my meal and other guests got it before mine even tho I arrived before them. Once my meal arrived it was the wrong thing. My boyfriends pasta was hard.
