Wait times:<br>- ~2 hour wait for a table on a weekend night for a big party (10+)<br>- 5 minute wait to get a menu and order a drink <br>-5 minute wait to get the drinks <br>-15 minute wait for the waiter to come back and take our orders <br>-5 minute wait for complimentary bread<br>-30 minute wait to get our food <br>- 5 minutes to eat the food because we were all starving by that point... <br><br>Time wasted: way too much. Worth it? No. <br><br>Seriously, the time spent waiting and waiting and waiting killed it. I understand American restaurants are meant to be slow paced, but this is beyond ridiculous. <br><br>Not to mention that the servers came by 3 TIMES and tried to give us food that&#39;s meant to be for another table. Disorganized much. <br><br>On to the food: <br>-Bread: wished they gave 2 sourdough instead of two of the wheat ones because the sourdough was definitely the winner of the two. Pretty much stuffed myself with this while dying for the food to come. <br><br>-Mushroom burger: Asked for medium well. Patty was cooked nice and juicy. Couldn&#39;t taste much of the mushrooms. Bun was nothing spectacular. Fries were nicely cooked. <br><br>-Bbq smokehouse burger: Again, nothing too special or mind-blowing. Asked for medium well also, but meat was more pink than the mushroom burger. <br><br>Overall, mediocre food, mediocre service, terrible wait times. Needs more organization.

I&#39;ve been to many Cheesecake Factory to order cheesecake but this one in Arcadia is the worst. <br>They did not look that busy and it took them more than 15 minutes just to get my cheesecake ready. Every other one that I go to is great and fast. I have never experienced such bad customer service.

I had lunch in the restaurant yesterday. Everyone was so kind and really went out of their way. Everything is immaculate, there is social distancing inside and out. The food was so delicious too. It was great to be out, first time in 3 months. Ps Miso salmon was out of this world.
Ordered to go and it was great! Quick service and all the cheesecakes were amazing. Desserts always hit the spot!

It has been my experience that this location deserves an A+ from me. Every time I go I receive great service. As for the waiting no different from anywhere else but I will go with reservations so the wait will be minimal.

Even though this is a chain, I give it 5stars because 22 years ago when my husband took me out on date to the original Cheesecake Factory In Marina Del Rey. That&#39;s where I first tasted the bistro shrimp plate. 22 years later, I still haven&#39;t changed it.  Today, I continue to eat the bistro shrimp, and there are no regrets with my choice. However, one other thing I must have is their sweet corn tamales from the appetizer menu. These two dishes are a must, and these dishes make up for the long wait to be seated.

We had dinner here last night after attending the 626 night market. <br>I&#39;ve been to the other locations, Marina del Rey, Brea, and Huntington Beach. But this is my favorite location. Since I grew up in this area and my parents still live nearby.<br>The waiting time was only 10-15 mins at 9pm. Our server, David, was great, attentive and patient with us deciding on our order. We had the shepherd pie, CA cheesesteak with fries and of course my chicken bellagio.The food was delicious as always.

My family and I love this place!  Their food is delicious (although a bit on the salty side), the pasta and hamburgers are great. And of course their cheesecakes are must haves!  We come here all the time!  Highly recommend!
Always a great experience here! The chicken madeira is the best and will always be my go-to meal.
Ordered with door dash forgot our dressing with Thai chicken salad and say we can go pick up the dressing or they can remake it. So annoyed! I was starving at that point.

I enjoy coming to the Cheesecake factory for the cheesecake of course, but they also have a great happy hour menu. You can get drinks and  appetizers for just under $8. The drinks are very potent and the appetizer servings are enough for 2-3 people. It is only served in the bar area, so make sure to get there early so  you can get a seat.

If I could give zero stars I would definitely do it !!!! this restaurant is the worst ! they are not disinfected their pla fork and a knife that people should eat from. Also, they gave me a salad with piece of hair inside and the fork and a knife and I supposed to eat from was super dirty just to let you know that right now on this time you need to be super clean more than usual!!!!!! I really afraid to go to eat in a restaurant right now. Because of your unresponsive attitude people catch the Coronavirus!!!!!! Shame on you!
Brandy was great! Will be back, her service was quick AF. She was on it throughout our entire lunch. Food was good too.

Food was surprisingly good; a lot better than I remember it being a decade ago. 10 years ago, their food was at most mediocre, nothing special or worth mentioning. <br><br>Now, it&#39;s almost very good. Would consider going there again!

Cheese Cake Factory food are a little pricey, but worth the food! I have been celebrating my birthday here for the past 3 years and they have never disappointed me with the food or the happy birthday song, I love the friendly ness that the workers gives out and that they enjoy serving my  food! I would recommend this place for quality but not super expensive food, if y&#39;all are looking for that

Been coming here for years and like most Cheesecake Factory locations, its ALWAYS busy! My bro invited us to lunch to celebrate his 4 daughters&#39; birthdays who were all born in January.  He suggested 1PM on a Sunday and my first thought was, man the wait is going to be ridiculous.  We put our name down for 14 people and they said the wait would be 45 mins to an hour.  I walked over to CPK to find out the wait was just about the same.  So we went to the food court, my sister got some food to hold her over, lol.  The kids played at the Bowlero arcade as we waited. We checked in a few times and they told us that their big party just paid the bill and we should be able to sit soon. So we all gathered in the Cheesecake waiting room and after another 15 minutes, we got seated. I also got a call from CPK around the same time saying that we should be able to sit in 15 mins as well but I just canceled that.<br><br>We sat and ordered drinks and started to devour the bread because we were all starving!  Got the spinach dip and buffalo wings appetizer and I was honestly getting full just off that and their yummy brown bread.  Luckily I just got the seared ahi tuna salad, which was light.  Family got a variety of things including pastas and fish and chips.  Then of course, we had to get cheesecake and dessert for the kiddos to celebrate their birthdays. Staff came out and sang which was fun.<br><br>Overall a very good and FILLING lunching experience.  Staff is always friendly, nice and accommodating, just ALWAYS be prepared to wait...

Whenever I come to Cheesecake Factory, I always order the same dish, the Farfelle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic. When I was 10 years old, I told my aunt that I loved Cheesecake Factory and she has been giving me Cheesecake Factory giftcards ever since, I still have 3 left that i need to spend.<br><br>The dish is Farfelle Chicken dish is huge, I can only barely finish it despite being a pretty big eater (from what my friends tell me). There is a ton of pasta with some delicious sauce on top, I assume this sauce is made up of spices and garlic. The chicken is very soft, which I love since it&#39;s easy to eat and has had it&#39;s taste amplified by the sauce! <br><br>This place also has a large selection of cheesecakes (who knew?). I typically just get the original cheesecake since I like to enjoy the flavor of a cheesecake without having too much extra fruits, sauces and other add-ons thrown around it.<br><br>So the reason I didn&#39;t give this place 5 stars is because they took an hour to come out with my order. They usually don&#39;t take near this long, but they admitted that it was because they ran out of Farfelle (they eventually somehow found some for my meal but it took a while). To make up for this, they gave me a free soup and also made my entire meal FREE! Good move Cheesecake Factory :), you&#39;ve won me back!

We came here for dinner as my son&#39;s request for his 14th birthday. As always, we love visiting The Cheesecake Factory and although it&#39;s a chain restaurant, we love this place. Me and my son has a sweet tooth so this is on the top of our list to visit.<br><br>We had the worst experience with our server Natasha. Food was delicious and we all enjoyed our meal, but our server went missing in action majority of our time. I was keeping an eye on her and she was attending to 5 tables, but for some reason she kept skipping our table for refills and then when she dropped off our check, my husband was pulling out his card and instead of waiting to get the card she takes off and goes missing again. So we waited for 20 min and still no Natasha to be found. We got up and went to the cheesecake area to pay and the guy apologized and said they can&#39;t take the payment there and he said he can grab a manager but just as I turned I saw Natasha go to the bar area and my husband flagged her down to pay. She ignored him and walked past him and so we went to the hostess area to see how we can pay our bill and just when they said they will try and see what happened to her, Natasha magically appeared and said I&#39;ll take the payment. Natasha was definitely  NOT a good waitress towards our party, but she looked like a good waitress to the other parties.<br><br>When visiting the Cheesecake Factory, I wouldn&#39;t recommend this one and good luck on service. I honestly don&#39;t see myself coming back to this location and it hurts me to say that since I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory.

I think the staff need better training. I placed an order for pickup at 11am. I got there and was told oh I need to get a text stating my order is ready. So I had to wait until I got the text for my pickup to be ready. See i don&#39;t have a problem with that if it was communicated to me beforehand.

came here to have a nice lunch/dinner .. wait time was quick .. sat us down and everything but once we ordered the lady that took our order had took about an hour to bring our food . Suggestion to never coming back again . <br>Horrible service

What a dissapointed visit. Poor service. And it was my niece&#39;s birthday...<br><br>The server seemed mad annoyed...our food took forever...<br><br>I don&#39;t know how many times I&#39;ve been to this restaurant, but this was the 1 bad experience...<br><br>What the hell is going on here...?

Ordered the white chicken chili and it comes w rice, it&#39;s suppose to be a circle amount of rice and this is what I got, I feel really ripped off by this, like cmon u don&#39;t have anymore plain white rice cmon smh I already don&#39;t go here for them getting rid of a plate I always got, but I got into this plate when I go and this is such a disappointment

What a terrible experience. <br>Me and my boyfriend came here around 9:00PM on a Friday. Granted it was a Friday, but it was towards the end of the night. Our orders took almost an hour to receive, and halfway through eating our waitress disappeared? <br>Me and him switched our plates halfway through eating, and I couldn&#39;t believe it....I found a piece of plastic stuck inside his Chicken Parmesan. <br>I wasn&#39;t able to take a picture of it, since my boyfriend immediately told the waitress, but I&#39;d say it was about 2 inches long. Thicker than a Saran wrap texture, but still pretty firm. <br>Sure, they comp&#39;d that dish and gave us free cheesecake, but it still doesn&#39;t sit well with me. He or I could&#39;ve ingested that, having no idea where it came from. <br>Not coming back to this location, or any other Cheesecake for that matter :/

I love Cheesecake Factory! This place is such a great restaurant for big family dinners. The only downside about any Cheesecake Factory restaurant is that there is always a long wait! Since this location is attached to the Santa Anita mall, average waits for lunch/dinner can vary from 40 minutes to an hour or so long. But the service here is always top notch. They bring your table your drinks immediately. <br><br>If you go to Cheesecake Factory and you don&#39;t get the brown bread, you are doing it all wrong!! I love how they come out with complimentary free bread, a sourdough and a molasses, sweet bread. They both come out hot and fresh, in a warm basket. I noticed that Cheesecake Factory does not give out individual packets of butter anymore, but give out tons of scooped out butter onto a small plate, which seems more cost efficient. <br><br>Some dishes that I would recommend are the four cheese pasta and the pasta carbonara. The four cheese pasta is just ooey gooey with cheeses and has a slight tomato taste to it. Nothing overpowers each other. The pasta carbonara is great too because it&#39;s creamy and has bacon bits! I also love the fried mac and cheese balls here because it has a nice crunchy texture on the outside, but is filled with al dente mac and cheese. It&#39;s not too cheesey and overpowering. They also have great salads and appetizers, such as the samosas and the filled mushrooms! All full of flavor. <br><br>I&#39;m not really a fan of cheesecake (I know, shocking). But I do love the chocolate cake here, both the blackout cake and Linda&#39;s fudge cake. The tiramisu here isn&#39;t too bad as well. If it&#39;s your birthday, they give you a free serving of ice cream! <br><br>All in all, Cheesecake Factory is a great place to indulge in high calorie foods. But nobody should be counting them when they come here. But great food and every Cheesecake Factory is consistent with what they are serving.

Happened to be in Arcadia earlier today and decided to do a look see through the Westfield&#39;s and Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu offers relatively healthy options. Really had to have the larger portion of the grilled salmon, steamed broccoli and mashed potatoes...all yummy good, although I noticed the portions have dramatically decreased from their standard generous portions, was not happy since I ordered the dinner entree and instead received the lunch portion and was charged for the dinner...NOT cool. Unfortunately, that killed my appetite for dessert, and skipped on cheesecake.<br><br>This particular restaurant in Arcadia was clean and the service from the hostess, waiter and servers were professional, prompt and nice. Watch out for bate and switch, and double check your bill before paying...
How often do the waitress&#39;s change gloves... Requirements??? From touching menus to people&#39;s drinks and plates... High chance of contaminating every thing they touch... Concerning a bit.

I was recently at The Cheesecake Factory and had such a horrible experience I thought to share it. I first went to The Cheesecake Factory on Father&#39;s Day after ordering online a strawberry cheesecake for my family. I made the drive 20 minutes to this location and upon arrival, I had to wait in 2 separate lines. One to get into the restaurant and another at the bakery to retrieve my cake. Upon showing the bakery worker my online order I was told that my cake was sold out for the day. The first mistake is the fact that The Cheesecake Factory does not update its online ordering system. I wasted both my time and money going to pick up an order that wasn&#39;t completed, and for some reason, no one thought to contact me and tell me that it was all out of stock. After speaking to the manager, I was told I would be refunded and although I was disappointed, I went on my way. <br><br>Fast forward almost 3 weeks later, I check my bank statement to see that I was charged for a $30 cheesecake on Father&#39;s Day that I never received. Upon discovering the charge, I promptly spoke to a manager (Daniel) at The Cheesecake Factory via phonecall. He told me to come back to the store for a refund, and I don&#39;t think this man understands that we&#39;re in a pandemic, I live over 20 minutes away, and it&#39;s not necessarily convenient for me to be traveling for a REFUND THAT SHOULD HAVE BEEN TAKEN CARE OF. I ask for the Santa Anita Cheesecake Factory email to attempt to have the refund done via email, and I was placed on hold for a few minutes only for him to refer me to the CHEESECAKE FACTORY WEBSITE that does NOT have the emails for individual locations. So.. not only does the manager at this location not know how to do refunds CORRECTLY, but they don&#39;t know how to help customers complete refunds via online and expect patrons to just be traveling back and forth in the middle of a pandemic. <br><br>I felt distraught at the fact that The Cheesecake Factory was trying to rip me off and if I had never checked my bank statement that day, I wouldn&#39;t have realized that I was wrongly charged for food I didn&#39;t receive. I left 2 messages for The Cheesecake Factory Corporate, and no one responded to my messages. In my last attempt to get my money back *before calling the bank to dispute the charges*, I went to The Cheesecake Factory on my own time and asked to speak to a manager. I really shouldn&#39;t have had to waste my time traveling just for an issue that wasn&#39;t my fault, but honestly, $30 is a lot. I explained my situation and was told that my refund would be processed and upon following up the next few days, I saw my money be returned. I appreciate the apologies, but it doesn&#39;t get rid of the fact that the workers here are incompetent and not accomodating to patrons like myself when faced with issues. <br><br>I was previously a regular customer at The Cheesecake Factory, but after my experience, I will no longer be dining here and will be advising my friends and family to dine elsewhere. If you&#39;re considering ordering online, I would advise against it, you might be faced with an issue similar to the one I had to endure.

Called 2 weeks in advance to hold a table for 20 people. Arrived on our family gathering and we found no record of our name / phone number or party. The Manager on duty worked hard and got us a table on the patio, worked out ok. but we waited about 30 minutes and our served was hard at work and could not keep up. My wife was helping tell the server about drink orders and refills and food. Food took way too long. We also sat outside on a very hot day. <br><br>Little painful, I know you don&#39;t appreciate this review, but sorry to be honest.

I hardly write reviews but this time I am beyond unsatisfied with the food and service that I have to share my experience with anyone who is willing to read a super long review.<br><br>Went here on a Tuesday night with a friend and I ordered Pasta Di Vinci while my friend ordered the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic. My food came out burnt. There were pieces of burnt food in it. The pieces of chicken were burnt on one side. It felt like they try to hide the burnt part with the mushrooms slices. The whole dish had a burnt taste to it as well. I even wiped my tongue on the white towel to get a piece of burnt food out of my mouth. Of course I had to send it back for a remake. I am not paying $17.95 for a plate of unedible food. I wasn&#39;t offered an apology or anything. After sending it back our waitress was giving me the cold shoulder (straight out ignored me) and was mainly answering to my friend. If I could I would give this place zero stars.<br><br>I used to go to this location at least once a month for over 10 years but I felt like the food and the service has gone downhill for the past 2-3 years. Which is when I stop coming here so frequently. This was the worst experience that I had experienced from this location. I don&#39;t think I will be coming back to this location anymore due to the horrible service and food quality.

The coffee here was amazing ! I haven&#39;t tasted such good coffee in a long time from a restaurant, so I was expecting something average. I&#39;m an avid coffee drinker so I was pleasantly surprised that theirs was so delicious ! I got it with a slice of Lime Raspberry Cheesecake which complimented the coffee perfectly. I wish I could drink their coffee everyday ! Love love love

This Cheesecake Factory has really gone downhill since I&#39;ve last eaten here. <br><br>Restrooms are gross and the restaurant floor is also dirty with crumbs everywhere. Filthy grimy and dirty you can feel it under your foot even though you have shoes on!! <br><br>Took them over 30 min to an hour to bring out our food. Our party almost finished the food and they still haven&#39;t brought out the last two.<br><br>Food was overly salty and we said no salt on the fries and they came salted. We ordered 2 fried shrimp platters. 1 of them didn&#39;t come with the sauces only ketchup?!<br><br>The food comes out lukewarm and not hot.<br><br>The pasta is overly greasy and oily, how can a pasta be flavorless but yet so salty?!<br><br>Their food was inconsistent but our server was attentive whenever she passed by but it looks like they were understaffed since it took awhile for her to come back with everything.

I ordered takeout from here for the first time a few days ago. We got spaghetti and meatballs, a hamburger, steak, and a thai chicken dish. The food was good as usual, but definitely tastes better when eaten at the restaurant. When I went to pick up my food, I had to wait 20 minutes. I would not recommend the spaghetti and meatballs- the sauce tasted like your standard canned tomato sauce. The other dishes were amazing though. The thai chicken dish was surprisingly my favorite. The flavor was strong, so I ate it with some rice I cooked at home.

Updated Review 11/16/18<br>Guest Services from Cheesecake Factory requested that I contact them through the company website about this situation. They apologized and assured that every effort was being made to prevent this similar situation from happening to anyone else. I really hope this is true. I would hate for anyone else to experience this. I was surprised that corporate expressed such sincere concern for their customers and are setting a high standard for all other restaurant chains.<br><br>11/3/18<br>I found a strand of hair in my pasta when I was already half way through my meal. I was only offered an apology and free slice of cheesecake. I think Management thought I made it up and put my own hair in it? They even had the audacity to pack up my pasta that had the hair in it. No discount or anything was offered for the dish. I didn&#39;t want to make a scene, but I didn&#39;t think I had to? I won&#39;t return to this location even though the waitress was extremely nice. I declined the cheesecake since we were going shopping after, but Maggie advised she was going to be here all day and would still let me redeem the cheesecake at a later time. I didn&#39;t come back though. I don&#39;t think a piece of cheesecake can fix Management&#39;s lack of concern for their customers.

Honestly the food was good as usual--it did take 45 min for my simple fettuccine alfredo though, but my main concern (and the reason for writing this review) is how they&#39;re dealing with the pandemic. It says on the yelp page that masks are required, however they in absolutely no way enforced that. I get that you can&#39;t eat with a mask on but that&#39;s not what i&#39;m talking about; people in the indoor waiting areas also weren&#39;t wearing masks. As an establishment this big, I believe if they openly state that masks are required, then they need to enforce that and they have the right to refuse service to the ones who aren&#39;t wearing them. Some people are purposely choosing to not go to restaurants that aren&#39;t enforcing that in order to stay safe and healthy. It&#39;s quite irresponsible of them to say one thing and do another while people&#39;s health &amp; safety are at risk. Also the outdoor seating is not distanced at all, you could literally turn around and raise your pinky and be able to touch the person sitting behind you; might as well be sharing a super big table with every party there. Very disappointed.

This is probably one of my favorite local restaurant! I come here pretty often especially during lunch time. I do enjoy getting their appetizers. I like the chicken sliders, avocado egg rolls which is deep fried, Factory nachos are really good and loaded with everything, macaroni balls are delicious, the side salad is okay and comes in a huge portion, the sweet tamale is very delicious (I don&#39;t know where I can this type of fusion) , spinach dip is delicious and not too oily/salty, and the buffalo wings is amazing because it&#39;s crunchy. They also have happy hour which is half off on selected appetizers.<br><br>Entrees of pretty delicious:<br><br>I have tried the salmon steak which is wonderful and good. It&#39;s not too dry. <br><br>My favorite is. Pasta Da Vinci. It&#39;s a sweet oily taste. Comes with loaded mushrooms, onions and garlic. Penne pasta. I love the hint of wine along with such delicious chicken. I will definitely order this again and again. <br><br>My bf had the four cheese pasta and it&#39;s definitely cheesy if that&#39;s how you I like your pasta. It&#39;s really good according to him until his cheese turned cold haha and it also comes with chicken with a spoonful of more cheese in the center. <br><br>Love their fresh squeezed orange juice. <br><br>Their mojito is delicious and refreshing. I usually get this during the day along with my appetizers. Love the mint leaves <br><br>Before I had diabetes (2017), I always get their strawberry cheesecake!! It&#39;s the best! And I would order one for here and one to go haha. <br><br>Most of all, I love the experience here. Wonderful customer service, all the waiters are really super nice except what they are super busy during happy hours. They take forever to serve you but if you come on non happy hours you would definitely leave happy. Everyone is very polite and very quick at their service. They always make sure you are satisfied throughout your whole experience. Again, this is one of my favorite restaurants in my local area.

Kid&#39;s portion of Grilled Salmon and carrots is exactly right size for anyone. <br><br>Then if want to blow your diet to the moon, Adam&#39;s Cheesecake is the rocket to fly you to that goal. <br><br>I wish they&#39;d cut way back on the sodium on their menu.

my coworker and i went a few days ago and they had outdoor seating with an online menu. we ordered our food and we&#39;re waiting for about 45 min when the manager came out and informed us that they were out of lasagna verde he brought us a meal to pick something else. we waited about 45 min for our food and when it came out it was perfect. he was so nice and kept apologizing the entire time. we were a little annoyed about waiting but it&#39;s nothing to be angry about. we honestly just wanted to eat. at the end they gave each a free slice of cheesecake and he took off 25% which was really nice. the manager handled the situation with nothing but respect and apologies. we definitely will be coming back!!

Just had Door Dash deliver the chicken lettuce wraps and they were amazing!  I was particularly impressed with the packaging!  The chicken and lettuce in one container and all of the fixings in another. Great job Cheesecake Factory!

My favorite appetizer to get at cheesecake is the fried macaroni balls! They are crunchy on the outside and warm and cheesy on the inside. <br>The menu has pages of endless options, there is something here for everyone. The cheesecakes are really good, just heavy.

Long wait times are to be expected for dinner on weekends. However they have systemized it so that you register your name, given a time frame (ie. 35-50min), if you leave (say &#34;go shopping&#34;) and your name is called, you&#39;ll be given priority when you return. <br><br>My husband and I left to Dave &amp; busters upstairs to play some games and returned right about 45 min later, we were seated in a booth within 5 min. <br><br>Service had a slow start, however they have bussers and runners to bring bread, etc. Drinks and food were all served in a timely manner. <br><br>We finally tried the IMPOSSIBLE burger and it definitely lived up to the hype. Texture and flavor of a meat patty, without the meat. Thank you Cheesecake Factory for making this POSSIBLE!!
A few weeks after my initial review Cheesecake Factory reached out and finally are refunding everything.

I dined here for lunch around noon on a Saturday.<br><br>My friend and I chose to sit in the outside patio area. Our server, Mercedes, provided fantastic table service by ensuring that our bread basket was always filled and promptly packaging up the leftovers from our meal.<br><br>We browsed the cocktail and wine menu, settling on a glass of Chapoutier Rosé wine for me (my first time trying this specific wine and loved the light yet crisp flavor elements) and a Red Sangria for my friend. <br><br>Next, we shared the guacamole and chips appetizer (also includes condiment-sized cups of salsa and sour cream), which is priced at $12.50, but overlooking the steep price since the guacamole was THAT GOOD for standard American fare.<br><br>For our main entrée, we shared the Bistro Shrimp Pasta (pasta portions are ample here, so I suggest sharing if you can&#39;t finish a whole plate of pasta by yourself) and an appetizer side salad; a tossed green salad that we asked to have two different dressings with: bleu cheese and ranch. The salad was exceptional for a regular green salad, since the lettuce selection wasn&#39;t iceberg lettuce heaped together, but actual green leaf lettuce freshly chopped. The pasta dish was wonderful, however the crispy battered shrimp was great tasting, but not my favorite kind of shrimp since I usually prefer my shrimp pasta dishes to have sautéed shrimp instead of fried. Therefore, if I order this pasta another time, I will choose to swap in sautéed shrimp instead of the former, because that basil-garlic-lemon cream sauce on the pasta was delightful!<br><br>Although quite pricier compared to other restaurant chains, this Cheesecake Factory location delivers splendid customer service and cooks up consistently delectable pasta dishes.

The food is mediocre because it&#39;s too greasy. I&#39;ve eaten there on countless family gatherings, take out orders &amp; celebrations, and one fact remains- it&#39;s too greasy! Please, less grease a.k.a oil.

Terrible management. Lack of communication. Extremely slow service. I think that pretty much summarizes my experience. And yes I know I didn&#39;t review the food cause after waiting for an hour, I still haven&#39;t received any.

Horribly disorganized. When we first arrived we were told the wait would be about 45 minutes- this became almost a two hour wait. Had we been told the wait was over an hour we would have chosen to go elsewhere. They either need to be honest about wait times or have a better system. Once we were seated and ordered, the waiter came back to tell us they were out of the item I ordered! So HANGRY at this point. My hunger outweighed my anger so I settled on ordering something else. The only saving grace was our waiter and the slice of cheesecake for dessert.

What a horrible experience!   We spent extra $$ in  a financially tough time to celebrate a birthday.    I went online at 4 pm to order our meal, then paid for it.    Curbside Pickup time was 5:30.  And instructions were to call when we arrived.<br><br>We arrived at 5:25, called the number on the email confirmation, and told the girl we were there waiting outside at the curbside .    She confirmed my name and  said the order would be right up and they&#39;d bring it out to us.<br><br>We waited and waited.   Many people were going in and getting food.   I understood that Curbside was to be brought out to us, like the girl on the phone had said they would do.<br><br>Nope, no one brought us the food, no one called us to say the food is ready, no one did anything to get our food to us, even though we had done everything the website had asked, and instructed us to do....  THIS COMPANY FAILED.<br><br>The kids were hungry and frustrated the food was taking so long, I finally parked the car and went in.<br><br>Our order was on the counter cold.   It had been sitting there since 5:30 it was not 5:50.   The order was placed and never given to us, even after being told to wait... they would bring it right out.<br><br>Being this frustrated, I wanted to just ask for a refund, since everything was cold and now gross.   I then thought if just asking them to make it fresh like it should have been delivered, but the kids were angry and frustrated, and we had guests waiting.<br><br>We drive 30 minutes to get there, and 40 minutes to get home, only to have to reheat a meal that was cold and not even good left overs.<br><br>In the wake of the Covid 19, I tried to be considerate, but what horrible service was given.   When I had to get out of the car and actually go in to pick up the food, the girl who obviously answers the phone would not look at me, and some lame guy came out of the back and double checked the order.    Yep, it was missing a number of things, that were plainly written on the order, but missed.   What horrible service.   He acted like he didn&#39;t care.<br><br>If there had been a crowd maybe I could have understood the poor response of the staff, and the cold food.   But going into the place, there were two other people and myself.<br><br>I am frustrated I wasted good money here.   I am frustrated that I had to apologize that the meal that is usually wonderful, is now cold, especially to the birthday girl.    And I am thinking that if they can&#39;t  at least do take out for three people, you should just shut the doors.<br><br>We are all trying to be patient, but this wa beyond bad.      What amazed me is that...   The way the staff was treated me, I walked out of there feeling like I had done something wrong in coming in to get the food I had spent $60 on.   <br><br>If you can&#39;t do curbside pickup, have the people tell me.   I wasted time sitting in the car waiting for food that was ready and now cold.     I had money in my pocket for a nice $20 tip, but after the way I was treated and the food we received, I kept the money.<br><br>Avoid this place.

Great service and delicious food! I had the bistro shrimp pasta and my husband had the classic burger. Both of our dishes were cooked perfectly, we were pleasantly surprised. Most chain restaurants tend to overcook their pasta but the pasta here was cooked perfectly al dente! The staff here is really friendly and accommodating. We&#39;ll definitely be coming back!

I have been meaning to write a great review for this place. I have been coming to this place for few years now. This is a chain restaurant ,so many of us are familiar with this place. However, the location and staff make all the different.<br><br>Location: At Santa Anita Mall in the back  by AMC movie theater/Food Court<br><br>Parking: free or you can get valet in right next to the restaurant<br><br>Decoration: Modern furniture. It has inside and outside dining area. You also have a bar area for happy hour. You don&#39;t need reservation to sit in this area. Outside area also have heat lamp for cold nights<br><br>Service: Service oriented restaurant. People appear happy and ready to do a great job<br><br>Food: I got the Fried Macaroni and Cheese. It was melt to your mouth with  crispy cheese ball and you dipped in creamy marinara sauce (delicious). I got the Skinnylicious Chicken Pasta. It was sautéed perfectly with tender chicken and top with fresh basil in Rigatoni pasta<br><br>Price: $13-20. It is reasonable for the amount of food you can. You can also ask for lunch or dinner portion. If you are into portion control<br><br>Dessert Menu: Tiramisu,  Chocolate Tower Truffle cake, Fresh Strawberry shortcake and of course any kind of cheesecake you can think of (Ex: Fresh Strawberry, Coffee &amp; Cream Chocolate,  Salted Caramel, Toasted Marshmallow S&#39;Mores , Oreo Dream, Lemon Meringue, Peanut Butter Cup Fudge, Red Velvet, White Chocolate Rasberry Truffle, Dulce De Leche Caramel). I can go on and on about their mouth watering desserts that  will clogged all your arteries. However, you will die happy.<br><br>They have Sunday Brunch  from 10-2pm<br><br>If you are into dieting, this is probably not the place for you. Their food are in high calories and it is written write next to the name of the dish. You will feel bad for eating it. I tried to be good by getting their skinnlicious menu, but the calories are still fairly high. However, I believed you only live once, so enjoy life vs worry all the time about how you look. Enjoy!!!
I love the Cheesecake Factory, they have a variety of cheesecakes I could select from after I enjoyed a good meal!  If you have never been here you are missing out!

Food is alright and Inlined with Red lobster, Olive garden, BJz type.  I wasnt expect much anyway if you consider this as typical dining spot or meet up a friend havent seen for a long time since the focus is not in the meal.  <br><br>I ordered steak medium rare turns out to be medium,  strawberry lemonade a but too much sugar.  since I didnt make reservations elsewhere, I resorted my bday there, they did pull out 4 staffs saying a mechanical birthday songs to me, and disappear the moment I turn my head wanted to say thank you politely.  <br><br>I found it awkward, and I end up need to get a spoon myself since they forgot to being along with the cheesecake LOL....<br><br>perhaps expectation is low, so it didnt bother me much.<br><br>1.  staff should have name tag so I dont have to ask.<br>2.  dont impose rule on staff to sing bday song if they dont want to, it&#39;s a bit ugly as I capture in my video their reaction which I am not gonna share..<br><br>as competition stiffens, this brand perhaps should start innovate a bit unless you are still one of the few diners available.  <br><br>but in LA....

I ordered delivery during the COVID-19 &#34;safer-at-home&#34;. This has been one of the worst food I&#39;ve gotten from this particular location (Arcadia, CA). I ordered the &#34;Louisiana Chicken Pasta&#34;. The chicken was half the thickness and was over fried...such that it was like chicken jerky/cardboard. It really felt like they were trying stretch their chicken (it was sliced really thin)...and couldn&#39;t adjust their cooking times. What happened to their quality? I felt like supporting this restaurant during this time and felt like I wasted my money (prices went up?).

Great for breakfast,brunch and dinner. And I can&#39;t forget to mention the most amazing and awesome happy hour with a full bar of liquor you can imagine.<br>The menu is like a book of desserts and a variety of different types of food selections. So if you can&#39;t decide what you want,I&#39;m sure this menu will have something for ya.The servers are mostly cool but you get your bad ones also. The cheesecake and specialty desserts are totally bomb! The food is great and I really enjoy the atmosphere here. One thing that&#39;s a bummer is the long wait time on the weekends and you can&#39;t go shopping while you wait because the signal on the buzzer is weak. But no worries everything else makes up for it.

Our server was great, she took care of me and my family last night for my brother&#39;s birthday. However, my mistake, I forgot my take out food on the table when leaving. I went back in 5-10 mins later from my car and they informed me they threw away my to go box with 3/4 of my entree still in there. Granted it was my fault for leaving it there, but with 5-10 mins of leaving it it was trashed, heartbreak city...
update - 7/25. They give me back a call and apologized for the inconvenience. I appreciated that they care about the customer feeling.

I just got cheesecake to go and the guy handling the cheesecake orders keeps coughing and clearing his throat while handling the food. The girl at the register is also coughing.<br><br>Not only that, my cheesecake containers were completely covered in chocolate, cream, strawberry, etc. Same for the napkin and forks inside, <br>It&#39;s like a baby got a hold of a neapolitan cake and touched everything. I doubt he ever changes gloves.<br><br>None of the people handling food orders are wearing masks.<br><br>Really unhygienic, I&#39;m not even sure I want the slices anymore. In this environment, everyone should be covered up. You&#39;re handling peoples food, just put a little more care into it, really.
Pasta da Vinci has always been my favorite! They make it right every time! I get it extra saucy so when u do reheat it, the pasta doesn&#39;t dry out.

I&#39;m always able to count on Cheesecake Factory quality of food and service, but today&#39;s host, server, and bus staff surpassed 99% of my experiences. Congratulations to management and corporate for seeking and cultivating an exceptional experience!!! <br><br>Ashley took my allergy data effectively into consideration and looked out on my behalf. BIG THANKS!!!<br><br>I highly recommend the burger and Guacamole... &#39;spicy&#39;
Horrible do not order for pick up waited 30 minutes after my order was sappose to be ready also have u waiting in the sun no shade

The most amazing thai coconut lime chicken curry I&#39;ve had in a while!!! Large portion - I actually came home with leftovers. Clean restaurant, pleasant waitress, wait time was 10 minutes on a Friday during lunchtime. You can valet park for $11 if you don&#39;t feel like looking for a spot at the mall parking lot.

This is the second time we ordered for pick up.. At first I ordered fettuccine with chicken and sun dried tomatoes.. I ended up getting chicken Alfredo with about 3 pieces of sun dried tomato and 1 piece of chicken.. it was an old favorite of mine.. figured, maybe it&#39;s not as popular as it once was and they don&#39;t make it anymore since I hardly go now.. I&#39;ll let it slide..  Then yesterday ordered again, thinking chicken Madeira.. it&#39;s popular and a favorite.. they can&#39;t do wrong with this one.. NOPE.  This order was DRY!!!! not a sauce in site.. I mean. Really? Chicken cooked in egg.. DRY... asparagus, mushrooms and mashed potatoes... DRY.. SMH!
i like coming here with my family. the food is good and the service is great. i usually get this pastas everytime.  they taste great and the portions are big

Mother&#39;s Day Dinner Disaster. We waited in line for about 20 minutes until someone came out asking if anyone wanted to cancel their order. That&#39;s when we should have realized this was going to be a nightmare. We had preordered online and already paid, and their return process was documenting your name and information on a sheet of paper. No way we were going to trust that. The woman said that based on our time, it&#39;d be another 30-40 minutes. We called mom and she said that&#39;d be okay to wait. Boy were we wrong. We waited almost 3 hours for our food from when it was supposed to be ready. But I feel like I can&#39;t even complain because people had been waiting 5 hours for their food. Others waited 2 hours for JUST cheesecake. Some had ordered DAYS in advance. Communication was severely lacking during our entire time there, in addition to receiving false information. If we were informed of the correct wait times, we would have left. But instead, we didn&#39;t get our food until 9:30pm, and there had to be at least 50 people still waiting for theirs, even though cheesecake closed at 9pm. When we finally got home to eat dinner, the food wasn&#39;t even good. I LOVED the food here prior to this experience, and I am now even more disappointed that not only was there a severe lack of customer service, but also the quality of food was embarrassing. Definitely will not be returning.

Only come here if your intent is to get food poisoning. Will probably never go here again, and will let everyone in my building know about the terrible experience. On 5/2 I had lunch here, by 6-7 pm was extremely sick, and by Friday morning was in Urgent care. <br><br>It wasn&#39;t until after my ordeal that I read the Yelp reviews and saw that another user had recently gotten sick also.  Their generic reply to him just advised that he should use the contact link on the website, so before posting this review I did exactly that.  Never got any type of reply.<br><br>Beware- receiving a generic Yelp reply saying &#34;Sorry you had a bad experience&#34;, is DEFINITELY not worth the agony/pain and ER or Urgent care trip you&#39;ll have to take afterward.
Shout out to Melissa S (table 46) we just had the best restaurant experience in a VERY long time. Thank you so much for all that you do!!!

I just left the Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia. I ordered two slices of cheesecake which were ready within 2-3 minutes tops. After waiting an additional 20mins and seeing my two cheesecake slices on their counter I went up to the counter and asked the waitress (Destiny) behind the counter who also took my order about my cheesecakes and she turned around and gave me my cheesecakes. They had been there the whole time. Instead of doing her job she was behind the cashier on her phone. It was not busy at all. There was no customers. To top it off another lady there had been waiting for her food for over and hour and a half. They completely forgot about her food, stating &#34;they didn&#39;t know where her order was.&#34; It was a horrible visit at this Cheesecake Factory and Destiny is the worse cashier/waitress. How do you just have the customers sitting there looking at their food sitting there on the counter while you&#39;re on your phone? I can&#39;t get over it. People are struggling to get a job right now and is Destiny is taking up someone&#39;s opportunity.

I was here today picking up a to go order that was called in. The wait was long. I observed, while waiting at the take out area a server take her naked hand and wipe off a plate. She then proceeded to put a slice of cheesecake on it and touched that. Why don&#39;t the servers wear gloves? I was not happy with my salad when I got home. It was only lettuce, no cucumbers, carrots, etc. <br>l will think twice before returning to this location!!!

By far my favorite restaurant. This place never disappoints. For appetizers I recommend the avocado egg rolls and the sweet corn tamale cakes. Soo good!! For entrees I always stick with the pasta. I usually order chicken piccata but this time I wanted to try something new. I ordered the shrimp bistro pasta. It is by far one of my favorite dishes now! Every time I come here, I always feel welcomed. The servers are great and really take their time, making sure you&#39;re doing ok and always checking in. Whenever I go out to eat, I always rate a server on how many times they refill my water. The servers here are always making sure your water is topped off. Oh and I almost forgot.... their cheesecake is to die for!!! Oreo dream extreme all the way!!!

The food here is good. Probably everybody knows that :) I want to recognize Mickey who waited our table. He was polite, patient and in general a person who brings hope out of you. It&#39;s getting harder and harder to find people like him these days. It&#39;s not what job you do. It&#39;s how you do it. Good job Mickey!<br><br>No, he did not ask me to write about him.

Rating: 3.5 Stars...... Sounds about right!<br><br>Been at this location a handful of times for birthdays, holidays, and gatherings. The last time I came here was to celebrate an early father&#39;s day.<br><br>Location/Parking: Located at the Santa Anita Mall. You&#39;ll find this restaurant next to Wood Ranch BBQ and Grill. Parking can be a bit troublesome during peak times.<br><br>Ambiance/Decor: Nice ambiance with modern furnishings and a outdoor patio to people watch. They also have heatlamps just in case it gets chilly willy!<br><br>Wait time: You might wait for awhile during peak times. So call ahead and make a reservation.<br><br>Service: Service was fairly consistent. Staffers were friendly and attentive. Food usually takes awhile, because they usually bring all the food all at once.<br><br>Food: They mostly offer high calorie (1,000+ cal.) dishes. If you&#39;re calorie counting, don&#39;t get scared off. They do offer a skinnylicious extensive menu for all you healthy peeps.<br><br>Over the years, I&#39;ve tried a lot of items, but my top 3 plates that I rotate (creature of habit) through are:<br><br>1) Meatloaf: Comes with mashed potatoes, mushroom gravy, grilled onions, and corn succotash. Meatloaf lovers will definitely love this dish. Very moist and very flavorful! Mushroom gravy, grilled onions, and corn succotash is the cherry topper for me. <br><br>2) Miso Salmon: Comes with snow peas, rice (white or brown), and topped with a miso sauce. Very yum! I&#39;m a salmon lover and this one is tender and flavorful. The sauce is beautiful! :) <br><br>3) Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken: Comes with mashed potatoes, carrots, and watercress.The chicken is flavorful, tender, and beautiful!!! I also like eating the skin! For me, the mashpotatoes, carrots, and watercress balances this plate beautifully.<br><br>Get your eating on folks!

Not the best location. Been to many cheesecakes across California and this one is one of the worst. <br><br>They are so disorganized at the hostess station and their service is so slow. We were told our wait was going to be 30 minutes and then we went to go check, they gave our table out to the wrong party and so we waited more. Then they gave our table out again saying they thought we left...thought we left when we were standing right by the hostess station and they never called our name? That time they admit their mistake and apologized for it. Still... we waited even longer. Then we get seated and we had a party of 5 but they stuck us in a booth with an extra chair on the side. Well the chair was in the already tight walk way and just wasn&#39;t fit for a chair. If only I could say it got better....the only thing that got better we asked for manager and he moved us to a proper table. Other than that, service was still slow (waters weren&#39;t being filled, took forever to actually get check after requesting)....how many things can go wrong??

I love The Cheesecake Factory, but I think I will wait until things settle down with this pandemic to return.  I ordered takeout for Mother&#39;s Day and yikes, what an utter disaster!  Completely unorganized, confusion for staff and customers, no social distancing inside the store, and just not a good experience overall.  I get that it was a holiday and expected to be busier than usual, but the restaurant seemed completely unprepared to handle the volume.

Used the Yelp wait list and was seated at the promised time. Service was superb! The hostess was very helpful, the waitress was attentive, and the food was consistent for a Cheesecake Factory restaurant.

We were seated outside for a party of 8 on a Friday evening. It was  quicker to choose patio seating versus inside due to a shorter wait time(20 minutes instead of 45). Our party was separated by choice because my daughter wanted to celebrate her 18th with her friends.  The waiters,  Justin and Cody, were attentive and gave great service to both our tables. They even decorate the cheesecake dessert plate with chocolate a happy birthday message and give the birthday person a small glass of ice cream with a candle.  The only misstep was that I ordered from the skinnylicious menu a Chinese Chicken Salad with dressing on the side. The dressing did come on the side, but it also had already been tossed with dressing. I didn&#39;t want to send it back due to time issues AND hunger .  Altogether a nice experience at a mall restaurant.

It gets super packed on Friday thru Sunday nights so be wary of the wait on those nights. For the most part, I enjoy going to this Cheesecake Factory pretty regularly because they have a large variety of dishes, especially if you don&#39;t like eating the same thing all the time. My older favorites are their Factory Famous Meatloaf and Santa Fe Salad, but I tried the Factory Burrito Grande and Skinnylicious Chicken Pasta recently and love both those dishes! For starters, I always get the Avocado Eggrolls.<br><br>In terms of service, it really depends on the server you get - some hustle, some don&#39;t. It usually is really slow on weekday late nights and so service could be slow and not so great. We had one of our orders completely wrong before and they were able to bring it the right order later. My boyfriend was afraid that there was an ingredient that he was allergic to when we got our meals and the staff were fantastic at making a new dish to make sure he didn&#39;t get a fatal allergic reaction.

In general I like CCF and this location is on par with my expectations for and experience with CCF.<br><br>Pros:<br>1. Food is good. In particular, one of my new favorites is the Cinnamon Roll Pancake, which is only available on weekends. It&#39;s the best pancake I&#39;ve ever had.<br>2. Wheat bread is bomb.<br>3. If you sit closer to the outside patio, there are several Pokestops you can reach while you eat.<br><br>Cons:<br>1. Everything I like there is about 2,000 calories per dish.<br>2. Usually a long wait which is normal for CCF (therefore go really early if you can).<br>3. Parking is shared with the Santa Anita Mall, which means it&#39;s bad (unless you go really early).
Made reservations on yelp for 20 minutes before we got there were seated right away very private booth nice waitress delicious food wonderful ambience. Highly recommend.

I love this franchise restaurant. Massive menu, fun drinks. But today....<br><br>Decided to take kids and relative kids out for Sunday brunch. Got here at 10am to beat the potential Thanksgiving rush. <br><br>Table of 17ish, 14 were here... but again no server (?).<br><br>They made us wait 30 mins because the server hasn&#39;t shown up? <br><br>Maybe I increase the number of stars after the food is served today.<br><br>Last few times at this location hasn&#39;t always been smooth. About two months ago, the pasta served were extremely salty.<br>-------<br><br>The waitress is very nice. I revised my 1 star to 4 stars.

Happened to be in the area and I wanted to kill two birds with one stone so I met a friend for lunch whom I hadn&#39;t seen in a few years.  I was at a Cadillac event next door at the Santa Anita Racetrack and suggested we meet at the mall since there were plenty of venues available.  I chose Cheesecake Factory cause I had not been in a while.  Service was great, food, not so great.  I ordered the lunch grilled salmon plate and the salmon was tasty.  Came with mashed potatoes and steamed broccoli.  Portion size was small, but excellent if you are counting calories.  Otherwise, rest of the food was bland, food&#39;s pricey, and the worst part about the experience was the congested area and parking lot.
Good dinner, good company, and cheesecakes were bomb! It gets busy so use the yelp application to reserve a table.

Haven&#39;t eaten at Cheesecake Factory in a long time<br>Got a gift card so we picked up dinner last night <br>It was very good <br>So today we decided to have same thing for early dinner<br>Ordered same meal and today it was half the size ? They asked if we wanted lunch or dinner size and we stated dinner paid for dinner size but got a small lunch size <br>And hair was in my food <br>$44 later for 2 meals<br>Very disappointed

One of my go-to places for a special occasion! This location is located right outside of the Santa Anita mall near the food court. It&#39;s pretty big with a lot of seating, but there can still be a wait during busy weekend dinner times. You can definitely grab a drink in the bar area while you wait. If you&#39;re into yummy cocktails, I would suggest the Strawberry Creamsicle or the Peach Bellini! <br><br>As for food, they have a ton of options ranging from pastas to pizzas to protein dishes. My favorite is the Lemon-Herb Roasted Chicken. I just love the light lemon herb sauce! Also, the mashed potatoes are great because I love mine chunky. The Pasta Da Vinci is also a good choice. It has chicken, mushrooms, and a great wine sauce. They also give you free unlimited bread here that&#39;s really great. I love the &#34;brown bread&#34; which is a sweet wheat and oat brown bread that tastes like chocolate in my opinion. <br><br>And of course, you can&#39;t forget about the cheesecake. They have so many different options that it&#39;s always hard to choose. The red velvet one is really good, and so is the white chocolate raspberry truffle. Each slice is pretty hefty so I suggest splitting it with someone.<br><br>Overall, Cheesecake Factory might be a bit pricey (~$15-20 per dish), but the food tastes great and comes in big portions, and they have good service, so I think it&#39;s worth it!

Food is always good here. Consistency of their dishes and portions have always been on point. The experience here varies from time to time depending on service, but they have so many servers here that I&#39;ve never had a repetitive server. <br><br>My friend and I sat up at the bar with Tiffany as our server. We ordered a couple of drinks and some dishes to share; we enjoyed ourselves! One of our dishes, the Chicken, Mango, and Avocado Salad did not come with avocado...even though it&#39;s suggested in the title. We informed Tiffany that our salad did not come with avocado and she said &#34;yeah it should&#39;ve&#34; and continued on with her business! She did not come back to us until we were done and brought us our check. I was hoping she would bring our missing avocado on the side instead...

Love the food, but I got to-go and got a salad and asked for extra dressing.  This is what I got in total- for a large salad.  Enough for a couple of bites.  Not cute, considering that the dressing is the only reason I ordered a salad from them
Worst fucking place ever! I drove 30 mns away so I can find a god damn fly in my food! I didn&#39;t even realize until I got home and ate one entire chicken!

This Cheesecake Factory is always super busy but if you don&#39;t mind sitting outside you generally can get a seat almost immediately. I ordered the steak Diane with the salmon and my friend went with the angel hair pasta with shrimp. Both dishes tasted decent and portion sizes were fair. <br><br>My only complaint about the experience was the outside patio they sat us at was quite cold. I had to go back to the car to grab a jacket which definitely ruined the experience. On my way back I noticed the patio side closest to the mall entrance had the heaters on so not sure why our side didn&#39;t. <br><br>Additionally you should keep in mind that food at the Cheesecake Factory is quite expensive. Food, drinks and desserts will easily bring your total close to $70+ (or more) before tip. While the food is good I don&#39;t think it&#39;s priced appropriately. Service though was quite good and very attentive which I really appreciated. Overall this place isn&#39;t too bad an option to dine out but just keep in mind that it will cost you a pretty dime.

The only reason I wanna give this place 4 stars are the food and service from Adrian at the front desk. He was the ONLY person ever smiling at the cashier. I don&#39;t understand why?! Most of the time I feel like a burden to the person but he was smiling right away and serviced very happy and speedy. Please put him in front of customers more. I think he&#39;ll make a killing tips as waiter.

Had a great Easter Sunday dinner here the other night. <br><br>Shared a bottle of wine and dinner which was delicious with the exception of the slightly undercooked pasta in one of our dishes which was chewy, but not inedible. Besides that, our service was great. Everyone that came to our table was very helpful. <br><br>After dinner, we moved to the bar where the bartender Mickey served us up several fantastic Gin Martinis and even offered us a free desert and warm conversation. <br><br>Thanks for a good time.
Overall the experience was great. Food was good and was attended to quickly. Made reservations in advance with definitely helped.

Came on a holiday and the service was very very slow, but the foods usually good.<br><br>Things that were good here:<br>Appetizer- spicy wings <br>-Anti oxidant salad<br>-Hibachi steak that comes with mash potatoes and wild mushrooms.<br>-The grilled salmon/miso salmon that comes with mash potatoes and broccoli<br><br>Things that are not good here:<br>-The jumbalaya pasta with chicken and bell peppers are so plain. The chicken had no flavor even when it was cooked with peppers. There&#39;s no sauce in this dish, it was missing tomatoe sauce but instead it was dry all around. I did not even want to box this to-go. Not enjoyable whatsoever.<br><br>Their sangria is not bad if you like red wine and fruits.<br>Also their steak Diane under the combinations section was alright, steak was not so flavorful.

Food was excellent but the outdoor seating was terrible because of flies everywhere due to trash can near by. Our waitress was very accommodating to find a way to get rid of flies. Please put your trash somewhere else if customers are expected to sit outside.

Well let me get this out of the way, it was my son&#39;s birthday and this was his request for dinner since we were out of town and he loves desserts.  I love food so I don&#39;t mind coming to a decent restaurant either and this was our first visit to this particular Cheesecake Factory location.<br>     The parking is out of control, it is located at the Westfield&#39;s Mall in Arcadia and that is the reason it is that way but it was also Superbowl Sunday, not sure what is everything in the mall but maybe some spots for people to watch it?  None the less we parked what felt like a quarter mile walk, luckily it wasn&#39;t raining until after we made it inside, half the time we were inside it was raining like mad, people were walking in drenched!<br>     Forget all that which doesn&#39;t really concern this visit really, I have to say the food was great, I had the Factory Combination plate of Chicken Madeira and Steak Diane that was served with veggies and garlic mashed potatoes.  I asked for the steak to be prepared as medium rare but it came more on the medium side which is fine, if it was served well-done then I would&#39;ve requested a new one.  The steak was well seasoned, the Chicken Madeira was super moist and the potatoes, well they were good.  <br>     The service of our waitress started off disappointing and ended horribly, we waited quite a bit for her to take our order for drinks, then another good amount of time to order our food but this is the kicker, it was not that busy in the area she was covering.  She did spend more time on one particular table more than ours and others, I have my suspicions but won&#39;t go into them, I&#39;ll just say we were neglected and were forced to flag her down for a refill or any other service including To-Go boxes and the check.<br>     Once we were finished and finally presented the check, she vanished, for 25 minutes I kept looking and looking, I didn&#39;t see her anywhere.  Keep in mind that were are visiting from out of town, the weather is not the best and we wanted to leave to get on the road before the weather started kicking up again.  Another 10 minutes pass, now its been 35 minutes and she seems to have pulled a disappearing act....<br>     I approach the cheesecake counter to try and pay the check but they informed me they are not allowed to process this transaction, the employee then stated he would locate a manager.  Another 10 minutes slowly pass by, still no sight of the waitress, I approach the host check-in desk and ask to pay the check and explain the situation, all of a sudden the waitress appears out of thin air like a cheap magic trick on the streets of Los Angeles....Why did it come to this?  What was she doing?  In the event a waitress/waiter goes missing and a customer does not care to wait and wait, why wouldn&#39;t they process my check?  <br>     I have never visited a Cheesecake Factory let alone a restaurant at all that let it get to this extent, I don&#39;t usually complain like this but I couldn&#39;t understand what was going on here.  Only one person wanted to help and it was the employee at the cheesecake counter, which says quite a bit for a restaurant and their standards.  I can only say I or my family will not return to this location, just really disappointing and it was beyond the waitress, more than one employee with the hands-off attitude.

I&#39;ve been to this location a few times, and there&#39;s been pros and cons to each visit. <br><br>Service is hit and miss. You either get a good server, or you don&#39;t. I usually don&#39;t mind service that is just okay, but for here, I also base it on whether they&#39;ll slip me some of that delicious molasses bread with my wrapped leftovers. They generally give it to me when I ask for it. <br><br>Honestly, the free brown bread is the only reason I eat in. Everything else is meh for the price. I&#39;d rather buy just dessert at the counter than eat here. Even then, dessert is pricey, so it has to be a &#34;treat yo self&#34; occasion.

When Cheesecake Factory opened up this location in Arcadia, it saved us time and energy in trying to make it to the Pasadena location, which is farther with some parking challenges. In all the times I&#39;ve been here, there is usually a wait to get seated.<br><br>My experiences at the Cheesecake Factory have been pretty consistent. Adequate service and the quality of food doesn&#39;t deviate (most of the time). On my last visit, I ordered my usual at Cheesecake - the seared ahi tuna tataki salad. Even though I had this so many times already, it still feels weird that the tomatoes come in slices like you&#39;ll have on a burger, rather than chopped up in wedges like a normal salad. BF branched out and tried the cajun chicken littles, which were fried boneless chicken breast pieces with mashed potatoes and corn succotash. BF subbed in french fries for mashed potatoes. It was good, though I doubt he&#39;ll add it to his rotating repertoire of what he&#39;d usually order. It must have been super busy because we had table bread served on a plate and not the usual basket, even though the two tables next to us had their bread in a basket. <br><br>While there is a wait to get a table, there is also high chances of a wait to find parking too as you&#39;re competing with people visiting the mall, the AMC movie theater, and other restaurants on that side of Westfield. Come with patience in tow.

This place gets really packed on weekends. The wait is long but they are good at managing on giving seats to customers. The wait time for serving our food was a little bit longer because there&#39;s a lot of people when we got there. I didn&#39;t mind because we were accommodated properly. The food was good and yes they have big serving. Overall the service was great and my family and I will still come back (if we&#39;re patient enough to wait again)

So sad to give this bad review, but the only reason why I gave it two stars is because of the wonderful hostess.<br><br>Came here for my dads birthday. There were 6 of us. Our server took our order and then went on break. Be proceeded to wait for over an hour for our food. The table next to us (who had 6 ppl as well) got their food way in advance. They did have a different server. <br><br>So, the food comes out cold. We ordered Jamaican shrimp, pork chop, steak Diane, some sandwich, and a and some other stuff. <br><br>The manager told us the food was cold because there was a back up at the  sandwich station....so I guess the policy is to let food get cold rather than serving the hot food when it&#39;s hot and bringing out the sandwich later. Just silly. Or a better solution would of been for someone to come over and tell us about the backup rather than letting us sit for an hour wondering what was going on with no one coming by. I think that they just forgot to bring out our food because our server went on break.<br><br>Won&#39;t be coming back to this cheesecake any time soon. The one in Pasadena is much better

Can never go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. Every one I go to always shows consistency in terms of food quality, wait time, and service. Came for lunch specials and ordered the Chicken, Mango, and Avocado salad but subbed the chicken for beans and the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Only complaint I have is that I had a chunk of blue cheese in my salad even though I specified no cheese (of course the worst type of cheese is the one that finds its way into my meal lol). The thing that will always keep me coming back to Cheesecake is their glorious brown bread, skip on the sourdough and just ask for a basket of only brown bread!

It has been almost 3 weeks since. I received no reply from the corporate office in regards to my refund and complaint. They did reach out on yelp telling me to contact them on their website but I did that already and refuse to do so again, and nothing happened after. They just didn&#39;t bother looking it up. I contacted the restaurant again and spoke to an male manager who promised me that I would receive my refund by Friday, October 30th, 2020. Nothing was refunded so I called again yesterday, and was told by the manager Sammy that it doesn&#39;t seem like it was processed and then he tried to and it wouldn&#39;t process and he needed the Accountant to process it in the morning when she comes in. She was suppose to call me today 11/04/20. But I did not receive a call. And still no refund. This is so beyond ridiculous. I want my money back! Your company did not provide me with what I ordered and I want my money now. I don&#39;t want a gift card to your crappy business because I will never go back.

5-star service, enough to leave a 20% tip.<br>Food 1-star.  So I guess it&#39;s my fault that I ordered a burger from a restaurant known for their pasta.  Just thought if it&#39;s a glam-burger, it&#39;d be more amazing than something at McDonalds.  Heck, the Big Mac taste way better.  I paid $14.50 for this burnt and dry burger.  Sad and pathetic small slab of ground beef supposedly filled with cheese but really just full of empty promises.  If you decide to use a large brioche and attempt to be fancy, let&#39;s make the patty just as big to give it a worthwhile appeal.  Actually, fill it with more cheese so it can oooze out once you bite into it.  Calculate that the meat will decrease in size after being cooked and prep it larger to give it a wow factor when presented.  Another tragic and pathetic fact, the lettuce used on this burger was exactly like the lettuce-tomato-pickles is what you see on a Big Mac when you peel the top bun.  The small shredded amount of green should be replaced with a few large pieces of iceberg, a nice slice of a large juicy beefsteak tomato would be ideal and pickles with ruffle like waves wouldn&#39;t be too much to ask for.  Your stuffed cheddar burger is a disgrace to the culture of traditional All-American grub.  Look on the bright side, the server got you guys the perfect score.

The Cheesecake Factory really specializes in desserts.  The rest of their menu is solid and always good but never fantastic or super memorable.  I love their little Beets w/Goat Cheese Salad, their different artichoke dips, the Avocado Eggrolls and their delicious free &#34;Famous Brown Bread.&#34;  I will just eat baskets of their fresh bread.  Service at this particular location has always been really super good and prices are okay for a nice chain restaurant.<br><br>Wait time is hit or miss.  Sometimes it&#39;s insane and it&#39;ll be way over a 30-minute wait, sometimes you get in right away.<br><br>I hate the lighting.  I can never, for the life of me, get a decent photo of anything I eat there, which probably means that this review might not have any photos to complement it for a while until my next visit there.<br><br>All in all, a good... No, a very good restaurant but there&#39;s just nothing that wows me about it.  I never crave it; I never suggest it as an option when we&#39;re mulling over where to have lunch or dinner.  Go, figure.

I&#39;ve been going to this place weekly for years. It&#39;s become my go to restaurant. I love it here. The food never disappoints. I&#39;ll usually stick to my usual orders but I would never be afraid to order something new because I know it would be delicious. I would die for the chicken marsala. I&#39;m in love with this dish. It&#39;s the perfect comfort food for any time of day or weather. The chicken chaser salad is an all time favorite. It continues to trick my mind into thinking I&#39;m eating healthy. They don&#39;t overdue the dressing so it doesn&#39;t become soggy and drenched in the first 30 minutes. The service is amazing, I can&#39;t remember a time where I&#39;ve had an issue with my waiter/waitress. They are always open to share their opinions on their favorite dishes and drinks. They talk to you with a smile and always know how to treat their customers. It can take a while for the food to come out but I would wait for that food any day !

Came in on Sunday for lunch and waited about 5 minutes before being seated. It was my first time<br>at Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s pretty pricey but I actually received a gift card for Christmas so it was time for me to cash it in. My sisters and I were having lunch for her birthday. We ordered the lunch specials, soup &amp; salad, fettuccine alfredo, and the four cheese pasta. All of which were really really good. The food was great, but the price for what we paid was crazy if I didn&#39;t have a gift card. Definitely a nice place for special occasions

I love Cheesecake Factory, but not this location. The food here doesn&#39;t taste as fresh and isn&#39;t cooked as great as the other chain locations I&#39;ve been to (and I&#39;ve been to many) and the last two times I ordered takeout, my orders were not done correctly. One time, I ordered the Pasta Campagna, and I got rigatoni pasta when it is SUPPOSED TO BE paccheri pasta. Then, this past Friday, I ordered the Miso Salmon, but got home to open my order with NO MISO SAUCE (what the heck?! Miso Salmon with no white miso sauce, see photo).<br><br>SUGGESTION: CHECK YOUR ORDER BC THE KITCHEN OFTEN GETS IT MESSED UP.
Like coming here my husband loves pasta  Alfredo and chipotle it&#39;s so delicious recommend those two! Customer service friendly.
I miss this place :( Their fried mac n cheese balls are amazing. Especially their famous cheesecakes.

This Cheesecake Factory is located at the Santa Anita mall. I came here on Thursday for lunch around 2:30. We did have to wait because it was pretty busy, but it was no more than 10 minutes. <br><br>FOOD: I&#39;ve eaten here a couple times, but this time the food just didn&#39;t taste great. I ordered from the lunch specials and got the meatloaf that came with mashed potatoes and corn mixed with vegetables. The meatloaf just didn&#39;t cut it for me. I probably enjoyed the corn the most. The portion was very generous though, I expected it to be a lot less than what I was served. <br><br>Besides the meatloaf, we ordered two appetizers - tater tots and the fried macaroni. I liked the tater tots, which was filled with bacon, cheese, and green onion. It came with sour cream and sriracha mayo, but I only dipped it with the sriracha mayo since I do not like sour cream. The fried Mac n&#39;cheese wasn&#39;t too bad either, I just wished they added a bit more macaroni inside. <br><br>SERVICE: service could be better. I don&#39;t know if it was because we looked like a bunch of kids or if it&#39;s because they put us in a corner, but they could have been more attentive. They probably came to our table only twice besides bringing us our food. We also had to ask our waitress a couple times before we got what we asked for. At the end, she came with the bill and I gave it to her when I was ready, yet when she came back with the receipt, she handed it to my cousin instead. I was kind of taken aback because and confused why she handed it to my cousin instead of me. I&#39;m not trying to make that a big deal because it&#39;s not, but was it because I looked to young that you didn&#39;t give it to me instead ? Doesn&#39;t matter though, but please be more attentive to your customers. <br><br>PRICE: I think it is pricey, but its price is comparable to places like BJ&#39;s or TGIF. <br><br>PARKING: since this is located at a mall, it can be pretty hard to find parking on the weekends, but there is an option if valet service. If you come on a weekday, there should be no problem finding a spot though.
My first time at cheesecake factory and it was delicious fantastic and great service I went with my son and I definitely should I say we definitely agreed to come back for sure very great experience

I prefer going here for their weekend brunch or during their lunch specials.  Why pay dinner prices when you could have the same thing for lunch?  I am way beyond the age of those date nights.  My husband and I are just as happy eating brunch/lunch together.  Since the lunch servings are not as big as their dinner servings, I am able to share a red velvet cheesecake with my hubby!

Drove 15 miles just to take my daughters out for dinner at this restaurant. We anticipated a long wait but to our surprise the restaurant was relatively empty.  So...three African American nicely dressed females approach the counter to check in.  Two ladies are at the podium...after they softly conversed, one said right this way.<br>At this point approximately ten tables in the entire restaurant were taken.  Needless to say, all the other patrons didn&#39;t look like us.  Our waiter passed numerous empty tables and seated us at the last table, in the back, all alone out of view from any of the other customers.   I immediately asked if we could be seated at one of the front seats and she said &#34;I have to ask.&#34;   Really???<br><br>After about 30 minutes I looked to see if they had seated anyone at that table.  Guess what two females that look like me are sitting there.....smh<br><br>The only reason I gave them 2 stars is because the restaurant was clean and our waitress was nice.

Tried to talk to a manager about their lemon - garlic shrimp and it took quite a while before she answered. I wanted to worn her about the food that afternoon. I ended up running to the bathroom a few times. My stomach didn&#39;t really hurt but running to the bathroom was a different story. After eating this it happened a few min after. I usually go they&#39;d to eat but right now the virus is still happening and I want then to be more careful. I hope I didn&#39;t get the virus

By far my favorite Cheesecake Factory location! I recommend the Four Cheese Pasta and the Margherita Flatbread Pizza. The service provided by Connor was excellent. He was very alert, attentive, and provided me with the deals of the day. Thanks to his positive attitude, I am definitely returning soon! Thank you for your exceptional customer service.
