After a exhausting walk around the Los Angeles Arboretum across the street we were starving for some food! The Cheesecake Factory is conveniently located across the street at the Westfield mall. We got there around 11:30 and were seated promptly. Bread was brought to our table immediately and drinks shortly after. Food came out very quickly and was excellent as usual. Bathrooms were clean and stocked which should be a given for a restaurant that just opened or the day, but you&#39;d be surprised how many are not. Valet is located right outside if you need that but I found parking in the lot which is very large as well as a parking structure next to it.

Kalyn is the best server here! I&#39;ve been to many cheesecake factories before and always run into problems with service but not here.<br>Every time I come to cheesecake I always get the same thing so I decided to go outside of my box and ask her her suggestions. She suggested the Baja chicken tacos, chicken maidera, and the lemon raspberry cheesecake. I ordered the chicken maidera and my bf ordered the Baja Chicken tacos. She also recommended I try to the Mai Tai and I&#39;m in love! My bf likes lemonade but was unsure of which to order and she said her fav was the cucumber so he went for it. After dinner we both ended with a slice of lemon raspberry cheesecake and a slice of Oreo cheesecake. Her service was outstanding she catered to our needs without being overbearing. So five starts for Kalyn.<br><br>On the other hand, I did have a few minor complaints. One being that it took us about 45 minutes to be seated even though we were told 30. I do not mind waiting but they weren&#39;t even busy. My second complaint is Monique. I can tell she had an attitude from the second I walked in. She told us 30 minutes and when it was about 10 minutes over I asked her if it was almost ready and she told me &#34;I quoted you 30 mins&#34; sooo I guess she didn&#39;t realized that her &#34;quote&#34; was wrong cause she was 15 minutes over. She is the reason for one less star.

Been Here Few Times Dine-In &amp; Takeaway @ The Cheesecake Factory (Arcadia Santa Anita Mall). Many (Group) Branches. Order Tex Mex Egg Rolls , Fried Calamari , Shrimp Scampi , Steak Diane + Original Cheesecake. Good Taste. Recommended.

Obviously today was not a good day for cheesecake , their servers went down, I will not let one day ruin their reputation for the workers and regardless of no one saying anything about the amount of people.Their General manager or manager should have stopped people but coming but I hope everyone knows how hard it is to deal with angry people and to get them to listen so do NOT blame Cheesecake Factory , people are SMART enough to know when to space out and not crowd . PEOPLE should also have full COMMON sense to wear mask and protect themselves , they SHOULDNT need a business to tell them how to do that. My food was really  late so I just walked out and went to buy something from the market to make at home knowing that the majority of the food being late wasn&#39;t the restaurant itself, No restaurant ever will just stop like that unless something terrible wrong has happened,  it was out of their control. I&#39;ve seen countless off IGNORANT people treat the waiters and staff like crap when I&#39;ve dined here. People should remember don&#39;t be rude to people making or prepping ur food ever. It&#39;s MOTHERSDAY expect delays everywhere

The service and the atmosphere was great. Prepare to wait on the weekends. I was there with the family - a party of 7. A very friendly staff and seating is comfortable. The food is prepared no matter how you ask for it. I love to frequent at Cheesecake Factory and this will be one of my go to restaurants! You will never have to worry about any errors with this place.

The Cheesecake Factory at this location used to be one of my favorite spot when I still lived around the area. I visited my mom yesterday so we did some shopping and decided to order to-go from here. I called beforehand and the person who took our order was very nice and asked us if we wanted some bread and butter as well, I responded &#34;yes&#34;. We got 3 orders of the Chicken Bellagios to-go. Tell me why, when we drove back home and started to unpack our meals, the chicken bellagios had no flavor to them? And they did not give us the bread and butter like they had offered. Me and my mom are a big fan of the chicken bellagio... so we knew how it was supposed to taste... the pasta had no taste or flavor... the meals weren&#39;t cheap either.

Gray haired short manager offers trash service. Ordered 2 pastas for take out and had us wait 50 minutes for a &#34;15-20 minute wait.&#34; When we asked him to check on it for us at least 3 times, he would go inside and did not update us. After waiting 50 minutes we went in and asked again to which they handed us a bag that had been sitting there for 15 minutes. The food was cold by the time we left the restaurant. I typically don&#39;t write reviews but this was pathetic.

Very disappointed not honest business, your Ad $20 promotion July 3 is the last day, Try to online order at1:00 pm can&#39;t do it. Call Arcadia store tell us can&#39;t order anymore. This is shady business. Bad business.

I do not suggest dining in restaurant I have seen employees outside an heard that they also in the kitchen smoke marijuana vaping is un detectable cause it has no smell this is un professional an very unhealthy when employees are preparing food when they are impaired an how are they cleaning dishes I will not ever dine here again I witness an employee walking back into the restaurant smelling of weed I know it&#39;s legal but should it be openly allowed to smoke around business area If patrons can smell it I know management does too people are getting sick I feel employees should be in the right frame of mine preparing our food an cleaning  sharing an smoking behind each other is very unhealthy with this virus going around

I&#39;m only giving this restaurant one star for service and another for the bread. <br><br>Came here on a weekend for dinner with a group of 6 and because they don&#39;t take reservations, we wound up waiting in line like everyone else for nearly an hour and a half to be seated. You line up and make your way through hoards of people waiting inside to put your name down and grab one of those buzzers. There&#39;s no fancy text messaging system to alert you to return when your name is about to be called. I expected some wait during the weekend but we were finally seated after 90 minutes. <br><br>Your experience with service here will vary depending on who you&#39;re paired with but our server was cute in an awkward kind of way. He made sure we were well stocked with delicious brown bread and sourdough bread with butter while we waited for our food. And this is where the positives end.<br><br>Eating at the Cheesecake Factory is not cheap, and while I hate the idea of eating at chain restaurants, my girlfriend really loves the strawberry shortcake here and we decided to bring the family along. At close to 15-20 dollars a dish, you expect to have some decent quality to the food. I&#39;m not sure if the chefs were particularly burnt out this evening but all of our dishes came out terrible and almost inedible.<br><br>Shrimp Scampi - bland overcooked pasta with a scattering of limp shrimp drenched in butter and lemon juice. If they had kept this al dente, it may have been okay.<br><br>Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp - overly sweet and rich coconut sauce was overpowering and the hints of ginger made this an entree that looked like a sad attempt at thai fusion curry.<br><br>Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - overcooked green pasta with no sauce. It tasted like someone had left the pasta boiling in the water 10 minutes too long and washed out the sauce after realizing that it wasn&#39;t clinging onto the noodles. Tasted a lot like mealy carbs with cajun seasoning sprinkled on and not much else.<br><br>Miso Salmon - the one acceptable dish but it came out overly sweet today and my parents didn&#39;t care for it.<br><br>Thai Coconut Lime Chicken - ordered this as it was on their list of new items and I&#39;m a huge fan of thai food. This was more palatable than the overly sweet bang bang chicken but the sauce was way too strong, and again tasted like syrup and coconut milk poured atop coconut flavored rice. <br><br>Smokehouse burger - bun was burnt to a crisp and extra smoky. &#39;nuff said. Those in the kitchen seem to have given up.<br><br>Quality control between the various Cheescake factories needs work in order to demonstrate to customers that their food is of good value. When you&#39;re paying north of 20 dollars per person for food after taxes, it is quite sad when the star dish of the day was the complimentary bread served before the main courses.

Love the vibe of going to The Cheesecake Factory. We had a very good experience and ordered many items from the menu. <br>The bread is absolutely delicious!! <br>We ordered a lot of items like pasta, pizzas and fish n chips. Also, we can not forget to get a delicious cheesecake. <br>I decided to get the Oreo Cheesecake! It&#39;s so delicious but with the food I was so filled up that I had to take it to go. <br>Overall, good service and great food!

I ordered the New York steak medium-well and it came with mashed potato and green beans. Everything on my plate was delicious. My daughter ordered fettuccine Alfred and her dad ordered the burger with fries. I didn&#39;t hear any complaints about their food but we could have had slightly more attention from our waitress. We finished our complimentary bread and had to wait until she came around to our neighbors (who came after us) for their second round of bread, to ask for more. I understand she had other customers and I didn&#39;t fault her for that. I will definitely come back to enjoy the food.

Cheesecake Factory is a great place for any group.  They have so many choices that anyone can find something they like.  The staff is always polite and attentive.  <br><br>The Cream of Chicken Soup was delicious.  A very nice mix of flavors.<br><br>The Wellness Salad is amazing and I always feel good after eating it.<br><br>Parking can be a problem depending on when you go.  But, with a little patience a spot can be found.

I first went to CCF about 20 years ago at the Old Town Pasadena location and pretty much that was the only one I would go to.   I now pretty much only go to the one at the Santa Anita Mall because I find the access to the restaurant is much easier than Old Town if I am going just to eat, but if at Old Town already then I will go to that location.   I go to CCF maybe four times a year and it&#39;s not for any other reason that there was so many places to eat that I like to visit other places too. <br><br>I don&#39;t understand the poor reviews.  I have not experienced the problems that some of the reviewers have complained about.  I usually make really long reviews but I&#39;ll try to make this straight to the point if I can. <br><br>Every time I have been to CCF the service has been good, friendly staff, food served quickly, food has been good and portions large.   I also love that they have a large menu.   A good variety for different people in your group.  I went the other day with my mom and I ordered the Cajun Chicken Littles.  I got all fries with it and I wanted to spice it up a bit and I asked the waitress if they could maybe turn them into garlic fries.  She told me she would check.  She also asked if I wanted Parmesan Cheese on it as well.  She&#39;s good because I didn&#39;t mention that and she was thinking outside of the box and verified if I wanted that.  Garlic Fries are best with Parm on it.  That girl must eat Garlic Fries sometimes too if she knew  to ask that. She asked if I wanted fresh garlic or garlic powder.  Good going girl, you are a good waitress to ask those questions and to check with the kitchen if they will do this for me.  Well, I got my wishes.  Very happy about that.  She said that I&#39;m the only customer who has asked her that.   Now if I can only ask her out?  Just kidding guys, just messing with you.   Well my meal was good as usual and my mom got the Salmon which I think was a Japanese style because it was seasoned with Miso, which is Japanese.  My mom liked it a lot.  She was satisfied.   <br><br>Our waitress&#39; name is Alexis.  She&#39;s good at what she does. She&#39;s prompt, polite, professional, gives suggestions, and goes the extra mile so to speak.  I&#39;ve also have had great experiences with other waitresses there too.  Oh wait, do I call them &#34;servers&#34; to be PC (Politically Correct)?  Nah I&#39;m old school.   The other waitresses are on top of things too.   <br><br>I can recommend CCF to others, this location especially but other locations I have had good experiences there too.

My friend and I arrived there on Friday at around 5:39 pm and we expected to wait more than 40 minutes but we did not. The host said there was only a 20 minute wait and he put my name down.  <br><br>Service had a slow start, however they have bussers and runners to bring us yummy bread and butter. Drinks and apetizers were all served in a timely manner.  The waitress was super friendly. <br><br>I got Evelyn&#39;s pasta which has (Penne tossed with Broccoli, Zucchini, Roasted Eggplant, Peppers, Artichoke, Kalamata Olives, Onion) and was pretty good but the artichoke seemed dry and did not add flavor to the pasta. <br><br>Definately coming back here.

Wha&#39;s up CCF?  I am new to this area so I ordered a pizza to go.  I was quoted 15 to 20 minutes.  I arrived after 20 minutes.  I stood by the cash register in the bakery area only to be ignored by cashiers, servers, Managers, etc.  They were all congregating in that area chatting about non-work-related topics.  One of the cashiers finally acknowledged me.  He said my pizza would be a few minutes longer.  It was about another 15 to 20.<br>I sat there looking at the ever changing, perfectly photographed menu items on your menu board.  There seemed to be no sense of urgency among your staff.  When my pizza finally arrived, it looked nothing like the beautifully arranged food from the menu board.  The pizza looked like it had been dropped from the roof into a way too small plastic box instead of a pizza box!!! (see photo).  I had been waiting too long to complain &amp; it looked like the manager was too busy chatting with the coworkers.  Honestly, even though all of the ingredients were forced to the middle, the pizza was still pretty tasty, just not very appetizing.<br>So, I figured I would give CCF another chance.  The food was good, and BRENDA R. did an EXCELLENT  job, but why was there a wait with so many empty tables??? (see other pic.).  Either poor scheduling, poor staffing or you just don&#39;t give a F*€K about your guests&#39; time.  There was only one other table seated in the whole section but the waiting area was full.<br>The food&#39;s been good, but most of your staff just has a dismissive attitude with no sense of urgency or guest focus.  Thanks for listening!!!
We dined here tonight and had the best service by Juan. Thank you so much for making our night wonderful.

Came to eat here because all the other restaurants in the mall had super long waits on a Friday night. The wait was only about ~15 mins for a party of two! <br><br>My bf and I ordered his favorite pasta, Pasta Da Vinci. It&#39;s a delicious pasta with shiitake mushrooms and chicken in a Madeira wine sauce. I&#39;ve tried to replicate it at home, but nothing comes close to the pasta they serve here! We also got the BBQ Bacon Burger, which was HUGE, and very juicy. <br><br>Like most Cheesecake Factory&#39;s, the servings were generous and you&#39;ll definitely be going home with leftovers.
See how &#39;thick&#39; the cake is! Really disappointed...and where is whip cream????  So sosooso disappointed!!!!!!

So we get to this Cheesecake Factory very hungry and ready to eat, and as usual it&#39;s very very packed and took us 15 min to find parking, Anyway, We put our names down in which the hostess tell us it&#39;s a 30 min wait. We finally get called to our table and we order our waiter appetizers as she leaves our waiter leaves our table we call her back to ask her for bread and she informs us that there is no bread and they have run out, WHAT! She says yeah the vendor in on strike or something...Wow, so ok we decide we can go with out bread. She then comes back to take out drinks and orders, my husband and I both order the steak with no problem. About 10 min in she comes back to tell us they have no steak intact no beat...WOW! She&#39;s like sorry but would u still like the appetizer. We said no we are going somewhere else. She did say sorry and nothing else. The hostess should tell people before they wait a long time that certain things on the menu are not available so that people aren&#39;t disappointed. Or at least have the manager come and apologize. Really bad service Cheesecake Factory! Not sure if I&#39;ll come back.

I ordered delivery once and they gave me someone else&#39;s food. They charged me more for their mistake to send me the correct food. I contacted their manager and corporate and they were extremely unhelpful. Super dissatisfied with the quality of their service AND food. I expected more from them.

Tough location, super crowded because it&#39;s attached to the Santa Anita Mall.  I love this entire chain, and it&#39;s family friendly, loud, and cray!<br><br>Go early. <br><br>The bread they give you at the beginning, free.  If it&#39;s fresh, so yummy with the butter.  <br><br>Love the avocado egg rolls to start, then I get my usual, FARFALLE WITH CHICKEN AND ROASTED GARLIC: Bow-Tie Pasta, Chicken, Mushrooms, Tomato, Pancetta, Peas and Caramelized Onions in a Roasted Garlic-Parmesan Cream Sauce.  It&#39;s $17.50, but the plate is huge.  You will have leftovers, unless you beast mode it.<br><br>The prices have gone up over the years, but hey it&#39;s a big place and I don&#39;t go often.  But every time I&#39;ve visited, the food was consistently good.

Wanted to update my recent review.  I gotten a call back from The manager May. It was a wonderful conversation to find ways to better the next experience at the restaurant.  She advised the options to upgrade to other meats of preferences that&#39;s not in the kid&#39;s menu and alternatives to noodles or white steam rice rather than the fried rice that I found is too hard for personal preference.<br>It&#39;s great to hear from May.  Thank you

So, this place is a hot mess! Long story short, do not go there with a slightly big party. They had no idea how to accommodate 3 tables for us. The hostess, who was absolutely rude, he says we needed to wait for 3 tables to become clear in one server&#39;s section in order to accommodate our Birthday Day party. This meant that we had to wait for an hour and 20 minutes, on a slow Monday night, this is because it wouldn&#39;t be fair to the other servers. Although I called twice prior to arriving to let them know we are coming because they refused to take a reservation. I did also ask about our cake being held in the refrigerator, and was referred to to the manager. While speaking with the manager,  he passed the phone back to the hostess while I was talking! Lol, ok...!  (Sorry, I took 30 seconds of your time) I should have figured not to go after that, but this is where my daughter wanted to go. It ended after waiting 45 min, open tables, and no manager anywhere to speak with. We were told 3 different wait times and then we decided to leave. We called a different restaurant and got in right away down the road. I personally know that the Cheesecake Factory isnt doing well, and with this it&#39;s sad that the employees also play a big part in that here at this location. If Corporate only knew... hmmm...! I will never go back there again! What a waste of time, lack of common sense, and a dash of rudeness!

Love how theres a wide variety of food on the menu. Of course it&#39;s very packed and theres usually a wait. The staff are nice and service is usually smooth. The desert menu is great as well. They always have something new to enjoy or try out.

So many choices here it&#39;s always hard to make up my mind on what to order.. lol! Anyways, I decided to try something new so I ordered the chicken enchilada. When asked if I wanted the skinny or regular version, I opted for the regular version which comes with rice and beans. Apparently, the skinny version comes with some sort or pickled veggies. I haven&#39;t had Mexican food for a while so it totally hit the spot. Their menu here is so extensive, and I&#39;m usually a bit wary when that&#39;s the case. I prefer a place be known for something for the most part. Well, I guess it&#39;s their cheesecake! Duh.. ‍lol

If I could give this place a -0, I would. Hands down WORST dining experience. Hot as hell with minimal accommodations! Couldn&#39;t even figure out how to set up their decrepit broken umbrella. Crammed into a very small area. Our guests had to get up multiple times to allow waiters to walk by to serve other table parties. Who does that? Our food took 1 hour and a half to arrive. Then they forgot one of the dishes in our party. Didn&#39;t even remember what was ordered. Took another 20 minutes, meaning she ate 1 hour and 50 minutes from sitting. Nicest part was the bread and water. So if you&#39;re into a food experience on par with a jail in a remote country, this is the place. Horrible experience.

What else can be said about The Cheesecake Factory that hasn&#39;t already been said.  The variety is wonderful and you can please all different types of tastes in your party.  Their pastas, pizzas, salads, and lots of other items are all wonderful.  Portions are huge so it&#39;s always good to share and try different things.  Here at the Westfield Arcadia, it&#39;s usually pretty busy.<br><br>The Chicken Bellagio is a great dish to have.  Their BBQ chicken ranch salad is great and the different ingredients add a lot of texture to it.  <br><br>They do have a happy hour here that is kind of on the down low so if you happen to be here during the week in the afternoon, get some cheaper appetizers in the bar area.<br><br>Their house bread is phenomenal and it&#39;s a staple of their restaurant.  Last but not least, the cheesecake is great.  I like trying the seasonal ones to see what is being featured at the time.

Just ordered the Avocado Egg Rolls, Fried Mac &amp; Cheese and Hamburger.  Everything was mouth watering and fresh. Curbside Takeout was on point.  Staff were friendly and wearing masks. Service was excellent. If everyone can, help out these restaurants.

Busy rainy Saturday... we were very lucky to be seated within 10 minutes of our arrival.  Unfortunately  we did wait over 1 hr and 20 mins for our party to be served our meal this sucked... as my kids had horrible internet reception... then when our order got here...mine was wrong...my sons was wrong...and totally not worth the $ at this point.  My salad was even brownish...looked old. Had to ASK for everything... salad dressing ... refills.... plates... ummm hello waitress is that not your job to pay attention to your tables needs... I am very disappointed.... first and last time at this location....

Trying to support local businesses during COVID-19. The online ordering system is hard to figure out when using multiple gift cards and tipping. Called for help, I was out on hold indefinitely. Finally I figured out the multiple gift cards and tipping situation on my own and hung up. We all need to help each other out during this crisis, but this location&#39;s customer service is really sub par.
This place never fails.   My family and I love this place and everything they provide.  Lol.

This place is great and prety cheap for what your getting. It is a perfect spot when you just don&#39;t know what to eat, or a great planned dinner date. They have good food, good service, and the ambient is great. And it&#39;s realy affordable.

I use to come here all the time to eat it&#39;s one of my favorite places for a specific dish I like so I placed a order online for a dinner of two for my birthday and when I got home to eat, my dinner that I ordered was missing!!!!! Like how unprofessional is that it wasn&#39;t busy when I got there so to simple guarantee that all the items are in the bag should be routine. I will not be coming back here.. remind you I come here and I live kinda far away so to drive back would be going out my way when the order should of been correct from the start
Ordered a phone order.<br>Carne Asada steak medallions.<br>Asked for them medium well.<br>Not only was the food cold within 10-15 minutes of taking it, the steak was RARE.

Came here on a weekend dinner after shopping.  The wait during dinnertime was around 30 mins.  Once seated my wife ordered the salmon and I had the bacon-bacon cheeseburger.  Also got the sampler egg rolls appetizer.  All of the food was deliciously prepared.  The burger was very flavorful and their sauce was very good.  Salmon was cooked perfectly and tender.  Will visit again when we are in the area.

Great food in very large portions!  Disappointed that they discontinued the BBQ Chicken Pizza but the Orange Chicken was really good.  The Mac and cheese was very fresh and cheesy and the Avacado Egg Rolls were great as well.  Also try the Chicken Madera it was really good.  Had Red Velvet and Oreo Dream Cheesecake for dessert.  Very rich and tasty.

Ok so this review is going to be honest on our experience as of what we saw, experienced, tasted. I hope there&#39;s no character limit as to how much I can write. In all honesty my family and I love Cheesecake Factory but on our visit this latest time we were with friends that just came in to town and I was really disappointed with quite a few things since we love how this place was consistently in the past. <br><br>First thing I noticed when we were lead to our table for lunch was the cleanliness of the table and the dishes and silverware. It was like the night crew just used a dirty rag to clean because there was crumbs all over and sticky table. The bread dishes had food stuck on 6 out of 7 dishes, that is bad. I understand 1 or perhaps 2 but 6?! Really was the dish washing machine broken or the dinner crew that slammed the night before that they stacked plates thinking it was clean? The silverware was much better just a few forks were crusted and sticky. I didn&#39;t notice what letter grade they received but hopefully not a C. <br><br>Now on to the food and drinks which were all very good, with the exception that when a child orders a simple butter Parmesan bow tie pasta you figure it&#39;s hard to mess that up, but yep the pasta station messed up in the back, there was a few  green onions that got in and a smudge of marinara sauce that dripped in and got served. Um this would be bad if someone has food allergies with either the ingredients of marinara or green onions, luckily my kid doesn&#39;t, but doesn&#39;t like either of the accidentally included bonus ingredients. We ended sending it back because what was included was enough to change the flavor of the dish that my child wouldn&#39;t eat it. You figure it would be quick to get a fresh one out, um no we were almost all done before it got out to her. Wow that&#39;s really amazing. <br><br>When we were looking for our waitress the few times we needed help, no where to be found. Waited quite a bit of time. I understand we came at that start of the weekend lunch rush but it&#39;s really bad to be not available to your guests, I figure it maybe the decision poor grouping of who takes care of which stations because I didn&#39;t see out wait staff really attending anyone else around us. She was pleasant and nice but if she was tasked to help our line table and other tables else where of course I wouldn&#39;t assume she&#39;s be close to us, she would be all over the place. That is poor management of table groupings for the poor server.<br><br>The adult drinks were done really well, we had a few between us and our friends and they were all mixed quite solid. The food over all was very good. The other thing I was concerned about was the amount of salt that was used in the French onion soup, wow I used my sandwich to help cut the salt and it balance out better but I just left that ocean in its bowl. I think it was saltier than the Saltons Sea down in imperial county, it was so salty. The salad was good, fresh and tasty. I had the chicken salad sandwich combo with salad and soup.  <br><br>Over all experience was not what I expected from an older seasoned establishment as this. I hope it was just a one time deal. I will be back again to see if things changed.<br><br>New edit...9-18-2016<br>So The mother ship aka corporate reached out and asked me to address my concerns to their corporate site.  will do over and out so I bring back 1 star but I need to send in yet another written letter of addressing my experience? Ok that&#39;s a bit much if they can&#39;t read my review here and figure something is up. Not being a brat or a complainer but just stating facts of what I experienced and hope the branch fixes it. Last couple times I&#39;ve been there have been eh just ok not blow my mind wow the experience was awesome. I guess experience goes out the door when you have too many people waiting for a table and you care less.<br><br>Latest Edit 9-24-2016<br>Ok guest services addresses me again, glad they are now taking me seriously and taking it internal. After it takes initial and edited post to get it this far wow. People don&#39;t think to take it serious after the first review. Uncleanliness is unacceptable period and if it takes 1 review and 1 edit to get it addressed then there is some breakdown in communication. Is my writing too unclear or verbose, I&#39;m not certain but I&#39;ll keep it short next time. For all the people out there deserve clean place settings.

This used to be a favorite spot for the family and myself. The customer service, though, has dropped down in the past few years. I know the staff is busy, maybe even overworked, but having friendly, attentive staff is important. Otherwise, I do like the food.<br><br>So I decided to use DoorDash to order dinner at Cheesecake and ordered a meal, including grilled artichoke appetizer, which was on the Cheesecake-DoorDash menu. The meal arrived, with no artichoke appetizer. I called Cheesecake. I was told artichoke is not in season, so they couldn&#39;t fill it. She couldn&#39;t do anything, was not sympathetic and told me, &#34;it&#39;s not our problem,&#34; and to contact DoorDash.<br><br>I understand if Cheesecake can&#39;t do anything because I ordered through DoorDash, but why is the menu offering items that are not available and charging me? More importantly, why didn&#39;t Cheesecake tell the Dasher to tell me it was missing, instead of me finding it out myself?<br><br>I know restaurant work is hard. I know staff can be overrun by customers. However, I also know great customer service should not include saying, &#34;It&#39;s not my problem,&#34; to people. A sincere apology would have helped immensely. Cheesecake, train your staff more and give them needed breaks. I could be wrong, but the staff member sounded stressed and it was passed on to me.<br><br>P.S.<br>I had a similar issue with Kabuki/DoorDash. I did not receive 1 of the items I purchased. I called Kabuki. They actually called DoorDash and got another delivery to get the missing item to my house. It was a big difference.

We came here for Mother&#39;s Day and I of course knew there would be a ton of people here. A party of 9, we put our name on the list and was told it would be an hour and a half. So we walked around and didn&#39;t hear anything. We sent someone back to check on the reservation and the said they tried to call but we never got a call. So I get it accidents happen. So we wait another 30 min because one table to taking up the space to join our tables together. After now waiting over 2 hours it&#39;s 9 pm and we have not been sat. The manager tried to do whatever he could to help us and he really did. It was just a bad experience. By the time we sat down it was so late and the food was really sub par. My pasta was dry and the portions are just so big and over whelming. I am not a big fan of chains and now I remember why. Again, the Managment went out of their way once they realized we had been waiting over 2 hours, but the combination of all the waiting, food quality and being tired put this experience very low on the scale for me

I&#39;m usually not a fan of chain restaurants, but something about Cheesecake Factory&#39;s pastas and chickens make my belly extremely happy! This location is in the Santa Anita Mall in Arcadia, CA, which is convenient! You can burn all those calories you stuffed your face with by walking around the mall after!<br><br>I usually order my favorite farfalle pasta! It&#39;s a bowtie pasta with a garlic creamy sauce, chicken, and mushrooms! I am obsessed with garlic, so I can definitely taste the garlic with my pasta. The chicken with the pasta is also extremely good! It isn&#39;t dry and the sauce goes well with it. <br><br>The chicken madeira is also a huge win for me! It&#39;s a sliced piece of chicken breast, with the madeira sauce! It is soooooo good. The sauce is addicting! It&#39;s this wine/mushroom sauce. It went perfect with the chicken and mashed potatoes it came with!<br><br>Another plate we enjoy ordering, is the avocado egg rolls! My mom loves the sauce it comes with. It&#39;s this sweet, cilantro-ish sauce, which is quite flavorful. I just love the avocado rolls by itself! It literally just tastes like you are eating huge chunks of avocados wrapped in a fried blanket of carbs! <br><br>I rarely come to cheesecake factory because of the prices. I feel like with the prices of the items on the menu is a little high! There are definitely chain restaurants that are more affordable. <br><br>TIP:<br>-if you&#39;re going for lunch, you can get the pastas &#34;lunch-portion&#34;<br>-ask for fresh parmesan to be grated over your pasta or meal!

Defintely has become one of my favorite cheesecake factories ever. The service is always really prompt now and  the food here is amazing.  I come here often and am definitely amazed with how good everything is. Ive tried the mexican food, the chinese, the pizza, even the  salads are  amazing. As for cheese cakes i have tried all but adams peanut butter is a must. I definitely recommend

came in to order a cheesecake. Line is so long. Poor system for cheesecake orders to go. They prepare each ticket regardless if it&#39;s to go cheesecake orders or in house. Been waiting 30 min for our order. Chaotic, dirty kitchen where they prepare the orders to go, short staffed. That&#39;s why the lobby looks so crowded all the time. The staff are nice, but the management needs to improve this system drastically and provide extra staff so someone can clean the kitchen. People are running around and it just isn&#39;t pleasant to watch.
Yuk<br>Every time I eat here I suffer on the toilet <br><br>Bartender have no clue what to make<br><br>Food quality is meh <br><br>Oh well. Another dumb chain restaurant without a clue

My all time favorite restaurant, having grown up in the suburbs :) <br>Stopped by late Saturday night for dessert after the movie and got the S&#39;mores cheesecake - the toasted marshmallow fluff on top of the cheesecake is amazing! Will be back to have this again!

Cody gave wonderful service last night ! Everything ran smoothly from start to finish. My boyfriend was hesitant about coming here for dinner but by the end of the meal was so pleased that he did. Our food was great, I got the Cajun Jambalaya pasta and my boyfriend got the Filet Mignon and added asparagus to his meal . For our appetizer we got the Dynamite Shrimp which is a favorite of ours whenever we do stop by. <br>The Red Sangria they have here is really good. It&#39;s sweet but just right not overbearing. <br>Cody was friendly and easy to talk too , he constantly was checking in on us and making sure we had water . Some of the best service we have had here . We will definitely be back and hope that he&#39;s our server again !

So I ordered banana cream cheesecake and got a really bad food poisoning. While eating the cheesecake I felt the texture was different. It felt different than other cheesecakes Ive eaten. Ive had cheesecake at cheesecake factory before at a different location too. I came home and felt super sick after maybe like 4-5 hours and the whole scene was not pretty! The service is great though!

Slowest. Service. Ever. <br><br>Came on a Friday night trying to have a nice meal, never mind the wait because it was expected. But once we were seated we waited.for.ever for our waitress to take our order and then waited for ever for the food to come only to see she had put in the wrong order for me. I tried to drown my sorrows in my sangria but could not get through al the ice to actually taste the drink. No exaggeration but when I scooped out the ice it completely filled my plate, I had maybe 55% of the cup full. I waited longer for them to make my meal (which unfortunately was bland) and of course by then was extremely disappointed. But no worries, because I got to wait wayyyy more for the check too. Not coming back for a looong time. They made me wait so I&#39;m sure they won&#39;t mind waiting for me to come back.

Four category review! <br>Our party of two came at 6:10 on a Sunday night. We were seated 10-15 minutes later. Of course this place is packed but not as bad. <br>Parking: Parking is ample at this time since everyone is typically leaving for the mall. Parking is pretty easy near JcPenny if you don&#39;t mind the walk! :)  <br><br>Ambiance: Its very loud and lively here. The decor is very grandeur. It&#39;s a very casual place nonetheless. Some come dressed. Some come from walking around the mall. <br><br>Service: We ordered two waters at 6:25pm. We got our waters at 6:27pm, we also ordered two entrees during this time. We were informed that our complimentary bread was in the oven, which was gratefully appreciated. Our waitress was a very nice young girl that was prompt and nice. <br><br>Food: the bread was very nice and toasty and crispy. So perfect for a snack. So appreciated. Our entrees arrived at 6:38pm I got the chicken chipotle pasta while my bf got the four cheese pasta with chicken. The four cheese pasta was ok. The pasta itself, hard. Honestly, I wish they offered freshly grated Parmesan cheese on both of ours. My chipotle pasta had a nice kick, but was over salted and the pasta itself was very dry. The plus side of being at this place are the portion size in comparison to price. I&#39;m getting a two person portion for less than $20. Can&#39;t complain. <br>For dessert, what we mainly came for, was the fresh banana cheesecake. For some reason, our cheesecake was coated with a layer of ice on top. I was so disappointed. If you&#39;re gonna serve frozen then at least thaw it out so you can deceive just a tiny bit. Thanks. :( <br>Overall, eh. Haha.

Philthy reViews....the almighty, yes you&#39;re gonna wait a while..hope your phone is charged, don&#39;t know what I&#39;m gonna order, this damn bread is delicious...Cheesecake Factory.....<br><br>Bread: ($0) One of the best free things to hit a table....only OG has an answer to this...<br><br>Truffle Honey Chicken: ($12)  Beset with mashed potatoes and asparagus, this new dish is my go to now.  It has upset the once reigning champion, Chicken Madeira.  But since I can cook that dish at home, I needed a replacement.  Crunchy and delicious with that truffle taste....how did I live without this?<br><br>30th Anniversary Cheesecake:  ($6.95) Chocolate truffle cream, original cheesecake and chocolate cake....a la mode w/hot fudge....makes perfect...perfecter...yeah I know it&#39;s not a word<br><br>Price: It&#39;s about right for what you get.  Do I wish it was cheaper?  Of course who doesn&#39;t....

The food, cheesecake and service was great there. My server&#39;s name was Gabrielle and she was very helpful and was not stingy with the bread portions. She was very outgoing and very attentive and that&#39;s the reason why I give this restaurant five stars. Food wise I would probably give it four stars because the prices are a little expensive and the white bread that came at the beginning was really hard to eat that it made my jaw sore after eating it (I&#39;m not even kidding) but the brown bread is really good!

Food was delicious. We asked no ice on the kids drink since they have a cough, but he forgot. He was very professional and apologize made up for it and was very attentive. Manage also apologized and was also on point. The only down was they ran out of my favorite bread, but was able to get the last of it. Thank you to both of them, wish I would of gotten their names. Wait was about 1 1/2 hr but all great places have a wait. Moral of the story appreciate what you have and have some sympathy since these places are always packed on the weekends.

Horrible horrible service. One of the server her name is Kay. She refused to do her job.  I call her 5 times to get her attention. After she came to me, I asked her for more bread. She said they are out of bread.?Cheesecake Factory out of bread? Obviously I called the manager, the bread came out in one minute. &#34;If you don&#39;t want to work, you don&#39;t have to work there kay&#34;. People like this shouldn&#39;t be working at a restaurant. Manager on duty wasn&#39;t that nice..<br> gave me lots of excuses but he tried. He should be training these people how to work in the legit way.<br><br>I would never come to this restaurant again :-(

Possible sanitary issues!!!<br><br>I arrived for dinner following a sporting event. We waited 35 minutes to be seated. Once seated, I immediately noticed that my silverware had food on it. My waiter arrived and replaced it brushing it off as no big deal that silverware was dirty. Also, I&#39;ve noticed that they no longer use individually wrapped butter anymore they just put it on a dish which I found to be good for the environment maybe ? Or just cost effective!  <br><br>Food was good. I also loved my drink, but I considered that cooking appliances and utensils weren&#39;t properly clean. I wouldn&#39;t return to this place.

This place sucked. Service was terrible. Took about 20 minutes to get an alcoholic beverage when it was lunch time and not very many people. The drink was tiny, did not seem to have alcohol in it and double the price as anywhere else. Food was terrible. Ridiculously overpriced for very cheap quality. <br>I got the dumplings for an appetizer. Way to much ginger, it was overwhelming. I got a burger that was supposed to be stuffed with cheese on the inside. There was barely any cheese. I told the waitress and she said that&#39;s how it is. It should not be advertised if it is not stuffed. It is literally THE NAME OF THE BURGER! <br>My boyfriend got pizza and it was disgusting. The cheapest pizza I ever tried. Will never go back ever. It was my first and last time going to Cheesecake Factory... don&#39;t understand what the hype is about. Worst place I have been to, don&#39;t go.

Came for a team dinner . Since it&#39;s been a while .. and I chose this place thinking it was a nice place to have dinner . <br>Anywho ..... we ordered . And everything was fine. Customer service was fine <br><br>But everyone got their food except one person <br>That one person just ordered shrimp and linguine . 30 minutes later... no food and now our food is cold waiting . Because we all wanted to eat together <br><br>They were nice enough to give us our dessert for free <br>But the whole experience was ridiculous and definitely not a place I&#39;ll be coming back to

I actually love this place! Though probably explains why the line at night is so long! Portion sizes are huge as well so you can definitely share or take home left overs! <br><br>First to start off with the bread, I love the brown bread that I usually just ask for that one especially when it&#39;s freshly warm and the butter gets all melting into it..yuum.<br><br>Some of my choices to get would be the factory combination of the steak diane(?) and herb crusted salmon. The steak is a little on the sweeter side, it comes with mushrooms and mashed potato in the middle separating it from the creamy sauce for the moist salmon. It comes with some asparagus which goes great with the sauce. I like both side sauces actually but the creamy one for the salmon is addicting! So addicting sometimes, I just get the herb crusted salmon by itself.<br><br>Another option I absolutely love is the Louisiana chicken pasta! The sauce is creamy, a hint of spicy, with some flavorable veggies like bell peppers, onions, and mushrooms. This comes with bow tie pasta, my favorite pasta. The chicken is breaded and fried, so its a bit crunchy but still moist. Also, you can add as much freshly grated parmesan cheese as you want! The sauce is so good, I like practically clean the plate squeaky clean.<br><br>I never really tried other cheesecakes but I usually go with their most popular if I&#39;m in the mood. Which is the ultimate red velvet cheesecake. Some days its not so good, other days it&#39;s the best thing ever. So I think this is the only thing that isn&#39;t always consistent, food wise. <br><br>Same goes for service, sometimes the service is amazing, other days, maybe not as good? It&#39;s still decent though!

I got the lemon chicken through door dash tonight. The menu clearly says its 1/2 a chicken. What we got was a thin chicken thigh that was hella burnt. I called to speak to the manager and she says it&#39;s the way they make their chicken now. And I asked her why it was burnt.  We also got the meatloaf. That had their new spacial black sauce on top as well. She replied that&#39;s their new recipe for the sauce on top. Manager, please fix your menu then  what a bunch of bs. Lmao just own up to it and say your cook messed up. Omg.....never order this

My order to go, took past the time it was scheduled, I politely asked the lady at bakery and she had a rude response that that she doesn&#39;t know. Not ideal service, I do not recommend. Sad to say the least. Thought I&#39;d share my experience. Thank you.

This place gets busy on the weekends so be sure to get there early! Unfortunately they said they don&#39;t take reservations...then again maybe it&#39;s because it was the wkend after New Years so I&#39;d recommend giving them a call because the wait went up to 1 hr 45 minute wait. Anyways, I&#39;ve always had good experiences at Cheesecake Factory. The food was good but the service was a bit slow. It didn&#39;t seem like it was only our table because it didn&#39;t seem like the servers really checked on the tables around us. The pork chop was very juicy and flavorful. I was worried it would be dry but i was not disappointed. the Pasta Carbonara was perfect. The sauce was not too dry nor was it too watery. The chicken salad, however, was a bit dry. If you have time and not in a hurry for dinner, I would recommend this place.

I ordered delivery from DoorDash.<br>My boyfriend ordered pasta and asked for the bowtie pasta in the comments section. <br>Usually, restaurants will ignore this request. <br><br>But the cheesecake factory didn&#39;t!<br>They called to say they forgot the bowtie and were remaking it for us! <br>THEN they offered us a cheesecake slice for the wait!<br>I thought &#34;how kind and thoughtful!&#34; <br><br>Thank you so much for your great customer service! <br>I really appreciate it! <br>Look forward to ordering again

I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants, so when my friends insist in Cheesecake Factory,  my heart (or maybe my stomach) sinks a little. <br><br>But I was quite surprised at this location. The staff was very friendly. Our server must have visited us 6 times before we were ready to order (and still we were a little indecisive).  She went over the specials again and we have her a couple of our choices and asked,  &#34;Which would you pick&#34;  lol.  She gave us a little run down in each choice, ultimately making it our decision and that was great.  She even brought me a small sample of the chicken tortilla soup, add I was in the fence about it. It was really good. And yes, that&#39;s what I ended up ordering. <br><br>Our drinks were always filled,  plates swept away, and dessert options announced. Mmmmm desserts. Wait! Mmmm CHEESECAKE!  Yes I know we are at the Cheesecake Factory. Yes I know I&#39;m going to want cheesecake. Why why why do I fill up on the free bread?  Oh yea because it&#39;s warm and delicious. So, nope... no room for the yummy cheesecake. And averaging the cost of a small meal,  my check book says that was good of me. <br><br>I would love to see this place add small small bite size desserts to their meal. That gives people the sweet taste after a meal and makes them want to bring home a slice or whole pie. I just dint get why more places haven&#39;t re adopted this way of eating. Courses!  I think that&#39;s why I eat at home so often.  I want a small salad or soup and a small meal and a taste of sweet. But not so I can bring home a bunch of leftovers that won&#39;t get eaten and not a bill that costs $30 for one person&#39;s lunch. I&#39;m just saying. <br><br>But overall we really enjoyed this place! The servers were great. The bathrooms were clean. There&#39;s plenty of parking. And the mall is right there to walk off that meal right after. <br><br>Thanks

THEY GAVE ME A NON GLUTEN FREE BUN<br>i ordered through doordash that they officially promote on their website.<br>I ordered a burger gf and no tomatoes.<br>First what made me question was that there was sesame on the bun and there was a tomato.<br>It was the first time eating this burger so I didnt know if it was gf or not. I ate a bite and it tasted like a bread.<br>I called to make sure and after transfers and transfers i waa able to talk to the manager. He apologized sincerely and told me a refund will be given.<br>I got sick that night because I have wheat allergy and i didnt get better until the next morning.<br>A few days later no refund, and i get a call from a different manager who said &#34;sorry about that&#34;regarding the nongf mistake. <br>The first manager said id be issued a refund to my card and now this manager was telling me a gift card of the refund was sent.<br>I received the gift card today to find that it was $15. My burger was $15.50 +tax +$ doordash fee and tip. <br>Im surprised that they didint even have the decency to justgive me a $20 gift card ATLEAST.<br>After the sickness and pain all i ate wat a patty.
This shrimp scampi was delicious!  We started with the scrumptious bread basket and finished with dessert.

I would definitely like my money back? Totally not worth it. My friends i brought my girlfriend here for her first Cheesecake Factory experience. Waiter was wonder no complaints but the food. Dear o dear. Their Italian sodas were completely syrupy. They were sent back, two pasta dishes were completely undercooked. (Fet Alf, and chipotle) they were flavorless as well. We felt bad because the waiter was doing his best so I grabbed the manager. He just apologized but I think the whole situation was just ruined by then. I feel so bad because we always have a wonderful time eating here. I wonder if the situation would have been handled differently if my friends and I looked older or dressed nicer? I don&#39;t know but the food ruined my experience completely, I don&#39;t think managements 5 second apology was enough. I won&#39;t be coming back.

Ordered take out numerous times as I work close by. Consistently disappointed in the quality of the food, portions and/or missing a main piece such as the CHICKEN in a Chicken Caesar Salad. The food has never been ready when I arrive (at the time specified) and when asking for bread and butter it is thrown aggressively in the to go bag. Never had a good experience there or with any employee on site.

After all these years, my love for Cheesecake Factory hasn&#39;t wavered. This restaurant chain has a soft spot in my heart ever since my mom started taking me here for my birthday every year. I love the free freshly baked bread- especially the honey wheat. My family and I always shamelessly ask for refills on bread throughout our meal. <br><br>Avocado Eggrolls- (5/5) My favorite appetizer! I love the contrast of the crispy exterior with the soft, creamy avocado filling. The tamarind-cashew dipping sauce is absolutely delicious &amp; really elevates the appetizer. <br><br>Thai Lettuce Wraps- (4/5) Make-your-own lettuce wraps that can get a bit messy. The appetizer comes with 3 different dipping sauces and an assortment of lettuce wrap components to customize my wrap just to my liking. <br><br>Factory Combination: Chicken Madeira &amp; Steak Diane- (5/5) My absolute favorite entree at Cheesecake Factory is chicken madeira. I can never get enough of the madeira sauce. Steak Diane is chunks of steak covered with black peppercorn &amp; covered with a delicious wine sauce. The combination of the chicken and steak was delicious. <br><br>Tiramisu- (3/5) not a super strong coffee or liquor flavor &amp; there was a bit too much whipped cream for the dish. I can&#39;t hold this dessert against the restaurant, since they are known for their cheesecakes- not their tiramisu.

As we walk in, boo and I could tell that it was a busy night so when we gave the hostess our party number and name she said it would take about half an hour just to be seated. <br><br>We were really hungry and were not willing to wait even longer to eat so we decided to sit at the self-seat high tables by the bar (NO WAIT!!). At first, it took a while for any server to notice us. When a young lady finally did, we were given menus and complimentary bread that Cheesecake always provides. First thing I noticed when we were given the bread was that we were given some short (only 2 loaves in the tray)... and it was absolutely cold. I had wondered if the waitress brought us bread from a different party who did not finish theirs? (Kind of upsetting if that actually happened). Boo had to ask for fresh bread from a male server. When the bread came, it was fresh out of the oven and hot! with 3 loaves... Hmm..<br><br>We ordered the Cajun Jimbalya and the Chicken Biscuit. Cajun Jimbalya is usually very flavorful and spicy, but this time did not seem to fit all those categories. There were too much noodles and not enough flavor; bland. Had to ask the waitress for more spice and seasoning, but she brings out some sort of &#34;cajun&#34; soup that tasted awfully like tomato soup. So I had to ask another waitress that knew exactly what I meant and brought my dish back to the kitchen to be retossed in the Cajun butter. For dessert, boo ordered the Oreo cheesecake that was too sweet for me but he seemed to enjoy it. <br><br>Overall, the service was minimal (not sure if it had anything to do with being seated at self-seating tables) and the food was just OK. I would probably only come back for their complimentary honey wheat bread  and possibly an original cheesecake.

Excellent service! We were waited on by a lovely waitress, Ms.Izatale who was there for  us and all out to serve us. She gave us an unexpected extra caring gesture since we told her that we&#39;re there to celebrate our anniversary... that was so sweet!<br>Thank you and a big thumbs up!

First of all, I&#39;m a little confused. I&#39;ve never been to The Cheesecake Factory before so I didn&#39;t know what to expectt, perhaps I was just unlucky. I was here with a group of friends and it was fun to talk and whatnot. If it weren&#39;t for that, I&#39;d be pissed off at the waiting time. <br><br>As we got seated, we had a kind waitress (forgot her name) that was patient and attentive. Food took a while to come out and most of it was lukewarm and pasta was hard. I was definitely not impressed for the price...At this point, my head was thinking 3 stars.<br><br>However, as we all finished the check came out after having had to ask for it, even though it was clear we had been finished for a while. We paid and after a solid 20 minutes did it come back...In the midst of all this, the patient waitress was replaced by Natasha for break. I read previous reviews and it seems like this Natasha is lacking in some areas.<br><br>All in all, the experience here is not worth it...you could probably find better food in the Arcadia area rather than this place. I could&#39;ve sworn the pasta was missing seasoning...it was no wonder they put salt and pepper on the table for us. One thing I will mention is that the atmosphere and ambience is nice, though loud.

I only go for the Asian lettuce wraps tacos and the mango key lime cheesecake... And maybe a fruity cocktail or two.<br><br>Everything mentioned above = super delicious and amazing!<br><br>If you didn&#39;t know, now you know.<br><br>You&#39;re welcome.

The new cut for half chicken do not include drumstick???????<br>So the poor manager tried to convince me that the wing is the drumstick????<br>Shame on Cheesecake Corporate office that change the chicken cut to use the drumstick in other dish !!!!<br>Too bad loosing good customers.<br><br>As you requested. I wrote to you on the website you mentioned. I got the traditional automatic reply  acknowledging receiving my e mail. That was seven days ago.<br>I haven&#39;t heard from you yet.

came here for a friend&#39;s birthday.  Thought it was okay as food goes...pretty much the same as most cheesecakes I&#39;ve been to but service was lacking.  Just really slow and not as friendly as other cheesecakes.  <br>I ordered the Ribs and the portion size like all cheesecakes was to my liking.  meat was good and falling off the bone.  <br>probably wouldn&#39;t go back again cause of the service

After an annoying day of shopping at the Santa Anita mall (because it&#39;s always so crowded) we decided to stop at Cheesecake Factory and grab something to eat. We came in at about 1:30pm and it wasn&#39;t really busy but for some reason we waited almost 10 mins and still weren&#39;t seated so we decided to seat ourselves in the bar seating area.<br><br>Our server took a couple minutes to come over and she took our drink order while we went over the menu. We put in an order for the avocado egg roll appetizer and they came out about 10 mins after. These egg rolls never disappointment me and I swear they get better every time. <br><br>I ordered the chicken piccata off the lunch menu. It came out about 15 mins after our appetizer. The portion was way more than enough I could barely finish it even though it was the lunch size. It&#39;s one of my favorite dishes the mushroom lemon caper sauce that comes on it is so refreshing and satisfying. I was a little disappointed that there wasn&#39;t enough sauce on it and there was way too much butter I wish there was more lemon in it today. <br><br>We somehow managed to fit in desert. We ordered the banana creme cheesecake with a side of vanilla ice cream. ONE OF THE BEST FLAVORS!!! It&#39;s almost like a creamy banana pudding and the whipped cream they used on top is so light and airy. You have to try if you haven&#39;t already!

Who doesn&#39;t like Cheesecake Factory?! <br>I try not to write reviews for chains, but when you are lucky enough to have an excellent meal...you have to write about it! Lunch menu is perfect! Not too heavy and the price is right. Food is excellent in taste, quality, and quantity. Service was great when I went. Hint hint: 3:30 is the perfect time. Right after the lunch rush and before the dinner rush. Always clean, and excellent service. It&#39;s really nice that it&#39;s located right on the plaza. Now I can shop and enjoy a nice meal that&#39;s not in the food court (nothing against the food court though).

I&#39;ve always had great experiences at Cheesecake Factory but tonight was rather annoying. <br><br>We sat down for 20 mins before a server came to introduce himself and offered us bread &amp; asked us what we wanted to drink.<br><br>10 minutes later, a brand new server brought our water, bread, and took our orders. Legitimately 10 minutes after taking our orders she walked over to ask us what we ordered because she &#34;couldn&#39;t read her writing&#34;.<br><br>While we were waiting for our food, we asked our server TWICE to bring us straws and to refill our waters. Our food didn&#39;t come out until 30 minutes later.  Our server never checked on us to see if everything was okay nor to refill our waters. <br><br>I&#39;m not quite too sure if they were short staffed or most of the staff was crowded were jus distracted in a table to reunite with an old employee. But I was utterly disappointed. We were not provided with the appropriate, professional, customer service a paying customer should&#39;ve been treated.<br><br>TERRIBLE SERVICE. Completely unacceptable

Cheesecake factory is my friends and It&#39;s go-to &#34;wanna be fancy&#34; but usually broke dinner spots. I&#39;ve been here multiple times and have always had a good experience. Servers are always super kind, and customer service is always on par. <br><br>This night we came in to celebrate my passing of my cset (2 down, 1 to go! Woot!) Plus I was introducing my best friend to the guy I was dating so it was a 2-1 deal . I ended up ordering a pasta and he ordered the steak/salmon combo. We also ordered a glass of wine as well as 2 cheesecakes. We got the chocolate one and the tiramisu. <br><br>Often times when I come, I always have to wait for a spot. But this night surprisingly we didn&#39;t have to wait at all. Once seated the server introduced himself and we put in our drinks order. They always give you complimentary bread, both sour dough and white along with butter. (Be careful, cuhs they&#39;re addicting and unlimited and then you get too full to eat your main meal). <br><br>We ended up spending around 120$ for 4 meals, a glass of wine, 2 ice teas, and 2 slices of cheesecake. Not too shabby for an Italian place. My go-to pasta was always the tomato basil pasta but decided to switch it up tonight. <br><br>Overall, I love coming to cheesecake factory to satisfy my pasta craving and pretend I&#39;m high class and dining fancy. The only downside is with T-Mobile, I rarely get any service so how am I supposed to Snapchat ?

Bad service that&#39;s all I can say.   My daughter and her friend ate here and were basically ignored by their server the entire time.  They asked for bread which was being delivered to the surrounding tables but not to them.  If the staff does not take customers seriously then there is a problem.   I will not be eating here again.

This is my favorite Cheesecake Factory location! The service is always on point and the entire staff is so friendly. The hostess was very sweet. Sat me down right away. And Cindy was our server.She kept refilling our drinks and asking us if we were okay. We love this spot!

The wait was reasonable considering it was a Friday night. When the hostess sat us down, I instantly knew our experience here wasn&#39;t going to be a very pleasant one. We walked to our table and noticed the family next to us were already there with one of their children sprawled out on the seat. We asked if they wouldn&#39;t mind moving the child so that we can sit at our table since their child&#39;s leg was extended on top of the seat.<br><br>The bussers or cooks decided to have a conversation near the pathway that we were seated next to in Spanish for about 5 mins. Literally just talking about their coworkers and gossiping. It was a bit odd but we just let it be since we didn&#39;t want to make a fuss. <br><br>The family next to us (2 adults, 2 kids) had their cell phones while the two children had their tablets out. Throughout our dinner, all we could hear were sounds from video games and notifications going off. It was extremely disappointing that the staff didn&#39;t address this issue. <br><br>One of the children takes off their shoes which stank the surrounding area horribly. It was pretty gnarly how parents can just let their kids behave like this. <br><br>After a bit, we tune out that insufferable noise and smell but then one of the children throws up on the table into a napkin. it was really gross. My partner and I were stunned. We didn&#39;t know if we should stay seated because of just how bizarre everything is or if we should complain. <br><br>We tried to make the best of it but the constant bickering of the parents and the relentless noises from the tablets made the situation unbearable. We literally had to get up and go with our plates in hand and walk to a different table where we finished our meal. <br><br>Although the waitress was nice, she knew how awful it was being seated next to them because she was the one who had to take the napkin filled with vomit away.

Love the miso salmon with brown rice. We also ordered the low calorie original cheesecake with strawberries. It taste just like the regular one only less sweet. The Godiva cheesecake and tiramisu was very moist and sweet.

Called in an order Togo. I&#39;m sorry, I mean I tried to call in an order Togo. Someone picked up and greeted me and told me they&#39;d transfer me to the &#34;bakery&#34; to have my order taken. No one ever picked up after 10 minutes. I hung up and called back, told the same gentleman that picked up the first time that no one ever responded, he apologized and said he&#39;d go check. Another 5 minutes pass and nothing....I&#39;m more than halfway there so there&#39;s no point in placing my order now. I come in and there&#39;s only one group waiting to dine in. I go up to order and while taking my order the cashier at the bakery answers the phone but it&#39;s another employee, so still not answering any customer calls. He tells me the Togo will take at least 20 mins. Really freaking pissed. no customers waiting and three people behind the bakery and NO ONE PICKS UP THE PHONE!!
My friend has the free cheesecake coupons, so we decided to cone for dinner.<br><br>Overall, great experiences

Located at the Westfield Santa Anita Mall, this restaurant has been here for as long as I can remember as one the original &#34;regular&#34; restaurants chains in the mall. Fixed between Wood Ranch Grill &amp; the newly opened Benihana, the atmosphere of the space is very similar to the majority of the other Cheesecake Factories around with the dimly lit interior space, comfortable (yet rigid) décor and the whiff of cheesecake in the display cases off to the side as you make your way to the hostess booth. <br><br>I arrived on a late Thursday evening and was seated promptly with my party (wait time can really range depending since it could be super busy or flowing traffic with no consistency). Our waitress was super attentive and brought everything to our table timely and refilling our waters often.<br><br>We ordered a side order fries to share &amp; it was quite yummy... their portion offerings are often quite large enough that you can share them among 2-3 people if you eat family style or if you want to share among yourselves. In addition to the double order of fries, we ordered several pasta dishes as well as their meatloaf. You can always count on Cheesecake Factory to present their foods with good taste and I haven&#39;t experienced any really bad service from this place yet. <br><br>+ Spaghetti &amp; Meatballs with penne substitute: pasta was al dente &amp; the 3 meatballs were nice and moist - not dry at all in the center. But be warned, this isn&#39;t consistent since it really depends on how long they leave it cooking.<br><br>+ Famous Factory Meatloaf: Comes with a generous heaping of potatoes, 3-4 slices of meatloaf &amp; a side of greens, this dish was pretty satisfying as well. Meat was thoroughly cooked and not dry at all.<br><br>+ Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (comes with Penne pasta): chicken was delicious and the spicy chipotle creamy sauce hit the spot right on!<br><br>+ Vegetarian twist on the Evelyn&#39;s Favorite Pasta: this dish has the makings of all that vegetarians love with a carb twist - fresh broccoli, eggplants, peppers, artichokes, etc. all doused with a light olive dressing. Very flavorful and we added extra parmesan cheese for a nice cheesy flavor twist.<br><br>We finished our meals and were off on our way, full &amp; satisfied. But again, like I said, very typical of other locations and nothing that really sticks out as out of the norm here.

CHEESECAKE FACTORY is taking advantage of the consumer!<br>Think twice before ordering takeout &amp; using a delivery service.  Cheesecake Factory gives you a SMALLER portion for the same price &amp; doesn&#39;t include the bread. <br>This was my 2nd time ordering takeout &amp; I was disappointed both times!

Impromptu birthday get together for my wife. Party of 10 told it would be 1.5 hr wait on a Monday. Sister in law decided to sit at the bar area with happy hour in swing. Our waiter was a trooper. He was very professional offered the happy hr special with only 5 mins before it ended. Took our drink order food order with out a hitch. Food was ok but service was on point. We&#39;ve been here before but this time service stood out.

I read at least one other reviewer who thought their cheese cake slices are smaller now.  My family and I have noticed this.  Tonight I got 2 slices to go, not only were the slices smaller but the whipped cream was less.  Food and service have always been decent.  I go during off hours so it&#39;s generally not super crowded.

This place has horrible service. I placed a order for delivery and they took my money And waited 30 mins to notify me that they refuse to make my order because the restaurant was too busy. It took 7 days to get my money back.

Cheesecake Factory is one of my favorites! If you don&#39;t already know, their wheat bread (or as I like to call it the chocolate bread) are to die for. I always ask for extras just because it&#39;s so delicious. I came with two of my girlfriends for a late lunch and our server Steven knew how much we loved it that he gave us each a loaf and another two each to take home --such great service even if it&#39;s complimentary!<br><br>Since I wasn&#39;t too hungry, I ordered the mushroom, avocado, and zucchini fries ($6.95). They were super delicious and did not disappoint at all. I actually couldn&#39;t even finish it all, but it&#39;s going to become a must order for me to share as an appetizer in the future. My usual order here is the Louisiana chicken pasta ($16.95). It&#39;s seriously my favorite pasta and I&#39;m also a huge fan of bowtie pasta. I love the way they cook up their crispy chicken mixed with the sauce. This place does not disappoint and I don&#39;t care how many calories is in it --worth the splurge every once in awhile. Their portions are huge and it&#39;s always nice to be able to savor your food for home too!
The worst service.  Waited over an hour to eat.  Food came out wrong.  No one took responsibility including the manager.  Save your money and eat elsewhere.

I&#39;ve always been to my local cheese cake factory never had problems here, the waiters are very friendly. Usually pack Friday-Sunday evening I try to attend on weekdays because I don&#39;t wait to get a table &#34;party of 2.&#34; Their desserts are very good I always get the chocolate cake it&#39;s a bit pricy close to $10 for a slice but if you have a sweet tooth you&#39;ll enjoy it! It&#39;s a good restaurant to go to when your feeling fancy but still want to stay In the budget haha, recommend you guys to try this place if you haven&#39;t so.

This is my first visit to this location.  It is located as a freestanding location at a mall.    Most restaurants in this area are closed by 10pm, but this location is open until 11.  We ordered carryout.<br><br>Parking was easy, they have horizontal parking right across from the restaurant.  My order was ready in 15 minutes.  Prices are consistent with similar locations on the west coast.  Overall, a good experience.

Bad bad bad.....its such a disappointment. First it is almost impossible to get your server.  Also my shrimp scampi pasta noodle came out partially uncooked. I had to wait 10 minutes or so for the server to pass by and requested my pasta to be made. I get my dish finally in about 15 minutes and bit into garlic that is not cooked!!! It looked like they just threw it in there by accident. I loved coming to cheesecake but not anymore. I WILL NEVER EVER COME AGAIN!!! Waste of one hour and half!

Yesterday I went to cheese cake factory to celebrate my sisters birthday. The service was great but when I ordered a chicken Alfredo pasta with shrimp and the next day I had a bad stomach ache, a head ache and some other things. I looked up the symptoms and turns out I now might have salmonella!!!!

My wife and daughter come here almost biweekly---and there&#39;s a reason for that. They love the food, the service, and the efficency that the Cheesecake Factory offers. Today, however, I accompanied them to see for myself how great Cheesecake Factory. To both my family and personal surprise, we were highly disappointed. <br><br>To begin with, Cheescakd factory has been praised by many for their delicious---and unlimited---bread. Upon being seated, were told that there was no shipment of bread today! For such a large resturant like CF, this came as a shocking surprise. While hungry and disappointed, what really made the experience worse was all the menu items that they didn&#39;t have. From typical items like brown rice to steak, we were unable to order SO MANY items because they were out. We arrived 45 minutes after they opened, and it again, shocked us that such a large resturant was out of so many typical ingredients.<br><br>Usually, my wife and daughter tell me that they wait around 10-15 minutes for the food, which isn&#39;t too bad especially since there&#39;s bread! Today, not only did we not have ANY bread to eat, but our food came 40 minutes later. We saw that we were not the only people who had been waiting so long, but the juxtapositon    to the usual CF experience was utterly disappointing.<br><br>Nevertheless, the waiters were incredibly kind and patient; kudos to the workers at CF for always offering good service! (That&#39;s what the extra star is for.)

I love Cheesecake Factory, but this location is just alright food-wise. The dishes sometimes come out missing an item, and the food doesn&#39;t taste as great as some of their other restaurants. Servers are friendly though.

Thanks for Mom&#39;s Birthday lunch, Boss! In honor of Administrative Professional Day (04.22.15), I got a gift card from my Boss and took my Mom out for an early Mommy Daughter birthday lunch.<br><br>It was pretty cool that lunch here is served until 5pm and so we took advantage of that. It&#39;s been a while since we&#39;ve eaten here and so we had an Italian lunch. We got the following items:<br><br>Full size Everything Pizza with Salad: Mom and I loved the pizza and it was delicious.  Wasn&#39;t too spicy or peppery and Mom gulped down half of her pizza slices. Usually, she&#39;s not much of a pizza fan, but this one she digged. It had the small pepperonis, sausage, mushrooms and red onions. Topped with a generous shaving of parmesan cheese. The salad was fresh and plentiful with arugula and radicchio and the dressing with tangy and sweet also with a generous shaving of parmesan cheese. <br><br>The chicken piccatta: the chicken steak was pound out thinly and with creamy sauce and spaghetti and a generous shaving of parmesan cheese. The spaghetti was soft and Al dente. Though Mom wasn&#39;t a fan of this one since there wasn&#39;t even sauce to mix the spaghetti with. I didn&#39;t mind this one and it made for a nice lunch to take to work tomorrow. <br><br>The avocado eggrolls: soft creamy avocados rolled into an egg roll and I dug it. Mom being the eggrolls making Queen giggle at this American creation, but she actually liked it as well. We both ate 3 each and saved two for me to take to lunch tomorrow. I loved the dipping sauce too - sweet pesto basil sauce, yum!<br><br>Finally, the crew sang Happy Birthday to my mom with a cheesecake slice. (The cheesecake was light and creamy and mixed with chocolate sauce and whipped cream...O.M.G..yum!!!). Mom was blushing, but giggle and enjoyed the finale, lol!<br><br>Service with Mickey was friendly and attentive and he packed up our leftovers for us. Overall, it was nice eating out at a different American restaurant.  Thanks again for Mom&#39;s early Birthday lunch, Boss!

Great ambiance, food ok and price a bit high for my taste. I ordered a chicken salad and water. Price was 21.00 with tax. The bread is delicious though! I guess I would give this place another chance and try a different dish. Food coming out looked good so I&#39;ll be back.

Food came cold . Little portion, and so not worth 18$!!! I order pick ups from here because I work close by . Takes too long to make the food and then when it&#39;s ready it&#39;s cold.. the cooks make mistakes with my order when I ask to take off few ingredients from my dish.  Didn&#39;t like the service . Will not order from here again . And would tell my employees to spend their money somewhere else.

Downgrade on the score!<br><br>Service was slow even though we came at opening, was not even packed!!! I hate when you want to pay and leave and it takes 15 minutes to find your damn server!<br><br>Factory Burrito Grande - $14.50 - Price went up from the last time I had it. Still the same burrito. Annoyed that they gave us a tablespoon of guacamole for a 14 inch 3 pound burrito! I asked for more since this was way to little and she literally brought me another tablespoon. How cheap can you be!<br><br>Chinese Chicken Salad - $14.95 - Same price, same good salad!<br><br>White Chocolate Caramel Macadamia Cheesecake - $7.50 - I could not take the white chocolate in the cheesecake but the macadamia was a nice crunch. Caramel adds a nice gooey sweetness. This piece was SOO SMALL. <br><br>Adam Peanut Butter Cheesecake - $7.50 - Normal cheese cake stuffed with peanut butter cups! Cheesecake with peanut butter and chocolate, best combo you can ask for. This piece was SOO SMALL. <br><br>I am so disappointed that they are so cheap on stuff now!

I ordered the miso salmon to-go.<br>They forgot to cook the rice. It&#39;s just clumps of hard sharp jagged rocks.<br>When I ordered I requested four sides of the miso glaze sauce. The woman working said she had to check with the kitchen to see if there was enough sauce left. I told her I didn&#39;t want it if there wasn&#39;t any sauce (as in just cancel the order). I guess they misinterpreted me and took it as a threat. They gave me four sides of cold, runny, uncooked sauce. I didn&#39;t realize this until I got home and they had already closed. Everything was cold even though I came straight home and had the heater on in the car. I really want my money back.

You know what you are getting into when you dine at Cheesecake Factory. You are diving into a 50+ page menu with tantalizing appetizers, entrees, lunch specials, breakfast options, and cheesecake.
