I am the type of person that needs to close the menu or I will continuously find something else that sounds delicious!<br><br>Anywho.. We like to frequent this particular CF whenever my fiancee&#39;s family dines out. Our go-to&#39;s include:<br><br>-Appetizers-<br>Avocado Egg Rolls<br>Fried Calamari <br><br>-Entrees-<br>Chicken Romano<br>Fish and Chips<br>Egg Plant Parmesan <br>Seared Tuna Salad<br><br>-Honorable Mentions-<br>Factory Burrito<br>Factory Burger<br>Anything on the skinnylicious menu when you are trying to trim down<br><br>Parking is horrendous during peak hours. <br><br>Cheers!

I always enjoy eating here and the service is attentive. The brussel sprouts here is delicious, best I&#39;ve tried outside of home made. Food is good overall and fulfilling. I never end up having room for their cheesecake so maybe next time.

Came down to visit my parents and figured we&#39;d would go to somewhere with some &#34;nostalgia&#34;<br><br>Been coming here since they opened in the mid 2000s. Arguably one of my favorite spots as a kid. Came here about once a week till I moved to the Bay in 2011.<br><br>Had its ups and downs as any restaurant over the course of 10 years. <br><br>Today was hands down the worst. <br><br>Tostada Salad was great. Just as I remembered it.<br><br>Tomato Basil Pasta: Pasta was raw. Brought it to the attention of the server who said it was Al Dente. Maybe I&#39;m missing something and just haven&#39;t eaten Al Dente pasta in my life but chewy and hard pasta is not Al Dente. Otherwise, the appropriate flavors were present. <br><br>Service: Abysmal. Waitress didn&#39;t even do the bare minimum that you expect at a mall based chain restaurant. <br><br>In short, poor service and poor quality control means there is a high probability I won&#39;t be back.

After waiting 30 minutes, to get seated not that bad for Father&#39;s Day weekend. We ended up being seated outside, after ordering we waited an hour in a half for our food. I ordered a simple fettuccine Alfredo and my boyfriend got south west chicken sandwich. That&#39;s all.. I got my food roughly 35 mins before my boyfriend. Our waitress was great, she even brought a small soup to hold him over because the kitchen was backed up. But the food wasn&#39;t that good, I got a Luke warm pasta on a hot plate. I&#39;ve been here before and it&#39;s been great service and food, but today they really didn&#39;t succeed the expectations as they very often do.

To start I had a horrible experience when I first walked into the restaurant. I entered ten minutes early to the restaurant and the manager was so rude. He did not even greet us. He asked us why we were there and who let us in with a rude tone and did not even say hi. Then once we sat down to eat we were forgotten about. They forgot our bacon, the food was cold, and our coffees came well after we had started eating. Nothing was compensated or not even a sorry was said. The food was not the best for the Cheesecake Factory. Will not be returning to this location! I hope they get a new management and can make the proper changes.

I don&#39;t know why the reviews are so bad. The food here is great!!! Perfect steak, great appetizers. Even the salad is great. My service has been good every time I come here, even when it&#39;s busy. I have been here with small groups, big groups and with just the hubby and I am always happy with the food and the service, My waiter has always been attentive, bringing refills before I even ask, answering every question (I&#39;m a picky eater and don&#39;t want certain things in my food), and not complaining if we split the bill in a big group. Ignore the reviews, you wont regret coming here.

Went there for happy hour, which is every weekday from 4-6pm. Had the pork belly sliders, nachos and avocado egg rolls. Overall food was good and the prices are even better! Service was decent as well. Will definitely return again during happy hour to try their other menu items.

For my sister&#39;s birthday dinner, we arrived at 1:00 pm to put in our name. We told them 14 people but they apparently heard &#34;for three&#34;.  We got seated at 2:30 pm. Every time we asked them if the table was ready they said, &#34; They are still cleaning the table.&#34; Really?!? Well, when we got seated the waitress came and asked our drinks. She was very pleasant. It took almost ten minutes to get our drinks. Appetizers came pretty quickly, but food took one hour to arrive. The food was good as always and the ceaser salad was extremely garlicky as always. I have been here before and it was a good experience but today was not a good experience. People make mistakes but today the mistake that was made caused the dinner to be delayed 1.5 hours, or more if you consider how long we waited for the food. I hope next time it will be different.

Everything is good about this place besides one thing: the hostesses. Almost every time we come here they have no idea what they are doing. They forget to put our name down, seat others who came in later before us, tell us there&#39;s a wait when there&#39;s 10 open tables, or sit us at a dirty table. You&#39;d think with 3 people running the hostess station that they could figure out how to do their job correctly. Thankfully the food is always good and the servers are fantastic. It makes up for the incompetent hostesses.

I don&#39;t know why this has such bad reviews but this place is the best! The service is always great with me and everyone is really friendly. I usually always get seated without a reservation within 20 mins. Always a blast to come here and get the best cheesecake to top it off!

Decided to head over to The Cheesecake Factory for dinner. Although it seemed like there was a lot of people waiting for a table my friend and I got seated fairly quickly. Our silverware was clean and freshly washed it was still hot when when we sat at our table. Our sever Lee B came to greet us quickly.. he brought over a basket of warm bread and a plate with some slice of butter. He took our drink order and gave us a few minutes to look over the menu. We had some questions and he even made recommendations. I ordered the Steak Diane (medium well). Lee refreshed our drinks and he checked on us multiple times. We enjoyed our dinner. My steak was cooked perfectly. The mashed potatoes were seasoned perfectly. Overall we had a great experience!

I had the worst dinner ever, the manger needs to train his employees better! I went to the front to write down my name and the host skipped me and when she sat me she sat me the server took 20 min to come the manger had to come and gove me the drinks. To top it off the server which name was DAVID was so rude made me feel uncomfortable! He was being rude worst service ever !!!!
Food is always good. This time we ordered some tacos, enchiladas, and toast with guac which were very good. Staff is was great, and attentive.

My husband and I had lunch at your restaurant the other day and the waitress was rather rude and inattentive.  She never came back to check on us or offered drink refills.  When she finally did return we asked for the bill and said please wait we need to leave.  Her response was &#34;you know this is a restaurant and people usually like to sit&#34;.  Yes, I agree with that statement but as a waitress her job is to pay attention to her guests and not disappear. Very poor service, luckily we don&#39;t live in Ca so we will probably never return to that location but your waitresses should be more courteous and not snippy to paying customers.

What can I say I came here for a nice dinner with my family after a long long long day of traveling and work. First if all the server was extremely weird. I was trying to be nice but he brought everything out in parts. First bread with nothing but water. My alcoholic drink didn&#39;t come out till I had finished my appetizers. I got fish that wasn&#39;t cooked right and the burgers came out cold. Then for some reason the waiter wanted to preach to me about how the closing shift was his time to relax and chill before he went out to his &#34;life&#34; outside of the restaurant....well thanks bro. It&#39;s not like I wanted my food hot...keep relaxing. Whatever works for you buddy.........<br><br>Anyway will not be eating here again. <br>Management was cool and refunded me for the uncooked fish but I got pretty sick and it was gross.<br><br>P.s it was not busy. Was standing by the bar most of the time. Did I mention I had to get my own utensils.

I payed $20+ for this, even though surprisingly it kinda filled me up, I expected more food for the price. Also the shrimp had the not edible tail on it, as in...I made a mess taking it off, it was slippery with the oils.<br><br>Food taste (of this particular plate) : 3.7<br>Drink taste: 0 ( it was pure syrup)<br><br>I was not impressed guys, the desserts and pastries looked good so I might go try that and hope I have a better experience. <br><br>Oh, also the plate and utensils looked dirty, the plate had dark spots as seen on the pic.

I went to Cheesecake Factory yesterday 5/19/19 to celebrate late Mother&#39;s Day and found old lettuce on my spoon when I opened the napkin. Gross! These were supposed to be cleaned utensils. The waiter was very nice about it he brought me a new spoon but I couldn&#39;t shake off the feeling and kept thinking that all their utensils were not thoroughly cleaned. It ruined the meal.

So disappointed in my most recent experience. Came here today because my mom specifically requested this place to make up for her birthday dinner. Let&#39;s just say it was the worst food experience for a birthday celebration. I wouldn&#39;t come back again by choice. My family ordered their meals. Avocado eggrolls were the only good thing coming out of our dinner. My sister&#39;s Louisiana pasta was hard. The bowtie pasta werent even cooked through! Cake topper, everyone in my party received their entrees as i sat there dwelling at the tv watching how much of an idiot Donald Trump is. I finally got my chicken alfredo near the end of everyones meals. Already pissed. Just looking at the pasta it was watery as heck. I mixed the alfredo around thinking it would get creamy but nah. It was just really watery and nothing was going to save it. The pasta was overcooked. It&#39;s like they didnt even bother to properly drain the noodles. So mushy in my mouth as if it was Baby Gerber&#39;s potatoe trio. Honestly i dont complain much but i had to ask the server to make a new dish. I wasnt going to pay $22.95 for the most basic chicken alfredo only to have it messed up. Time went by and it seemed like my food was never going to come out. Enough is enough. I went up to the hostess to ask for the bill and to also void the alfredo. She said &#34;are you sure you dont want it to go?&#34; Honestly the way you guys handle customer escalation sucks. I told the hostess no, just void it. Everyone in my party is already done yet i havent even gotten my dish! I said it already but ill say it again, i will never come back. For the price and poor quality, i will find chicken alfredo else where.
Bought cheesecake to take home..and they couldnt even package it right got home and the thing was in crumbs..and unappealing mess...never again!
I am obsessed with their amazing bread. I have never had such amazing bread lol. <br>I really really enjoy their steak as well! Super good!

Good Food. Customer service was at its worst. We wont be returning back. We ask for something 3 times from 3 different people and we still didn&#39;t get what we asked for, until it was time to leave and by then we  didn&#39;t need it anymore.

Terrible service! Food was good, reason for the 2 stars. I always said, that a restaurant can have ok food, and great customer service and you&#39;ll be back. Or you can have good food, but terrible service, and you&#39;ll never go back. You can guess what I&#39;m going to do,...Never be back!

After we finished dinner at the Wood Ranch bbq just next we decided go to the Cheesecake Factory to get a slice of their world famous Cheesecake.   It&#39;s been many years ago even my doesn&#39;t remember WOW!!!!  Anyway we were looking at Cheesecake display another amazing wow so many different style and flavor of cheesecake. <br><br>We were fighting what kind of cheesecake did we want I told my wife let&#39;s get two different slice of cheesecake, but she say to me just one slice I say ok. It  was hard to choice we decided to the 30th anniversary edition looks very good and devilish chocolate good.   <br><br>We took home.   The Cheesecake was so good even the chocolate have a good similar flavor I know I figure out they use Godiva chocolate one the best chocolate wow, the Cheesecake Factory top themselves with this devilish dessert.

Honestly the food wasn&#39;t that great . Everything was overpriced and overhyped.  My date and I felt pretty disappointed when we had our food. Didn&#39;t even want to order a cheesecake bc we didn&#39;t want to be let down. Customer service was pretty great overall.

Before, I loved going to cheesecake factory because it felt fancy to be there. Today, I am very disappointed with my experience. Our appetizer was the buffalo blast, which is fried, stuffed wontons. A few that were eaten didn&#39;t have the chicken/cheese that was promised. Then the entire I ordered tasted bland and was disappointing. It&#39;s like they cooked pasta and put old spice from traders Joe&#39;s. The shrimps my father got were way to small, there were things overcooked and burned and a burger that was rather than requested. I would not recommend eating here at all.

My boyfriend and I came to eat here yesterday. First time there.  It had lots of space. Nice people. Nice romantic lighting.  I love how the eating booths give u privacy. The waiter was nice.  The bread is really good. The food was delicious!! The food has a lot of flavor. Many many choices.  There&#39;s all kinds of food you can think of. They also have valet parking. Definitely going back.
I love Cheesecake Factory but the only issue I have is that their utensils are dirty!!  Price keeps going up!

As yelp approaches it&#39;s 500th review of this particular cheesecake factory, there&#39;s probably not a great deal more to be said regarding this establishment.<br><br>Because it is attached to the Arcadia Westfield mall, you are more likely to run into jerks like me that bring their kids out to a restaurant on a Friday night.  Crowds tonight or considerable, and the supposed 15 minute wait time came and went like the minuscule bread plate put on our table with three ravenous children at the ready to devour.  <br><br>We saw one very young couple - maybe 16 or 17 years old - that appeared to be here on the first date.  The extended wait time in the lobby resulted in the casualty of an apparent wall in conversation. I knew he was in trouble when she took out her phone made a call, and started talking as if he wasn&#39;t there. Epic fail.<br><br>As previously stated, the menu has been discussed ad nauseum on other reviews.  Interestingly, this particular cheesecake factory has the added bonus of good people watching, considering that it is so close to Arcadia, the freeway, and to repeat-- it&#39;s attached to a mall. Did I mention the kids? The restaurant is two doors down from Jumpin&#39; &amp; Jammin&#39;, where kids have fun climbing around on giant hamster happy trails, and no single father is safe from the onslaught of... Attention.<br><br>Anyway, pasta... Steak... Grilled chicken things... You know the drill here.  Maybe it&#39;s a good idea to arrive early, like say, 430 in the afternoon. You&#39;ll probably get better service, and you won&#39;t have to stand in the lobby with 160 of your closest stranger soon to be friends.

Like the atmosphere. Relaxing  place to come have lunch. Chicken Appetizers area great and rest of food is also great. People are friendly and quick to assist you. Must come for lunch  during the week as is not as crowded as weekend.

My girlfriend and I decided to eat at Cheesecake Factory to avoid mediocre food at the Santa Anita food court. We were sat and kindly greeted by the server. My girlfriend&#39;s vegetarian so the waitress guided us through what was vegetarian friendly and what wasn&#39;t. <br><br>Once we ordered, we patiently sat and waited for our food. I had a view of the food window and was concerned about how long some items sat at the window. Up to ten minutes I saw some plates sit there as numerous servers pass it by. I just hoped it wasn&#39;t ours. <br><br>It took about 30 maybe 40 minutes for our food to arrive which wasn&#39;t bad at all, but our plates were piping hot and our Four Cheese Past over-cooked and mushy. I&#39;m no Gordon Ramsey, but if I&#39;m paying $15-20 for a pasta plate, I expect it to be better than microwave quality. <br><br>I ordered my favorite Jambalaya pasta, and it just wasn&#39;t the same. It looked as if the chef put the pasta and just poured the Jambalaya sauce on top. If I hadn&#39;t had mixed it, I would&#39;ve just had plain pasta with jambalaya soup on the side. Something was missing too and I just couldn&#39;t figure it out. The pasta was just oil and no flavor and the chicken bland with no char as if it was boiled. I told the waitress hoping she or the manager can help me out. She returned back with a message from the manager that the sauce on the pasta is correct and basically telling me there&#39;s nothing wrong with it. I appreciated the server trying her best to help me out on top of watching her juggling her tables around us. <br><br>She told me that they&#39;d remake the dish for me and it&#39;d only take 10 minutes. I couldn&#39;t wait that long since my girlfriend was already halfway done with her meal, yet I was still surprised at how quick the dish takes to be made. Didn&#39;t want to believe it but I have a feeling our pasta just sat there at the window losing its al dente. <br><br>I&#39;m just extremely disappointed by management for not intervening and making sure our experience was saved. Although I didn&#39;t see the manager, I could tell he was apathetic and didn&#39;t care if I stuffed myself with the free bread for dinner. <br><br>0 stars for manager&#39;s effort to make my night and 1 star because my server was very nice and accommodating.
Stopped in just for a slice of cheesecake...on a Sunday busy night...luckily the staff is attentive and managed the crowd pretty well.

I usually come here for the vast variety of cheesecakes but decided to venture out into their specialty burgers.I saw the macaroni and cheese burger on the flatscreen and it looked pretty good so I decided to try it out.When I came out it looked decent but it lacked that Mac N Cheese pop that I was hoping for and so I had to order a side of Parmesan cheese to help it out.Next I ordered a slice of Craig&#39;s crazy carrot cake cheesecake,I don&#39;t know if the economy is still in play but it looked smaller than most slices I usually get.Nevertheless the cheesecake was great and my server Valerie S was really nice and helpful.This restaurant is a hit or miss and today the service was hit and the burger was a definite miss.Luckily the cheesecake is always the big winner here.

I am leaving cheesecake factory a 1 star review because they provided terrible customer service for my family and I. We came on a busy Saturday night, and I understood that there was going to be a wait for a party of 7.. They told us the wait was going to be an hour, so we went to the new bowling alley in the mall. They didnt provide a buzzer since we had a table under 8 people. We came back around 45 minutes later, and they told us it was going to be another 15 minutes. We waited and looked at the menu, so that we were prepared to order when seated. 20 minutes passed so we asked what was the status of the table, and she told us that they were waiting for a group to leave. We moved aside, and we heard them call multiple parties greater than 5. We asked them again what was the status of the table, and they told us that there was a set back in the kitchen and that there was a 3 parties of 6 in front of us. This was extremely unprofessional since they did not notify us the first time we asked about the status of our table. We were told that there was a table getting ready for us, but it turns out we were fourth on the waitlist. The lack of communication and professionalism at cheesecake factory left us starving and waiting over an hour and a half.

I&#39;ve been coming to this particular Cheesecake Factory since it&#39;s opened. Service is usually great when you dine in. I&#39;ve been here for all sorts of events: dinner, lunch, birthday celebrations, and date night. The bakery sections is a hit or miss since it can be busy at times. The food is usually delicious though. If you order take out, I suggest telling them a time for pick up earlier than you anticipated. They can be delayed preparing your order. Otherwise, this is my go to location and they have been consistent with their service and food.

I was very disappointed at my experience today. I was slightly let down to learn that what I usually order was taken off the menu which put a damper on things, but I understand restaurants take things off the menu and add new things, it happens. What really lead to this review was that I ordered the pork belly sliders since I couldn&#39;t get my usual order. When the sliders came out I discovered that it comes with a chipotle sauce on it which was not listed in the menu&#39;s description. I tried the sauce and it was too spicy for me as my tolerance for spice is admittedly pretty low and would have asked for it to be omitted had I known. When I brought this to my servers attention he told me that it wasn&#39;t spicy and that there are just so many things on the dishes they can&#39;t list everything. So not only could I not eat it, but was made to feel that the spice of the sauce was all in my head.

I noticed if the server is awesome the food is awesome! When the server is rude or in a bad mood the food is not great.. Kinda a hot or miss..<br><br>Last time we had the mushroom burger medium well.... It&#39;s honestly the best burger out there. No doubt about it.<br><br>We also had the<br><br>Steak Diana it&#39;s sooo tasty and filling!

This is a review only for their happy hour. If you want an above average meal for a great price, this is definitely high on the list.<br><br>Weekday happy hour Mon-Fri from 4-6PM. One of the best happy hour joints in the area. Appetizers are $5.95 with other small dishes that are $6-8. And the portion sizes are pretty big. I ordered the happy hour burger and my friend ordered the fried macaroni and cheese. The burger was one of the better burgers I had. Double patty was cooked at a perfect medium rare. The thousand island sauce with the butter toasted buns made this a great burger. The fried macaroni and cheese was good as usual, but they slightly burned the edges. <br><br>The bill came out to less than $14 total and both of us were pretty full. Can&#39;t find a better value than Cheesecake Factory happy hour. Will definitely come back again.

Really great Cheesecake Factory. One of the best I&#39;ve been to. Really wonderful location and nice set up inside. Nice space for happy hour too. Great customer service.  Part of huge Westfield Santa Anita mall. <br><br>Parking is great at this Cheesecake Factory location. Free parking too but they also offer valet parking (although finding good parking is a challenge on the weekends)

I recently had dinner with my parents at this location and was sadly very disappointed at their service. When we first arrived, the hostess ignored us for a good 5 minutes before someone else came up to us to help us put our name down. She had her head down the whole time and when I tried talking to her, she just ignored me. I understand she may have been busy but she could&#39;ve at least acknowledged us. <br><br>When we were seated, I was shocked to see that they had placed new utensils and plates onto  the table but the table was still littered with bread crumbs and food leftover from the previous party. My &#34;clean&#34; napkin had green stains on it and my mom&#39;s &#34;clean&#34; knife had food stuck to it. We told our waitress shortly after we were seated but no one came to wipe our table down until shortly before our food arrived. Even after reminding the waitress about my dirty napkin and the stained knife twice, we didn&#39;t receive them until after the third request much after our food arrived.  <br><br>After we finished our dishes, we were considering ordering a cheesecake to end the meal. However, our waitress just dropped off our check and walked away. That was our sign that our dinner was over before we were ready for it to end. I was shocked that they did not ask if we wanted to see the dessert menu or asked if we wanted anything else considering this restaurant is known for their cheesecakes. Similarly, the same thing happened to the table next to us. <br><br>I&#39;m typically a fan of the Cheesecake Factory but this was by far the worst service I&#39;ve ever had at any location. Now I know to go to a different location instead. If you want to order cheesecake at this location, it seems like it&#39;s better to order it to-go since they don&#39;t seem to want to offer it to their dine-in customers.
Had a great time with my family. I had the stuffed chicken tortilla which was like a enchiladas type. Will come back. Fast service

*** Well-run, beloved chain. Consistency is key ***<br><br>Cheesecake Factory is an oldie but a goodie. I have ordered the same favorite dish for decades...LOL. the thing about that is that i used to try new dishes when i visited, but it left me wishing i had just ordered my fave.<br><br>CHICKEN MADEIRA - thin chicken breast with madeira sauce, mushrooms, cheese, asparagus with mashed potatoes. Mmm...<br><br>i usually split the chicken madeira since CF portion size is generous. for those who say that CF is expensive, they probably don&#39;t share an entree. if i order the chicken madeira myself, i would have to box half of it up. if you don&#39;t, that is why america is obese. <br><br>food comes out in a timely manner. this is one of the biggest reasons i go there, besides the food. when you have such a well-run chain, you get efficiency.<br><br>also, my fave appetizer are the avocado eggrolls. they are premade. they have cilantro which is highly dislike...but this is still my favorite appetizer. what does that tell you? ha. <br><br>i&#39;ve had the eggroll platter, the one where you get 4 different kinds of eggrolls, but that was overwhelming. would be good to share if you had more people with you. their salads are huge. you can&#39;t go wrong with most of the menu. <br><br>however, i must say that the most disappointing thing i have ever ordered was the soup. way too salty. i couldn&#39;t take more than two spoonfuls.<br><br>i never get to eating cheesecake but if i were to recommend one, it would be the vanilla bean. i had it at a party...best cheesecake ever.

Just had an order to go online through doordash when it arrive I was looking forward to eating my lasagna. I had it before at another location was so good so I wanted it again and closes to me was the Baldwin location.  Sadly I am upset and very disappointed with what I have received. It does not even look anything like a layered lasagna should be look. Instead it looked like a rubbery flatbread with tomato paste and cheese all around it. Will never order again and definitely will never come back here again. I think I&#39;m better off going back to the other location in Pasadena where I can get a decent edible food.

Disappointing Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi for $23, first off, 4 bite size pieces of steak medallions and 3 FRIED shrimp with Mash. Will not order that again...  3 stars because the staff was friendly and cheesecake made us Happy!

Don&#39;t mind the pansies like Winnie L.........just enjoy your typical Cheesecake Factory fair here.....you won&#39;t be overly satisfied, you won&#39;t be disappointed, typical Cheesecake Factory here.
Went to have dinner with the family like we always do.. Only reason I go there is to eat the club delicious!! I went there on 5/21 and they had no turkey!

I ordered cheesecake online and asked someone to pick up on my behalf through doordash. What I received is a leftover eaten slice of cheesecake. I&#39;m sure it&#39;s the restaurant&#39;s fault because it was in a square to go box instead of a rectangle box for cheesecake slice. Unacceptable conduct.
Review for information given on YELP. According to &#34;Sienna&#34; who answers the phone at the Arcadia location, they, in fact, do NOT take reservations as stated on their YELP profile.

Overly salted food. Long waits. The cheesecakes changed too since I came to the cheesecake factory. They took out a lot of the cream cheese and replaced it with whipped cream so they are more airy. Most important of all, they no longer make pumpkin Kailua cheesecake. I&#39;m no longer a fan beyond their bread baskets.

Review is on to go of dessert.  Almost $10 for one slice of cake and it was squished into a small container and smashed.  Bad service and slow.  The bottom on the container was carved out.  Really disappointed.

We were celebrating my birthday at our fav family restaurant on 11/12/18. We usually come here to celebrate at least once a month for something. Our favorite waitress left so this time we got Kay. At 1st she was ok. Then my spouse asked for a refill on Coke. Kay ignored him a few times and finally brought it. I brushed it off as she was busy and didn&#39;t want to make a big deal. Then it was the end and time to order cheesecake. Could not find her for 15 mins. Kids are getting annoyed waiting. Flagged down another waiter who found her. Kay was so mad taking our cheesecake order, only looking at me and ignored my spouse order. So I had to repeat his cheesecake order. After our cheesecake comes, Kay gave us the check???<br><br>Okay we are not done eating but she gives us the check. Maybe she had to leave? Forget singing, we just wanted to leave then. Time to pay the bill.  So spouse pays and is so mad, no tip is given and just gets up to leave. He complains to the receptionist people.  After such service, we were in no mood to talk to a manager.  The nice African-American male receptionist said we were not the only ones complaining about Kay.  Super! how lucky were we to get her. <br><br>Food was fine but no more Kay....<br><br>Warning to those who get

I&#39;m in love with some of the dishes here such as fish n chips,sweet potato fries,fried calamari,buffalo wings,cajun jambalaya pasta&amp;jamaican black pepper shrimp.<br>  Last but not least,their servers did a very good job~!
Food is always good.... but came for my daughters birthday, and when they came out to sing, they brought only a candle and placed it in my daughters already eaten whipped cream

My dad decided he wanted to have dinner with his wife and kids! (SO RARE WHEN THAT HAPPENS) and he chose Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s only about 3 miles away from our house, too bad they don&#39;t take reservations but it is at the mall so it is incredibly packed! We got here around 5:20/30 and it took about 50 minutes to wait, even though they told us 30. We ordered the fried Mac &amp; cheese, warm crab &amp; artichoke dip appetizers, mushroom burger, Louisiana chicken pasta, four cheese chicken pasta, and renee&#39;s special! For dessert we got the tiramisu cheesecake. I would&#39;ve posted more photos but my family was too hungry and ate too quickly! I&#39;ve always been a fan of Cheesecake Factory. :)

I really just like the macaroni balls,calamari and a few of the cheesecakes. Came here recently on a busy Saturday but the wait wasn&#39;t long as they told us it may be. I will say the dish I got this time was pretty good even as leftovers . It was the shrimp scampi pasta. The shrimps were huge and so I cut them up to mix In my pasta with the sauce it was fabulous. So flavorful! Also appreciated that our calamari was comped due to the fact it came out after our entrees so that was awesome. Great customer services

Afternoon lunch with one of my besties. 12pm weekday. We sat down right away. Service good. Ordered Tosada chicken salad, it&#39;s a lot of lettuce very lil chicken &amp; black beans, tosada&#39;s on the bottom. It was alright. Not terrible not great, just mediocre. $16. Large portion. Could b shareable. <br><br>Order the &#39;pink Lemonade&#39; off the cocktail menu, so so good. Not strong but u feel it a lil after, or maybe bc I had rabbit food, a salad. It had vodka &amp; that&#39;s all I remember. Vodka, I&#39;ll take a million...<br>Ok just one bc it&#39;s lunch time.<br><br>Cheesecake is always good

I have been here many times before, service is usually standard but this last experience was terrible. I brought my children here (ages 10-17) for my daughters birthday. When we entered we waited at the host stand for several minutes until the girls chatting behind the dessert counter even came over to greet us. They were unable to locate the host...(we should have left then). <br><br>Once seated we placed our order promptly and waited entirely too long for even our appetizers to come out with no explanation or assurance from our server. She didn&#39;t even come over to ask us if we wanted refills on our drinks. Once the food comes my daughter was given her sandwich with hardly any meat on one half which I was gonna ignore but there were also onions which she asked for them to hold. I brought this to the servers attention and she said the kitchen had been getting complaints all day. She asked my daughter if she wanted something else, And said that she would comp the meal and give a dessert on the House.<br> Ok awesome..... fast forward the bill comes. <br><br>Neither the replacement order nor the dessert are comped.... when I ask the server why, she said she forgot to tell me the manager said they wouldn&#39;t do it because there were green peppers on the sandwich and not onion..... So you are telling me that I don&#39;t know the difference between onion and green pepper? This was an insult to my intelligence my time and my money. My bill was roughly $170. But I don&#39;t care if I paid $2. As a customer there should be some respect and communication. I paid for my meal. I left a tip. And I will never be coming back again.

I&#39;ve been going to the Cheesecake Factory every now and then for years, and now I&#39;m finally writing a review. Usually when I come here, I order the factory nachos which are always super decadent. Absolutely delicious.   But my fiancé and I decided to split a dish because the portions are huge, and today, I was craving pasta.  There are so many delicious pasta dishes here so we could&#39;ve gotten anything, and it&#39;d still be delicious. We finally decided on the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta.<br><br>Before we got the food however, we waited a very long time. I guess I&#39;m used to it because the wait always takes really long at Cheesecake Factory, but I wish they could do something about it. We devoured the free bread in the meantime.<br><br> When we got our food we saw that it had asparagus, red and yellow peppers, honey-glazed chicken on pasta in a parmesan cream sauce.  I don&#39;t understand the reviews claiming this was super heavy, but maybe I was craving something heavy that day. Overall I&#39;d give it 4 stars since it was good, but it made me super gassy a couple hours later.

The food here is okay staff is okay but they have the best cheesecake I love it. I usually just call ahead if I can get through order my cheesecake cuz it takes a long time and pick it up. It&#39;s so good!! It&#39;s a nice atmosphere for having lunch for dinner with a friend.

Shout out to Stephen. Awesome service! He&#39;s very polite and soft-spoken.<br><br>Fell in love with those cheeseburger egg rolls. Very creamy! Had white chocolate macadamia cheesecake for dessert. There were actual large macadamia nuts. Yum!

I&#39;ve been to this restaurant several times in the last few years, the service is always the same - good to very good. The place is very classy, but there is no dress code. Since this place is located in the mall, I highly doubt they would require a &#39;coat &amp; tie&#39; for dinner guest. The restaurant in Pasadena has mostly &#39;business&#39; people as the primary clientele. <br><br>We usually come here for lunch or early dinner - the &#39;lunch specials&#39; are a good value. The last time I was here, we ordered the California Cheesesteak, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and a Tiramisu Cheesecake for dessert - It was very good.  I would say though that the pictures on the website menu section seems like a much larger portion than the one they serve on the table. Other than that, the quality and portion does not disappoint. <br><br>The Renee&#39;s Special and Chicken Marsala and Mushrooms are also very good.

I have been coming to The Ceesecake since the mid-1990s and the quality and quantity of the food has tumbled to the level below my own cooking abilities. The prices are markedly high and unreasonable in comparison to the dull, spiceless, and stale ingredients that are mashed together onto plates. In addition, today was the the second time I encountered hardened sauce residue on our plates and tableware. I notified the manager about these health and safety concerns; and that I washed my dishes better at home. Now to the food: my kids both ordered the Cinnamon Roll Pancakes and said they were too sugary. I tasted them and found them to be more of frosted sugar donut texture rather than a fluffy four pancake. <br>I ordered the fried chicken waffles with hollandaise eggs and them to be 0lain and tasteless. To my further disappointment the waitress informed that they no longer carry Tapatio sauce so I had to settle with vinegar sauce (Cholula) to make this $15 meal tolerable on its path down my esophagus.

Ordered a to go 110$ order took over a hour and the guy let our food sit there for 20 minutes after I asked him If that was our food I talked to the manger about the situation he seemed nice, said he was going to send us a gift card in the mail and only gave us 20$ when we couldn&#39;t even eat when we got home it was so cold and soggy.

We&#39;re seated at half the time we were initially given when checked in. Our server was prompt, amiable,  thorough and very professional. His service was superb and beyond expectations. Dinner portions were big, tasty and the ambiance was pleasant. Will be back to this location.

It has its pros and cons.  To start, this location is particularly busy, being part of the Santa Anita Mall.  The wait can get pretty crazy, but they have those buzzer things they give you to let you know when your table is ready.  Restaurant ambience is pretty nice and dim, but not sure if its date night material, considering the sheer volume of people and loudness.  Good for group events though.<br><br>The bread they start you off with is amazingly addictive; at least the brown bread is.  If you&#39;re not careful, this can end up being your entire meal.  This last time I went, I shared the factory combo of the Steak Diane + Salmon (served with mashed potatoes) and a small-dish beet salad w/goat cheese.  I asked for medium-rare for the Steak Diane and it came in more of a rare/med-rare, which I wouldn&#39;t normally mind, but it was a bit too chewy and tough.  More of a preference thing, but the mashed potatoes were a bit too chunky for me.  The herb-crusted salmon was fine though.  Lastly, the beet salad was delicious, but we just wished they had a large plate option.  I wasn&#39;t a huge fan of the combo meal, but would recommend the Chicken Bellagio w/Pesto Pasta instead.  If you happen to be on a diet or watching what you eat, they do have a &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; menu.  Everything outside of this will easily break your calorie budget. <br><br>Would recommend if you&#39;ve just finished shopping and don&#39;t have the energy to go elsewhere, but there&#39;s also Woodranch next door if you&#39;re more of a bbq type.

Came here for dinner on New Year&#39;s Eve and the wait was almost an hour. So if you want Cheesecake Factory, especially this location, and don&#39;t want a long wait. Avoid the holidays.<br><br>This location is one of the more bougie and grand than some other ones. The staff is nice and friendly and the food is decent. One of the best things about this place is that serving sizes are fairly large. However, I would stay away from their combination options if you&#39;re hungry. My farfalle with chicken and roasted garlic was great and I was able to have some leftovers even after sharing with another person.<br><br>Definitely try one of their cheesecakes because hello... Cheesecake Factory. Can&#39;t go wrong with any choice, but you can always ask your waiter for recommendations. My party actually ended up sharing a tiramisu cake, which wasn&#39;t bad but they put a ton of whipped cream so that was meh.<br><br>Their cocktails/mixed drinks are pretty good as well. Their passion fruit mojito and Georgia peach are great, but will cost you a pretty penny. Their moscato is a great alternative and is more cost effective.<br><br>My only complaints about this place are that my party had to wait an extra 15 minutes because the hostess at the counter put me down as a party of 2 when I actually had 3. And the waiter we had was here and there and would disappear for some time while his tables needed him.

Ordered their $14.95 bowl of chicken chili.   It sez on the menu that is a good size portion.  Well the chili was good. Tasted good.  Hot.  Plenty of chicken.  Spicy the way I liked it.  But there wasn&#39;t more than $4-$5 worth of chili in the bowl.  It was a very small serving.  I just kept eating it and I didn&#39;t complain. But screw Cheesecake Factory anyways.  Noticed the food quality is gettin old and going downhill fast.  I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be going there anymore.  Oh and they always switch waitresses on us it seems like.  <br>Almost kinda fishy .. 2nd or 3 rd time that&#39;s happened.  It shouldn&#39;t really matter I guess.  But even our guests commented on how small a portion it was.  Shoulda ordered what they ordered!

Haven&#39;t been to this place in a while and went in today to pick up a take out order for lunch.  Staff at the counter were so unprofessional.  They are so busy chit chatting took them a few awhile to even bother to take my order.  After the girl took my order, she did not say a single word to me and just said &#34;next&#34;.  And then the staff continue to chit chat while I was waiting.  When my order was ready, they gave me the wrong order because they were so busy chit chatting.  Good thing I double check.  Will not be ordering from here anytime soon.  Worst service I ever got at Cheesecake Factory.

Came here on Christmas Eve after going to Clearmans and it being closed. This is our go to Cheesecake Factory. Service here is always good. We get seated very fast even if there is a lot of people waiting. Most dishes, drinks and desserts are also very good.

Alright so, for some reason, I keep having a really hard time with this place...<br><br>Around October, on my friend&#39;s birthday, we decided to get food here. The experience was the same, very good!<br><br>Before we ordered, we mentioned it was our friend&#39;s birthday so he would get a song and some special little dessert!<br><br>The food portion seemed smaller than usually but I could manage! Everything was fine until I found a pea in my meatballs and &#39;penne&#39; (I switched it from spaghetti to penne cause you can do that!). I brought it up with my friends and then we laughed about it since it was just a small out of nowhere experience. And besides, I like peas in the first place! But what happened next was pretty terrible. I bit into a piece of sharp, flat, charred piece of metal. It cut the gums behind my teeth... <br><br>I started bleeding slightly, it wasn&#39;t that deep of a cut, but I was panicky. If I had swallowed that, there would have been consequences. We told our waitress about it, and she looked at the food. Afterwards she had to get the manager and he apologized for it and took the food away. He said he wouldn&#39;t charge me either, but I still was really hungry. I only got to eat one meatball and some pasta!<br><br>Afterwards, I think the girl made a mistake on the check because she &#39;paid&#39; for my bad meal? Like she gave us an extra 18 dollars? We asked but she seemed like she was confused and in a hurry. <br><br>My friend never got his birthday song, and I was still pretty hungry.<br><br>I visited again after a couple of weeks, and was randomly chosen to do a survey on my receipt. I told them about my experience, and they gave me a $10 card, but I guess because it wasn&#39;t a good experience, they apologized and offered me a $50 gift card! I like the gestures but I would really appreciate it if they actually talk to their team about this.<br><br>So on the 10th of December, I ordered a lousiana chicken pasta and a shephard&#39;s pie, both lunch size. They told me it would take 15 to 20 minutes, which I gave them before I walked there since I work at the same mall. They made me wait 10+ extra minutes even though my order was right on the side, and I ended up using most of my break time. Plus the walk to and back are around 5 to 8 minutes long each. (I work at the opposite side of the mall and I have short legs since I&#39;m 5&#39;1.). The food by then was damp, clammy, and dripping wet. The man who helped me however, was very nice about it and made the experience a bit better. <br><br>Other than that, I feel this place is losing its touch.

First I have to say I love this location. If you don&#39;t want to look for parking, you can valet and with validation gets half off. I recommend Sunday&#39;s because if you have the brunch option. For the first time I tried the Cream of Chicken (with artichoke) was amazingly delicious. I have always ordered the Lemon Herb Roasted Chicken. It&#39;s always been spectacular. This last Sunday not so much. It came extra charred. I had them take it back and it was better. But I was informed that the plate had been changed. That it was meant to be charred now :(<br><br>I just want to request that you go back to the way it was done before please.  Even the second plate which looked like it was broiled.  The sauce was still amazing but the way the chicken is cut and cooked unfortunately leads it be dry. The way it was previously prepared and cooked (the way I have ordered it many times at various locations) kept the chicken moist and juicy .  Please please change it back. If not I will no longer be ordering this plate.

I made an account just because of this experience.<br><br>My mom, boyfriend, and I went to the Cheesecake Factory at the Santa Anita mall last night for my boyfriend&#39;s birthday. I ordered a vegetable pasta, and the noodles were dried and under-cooked. It is very rare for me to send food back, but I requested for it to be replaced. After it was replaced, the waiter approached our table and told us that the manager wants to inform us that the initial pasta was cooked al dente, and if I want to order the pasta in the future, I must stipulate that I want it cooked softer. I absolutely know the difference between al dente and under-cooked pasta, and told him as such.<br><br>After we sat through the more uncomfortable than usual birthday song performed by the staff, we received the check. We noticed the bill was a bit high. Upon closer inspection, we realized that we were charged TWICE for the pasta. We ask to speak to the manager. This request inexplicably causes the waiter to realize the error in the bill and brings us a corrected one. We still ask to see the manager, who does not come to the table and my mom has to track down herself. The manager acts oblivious to the entire situation, including his request to have the waiter inform me of my ignorance of &#34;al dente&#34;. <br><br>Absolutely absurd service. Will not return again unless I feel the need to brush up on my knowledge of appropriate pasta firmness.

We came here right when they opened at 11:00am.  Great service,  relaxed atmosphere,  clean restrooms, generous portions of well-cooked casual American food.  <br><br>Comparing this place to BJ&#39;s Brewery, Cheesecake Factory beats BJ&#39;s by a long shot.  Take the avocado rolls, as a comparison.  The rolls at CKF are crispy, fresh out of the fryer, and the sauce is sweety, tangy, and served generously.   BJ&#39;s (esp the one in Puente Hills) ... soggy, lukewarm, and the dipping sauce served was insufficiently portioned.<br><br>Tip:  long lines if you arrive after 12pm.  Get here early for the best and most prompt service. <br><br>Recommended.

Well, have mixed feelings this time around. Its the middle of January but when you&#39;re at this mall, the cheesecake factory is always busy. This time we had some great luck! We got a seat at the bar and were able to order. The bartender took our order quickly. We got our drinks and appetizer rather quickly... the only downside (and a major one at that) was that one of the bartenders was sick. She was coughing pretty loudly. Loud enough to call my attention. To her defense, i saw her attempt to cover her mouth but during our dining experience she let a let out a few coughs into the air... not cool. We noticed she did not always cover her mouth. Later, when she came to pick up our she could barley speak. Poor girl, but I think this is very unhealthy. Even if understaffed, its not safe for the employee or the clientele for people to be serving food when sick. Was management aware? I hope she feels better but I think its better she rest at home. <br><br>Side note* During our meal we noticed that the other bartender made a mistake with a order. He was very attentive to correct it although the young lady was waiting so long she cancelled her meal. But again, this restaurant is so busy, that its a hit or miss experience. Food is great but be prepared to wait.

I used to come here since I was little. It was my favorite place and I had spent birthdays there too. The food quality has gone down hill, so has the quality in servers. I almost always have to ask for bread, and my refill never comes until I&#39;m finished with my plate. I&#39;m just tired of such low quality food and service when this place costs way more than that. Not worth it, I would just take my butt over to wood ranch instead of here. <br><br>I ordered the bow tie pasta, it was bland.
The inside of the restaurant was crowded on Sunday. So we ordered takeout. My daughter love to tiramisu:) we just take out only one cake. We got the cake quickly. It was very delicious.

We ate at this location last minute right before we went to go see Arrival at the AMC Monday night.  Food right before a movie is a fun tradition and we thought what better place to go then the restaurant with the fifty-page menu (we love options!).  <br><br>First and foremost, it must be said that our waitress was so great.  She was attentive and polite and she made sure our drinks were filled and a fresh pot of coffee was made because someone at our table that night needs her hot drinks as hot as possible.  I love good service and this place was bringing it on that Monday night.<br><br>Two of us ordered breakfast for dinner while one of my friends got Shrimp Scampi.  I have to say, she gave me a shrimp and it had lots of garlic and was amazing.  I would have poached all her shrimp from her plate if I had no self-control, but I did, thanks in part to our basket of fresh bread and butter.  <br><br>Our breakfast wasn&#39;t the best omelette I&#39;ve ever had (they do the fold the egg over the ingredients method) because I like my egg to be binded to the ingredients almost like a scramble or a tort of sorts.  The bacon in it was incredibly tasty though and it did bump up the flavor of my dish.  Bacon really does make everything better!<br><br>We enjoyed our time there but I was bummed to find my &#34;free cheesecake&#34; coupon that came with my gift card had expired!  It&#39;s always a bummer when you miss out on free food and a million calories of cream cheese goodness.<br><br>If you are at the mall and want some good food and service, stop by and eat among the Eyes of Sauron!

Three  times they&#39;ve packed burnt food. i order the same thing. cashew chicken. burned at the bottom every time. only when i order to go. instore its been great. the first time they offered me a refund. but nothing these last two. i have to order it at the table and immediately have them pack it up. seems like the only way i wont get burnt chicken. ialso hate having to wait in line to pickl up my ordere. serioulsy, wait in line for a to go. by the time theyre done helping the people in front of me at least 5-10 minutes each the damn food is cold. i went to the side of the counter and was told to wait in line. why? i piad and need to go. ugh. i have to go to the other location in old town from now on.  they called the first time. i couldnt answer as im deaf and cant hear. i emailed them and advised of this, they acknowledged it. that i need to communicate through email  or text, but the manager kept  calling and leaving voice mails. which i knew she knew i was deaf because she addressed it in the voice mail. so silly.

Came in on 3/7/19 alone. Was seated pretty quick. My waitress came and asked if I was ready. I order a drink and a lunch chicken item. I would say about 7min later my food came out. Thought to myself, that is fast for some chicken and noodles. The noodles of my dish were slightly undercooked. Asked them to take it back. The noodles came back over cooked and I had less chicken on my plate. So they brought me more noodles. I also noticed I didn&#39;t receive any bread until I asked for it. Its been hit and miss lately

Cheesecake factory is a clean and easy place to take the family and friends for any large parties. The service is always outstanding and the food is pretty good. The desserts menu has a huge selection and if you aren&#39;t feeling cheesecake their baked goods and ice cream are decadent as well.<br><br>This visit I ordered a chicken madeira and the chicken was a little too fatty for my taste. The mashed potatoes weren&#39;t very warm either, but its cheesecake factory.

The service was great and our waitress was really good. The food came out quickly and our needs were met, but, my dinner was not good. I ordered the Baja chicken tacos. The chicken was really dry, the rice only tasted like lime, the tacos were more like raw pieces of round dough, and the beans were not seasoned. I picked at the chicken, guac, and salsa; everything I else I took one bite of and didn&#39;t like. My friends told me to send it back but they were already eating and I didn&#39;t want to waste anyone&#39;s time. Don&#39;t order this menu item because it will only disappoint.

Walked in on a busy night  with a group of seven.  Girl at desk asks my phone number and says we will call you and says it will be about an hour.  With that being said we went shopping in the mall to pass the time.  1 hour and 20 minutes later I go to check and a snotty millennial girl says we called your name for 10 minutes and we don&#39;t make phone calls for parties that size.  In comes manager and says ok we will help you won&#39;t be long.   As we wait 4 parties of our size go to eat and we are still now standing here for another 45 minutes and counting.  Beware of the snotty short brunette at the desk.  Hopefully eventually we will get to eat and the food is good.

Where do I start if I could give this place no stars I would. First our server took forever to bring sugar had to ask twice. Second our food came out wrong twice first time it can out with onions and beans which I asked for no onions and no beans sever didn&#39;t know her menu, and it was missing the cheese. Our second plate can out with nothing on it at all . After wating 15mins for a refire that isnt ok . I had to call a manger over and she told us the cook was new but that should be an  excuse she offered to remake but I didnt want it anymore after an hour from the first time we order. Took forever  for refills I had to ask for a refill twice and my kids didnt even get refills when there cups where empty. After all this the plate got a lot small not worth the money. And when we were eating cheesecake we found glass on the  table where my kids where sitting that isnt ok with me what if the glass cut my kids there would have been a big problem. I had to ask to talk to a manger again and the manger really didnt seem to care. Ask for the check to see I&#39;m still paying for some of my food which I paid for but it wasn&#39;t worth it. I think everything that happened I should only paid for my alcohol. And on top of everything  the bathroom was dirty and it was wet where my kid almost fell thank God I was able to catch  her with help of some lady in the restroom. It was a bad day there I will not be going  back to this location  Pasadena is 100 times better and worth the drive. Let&#39;s see what corporate has to say 2morrow  when I call because I&#39;m so mad and this isnt ok with me to be treated this way.

Well...it&#39;s just like any Cheesecake Factory. Not amazing but not bad. We came in around 9:30p so it wasn&#39;t busy. But, it still took 7-10 minutes to get a seat.<br><br>Food arrived in a decent time, service was average, food was typical Cheesecake Factory. My friend and I just wanted a place to chat and eat so this was a good place that was open and had hot entrees. <br><br>I love their bread, especially the darker wheat one. It&#39;s sweet and chewy, and I could just eat only that. If only I could have gotten a whole bag of just that! But, I got the chicken enchilada (meh, it was a tad bit too salty and small for its price) and my friend got the pasta da Vinci. We mixed the two together and the flavors worked well together.

If negative stars were an option that&#39;s what I would give for this service. The cheesecake counter attendant (Paulina)  had a bad attitude and kept rolling her eyes and then walked away when I was about to order and didn&#39;t even say anything. Her hair looked nappy and gross as well. She should&#39;ve at least had it in a braid or bun. Asked for a manager and he had the same I don&#39;t care attitude. Will not be coming back to this location.

So I have become a complete Cheesecake Factory convert since I last reviewed this place. It turns out... you have to be able to eat BREAD/CARBS in order to enjoy this place! I didn&#39;t mention it in my last review but I was on a gluten-free diet when I came here... and that really makes a world of difference.<br><br>Why? Because their complimentary bread here is AMAZING. The dark wheat bread that they give you is so good! I always ask for a second basket because I basically inhale that bread... mmmmmmm...<br><br>Anyway, my friend JC who is the reason why I love Cheesecake Factory yelled at me when she found out I ordered steak here. She said that was a horrible mistake and of course I wouldn&#39;t like them if I did not eat their bread and I ordered steak. What is this place, a steakhouse?!<br><br>Now I order smarter and I always enjoy my food here :D

We went to Cheesecake Factory Arcadia to have mid lunch and dinner! <br>We ordered a pasta plate and BBQ chicken salad we are going to share that sound good right what this hot weather around 3.30pm! <br>I m started to eat my past and about to finish I pick up a piece of white hair out from my mouth! <br> Disgusting! I called the waitress  and she took my plate and the hair so quick a blink of an eye...<br>She came back with the manager saw our salad on the table and saying it the corn hair,,..<br>I said no I haven&#39;t touch the salad as you can see.<br>He was rude and just took that salad out of the table and saying I will take care the bill! <br>Left us empty table with out no one says anything..we sat and wait and no one bother to come and say anything <br>So we walked out and everyone around us seeing and don&#39;t know what happen..<br>Bad service at Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia we regularly go there for dinner! <br><br>Tell what you should do?
First time coming Probably wouldn&#39;t come again for the food, but the cheesecake yes. Waited 25 minuets for my food and it was empty, unsatisfied service :/

My family and I always go here because it&#39;s in the malls and close to where we live. We usually come here to catch up with other family members, birthdays, and celebrations. Overall the food is good, but it can sometimes be very oily and salty! <br><br>Appetizers: avocado egg rolls are so good! It&#39;s crunchy on the outside and warm and soft in the inside! It comes with a special sauce to dip with, but there&#39;s only 6! :( wish they gave more, but it&#39;s just an appetizer so I guess it&#39;s ok haha I&#39;ve also tried the fried zucchini, portobello mushroom, and avocado. This is also really good! It comes with 2 types of sauce with complements the fried goods. <br><br>Entree: my favorite dish here is the Louisiana chicken pasta hands down! It&#39;s a bow tie pasta with a delicious sauce and crispy chicken! The chicken pieces are huge too! I usually eat half and save the other half for tomorrow or share with someone. Some other dishes I like is their miso salmon, chicken Bellagio, shrimp scampi, and their luau salad! <br><br>Dessert: cheesecake is a must! They have so many different kinds and they&#39;re all good! Any of the chocolate ones are good, white chocolate raspberry, and kahlua! <br><br>Try to come 30-45 min before you actually want to eat because it does get crowded!!

Great service, great food and great company made tonight a success at the CheeseCake Factory!  Just for your information and you Wanda has never been to the cheesecake factory before no it is not like a cheesecake making factory, it&#39;s more of a normal fancy restaurant that&#39;s serves a variety of delicious cheesecake. <br><br>The menu here may be a little overwhelming. It kind of looks like an encyclopedia of food. Let me tell you little bit of what we ordered because it was all delicious.<br><br>Loaded baked potato tots <br>Avocado eggrolls<br><br>Cobb salad <br>Bistro shrimp pasta <br>Herb crusted salmon <br>Filet mignon (swapped the sides for mac &amp; cheese and sweet potato fries)<br>Eggplant Parmesan

American food (pizza, pasta, salad, burgers, steak) that&#39;s slightly overpriced with lots of calories, but oooh so good for once in a while right? =)<br><br>I love the Cheesecake factory for the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic with lots of Parmesan cheese on top, one of the best strawberry lemonades ever, that complimentary brown bread with loads of butter, and of course, the cheesecake!<br><br>My family came here to celebrate my niece&#39;s 2nd birthday and it was an exciting time because this is the very first year she can blow out a candle. We were a party of 8 and very happy to celebrate a milestone. Although the food is great, the service needs improvement. Our server was inattentive with an attitude. The part where she was MIA, took 15 minutes to bring out initial drinks, forgot promised condiments, and left us hanging after everyone finished their meal (waited 15 mins before being able to find her to ask for dessert) wasn&#39;t the problem. We figured she was busy and gave her the benefit of the doubt. It was the fact that she refused to refill my lemonade because my boyfriend had a few sips. It&#39;s considered &#34;sharing&#34; so she would need to charge for a new one. Unbelievable...we were all shocked. The previous 2 refills were majority ice so that was why I kept asking for refills, not because someone else had a few sips. I spoke to the manager and immediately after, our server brought a new cup out and said she didn&#39;t want to fight the system over the rule and that it was Friday so she didn&#39;t want to fight. None of that made any sense nor was it necessary to share. I&#39;m pretty disappointed and will not be back to this location for another celebration to be spoiled.

Had a approx 15-20 minute wait until we were seated. When we ordered our drinks, there were no straws so we had to request for them. I had the pork chops, asparagus, apple sauce and mashed potatoes and it is perfection. Had the Original Cheesecake slice to end the service.
Good food but the utensils were dirty and so was the table. But the food made up for it in a big way.

I generally avoid Cheesecake Factory.  I find the food overpriced and laden with calories &amp; sodium.  Plus, anytime a restaurant has a menu that big with that many pages, I&#39;m naturally nervous about freshness.<br><br>So imagine my surprise of the very pleasant experience I had on a Wednesday night for dinner with my teen daughter (yes, she asked to eat here.)  <br><br>This was my first time at this location (The view of the Redondo Beach location is great; however, the Old Town Pasadena location is too crowded).<br><br>Daughter and I walked in and we were seated immediately at a small quiet booth.  Okay, I was liking my seat...then we were handed the giant book of a menu and a small 2 pager menu.  The 2 pager menu was the &#34;skinnylicious&#34; menu of entrees under 590 calories.  FINALLY.  After consistently having entrees ranked the worst in the country for calories &amp; sodium, you have listened and created healthier options.  <br><br>Further, I was able to get a glass of a good Russian River Chardonnay.<br><br>My entree?<br>Seared Tuna Tataki Salad-The Ahi tasted fresh and was prepared correctly.  Plus, I enjoyed the Wasabi vinaigrette and appreciated that they put it on the side so that you can decide how much you want to add to the mixed greens.<br><br>Finally, our server, Cody L was fantastic.  He was attentive and friendly.  Further, he offered to give my daughter a soda in a to go cup.  KUDOS; my daughter loved this.<br><br>I have heard from a good source, that Cheesecake doesn&#39;t use Yelp.  So how do they get feedback?  They expect people to contact their corporate office.  NAH, I&#39;m not writing comments to more than one place. <br><br>Sorry Cody L, don&#39;t think management will see this.

Food is nothing special. Second time I&#39;ve been here but this time was a terrible experience. They said the wait would be an hour which is pretty typical. Sure, no problem. We&#39;ll go inside the mall for a bit and check back in near the estimated time. 15 minutes left they said. After checking again after the 15 minutes, they said another 15 minutes. The third time we checked, the hostess said we would be next and that they were cleaning up the table. <br>FINALLY... After another 10 minutes, we checked up again and to our surprise, not only did we have to wait again but there were 3 parties ahead of us. 2 More tables of 6 and a table of 7. How long would that wait be? Another 30 minutes? Either they let other parties ahead of us or the hostesses are incompetent. I&#39;m thinking both. So no, after an hour and thirty minutes, we FINALLY realized how we&#39;re never coming back and would never recommend this place to anyone. Up and left.<br><br>Be real and let the customers know if they&#39;re going to be waiting another hour and not say another 15 minutes each time. And don&#39;t use the excuse that there are multiple people with your name and you may have gotten confused because I clearly always stated my name and my party number.

Food is usually on point if you know what to order. Faves so far are chicken bellagio &amp; chicken madeira. Pastas are also all good, but you can&#39;t really go wrong with that. Complimetary bread is soo addicting... that brown bread though.. mm...<br><br>Service is also always exceptionally good. You can always count on CF on providing a great time unless if you&#39;re on a time crunch because wait times during peak hours can get pretty scary.

The host immediately sat my girlfriend and I in the bar area. I was delighted that we received outstanding customer service. I ordered the honey truffle chicken breast and my girlfriend ordered the Louisiana chicken pasta. I noticed our server always went out of her way to make sure our drinks were filled. I also noticed that the cleaning crew did a great job at clearing off the tables around us.

Worst experience ever...we came today at 6 for a party of 5 and let me tell you...a 50 mins wait and a mess in management of the line. No one knew there was a line for the reception desk.<br><br>We ordered pizza and spaghetti w meat ball for the kids. The spaghetti had too much salt and we had to send it back. The pepperoni on the pizza was also extra salty. <br><br>I had the habachi steak and it was too sweet.<br><br>The only good thing was my wife Santa Fe salad.<br><br>As we were finishing up the fire alarm went off. Perfect time cus then the kids went nuts because it was too loud. They took off as I wait for our check and spaghetti to get pack to go. I have been waiting for a good 10 mins now.<br><br>Overall, I give this place 2 stars. Why? The salad was good. I won&#39;t be coming back here. The bill didn&#39;t not covered the inconvenience I experienced. They did give me a comp spaghetti meatballs cause we sent it back.

Place order online to be picked up by 4. Got here and 30 minutes later my food still isn&#39;t ready. And what&#39;s more frustrating is seeing people come in after me leave with there food while i still wait.

It seem each time I come, their food quality is worst than previous visit....<br><br>This is my third visit during their annual Cheesecake national day which they offer half off in all their cheesecake slice.  <br><br>I ordered their gumbo, the portion is pretty big and easily be share by 2 peoples if they not too hungry.  You can choose brown or white rice which is nice.  The presentation is excellent, but taste is different story.  There was way too many white chicken pieces on the gumbo, I never see gumbo with chicken.  There was 5 times more chicken than sausages !!! If you gonna order this dish request no chicken !  The broth was not usualy gumbo tasted and was overall pretty mediocre and a bit disappointing dish. <br><br>I try their Tiramisu and Reese Cheesecake this time.  I like the reese a bit better and has a lot of different flavors and nice chocolate chips in the side.  The Tiramisu wasn&#39;t that good in my opinion.  The best part of the cheesecake actually is the white cream lol.

Do not come to this Cheesecake Factory.  We were seated and waited over 15 minutes and no one even acknowledged us.  Several waiters walked by and made eye contact but ignored us.  I finally waved someone down and they said they will find our waiter.  However the waiter never came.  We ended up walking out and going to Wood Ranch next door where we were prompted given water and service.  Don&#39;t waste your time at this cheesecake.

Although the service and the staff is always bar none, there has been quite a shift in the quality of the food. <br><br>Hopefully it was a bad day, but unfortunately my friend and I were both quite shocked that we did not really enjoy our meal. I had the Caesar salad, and usually it&#39;s delicious and creamy, but it was sour and vinegary this time around. My friend ordered the cheese pizza and all you could taste was the nearly flavorless crust. Interesting. <br><br>It&#39;s not to say I wouldn&#39;t return to this Cheesecake Factory, I did enjoy my half-off cheesecake (in honor of national cheesecake day!), but fix the Caesar dressing for my sake!

I made a reservation two weeks prior to May 25th for a party of 15 to celebrate 3 birthdays in my family. The lady I spoke to was very rude and told me that they only take large party reservations between 10 and 11am and we have to be there on time. I booked my reservation for 11am and left my number with the her. Today, my party showed up 10 minutes prior to our reservation. We checked in at 10:50am and was told we would be seated shortly.  After a confusing conversation with the hostess, the hostess stated that they had no reservation booked for our party. (which includes two handicapped elders and 2 children). I asked to speak with the manager and he told me the only available options for seating on short notice was in bar seating area, (where it&#39;s too high for my handicapped family members and children), outside seating (where it was humid), or to wait 30 minutes to be seated inside. After discussing this with the manager (who was very nice and doing his best...shout out to him), we decided to take our business elsewhere. The whole point of making the reservation is to guarantee the correct seating for my family. I have been a fan of the cheesecake factory for a very long time but this experience has left me very sad and disappointed. I hope this complaint is taken very seriously to prevent others from having to go through a similar situation. Perhaps a reservation system with a confirmation number or email confirmation so your customer has proof as well.

We went to the Arcadia mall yesterday to exchange some shoes we bought for our 5y/o daughter before we had to head to anaheim for the big jojo siwa concert she was waiting to see for her birthday! We decided that we might as well just enjoy her birthday lunch out here because waiting an hour until we got to anaheim wouldn&#39;t cut it. We were hungry! Since we parked at valet and don&#39;t get to eat the Cheesecake Factory often we decided to have her birthday lunch here for the three of us. The place was pretty empty on a Tuesday afternoon at 3pm. We were immediately seated which was nice since we were on a schedule. The hostess seated us next to waiter station close to the restrooms and another two groups of people eating. We looked over the menu and decided on what we wanted to eat and I took my daughter to the restroom. We returned to our seats and watched the staff sing happy birthday to the table next to us. All this happened in a matter of 15-20 mins the ENTIRE time not one single soul acknowledged us in the restaurant. Staff walked by us maybe 4-9 times and not one person said &#34;give me a minute I&#39;ll be right with you.&#34; We decided to give them 5 minutes before walking out. After 20 minutes total of no one speaking to us we decided to leave and head to Benihana&#39;s next door. The hostess could care less when my husband explained to her the issue and didn&#39;t even offer an apology. Benihana&#39;s was more than accommodating and I would rather spend my $165 at Benihana&#39;s than this Cheesecake Factory any day. Needless to say we will not be visiting this location any time soon, looks like the extra drive to pasadena it is!

This place has a fantastic menu! Not to say anything  of the desserts. So rich so decadent! The waiters and waitresses are cordial and very professional. I coins have given this knave a 5star but one thing stood in the way. The wait time on Friday or Saturday is ridiculous. You go in and they tell you that you have a 30-minute wait. An hour later they&#39;re still telling her you&#39;ve got a 30 minute wait. You see people going in and being seated before you are and you&#39;ve been waiting longer.&#34; Oh how you been &#34; is what they say &#34; this is my friend&#34;  is what I heard. So friends get seated first. I guess I have to make a friend to somebody that works there.  but otherwise if you want a great meal go just don&#39;t go on a Friday or Saturday because you&#39;re going to have to wait a very long time I walked out after a 90 minute wait.

I absolutely love the Cheesecake Factory Food is great atmosphere is amazing I have been to several locations including this one, riverside and Glendale. But this experience today wasn&#39;t the best. The server customer service was not even standard. I ask for fresh bread she brought out room temperature bread. I ask for oil and vinagre she mixed it on a saucer I didn&#39;t want it mixed she didn&#39;t even bother to ask if I did. Not to mention it&#39;s spilling off the sides because it&#39;s not in a bowl or anything. This location definitely wouldn&#39;t be my first choice when I&#39;m visiting this area

I&#39;ve always enjoyed coming to cheesecake factory coz I&#39;ve never been disappointed with service, selection of food and ambience. I like how it&#39;s been consistent thus far (from east coast- Florida to west coast-cali)...we came in for the national cheesecake day and purchased 2 slices of cheesecake for 1/2 price...so good!<br>We got banana cream cheesecake---winner!! It was refreshing, not too rich, heavy or sweet unlike the outrageous cheesecake. <br>Lesson learned- I will stick with classic flavors and not the fancy ones.

After I contacted back Cheesecake Factory from their message to me on yelp, Cheyenne Smith got back to me in a email. She was very professional and understanding as I walked her through the situation. She apologized countless times and agreed the situation could have been handled more professionally. Cheyenne was very kind to offer me a $150 gift card to welcome me back to any of the Cheesecake Factory restaurants. I was very surprised when I found the gift card along with a letter in mail today as it&#39;s extremely fast since I just talked to her yesterday. She definitely handled the situation very professionally and in such a swift manner. Talking to her gives me the faith that my next visit to the restaurant would be much more pleasant and enjoyable.

Whatever happened to the good old customer service at Cheesecake Factory? My family and I been coming to Cheesecake Factory for years now and I have been getting good services except for this one recent visit we had. On July 2 my family and I went to Santa Anita Mall and after shopping my kids said &#34;Mom, can we have dinner at Cheesecake Factory?&#34; So I said sure!. We go there and I told the guy table for 4 please and he asked &#34;Outside or Inside?&#34; We all decided we wanted to eat outside and he said ok and gave us the buzzer for us to wait and was told 15 minutes wait. So we waited...waited...waited and after 25 mins of waiting our buzzer started buzzing so we gave it to the guy. He took the buzzer from my husband and was told just stay on the side. We waited again bout 5 minutes and finally the girl said &#34;Let&#39;s go this way&#34;. We followed her and she took us to a table which it wasn&#39;t outside like we told the guy but we all decided to just take that table because we were all hungry already. Another 5-7 minutes on the table Kalyn took drinks order then she came back with our drinks but without any straws so I asked her if we could have straws and she said &#34;I&#39;ll be back&#34;. She came back with our straws and left right away. So we were waiting and waiting and waited again and hey guess who showed up after minutes of waiting? Yes, Kalyn decided to show up gave us 3 pcs of bread with 4 pcs of butter and took our orders. After she took our orders my daughter asked her if they have some type of wipes or hand sanitizer and she said &#34;No but we have napkins. Would you like some?&#34; My daughter said &#34;Yes, please&#34;. My daughter waited and waited and waited but she never came back.
