So by this time my head was already pounding from hunger. 25 minutes pass us sitting from our table another family sat by our table. She brought them 4 pcs of bread which they were only 3 but hey that cool by why we only got 3 pcs of bread which there was 4 of us? Anyway, she took their orders. Everyone happened so fast from the table next to us that their food even came first before us. We waited 40 minutes for our food!. So we ate and we ran out of drinks but she didn&#39;t come back to us if we needed anything. After we wait we waited and waited and after 10 minutes she showed up and said &#34;everything ok?&#34; And my husband was like can we have more soda? And said for here or to go? We said to go cause it might take another 20 minutes. She came back with the soda to go which was only 3/4 she didn&#39;t even fill it up. She asked if we want desserts and I said no we will just buy it at the front and she looked at me and gave me a fake smile. So she gave us the check and we gave her 2 Cheesecake Factory gift cards that was given to my kids both $25 each and the rest I told her to put in my debit card. 5 minutes later she came back and told us that one of the card didn&#39;t have money and only one went through so I said just use my debit card for the rest so she left. She handed me the gift card that supposedly didn&#39;t have any money that she said she ran twice. My husband and I was thinking why wouldn&#39;t have the card any money? Anyway, she came back and gave me the receipt that I needed to sign and left. So we got up and decided to get desserts at the front and at the register where I was paying I asked the girl can you try if this gift card would work and she did. After she ran the card and it actually worked and she even said &#34;You have $7.35 left&#34; after she charged me with 2 Cheesecakes. So we were all like hmmmm why <br>did  Kalyn the waitress said there was no money ??? Well, over all we were disappointed that&#39;s the bottom line. Customer service needs to get better.

The pagers DO NOT work! My party was waiting for 50 minutes before deciding to check in with the hostess. They said that they called our party 30 minutes ago! The pagers did not go off and we were just standing in front of the door. So then, they wanted us to wait on the side for another 20 minutes. While waiting on the side, we heard them give another table of 5 who just check in a 10 minute wait. Unbelievable! <br><br>Service was slow, and food was mediocre. <br>Not coming to this Cheesecake factory again.

Came here with my co-workers for dinner and it was pretty good! We were seated quickly and our server was very attentive. The restaurant is within the Santa Anita Mall so the parking lot can be packed on a busy night, but you should be able to find parking, although it might be a longer walk to the restaurant. <br><br>Hilariously, half of our group ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta ($16.95), including me! This bow tie pasta dish is served with crispy chicken, mushrooms, peppers, and onions flavored with their Spicy New Orleans sauce.  Don&#39;t fret, it&#39;s just a hint of spicy, nothing too crazy. I really enjoyed this dish, it was flavorful and tasted great.The portions were also plentiful, most of us had leftovers for to-go. <br><br>For dessert, we ordered three cheesecakes: the Original, Fresh Strawberry, and Red Velvet. The Red Velvet Cheesecake was gigantic! I recommend sharing it, I cant imagine how anyone could finish one by themselves! The other two were nicely portioned. I try to avoid sweets nowadays, so a small slice of each was enough to satisfy me. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory was an enjoyable dining experience, thumbs up for the good service and food!

It&#39;s really annoying  that this place doesn&#39;t take reservations. We had to wait two hours once for our party of fifteen. When we finally got seated the servers offered us water right away which was nice. <br><br>We got the free bread which is honestly one of my favorite things about this place because the wheat bread is just so dang good. I could eat so many of them and would still wanna take some home. <br><br>Avocado egg rolls : so delicious. Overpriced for what it is but they do make it perfect every single time <br><br>Jambalaya sausage over rice : we got it with brown rice which was too overcooked and soggy. The actual sauce of the Jambalaya didn&#39;t have much flavor and the meat it came with was too tough. Don&#39;t get this dish <br><br>Chinese chicken salad : pretty good dish. I thought they put too much dressing so the lettuce became soggy but the flavor was on point <br><br>Garlic noodles with shrimp : my favorite fish because the garlic spaghetti was so good and flavorful. The shrimp was too tough but the overall flavor of the dish was super good <br><br>Salmon with mashed potatoes : this dish was good too but not anything special

Appetizers: dynamite shrimp was really good, especially with the sauce that they provide you with. Tex mix chicken tasted like an avocado egg roll with out the avocado. It was also provided with that sweet teriyaki-like sauce. But i am an avocado lover, so I would go for the avocado egg rolls next time. <br><br>We went here for lunch so we got lunch specials/ lunch portion. I got the orange chicken with brown rice. It was only about $12, good portion which got me leaving the place full (I even gave away like 4 pieces of the chicken to my friends). The chicken was white meat, so it tasted fresher and healthier at the same time. The orange chicken taste itself was sweet and not spicy at all. It tasted good, like a high end Panda Express with the right amount of crunch and tenderness. <br><br>Cheesecake usually allows you to add salmon to your pasta. But they&#39;ve never before tried adding catfish on top of the pasta. So I appreciate their willingness to allow my friend to add catfish on top of their pesto flavored pasta :) i liked the fried cat fish. It was tasty fresh and didn&#39;t have a lot of salt at all, which I thought it would.

This is the worst Cheesecake Factory I had ever been! I&#39;ll never come back here again... the reason I am so piss off.. because we got very bad service from the front host...especially the manager of the store... he was mean... and the food came out so slow.. and we got a party of 9.. then food came out one then after 10 or 15 mins came out other one..  anyway... speechless..... never go back again...

We haven&#39;t been to any The Cheesecake Factory restaurant for long time. I&#39;ve almost forgotten about how good it was, great comfort food in huge portions! I have always loved their big and vast menu, lots of choices. They now have low calories menu with drinks, tapas and entrees, it&#39;s great for light eaters! The cheese cake menu is my favorite, I don&#39;t usually eat cheese cake, but I just have to have a slice here! They serve lunch till 5pm everyday, it&#39;s good deal, happy hour at bar area from Monday- Friday. <br><br>We started with Ahi tartare, it&#39;s small plate, tiny portion but very fresh and flavorful. Great with a Stella draft.<br><br>Hubby had Jambalaya pasta, it&#39;s dinner portion only, it was fairly delicious, but not as good as I remembered, the pasta was a little hard and chewy. <br><br>I had lemon- herd roasted half chicken, I am PMS so bad, I really had to break my Pescetarian diet for some light meat protein, the chicken is free range all natural organic chicken, so I guess it was OK for me to eat just once. Glad I ordered it, the chicken was sooooo tender, the sauce was very flavorful, I asked our server to bring me some more of it, I almost wanted to ask the recipe, the tender chicken meat with that amazing sauce.... just the type of comfort food I needed! The mashed potato was very light and yummy, it was a good balance with the strong flavored chicken. <br><br>We had tiramisu cheesecake, loved it, not too sweet, the perfect mix flavors of tiramisu and cheesecake! The house made cream was soooo good! I had another Stella draft to go with it. <br><br>Great late lunch, I was very satisfied! the service was good, friendly and attentive. This meal reminded me that I should go to The Cheesecake Factory restaurants more often. Especially now I can do both comfort meal, and small plates light meal there!

This review is overdue.  Last December, we went to this location for a holiday lunch.  There was six of us and we got lucky with two tables in the bar area.  I had not been to a CF in a very long time.  Menu options were very good but most importantly, all of the food was hot and fresh and the service was EXCELLENT!  Our servers were Yesenia and Anntrice and they both were fantastic!  Thanks again!

This place is located in a nice area, but the people that work here are bipolar!!! Our waitress at first seemed to be putting on a fake smile and cheerful attitude, being very condescending. Mid way through our dinner after several please and thank you from us it was as if she was a whole new person. She seemed honest and sincere in being glad to work there. At the end she made up for her poor attitude. <br><br>The food was okay the charts good. We had the habachi steak which I totally enjoyed. My girlfriend had the chicken with biscuits that lacked in seasoning and taste. My son took one bit of mini corn dog and was done. Something about the hot dog that they use, seemed to be a little tart.
Stopped by for lunch recently. The waiter was fantastic. Friendly and efficient. The salmon was done perfectly, the vegetables were cooked to perfection. Healthy and delicious.

Cheesecake Factory definitely has one of the most expansive menus around - I mean what don&#39;t the serve??<br><br>This last time I started with an alcohol infused milkshake (called the Flying Monkey) - it had Godiva Liquor and was actually quite delicious. <br><br>We also had the Mac N Cheese Balls (good, but too heavy) and the Avocado EggRolls (I&#39;m not a huge avocado person, but they aren&#39;t bad). <br><br>I love the Luau Salad here ... it&#39;s probably my favorite thing on the menu! We always get that to share with a few friends (the crunchy wonton pieces are worth fighting over). <br><br>I decided to try their chicken tacos during my most recent visit - not much of a fan ... they definitely need more flavor to them. <br><br>The service is hit or miss ... last time our second waiter (because they always seem to swap waiter shifts when I&#39;m there) was not as attentive as our first - If I&#39;ve noticed the absence of a waiter for more than 10 minutes, something is wrong. <br><br>Also, the lighting at all Cheesecake Factories needs an upgrade ... it&#39;s way to dim inside - I can barely read the menu or see my food - both somewhat important parts of my restaurant going experience!

Me and my wife had lunch on Saturday, August 16, 2019 and I ordered the Renee&#39;s Special (half turkey sandwich, soup and salad).. I was hungry but I only had the soup because the salad made me lost my appetite - it was soggy, obviusly not fresh, lightly dressed and almost bitter..  maybe it was a leftover salad from an earlier disappointed customer.. SSSOOO FRUSTRATED AND DISAPPOINTED!! I complained to our waitress about the salad but she ignored me and didnt say anything except that she put vinaigrette in it.. thats it, she could have offered  to get me another salad  (a customary gesture for restaurantant - but she did nothing).. she was just busy entertaining her friends on the next table and they seemed to enjoy laughing and chatting.. so we just got our check and leave.. the Manager of this place should be fired!!! u should be ashamed - a $7 salad at Wendy&#39;s is 20 times better!!!

I am a little disappointed about the Manager today.  I went for Lunch, so I ordered a shrimp scampi pasta. The food is good and I like it, but in the mid way of my dish, a white hair inside the dish that I took out from my mouth. I call the waitress, she took the hair a ways with out saying anything. After 5 minutes, she came with the manager.  He told me that hair that came out from my mouth, was a corn hair.  It doesn&#39;t make sense to me, because on my shrimp scampi pasta doesn&#39;t have corn at all.  He is trying to make me believe that white hair on the dish comes from corn which the dish has not corn inside!!!!!He expressions was rude. He took the dish out from and didn&#39;t say anything.   Left me with a empty table. <br>Very disappointed!!!!

I&#39;ve been here a couple of times and still get the same thing, BBQ Salmon. This dish is not on the menu but if you ask the server they know what it is. The staff and servers Are very friendly and super helpful if you have any questions. The bread they give is always a hit.. and I usually get full after eating it but it&#39;s okay cause then that means I have leftovers for the next day. The cheesecake are delicious! I mean that is what their known for!

Yea it&#39;s not a bad restaurant at all but I still think is not the best in the area. Some dishes ara more flavorful than others and at the end of the day is about choices and preferences. If you go at night the customer service is the worst or maybe they didn&#39;t have enough staff working that night but I literally stood up and went to look for my waitress....but I might go back for the convenience after doing some shopping at the mall.
Make a reservation for party of 8 and told me only 4 when I arrived , told me to wait another hour or sit under direct the sun <br><br>Bad customer service and would not come back

Love to come with my mom because she likes, actually we like the clam chowder soup, the house salad and miso salmon, oh and the wheat bread.<br>But i love to come with my boyfriend too and have a pineapples mojito, love it.

This is my second time at this location. It was like night and day from my first visit which was nothing less than amazing!<br><br>This time around we were seated right away, there was no wait time. Maria was our server. She started off by mixing our drinks up. I ordered a cherry coke and my Husband ordered a Diet coke. I received a regular coke and he ended up with a Cherry Diet Coke. <br><br>After we ordered we received everything but my husbands Salad which our waitress forgot about. I don&#39;t know if she was flustered from getting our drinks wrong and just forgot? Either way my husband wasn&#39;t satisfied with his small shrimp, mashed potato and steak dish. He received I think 3 cut up tiny pieces of steak, and 3 shrimp were on the plate. Even I was disappointed and I didn&#39;t have to eat it. It was an over priced dish for sure!<br><br>I ordered the pork chop dish again and this time it didn&#39;t seem to have the same delicious taste as last time. <br><br>After our mishap with Maria I will say this, She was super attentive to us in regards to refills and kept checking in on us a lot which I sincerely appreciated!! She was still great regardless of the mess ups.<br><br>While we were eating a employee brought a side of fries and dropped them off at our table. Now we didn&#39;t order that or were expecting it but found out the table next to us was. That was awkward for all of us.<br><br>Honestly I would go back and give them another chance because the first visit was so great and even Maria tried to make up for our not so great visit which is appreciated

I came to this restaurant Jan 19th 2019 to celebrate my mother birthday. We always eat at the cheesecake in Pasadena without any issues, but this was the worst experience ever and I don&#39;t recommend this location to anyone. As the waitress gave us our silverware we notice left over pasta on our forks, spoons and plates. Reminder we had a party of four and all four sets of silverware were dirty. We ask the server for new silverware when he came back it was still covered with left over pasta and other food so bad that we had to wash our hands to get the food off them. We eventually left the restaurant and won&#39;t be returning. Posted a pic but it doesn&#39;t do it justice for what we saw.

Been here a few times but never really thought to review the spot.  I come for the seared ahi tuna salad and it always hits the spot.  The tuna slices are a bit thicker than other joints I have been to, so it&#39;s a fork and knife meal for me.  The wasabi pesto is savory and of course has that familiar kick to it.  Service has always been spot on and have never had an issue.  Of course, the dessert selection never disappoints.

Celebrated my parents&#39; 60th Wedding Anniversary &amp; even though they don&#39;t take reservations, they were able to accommodate our table of 14 tonight.  As always, the food was delicious &amp; tasted even better because the delivery time to the table was a bit longer than anticipated ;-)  But, all the meals were delivered as synchronized as possible!  That&#39;s no small feat to deliver 14 different meals!  To top off our evening, the waiter brought a lovely plate of cheesecake for my parents that was beautifully decorated with Happy Anniversary in cursive chocolate syrup.  Thank you Cheesecake Arcadia!
Excellent service and the food was great as usual. Went on a Saturday evening with friends, short wait for seating, and very quick service.

Albsolutely the worst service ever given at any Cheesecake Factory by far. This was our 3rd and final trip to this location, we will not be returning.<br><br>Let me begin by saying we are some of the most patient people when it comes to service, so the fact that we feel the need to write this out says a lot. We were seated at the same time as a family of 4 (parents with their young children), and had our drinks brought out at the same time. The waitress Ashley forgot the waters we initially ordered, perfectly fine, people make mistakes. She took our orders at the same time as well, but when it came to our appetizers, the family of 4 received theirs 20 minutes before we did, which can be justified by saying they were 2 different items and therefore might have different preparation times. But when it came down to our entrees, after an additional 20 minutes of waiting, manager Tamara had to stop by our table and let us know of the delay, at which point we knew our order had been forgotten. We finally received our food after almost 50 minutes since being seated, when the family of 4 was on their way out. The food was okay, but after waiting so long we had all but lost our appetites.<br><br>The server attempted to remedy the situation by offering a free piece of cheesecake. A piece. Of cheesecake. It was almost laughable that they assumed this would make up for the lack of quality service. We refused, at which point she brought our check at full cost to our table. Most definitely not being satisfied with this, we brought it to the attention of Tamara (the manager), who then stated the delay to our food came from an item that had been ordered. Again, definitely understandable, were it not for the mother sitting across from us ordering the exact item in question and receiving hers without a problem. She apologized and removed the item from the bill, which we then took to the front (not wanting to wait any longer) and paid directly with her.<br><br>Again, we appreciate that she understood how upset we were and the accommodations made for us, but the overall lack of customer service from a restaurant chain with such a high reputation was very disappointing. We should have been notified of the delay prior to our 40 minute wait, and given the opportunity to order something else in its place. We will be taking our business elsewhere from here on out, a visit to this restaurant should not have taken the hour and a half that it did.

Dirty forks and spoons . Watch out your stomach ! <br>See photos I took at Cheesecake Factory. I m here with my whole family . I don&#39;t want my Familu get Dick by coming here should be a delightful afternoon for them .  It turned out we see dirty  forks and spoons on table .  They didn&#39;t apologize just try to take away as trying to hide their mistake .

I finally made the drive out here to use gift cards I received for Christmas. We planned to eat, then walk the mall. We were told the wait was 30 minutes, well that 30 minutes took an hour. We were seated and a waiter didn&#39;t come for another 10 minutes. Once we placed a food order, we sat for another 30 minutes waiting for our food. After waiting around for our waiter(they didn&#39;t check on us while we ate or notice we were done) it took another 20 minutes from the time he boxed leftovers to the time he brought our final check. Our table was bussed and we were still waiting for our check. We were finally ready to hit some stores on the way out and we were informed the mall was closing. The food was pretty good, but we weren&#39;t even offered dessert so I don&#39;t know if the cheesecake is any good. I guess I&#39;ll never know!

Service was good here tonight as most times we have came here. Came here for the red velvet cheesecake &amp; thank goodness they had it; last time we came they were sold out. Food was good and on point. Keep it up!

Went to the Cheese Cake Factory at Westfield Mall/Santa Anita. It was busy and a 30 minute wait. We were a party of four. The outdoor dining area was not available!<br><br>My utensils were spotty. I had to clean then with my lemon water. Service was a little slow due to the busy lunch crowd.<br><br>We ordered Thai chicken lettuce cups, chicken Fettuccini Alfredo, Spicy Cajun Jambalaya Pasta &amp; Rigatoni with meat sauce.  The food was tasty and a good portion size for the price. <br><br>No room for a Cheese Cake dessert.<br><br>A 4-Star Rating.

This cheesecake factory is terrible bad service, do not go there, waste your time and money. Charles is very rude and impolite and talk badly and cheating the customer with very bad food and terrible services.<br>The receptionist is not trained, the waiters are not trained, they have very back service and the food is very low quality. Do not go there.

I don&#39;t usually come to the Cheesecake Factory however we&#39;ve decided to mix it up and come here for some food and drinks on a Friday afternoon. Arrived here on May 3 at 3pm and was not greeted by the hostess. She was quite rude, no smile, and no hi how are you. She waited 5 minutes before giving me eye contact without a smile. Bitch face is what I call it. I proceed to give her my name and the number of people. She said to give her a few minutes. We waited until 3:12pm and then I saw her seat a lady to a booth. Then she proceeds to seat us and I requested a booth. She said it&#39;s another 10 minutes and then I said no I don&#39;t want to wait. So we started to walk out and then they proceeded to seat a party after us (same amount of people) who also came after us to a booth. I walked back in and confronted her and asked how come they seated them at a booth but not us. She said they didn&#39;t have the section to seat us. Why did you seat the party after us to a booth when you clearly said there wasn&#39;t one available. Her name was Corey (not sure of the spelling). The whole place was quite empty. Corey if you hate your job please go find something else. Don&#39;t take it out on the customers.

I went here for the first-time in ages and remembered what I both love and don&#39;t love about this place. I love the atmosphere and comfortable seats. I love that I can bring a large group of people since there are options for groups. <br><br>The food is good but not mind blowing. Portions are huge and expect to take the food home with you for another meal of leftovers. I had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. I don&#39;t want to know the calorie count in this. It was tasty but a tad on the salty side which is a common opinion by the friends I ate with. If you need a ginormous meal and space for a group, come here. Expect to feel a little heavy as you wobble out the door.

It might sound crazy what I&#39;m about to say<br>But some days we go the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s way<br>And since last year, I haven&#39;t got full meals<br>That&#39;s because of their afternoon deals<br><br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you like their tamales of sweet sweet corn<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for the chicken sliders with all the sides you can adorn<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for big portions and the small $5 price<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you think this deal is very nice<br><br>Some Yelpers scoff when others write &#39;bout chains<br>Advancing corporates they say we must refrain<br>But Cheesecake Factory has something going good<br>I must extol their praises as best I could<br><br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you like their fusion Tex-Mex egg rolls <br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for chicken potstickers served in a humongous bowl<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for big portions and the small $5 price<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you think this deal is very nice<br><br>Bring me here when I&#39;m feeling blue<br>Bring me here to try something new<br>Bring me here for a cheesecake slice<br>Bring me here for plates that just entice<br>Bring me here when I&#39;m feeling great<br>Bring me here my appetite will sate<br>Bring me here with some Yelper friends <br>Bring me here again and again<br><br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you like their cool buffalo blasts<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for the duo of breads that I eat so very fast<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along for big portions and the small $5 price<br>At Hour Happy:  Clap along if you think this deal is very nice

I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants. But I&#39;m also not a fan of shopping. So when I have to spend a few hours at the mall, what better way to start it off than by having a few drinks? Yup...that&#39;s what brings me to the Cheesecake Factory. It&#39;s located right at the Santa Anita mall. I didn&#39;t eat there this time, but I have eaten there before. Their food is decent, nothing too exciting. Service at the bar was good, there was no wait. I&#39;ve been by before when there is a 2 hour wait to get a table...and people actually wait! I&#39;ll be back because of convenience and because they have a full bar.

I understand that it&#39;s called The Cheesecake Factory but if your going to sell entrees and such, at least try to make them tasty.  I got a &#34;Spicy&#34; chicken sandwich and it was sooo bland, no spice whatsoever.  My wife got Fettuccini Alfredo that was just a giant gelatinous clump of who knows what.  It was pretty disgusting.  Maybe just stick to cheesecakes and call it a day on everything else.

We decided to splurge for dinner since it is back to school and work tomorrow after the holidays. Very disappointed in Cheesecake Factory&#39;s ability to follow the &#34;special instructions&#34; on the online form. Why provide that ability if the preparers aren&#39;t going to look at it? <br><br>Lesson learned - don&#39;t order take out, eat-in. <br><br>Two orders of pork chops came smothered in apple sauce even though we asked for the apple sauce to be in a separate container. Club sandwich was requested to have tomato, lettuce and mayo on the side, nothing was sent on the side, we got a Club with bread, bacon and turkey. Nothing else. Kids alfredo requested a side of alfredo. No side of alfredo was provided. <br><br>I called and Amanda said &#34;the best we can do without involving corporate&#34; is a gift certificate for $35. Two orders of pork chops were $43 and the Club sandwich was $14.95. Gift certificate didn&#39;t cover the pork chops that had to be rinsed under water to remove the apple sauce. We were not willing to make another trip to the mall to pick up a second order and they said they could not deliver.
This time we got a much better service with Jose S. Thanks for take a good care of us !!
Always my goto place when all fails. Whether I dine in or ubereats/dinnerdash/ or whatever the delivery service is, I get what I want.. Not always pleased, but I love this place.

We decided to go back upon the request of a corporate response to my last review. Of course fearing the worst we went at off peak hours.  Service and food was back to the expectation of we normally experience. I had the chicken and dumplings and my wife had Evelyns Favorite Pasta. Everyone was courteous and attentive to the accommodations to my now pregnant wife. Food was served promptly and was quite delicious. We will slowly put this locations cheesecake factory back into our rotation of restaurants we visit so long as we see the same kind of service we saw today.

Always delicious!<br><br>I ordered the Greek salad which is a great option if you want a light veggie salad.<br>I also had their Arnold Palmer which is so good with the rock sugar on the rim of the cup.<br>My wife had the tacos and a mojito.  She live the mojito&#39;s here because they are very refreshing.  The tacos come with 4 tacos and is plenty to share for the both of us.  Then we ordered the chocolate cake after.  The cake is rich but smooth.  After all said and done we still had leftovers to take with us.  The only thing is my constant major complaint is the lighting in the evening is very dim so it makes lengthy dinners tiresome because your serotonin levels start rising in dim lighting.  Overall cheese cake is always dependable and always a delightful time.  <br><br>Tip -<br>Order the Carmel macchiato with a shot of baileys to wake up and keep the evening moving forward. <br><br>Cons -<br>The evening usually has long waits so be ready for a wait,<br>The lighting can be a little tiresome <br><br>Pros -<br>Absolute dependability from the menu!<br>Beautiful environment!<br>Great service!

The place is good. Most if not all the food I&#39;ve tried here is really tasty. The desserts here are good too. The choices are there to be made. Simply go and find out what they have. The place can get very busy and filled fast, however the service that they have in this location is excellent. I&#39;m not disappointed with them. Thank you all at Cheesecake Factory. This location is nice. Clean and has lots of parking that is under good servalence. They get my orders right most of the time, now that I recall... they only messed up once with my order. Almost huh.<br>The wait time is not that bad. Last time it was under 10 minutes. Enjoy! Don&#39;t Forget to invite me there.

Restaurant chains don&#39;t normally appeal to me, but Cheesecake Factory is a guilty pleasure. The food isn&#39;t the best, but the quality and taste is consistent, my expectations are always met, and the menu has a variety of safe choices.<br><br>This particular location has been around since the mall remodeled and added the current food court area (10 years now?). During high school, Cheesecake Factory was the fancy schmancy &#34;it&#34; place you&#39;d go to for special occasions, so I&#39;ve been here more times than I can care to remember. Now, it&#39;s a place to go to when no one can decide what to eat.<br><br>Bar seating and high-top tables are first come, first serve. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ve ever waited for a table at this location, just because I usually come on weekdays (if you&#39;re a local, you know to stay away from this hell hole of a mall on weekends). There&#39;s also patio seating, which is nice, but there&#39;s not much of a view to look at.<br><br>The service has always been a hit or miss, averaging 3-star quality.<br><br>For food, I usually stick with a pasta: either Pasta Da Vinci or Tomato Basil. If I&#39;m not in the mood for carbs, I&#39;ll get a chicken or fish dish. I&#39;d recommend Crispy Chicken Costoletta or Miso Salmon. Portions are always double what you&#39;re actually able to eat, so it&#39;s nice to pack up the leftovers for lunch or dinner for the next day. Whatever you end up choosing, I&#39;m sure it will taste fine. Dessert options are endless as well, but I find myself gravitating towards the Original Cheesecake with Strawberries more often than not.<br><br>Parking can be a hassle, just because it&#39;s mall parking, but there are lots everywhere and the mall isn&#39;t that big to navigate through. There is valet directly in front but I&#39;ve never used it, as well as curb-side parking for take-out pick-ups.

Worst meals ever. I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory twice in a roll now and both times, I left eating only a few bites of my meals.  Tonight, I had the Tuscan Chicken. The chicken was mindlessly over cooked and tasted like a big piece of rubber eraser. The sauce on the faro was so intensely salty that it almost over-powered any other favor on the dish...almost EXCEPT for the really tart baby tomatoes that exploded in my mouth in all the wrong ways.  In all, the dish was a horrifying juxtaposition of salty sour flavors that left me hangry that I paid $18 to leave 90% of my dinner on my plate.  Needless to say, I have learned my lesson and will not be coming back for overly priced meals that insult my taste buds.
Yummy, love the bread they serve, reasonable prices and yummy foods! Cheese cake is yummy too, lots of selections!

Well with the time it took for the &#34;manager&#34; to respond to our posting it is obvious the reason they have 3 stars is a corporate culture. In addition it shows that they are more interested in the bottom-line instead of creating a culture and dedication to great service. I have seen this many times in restaurants that have been bought out and our acquired by large corporate entities. They reduce staff, under schedule staff, over work them and cause burn out. With a focus on the bottom line instead of great service experience it is obvious to the outside world that they only have 3 stars, when they should be a 5 star with rave reviews. So I would put the blame on the leadership and the corporate culture. Sooner or latter this will effect the bottom line when customer start going to the competition or if a new version is opened up with great service, fantastic food and a better price point. If that happened I would give this location 6 months before it became a ghost town.

For lunch: usually order Renee&#39;s special - it comes with soup, salad, and sandwich. There usually isn&#39;t a wait and you can just walk in to be seated. Because it isn&#39;t as busy as it is at night during lunch time, waiters are very attentive<br><br>For dinner: 9/10 times I would get the chicken jumbalaya! it is SO good and the portion is HUGE! I&#39;d share it with one other person or box what I don&#39;t finish and bring it home with me. Service is a bit slower, there has been times that our waters and drinks come around the same time as food. I always leave very satisfied and don&#39;t always have room for a cheesecake dessert but the ones I have tired (oreo/tuxuedo/smores/godiva choco/white raspberry truffle) have been amazing! I&#39;m making it a goal to try the godiva chocolate sundae before the end of this year haha. Also, cheesecake factory has the best bread! The brown bread with oats is to die for!<br><br>P.S. I would make reservations for dinner time. You can never go wrong with The Cheesecake Factory!

My favorite dish is the chicken Madeira  oh my God I cannot get enough of those mashed potatoes, mushrooms, and asparagus. So delicious! I also really love the avocado eggrolls. My only complaint is that drinks are very very pricey. My drink cost as much as a meal!!! $14.25 for a drink ????really ?!that&#39;s crazy! Pure madness! I think if the drinks are going to be more than $10 you should let us know and give us the option. At least have the courtesy to do that for us.

My family and I (group of 6) went on a Saturday night around 7 pm. Of course, the place was crowded with long lines as usual. We were told that the wait would be 30-35 minutes, and after 40 minutes we checked in, and they told us that they were already setting up the table. <br>Around the 40 minute wait time, this HUGE group of kids came in for someone&#39;s birthday, and mind you, it was HUGE. As in around 15 people or more. We kept on waiting, but after 20 minutes, the group went in! <br>We check in one time and they tell us that there&#39;s just too many parties of 6. WHERE DID OUR TABLE FROM 20 MINUTES AGO GO? I&#39;m pretty sure they ended up giving away our table to the large group despite waiting for over an hour.<br>Finally, after an hour and 15 min, despite being told to wait only 35 min, we were let in. <br>This is ridiculous. Just because other people have larger parties they should not be taking the tables of people who have been waiting for MUCH LONGER. <br><br>Terrible service aside, the rest of the dinner was enjoyable. Food was delicious (and extremely high in calories) and table service was great. <br><br>If you plan to come here during a busy time, expect to wait longer than they tell you. An alternative is California Pizza Kitchen in the same mall area. The lines are usually shorter and the food is relatively similar. <br><br>Update: Cheesecake Factory has expressed their sincere apologies for this event. I&#39;m glad that their guest services are so active in trying to make things better; I really appreciate it.

AWESOME service, great staff, delicious food, &amp; yummy dessert. Oh &amp; JADE is absolutely amazing! Overall, I was happy with everything. The wait to get a booth was very short (only a 5 minute wait). Once we were seated and ordered, our food came quickly. Our waiter (forgot his name) always checked up on us and was very attentive. They provided us with delicious complimentary bread while waiting for our meal to arrive.

They need to work on their To-Go service.  I ordered a medium rare steak with beets, and cheesecake. When I got there, the steak was ready, but clearly they forgot my side dish. I waited another 10 minutes. When the beets was ready, I found out they forgot my cake too... <br>I checked over and over to make sure all my order was in the bag.  When i got home, I realized my steak was WELL-DONE, not MEDIUM RARE.  I didn&#39;t order a lot and it was Monday night. Not a busy night. <br>People there are nice but it&#39;s frustrated to get your order wrong.

Ruined a birthday celebration that cost $144+. For 1, the bow tie pasta under the chicken marsala was hard. On another plate, the steak diane &amp; chicken marsala were swimming in the large plate. The chicken was as thick as a cardboard flap. (Seriously). The steak were a few cubes of meat w/ mushrooms &amp; lots of sauce. Portions have been reduced. Not like you! Receptionist promised to have e&#39;ees sing H. B&#39;day. Never did. Waitress was pushing the check after we ate. Horrible. Horrible. Horrible. Gave 2 stars but really deserves 1.
Bad service, but it is Cheesecake factory, its to be expected. <br><br>I ordered a grilled salmon, it was over cooked, told the waitress and she just said ok.

Came here on a Friday afternoon for their Happy Hour. (yes! They have a Happy Hour M-F at the bar)....was pleasantly surprised with the plethora of appetizer options all reasonably priced ( about 1/2 off for Avacado egg rolls! Yum!) but came away a bit dissappointed with lack of stiffness to the $5 margaritas....however, would definitely be back for maybe a beer and those lovely apps!!
Thanks for responding expeditiously &amp; compensating is. Looking forward to a better experience next time.

Sitting here right now with lots of yummy food... Great people and Great Menu!!<br><br>Gotta try the sweet potato fries with all the delish sauces... Garlic Aioli.. Chipotle Mayo.. Savory Ranch.. and gotta have the Classic Ketchup...

It&#39;s weird, but The Cheesecake Factory would never be my go-to restaurant. However, if my friends choose to have a meal here, I&#39;ll happily oblige. The few times I&#39;ve dined at this location have been fantastic. The service has been wonderful and the food have been well-prepared. <br><br>Skinnylicious Grilled Steak Medallions - Angus beef over a bed of mashed potatoes and surrounded by asparagus, Shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, in a Madeira wine sauce and sprinkled with crushed croutons. Absolutely delectable. I would definitely order this again. <br><br>Fettuccine Alfredo with Chicken - Thick pasta with chicken strips drenched in a Parmesan cheese sauce. Heavy stuff, so it&#39;s good to share, unless you can finish the entire plate yourself.<br><br>Factory Combination: Steak Diane and Shrimp Scampi - Angus beef coated in a black peppercorn, mushroom, and wine sauce along side 3 large shrimps sauteed with cloves of garlic, tomato, and basil atop some angel hair pasta and separated with a generous portion of mashed potatoes. Gotta love this land and sea pairing.<br><br>Wild Blueberry White Chocolate Cheesecake - Cheesecake swirled with blueberries and topped with a layer of white chocolate mousse and shavings. The crust had hints of cinnamon. I don&#39;t like cream cheese, but this was quite heavenly. The blueberry added that tartness, white chocolate provided the smoothness and cream cheese was pure richness.<br><br>Factory Peach Bellini - Champagne, peaches, and peach liqueur. It&#39;s like a peach slush.<br><br>I like their complimentary little bread basket. I especially love the squaw bread! This brown bread has a nice crust, soft center, perfect amount of sweetness and topped with rolled oats. I usually like to ask for more, if I&#39;m particular ravenous that day. Anyway, I&#39;ll have to give the Peppermint Bark Cheesecake a try the next holiday. Hopefully they bring it back next year!

We ordered Thai lettuce wraps, mango avocado salad and shrimp scampi pasta. The wraps were fresh and tasty. However, the salad wasn&#39;t that great. The chicken was dry. The scampi dish was more on the oily side. Overall, we think it was overpriced. The food was average, not that great. Service was good thou.

I used to get really good service at this location，I always visit this location with my families.But I got really terrible service from Christa（that&#39;s the name I got，not sure it is real or not）who works at front desk today to serve us the seat .I don&#39;t know what&#39;s problem with her......I talked to her about my problem to see if she could change another table，because it is too dark for me to read the menu，no lights work on my table.She was so rude that ask me back to the waiting line to get a new number to wait another 30 mins...I totally cannot understand .The light doesn&#39;t work is not my fault......really disappointed with this restaurant......A good restaurant should never have cheap service......I want to give 0 star if I can<br>.

3 1/2 stars. I came here on a <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2FMatch.com&amp;s=811cc30022d77156f869d2477f68d5823aaf9b46b799319ab032f2da80256579" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">Match.com</a> date and it&#39;s been years since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory. I won&#39;t lie, I was really surprised. The food here is actually pretty solid. We ordered the kale salad and a steak. Both were pretty good. Not amazing, but good. I&#39;m reconsidering this franchise.
Food was good the host was horrible. Came in for Sunday brunch with friends. The lemon herb roasted chicken was Perfect.

I went in this past Sunday with my kids. From the moment we sat down we were greeted by Emily (unk last name). She was quick, accurate and very personal. Our meal came out so fast I had to question if it was really my order. Emily said, &#34;its all yours, enjoy it!&#34; Well I did and it was great. I wish I could have given her a bigger tip. The CheeseCake Factory needs to promote Emily and have her train all the new servers. She is a natural!! Go in and ask for Emily as your server, I will!

I love cheese cake factory.  The food is better than average.  Customer service is normally awesome.  However,  today I must say would rate it 1/2 star.  It took 35 minutes for our waitress to introduce herself.  After an hour of being seated.... we finally was about to order. Thank goodness that our food came right away. <br>Our waitress,  Z was nice but never had time to check on us at all. <br>No refills<br>No follow ups<br>Nothing<br>We had to Walk up to pay our bill.  Some service,  right? <br>1/2  = service<br> = food

Forty minutes to get a table and thirty minutes to get the food. Totally not worth unless you&#39;re going on a date that you never want to end. I have to admit, the chicken bellagio was definitely out of this world, but everything else was mediocre. My sister ordered the chicken pot pie, which is suppose to be one of the popular items on the menu. It was at most, acceptable. The cheesecake was kind of melting when it got to our table so it didn&#39;t taste as good as when it&#39;s cold. The only part that was fast was the time they took to get us the bill and get us out the door. Not worth the time or price, unless you have an amazing date that you want to spend more time with, or a gift card that you need to use up.

Our server provided us with not so great service <br>Never asked or came around once to see if we needed anything  we literally had to ask other severs when we needed anything horrible service on her behalf

So this past Sunday we decided  to go to the Cheesecake factory, my son was turning 15 and it was his first time and my 2 nd time and let me tell you it will be my last . The food is delicious but the service is horrible. It was a table for 6 and we were sat outside and at the same time there was a party going . I think out waiter was too busy attending everyone else but us. We had kids in our party. He took forever to come and take our drink order and my kids were thirsty and once our food came out he hardly checked up on us. He didn&#39;t even give us a chance to tell him we were celebrating that towards the end I just wanted to get the check and leave .  Not sure if it was he waiters fault for a horrible experience of the restaurants fault for giving him too many tables . Either way not recommending this place and not returning. It was the worst 180$ Ive spend .
This place is great!! Great service!!! Food is amazing!!! And the cheesecake is delicious!! To bad I couldn&#39;t fit any more definitely want to try more flavors!! Will return

It&#39;s been a while since my last visit and tend to keep it that way. As soon as we were seated I have a habit of looking at my utensils and they were dirty. Sticky food was still on spoons and bread plates. Disgusting!! Advised the waiter and gave us clean ones. Only because I noticed!
Ms.Brandi was such an awesome waitress! We really enjoyed our time with her! Thanks girl for the experience!

Came here twice today, once for lunch and later in the afternoon for dessert.  We were greeted and seated promptly each time. Must say that service at lunch was better than when I came for dessert, but neither time did our server check on us much or offer to refill drinks. Dessert was horrible, meaning it took about 30 minutes for our server to bring out vanilla ice cream and a side of strawberries. We were told multiple times, &#34;They&#39;re making it riiiiight now.&#34; It was a few scoops of vanilla, not sure what had to be made. Strawberries came way after the ice cream because I guess they &#39;were making&#39; those too. The manager tried to make amends by offering cheesecake to go, but at that point, over an hour to have ice cream and strawberries and one appetizer? Thank you, but no thank you. Other customers seemed to be complaining a lot about the service around us, we weren&#39;t the only ones. Also brought it to the attention of the manager that there was no soap in the ladies bathroom, from the time we were there st 12:30, and still when we returned at about 3:00. His response was that there was soap, you just had to pump it a lot and it would come out. Folks, I pumped those damn things plenty of times and if there was soap, that was news to me. My thought was ok, if there&#39;s soap that&#39;s great. But if it&#39;s that difficult to dispense, it&#39;s doubtful that people will stand there and keep trying to pump out soap that doesn&#39;t seem to be coming out. Time to get new dispensers then. (My brain immediately thought of people who work there and prepare the food. No soap?! ) Cheesecake Factory, in my experience, has typically been a solid choice--the Marina del Rey and West LA locations have usually been ok. This experience was sub par, I&#39;m hoping if we frequent this establishment again, they&#39;ll take these reviews into consideration.

This restaurant is always mediocre at best. I typically come here with family when we have a birthday to celebrate and want to go to somewhere local, semi nice, yet also not too pricey. This is one of those restaurants that reminds me of the high school days, when large groups would go out to eat together before heading to Prom or the Homecoming dances. <br><br>My favorite appetizer would have to be the avocado rolls. i normally am not a huge fan of fried foods (especially as appetizers), but it is quite tasty despite being fried on the outside. The sauce complements the avocado very well. Moving on to the main dishes... I highly suggest the miso salmon for the healthy eaters out there. The salmon is cooked perfectly (almost) every time and the sauce is also an A+ with the rice on the bottom (choose brown rice if you want to be extra healthy). But on the days when I&#39;m craving straight up pasta, I like to get the angel hair shrimp, which is just a huge plate of plain old angel hair and shrimp drenched in tomato sauce with a hint of garlic and lemon. The farfalle pasta is also a good option I go to if I&#39;m not in the mood for angel hair. If you want a salad though, I recommend the Asian chicken salad, as it is a HUGE entree and you will most likely not be left hungry after from eating just a salad.

Female asian bartender is super rude.  Came here with a friend of mine on my lunch break and decided to sit at the bar cause we didn&#39;t want to wait for a table.<br><br>I was in a great mood and from the get-go, she wasn&#39;t friendly.  Not even a hello.  She then asked in the most unenthusiastic tone &#34;...anything to drink?&#34; I literally looked at her, didn&#39;t respond, took our menus, and decided to move to the adjacent bar tables.<br><br>One stars for our server who was nice and attentive.  Two stars for their great lunch happy hour!

I hardly write reviews, but this cheese cake factory is horrible, the service is so horrible, the person charls is very rude, impolite, racial discrimination, he is also cheating he is the manager there. <br>It is the Christmas even, I was waiting for my friend drive long way to the Arcadia mall to watch movie, during waiting I went cheese cake factory to have dinner, I went there many times before. But the girl receptionist is very rude, bad horrible services, after I registered one hour ago and the girl told me to seat in a seat next to her in the first line, I seat there waited long time but there is nobody come to service me, bring water and menus.         I asked  I need talk to the manager, ask the manger to come over, where is the waiter? Charles came and lied and told he is the manager and  even abused the truth. Charles is impolite, very rude , talked very badly and even asked the customer to leave because their bad services. Both Charles and the girl in the front desk should be fired. They are very rude and low class. Such kind of horrible services in the holiday!  They are racial discrimination, the girl in the front table and Charles he told he is manage, he lies. Do not go to this bad cheese cake factory the food is bad,  (the other restaurants in the mall were closed or never went to this bad restaurant) their services are the worst and racial discrimination, my lawyer will sue them! They should fire Charles and the receptionist girl in the front table! I choose there is no any start for this horrible restaurant. Charles and the front receptionist should be fired.

Chicken piccata was delicious! Lightly sautéed chicken with lemon butter sauce and angel hair pasta. Perfect seasoning. Lunch special 12.99. Minus a star for service. Bread was hard and dry. Told server and she brought another basket but it wasn&#39;t much better. Service was just meh but food was yummy!

I&#39;ve been here before, have had good experiences until I sat at the bar with the Mr and we regret that decision. We had our brunch drinks and our barista asked us if we wanted bread, we kindly responded to a yes- gotta have the carbs ;) Hubs and i order breakfast; Pancakes &amp; French toast with a side of scrambled eggs and bacon for the Mr.  As were sipping our drinks, I tell my husband i have been craving the avocado egg rolls and he&#39;s like &#34;Yes, order it.&#34; So, I called our barista Tiffany and placed our order, and she looks at me and asked if we would like some bread.... Umm, yes, I replied back. I looked at my hubs and mention to him that she must have for gotten to get the bread, which it was the second time she had asked.. The appetizer came out before the breakfast, which it was perfectly fine. We gobbled those egg rolls so fast, lol. It seemed as if we were in a competition. what can I say, I love avocados. Our eggs had arrived but not the main course... I thought it was going to come out all day together.. :/ it took about another 5 min before the dishes arrived but I was missing the syrup for my pancakes and my husband was missing his bacon. We waited about another 5 min and were trying to call Tiffany and she&#39;s to busy chatting with her coworkers. Keep in mind the TV&#39;s are on and so is the music... by now nothing has arrived and our food was getting a bit cold. My hubs had to wave down Tiffany and we told her what what we were missing. It seemed like she had forgotten about our requests and she personally went to the kitchen. She came back with our orders and the bread. I&#39;m not sure if Tiffany is new or just not on top of her game, she was very distracted with the chitchatting, she belongs as a hostess not a bartender/barista. I really didn&#39;t want to tip since we weren&#39;t satisfied with the service but the hubs said she probably splits the tip with her partner and I really liked her.. who by the way, she was on top of her orders and asking us if we needed anything else. Yes, she was talking but working at her same time. Tiffany was talking so much more and you could tell who was working harder. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll sit at the bar in the near future, unless I&#39;m going for drinks only ;)

Located in the Santa Anita Westfield Mall, outside between Benihana and Woodranch.<br><br>Their menu is huge! They serve cocktails, pizzas, burgers, pastas, tacos, seafood, and of course cheesecake.<br><br>I&#39;ve come here a couple of times because it was convenient, but I really wouldn&#39;t come if I had the choice.<br><br>We were given a buzzer and told our wait would be approximately 25 minutes, but I think it ended up being more like 15 minutes. The interior is pretty large and has nice decorations. They also offer outdoor patio seating. Our server was pretty nice to us the entire time and came to check up on us once or twice during our meal.<br><br>MISO SALMON ($19.95): fresh miso marinated salmon served with snow peas, white rice and a delicious miso sauce, but I substituted with asparagus and mashed potatoes. I did not taste any miso flavoring in the dish and it tasted like teriyaki salmon. Salmon was perfectly cooked.<br><br>FACTORY BURGER ($11.95): charbroiled with cheddar cheese, tomato and grilled onions on sourdough. Tasted just like any other burger you can get elsewhere.<br><br>STRAWBERRY LEMONADE ($4.50): with complimentary refills.<br><br>CHEESECAKE ($6.95-$7.95 per slice depending on what kind): I like their white chocolate raspberry truffle cheesecake and OREO dream extreme cheesecake.<br><br>Downside: Utensils were dirty. I would think they have CLEAN utensils especially the way they charge each dish/drink.

4 stars based on my last visit. 45 min wait for 4 around 7pm on a Sunday. Friendly staff at the host stand.<br>Is it just me or did the chefs at this location up their game? I had dinner there yesterday and had the bbq ranch salad, pasta da vinci, chicken sliders, and jamacian shrimp. Cheesecake factory has always been a 3 star restaurant for me in terms of food taste but last night made it a 5 star. We loved everything we had and everything felt like it was freshly chopped, cooked, and fried. The food was on point.<br>Deducting 1 star for our server. He was great when he was present at our table. He refilled water voluntarily, packed our food, and was observant. HOWEVER, we spent alot of time waiting for him because he was just absent. The server at the table next to us was constantly there but ours only came 3x during our dining experience there.

We had a large party of 12 last night for my nephew&#39;s birthday.   We sat outside with heat lamp, and it was very nice.   The service is great.  The brown bread was really delicious.<br><br>What I also really liked was the addition of vegan menu items.  Avocado toast had a nice kick to it.  The vegan Cobb salad was filling, refreshing, and tasty.  It had green beans, pine nuts, quinoa, beets.  It was awesome!  Way to go Cheesecake Factory to include vegan items!!

Shame on you Manager and receptionist with amnesia for making an entire family including a 90 year old grandmother wait nearly an hour for a non-patio seat (as requested up front) only to be offered a patio seat.  Then saying we have to get back in line all over again for a table inside.  Not cool.

In all my years and many visits to the Cheesecake Factory, never have I ever had a better experience than today. Bryan Ramirez has to be the FASTEST busser I&#39;ve ever seen. We came in with a dirty table and once Bryan was called, it was cleaned in SECONDS. His work was so impeccable that not even a crumb was left. Bryan continued cleaning all the other tables around us and we were just so fascinated with how he wouldn&#39;t even break a sweat. Talent is what he is and he definitely deserves a raise!!! <br><br>Ps. If you want a clean table, make sure to request Bryan

I ate lunch at The Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia, CA on 6/8/2017.  I&#39;ve been there many times before.  This time I had their Louisiana Chicken Pasta ($13.95) and coffee ($3.50).  Damien, my server, did a fine job (assisted by Chris).  Plus, I took photos.

Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory.  What more can you expect from a restaurant that is famous for its cheesecakes.<br><br>The qualities of pasta, sandwiches, salads, and steaks are just about the same as other restaurants that charge the same prices as they do.<br><br>But, what separates them from other restaurants that are in line with their pricing are the service and the advice that you will be receiving from the waiters and waitresses before, during, and after the meals.  They know how to make the patrons feel what a dining experience should be like.<br><br>Its brand will live on for as long as they have been in  business which is farther away than an unforeseeable future.

One of my favorite places to eat. Great potions, food is full of flavor, cheesecakes are always amazing, service is almost always wonderful. It&#39;s been several years since I&#39;ve been to a Cheesecake Factory. This one was good. Our replacement server was wonderful (previous one was leaving soon and extremely slow considering restaurant was nearly empty). The restroom needed a good cleaning and sadly, the cleanliness of the restroom taints the overall experience at a restaurant.

So, I love the cheese cake, but dissatisfied with the staff. We had a meal that this cheese cake a week ago. My hubby called to complain and they told him, they will give him a $25.00 gift card.<br>Today 8/7/17, my hubby walks in after getting the mail, and they sent us $15.00 dollar gift card...... <br>Hmmm... it&#39;s too bad the foods so good, that they can&#39;t get a good staff there. <br>Next I want cheese cake, I&#39;m going to drive 20 min out of my way and go to Glendale.
Very Good foods any Asia, Mexican, pasta or Steak, and very good service, Love this place.

One of the most cheapest romantic setting restaurant that you can find.<br><br>I forgot what I ordered but it should be the very first item in the specialities section in the menu. Chicken something and I have to admit... It was amazing! Crispy chicken on top of pasta. The red velvet cheesecake tasted so sweet and good also! The waitress that I had was so nice and definitely someone that&#39;s l fun to talk to. It&#39;s like the best service I&#39;ve ever experienced in for so long. <br><br>I would definitely come back.
I have order the medium rate beef steak,but the cook the well done,and didn&#39;t return or replace the new one to me.very bad restaurant, I need give them 0 star. Terrible food

I came for their happy hour recently and was extremely satisfied with the food, the prices, the drinks, the service, and the ambience. This review is strictly for their happy hour since I don&#39;t remember the last time I came during regular hours.<br><br>I ordered a happy hour burger for $6 and was extremely impressed with the burger I got. I usually am never impressed or even satisfied with food from a happy hour menu so that really stood out to me. On top of that the drinks were great for $6 as well. We got a few other appetisers as well and they were good but nothing amazing. Our party decided to order a red velvet cheesecake as well and that really hit the spot. Again, I don&#39;t know if I&#39;d come during regular hours, but I will definitely be returning for their happy hour.

Waitress was nice, but it shouldn&#39;t take 20 mins to get our drinks after they take our order and then to get the drink order wrong. Now we&#39;ve been waiting for 40 mins and still no food.  No idea what&#39;s going on with this restaurant but will definitely not be back.

Do they even care about customer service? I feel like they dont give a crap because its cheesecake factory. You know what I mean? Since everyone knows what CF is and they are already well-known to the public, even with the below-average customer service, people still come. Thats the only analogy I can come up with.<br><br>Use the happy hour wisely. Get many appetizers for $5 which is a good deal indeed. They even have happy hour for cocktails, beer and wine for wine lovers like me.<br><br>Try their spicy chicken chipotle pasta. You will love it. Portion is too big but you can always take the leftover home.<br><br>Like I said, service is extremely slow here. I am very impatient and I couldnt stand it, especially during my recent visit to this place. Awful!

Located at the Santa Anita/Westfield mall, parking can sometimes be a challenge especially during peak hours. <br><br>Was able to be seated within five minutes and had a pretty attentive waiter. Ordered Renee&#39;s Special (side garden salad, chicken salad sandwich and mushroom soup). As usual it was pretty delicious and had a good portion size. <br><br>Also took a chance and ordered the Firecracker Salmon. Unfortunately wasn&#39;t that impressive. It&#39;s salmon pieces wrapped in spinach and fried in a crispy wrapper with sweet and spicy chili sauce for around $12. <br><br>While the presentation looked nice, that was about it. There&#39;s only four pieces on the plate about the size of a roll of quarters, and the inside reminds me of how bags of chips now are: 70% air 30% food; not much there. There&#39;s also a large piece of cabbage to fill the plate if you like eating it. <br><br>Overall, the experience is good and food consistently good. Prices for some items  getting a bit too high: I.e. $3 for a soda, $15 for chicken Caesar, etc. <br><br>But for a beautiful interior ambience, great service, your complimentary bread and good portion sizes, enjoy. I&#39;ll still be visiting.

My husband and I went here on a Sunday night. It didn&#39;t take too long to get seated. It was moderately busy, so that was great. We were seated right before the two people at a table next to us. My husband immediately noticed the table was dirty and proceeded to clean it, before I sat down. After sitting, I noticed my small plate was dirty. My husband gave me his, but that one also had food on it. When the table next to us sat down, immediately the server, Christopher, greeted them and took their drink orders. We still waited for Christopher to come to our table. The table next to us got their drinks and bread, yet my husband and I were still waiting. Finally, Christopher came to our table. We told him about the dirty dishes and he just said &#34;uh-oh.&#34; Christopher takes our drink orders and then took the meal order for the table next to us. After awhile, he brings water that we didn&#39;t ask for. And we wait...the table next to us get their food and we&#39;re still waiting for our drinks and bread. <br><br>Christopher finally brings the drinks and bread. He left then came back and dropped off plates. Another 10 minutes goes by or so and he takes our order. After another long wait, my husband gets his appetizer. After that, we saw Christopher pass by a couple of times and yell out something like still waiting, without even stopping at our table. After the table next to us are done eating, he immediately took their plates away and joked with them. He then came back and gave them their check. The table left. That was it!<br><br>I went to the hostess stand to find three employees chatting with each other as I stood there. I called out excuse me loudly and asked for the manager. They quickly dispersed and one went to find the manager. <br><br>The manager, Shannon, came out and I told her about my horrible experience and still no food. She quickly apologized and said she would check on the order and comp the entrees. I went back to my table and the table next to us have already left. Shortly after, Christopher comes over and asks if we want more bread and apologized for the wait. Completely fake! He didn&#39;t care. Shannon came over and again apologized and offered us a drink and we declined stating that we just wanted our food. <br><br>The food finally comes and Christopher haphazardly thanked us for our patience. The food was great. After we paid, Shannon came over again and asked if we wanted dessert to take with us on them and we declined. As we left, no one at the hostess stand said anything to us. The restaurant was pretty empty by then. Earlier, I had noticed the hostesses excitedly wishing leaving patrons a good night and thanking them for coming in. <br><br>I know this place has the worse reviews, but I had never been treated so badly there. Christopher not only serviced someone who sat down after us so quickly, but he didn&#39;t even care about how he wasted our time. Time is something we will not get back. We don&#39;t need food compensated. We have money to pay for what we want. I just don&#39;t understand why we were treated like that. And I would hate to think about ethnicity. Christopher is black and so am I. The table next to us were Hispanic. My husband is white. All of this shouldn&#39;t matter and hope it didn&#39;t matter to Christopher. However, I do hope he&#39;s now looking for another job.

The first time I had cheesecake factory was 10 years ago and I did not like it. It&#39;s because I didn&#39;t order the right thing. But ever since I had their pasta &amp; calamari? It has been my favorite ever since! <br><br>This is the closest location in my area and it never disappoint each time I come. Their service is always great so I never had a bad day with them.<br><br>They always start you off with bread (after your order that is! My friend joked people might take off after eating their bread only). That&#39;s because they have the BEST wheat bread ever. It&#39;s so soft and sweeet! Heck, just take me there and give me bread and I&#39;ll be happy! But on a side note, they do have few dishes there that I absolutely love! <br><br>|Four Cheese Pasta|<br>I&#39;ve tried several pasta from them but this has been my staple for a very long time. Penne style is my favorite so this dish is it! It&#39;s very creamy and cheesy. This dish doesn&#39;t come with meat so it&#39;s additional $3 if you order with chicken. But I preferred less meat so I never order it with chicken. <br><br>|Calamari|<br>This has to be my favorite appetizer from them. Nothing else. And yes, I did try several before. They use the right mount of batter that makes it perfectly crispy in my opinion. The texture is fresh and not too rubbery. The dipping sauce they serve with it go well with the calamari or just how I like it at least. Cocktail &amp; garlic.

The one thing I know is consistency, and that&#39;s what makes TCF my favorite place to dine (including Rock Sugar in Century City).  Their table breads are soft, with a choice of white sourdough or brown squaw bread; we never can have enough of the squaw bread though...  I prefer the fish tacos because they are done the best I&#39;ve tried throughout the LA Area (gringo style).  I can&#39;t compare this to street tacos though because they are so much different when served from a food truck.  Of course, the cheesecake at the end of dinner is what we all look forward to, and fortunately, I invested in gift cards that came with free cheesecakes, so I&#39;ll have some more dining to do before the end of March!

I&#39;ve been to cheesecake factory countless times, and mainly with my mother. She loves this place, not sure why, but she does and I will not hold her against it. Their menu is a tad too big for me and too many options. A dish I tend to go back for is their AHI TUNA TARTARE. It&#39;s a very nice appetizer dish with ginger and avocado. Service is always good. :) ENJOY!

Sorry but today ended in a nightmare. 8:20 p.m. the fire alarms sounded off so everyone was like what&#39;s going on instead of the managers or employees coming out and say hey guys everything is okay its just a false alarm they just stood in the side like WTF? I already have 1 bad ear now i have a pinging noise in my good ear. I came to have a peaceful dinner with my family not to have a loud false alarm ruining our night. SUPER UNPROFESSIONAL CHEESECAKE FACTORY. TRAIN YOUR EMPLOYEES ESPECIALLY MANAGERS TO LET THE CUSTOMER KNOW ITS JUST A FALSE ALARM!!!

We sat at the bar and had the worst treatment because we mistakenly ordered the wrong appetizer ...never been so humiliated with the worst attitude at the bar! We were celebrating our anniversary and felt the so so humiliated! Talk to the manager and he was absolutely very kind and nice ...offered refund but we resisted...just ask him to please talk to his bartenders ....

So the whole concept of when you&#39;ll be seated is dictated by when the previous party has left the table. So in theory if the original party never leaves you&#39;ll be out of luck even though if there&#39;s other tables empty. The fun part of this is  you&#39;ll be seeing parties of the same size getting here after you and being seated first. I guess you can either blame luck or the way they handle seating. Either way efficiency is being overlooked.
Food was delicious during lunch today. The restaurant music was louder than fuck!  I thought I was at a dance club. Pure millenialism!

I have eaten here twice lately: once on my birthday on March 15 and the other time April 4.  Both times I received excellent service.  Not only was the food served promptly, but the presentation was awesome.  No, they didn&#39;t present me my food with a brass band--it wasn&#39;t that kind of presentation--but the way my order was arranged on my plate.  Many of you should know what I&#39;m talking about.  If you don&#39;t, then eat here and you&#39;ll find out!

Its consistent for a cheesecake factory.  Its at the mall so parking can be a pain specifically on major nights (Friday and Saturday).  I prefer valet on those days.  The food was good and service was good as well.  I got the hibachi steak with wasabi mashed potatoes.  Overall as a dish it was good however the steak after some time got a little salty.  The mashed potatoes are seasoned with wasabi butter which was good.  I&#39;ve been here a few times and have ordered several pastas, my favorite is the Chipotle Chicken.  They used to have a really good thai peanut pasta I hate they removed from the menu.  I also like some of the buffalo chicken starter (they&#39;re wrapped in a triangle wrapper).

Mm.. what a great experience! i took the bf here to celebrate his birthday, and it was a great choice! The interior was beautiful and classy, and the service was excellent. The food is a bit expensive, so I would not come here unless there was a deal. [that&#39;s how I feel about Olive Garden, actually]. <br><br>Here&#39;s what we got:<br>Avocado Eggrolls<br>Chicken Parmesan Sandwich<br><br>That was only two orders, but it was very filling and very delicious! These were the only items I saw worth getting in an expensive place like this, but I loved what we chose! I wish we tried the cheesecake, but it was going to be $7 for a slice. Despite the priceyness, I can see what the fuss is all about! :)

Came on a Monday night to celebrate with my family. I&#39;ve been coming here for a long time and I really do love coming here, but yesterday was a particularly busy night and so the customer service and the quality of food suffers a bit. Things I love getting: 1. Avocado Egg Rolls (appetizer): If you love avocado and a zesty, tasty sauce, with a nice crunch this appetizer is for you 2. Chicken &amp; Biscuits: This was something incredibly surprising for me, usually people don&#39;t think to order this dish at The Cheesecake Factory but it&#39;s everything you dream about when you think (southern comfort). Give it a try! 3. Burgers and Smoothies 4. Cheesecake: There&#39;s just a long list of amazing cheesecakes but my top two choices have always been the Fresh Strawberry Cheesecake and the White Chocolate Truffle Cheesecake. Bread is refillable and drinks can be taken to-go. Make sure you make a reservation if you&#39;ve got a big party, or you will probably have to wait a while. Great place to celebrate with your family and friends.

I&#39;ve come here a couple times because it was convenient, but I really wouldn&#39;t come if I had the choice. I don&#39;t know much about the carb-y options, but I&#39;ve gotten a bunch of their salads. Whether its from the &#34;Healthy&#34; portions menu or normal menu, the chicken is very sparse or just NOT THERE!! Happened to me and my friend on two separate occasions, and I&#39;ve had to ask for chicken on my grilled chicken salad! Other times, I&#39;ve had to pick through the lettuce to find some strips of protein, like a gold miner back in the olden days of good ol&#39; cali. The &#34;healthy&#34; dressing is thickened to the point where it looks like thawed out frozen gravy, and tastes even worse. <br><br>Seriously, all the salads are not that great, minus the ahi tuna salad because you get a good amount of ahi, though the salad part is not much to look at. Don&#39;t come here to be healthy. If you come, come to FEAST LIKE A KING!! Then maybe the food won&#39;t be as atrocious.<br><br>So people coming from Gold&#39;s Gym....go to CPK and get the salad there instead. You will thank me!
Manager needs to be more organized for the bakery takeout. 1 person working isn&#39;t going to help for the holiday rush when it first opens

Found a egg shell in the meat ball and the manager ask me what I wanted to do? I mean u r the manager not me. I think u should come up a solution for the customer instead of asking the customer what to do.

I&#39;ve only eaten at Cheesecake Factory twice - once at the Americana and once at the Santa Anita mall location. The interior decor is really quite beautiful, both classy and elegant from floor to ceiling. While the restaurant isn&#39;t high end or even considerably fancy, the atmosphere inside does elevate the restaurant to a level above your average chain.<br><br>We were seated promptly at a cozy booth since there were many empty seats (some hostesses will actually seat a party of 2 at a tiny table when other larger ones are available). Our server (didn&#39;t catch his name) was extremely friendly and professional the entire time. I even commented to my date that it was a breath of fresh air having servers who didn&#39;t seem to hate you, their jobs and life in general. <br><br>Ordered a dirty martini, the grilled pork chop and the chicken madeira. Both dishes were good, nothing mind blowing, and very filling with great portion sizes. Even picked up a slice of cheesecake to go for my little sister and she loved it.<br><br>Good place to stop by for a hearty lunch or dinner.

Over this place! Gave it a few chances and it&#39;s ALWAYS DISAPPOINTING. Food takes forever to come. Dishes are dirty, everytime we go we have to ask for new utensils. They also take forever to refill your drinks and bring basic things like hot sauce. Today it took over 15 mins for her to bring it. I even asked twice. Today we also found a hair in our burger they said it was a pice of corn husk (which could be possible) and we agreed it could be possible, either way it shouldn&#39;t have been there. But the thing that bothered us even more is while we waiting for a new plate They offered a salad or soup &amp; we said sure we&#39;d like a salad but the new plate was ready and all he said was oh it&#39;s ready &amp; gave us our new plate &amp; walked away. We never got the salad or anything. They could have given us the salad for the inconvenience or taken the plate off our bill or a slight discount or something!

The Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t provide the best service anymore. The line on Sunday isn&#39;t long, but I had to wait for 1hour. And also the server isn&#39;t friendly enough, the foods take so long. We were so hungry and the food took almost 2h to come out. Never ever come back to this SANTA ANITA mall branch anymore.

What can I say!!! The food is amazing, but It doesn&#39;t compare to the to the quality of work that our waiter gave us. Even with a dinner rush Sean G. Was very polite and extremely quick about helping us with anything we needed. We need more people like him. Thank you Sean G.

Terrible service and not organized. Came in and was given a pager because there was people waiting in the lobby. After a twenty minute wait, the pager goes off. I walked up to the counter, and the host took the pager. The host then had me and my family wait off to the side and told us a waiter would seat us shortly. In the meantime, the same host is seen taking pagers from people and seating them down on their tables. After about ten minutes of seeing this, I became frustrated. I complained to a different host and thought we  were waiting in the lobby like the rest of the other people. He then sat us down in on a table. <br><br>Once seated, a waiter came by and informed us that the restaurant had ran out of bread rolls. Both wheat and sourdough. The waiter then walked away without saying if he was going to be our waiter,  or if someone else was coming to take our orders. We waited and waited. Nobody came by, so we simply stood up and walked out. <br><br>This restaurant not only did they run out of bread rolls, but also with customer service.

Over priced, slow service, food was so so. We went for lunch and sat outside. The patio is cramped and hard for people to walk through. <br>Here&#39;s what we got:<br><br>Ahi Tartare - pretty good, lots of avacado, the fried wontons strips were overly oily, not the freshest tuna but what do you expect from a chain restaurant.
