It was a small portion, good for two people. <br>Fried Zucchini - pretty typical. They used the perfect amount of oil to get a nice crispy outside and juicy inside.<br>Tossed Garden Salad - large size for an appetizer. We got basamic dressing and it was great! The croutons were super hard though. I would suggest skipping yhe croutons.<br>Bang-bang chicken - terrible! The description said... Spicy. But it was not at all spicy. It was super sweet with dried coconut on top. They need to go light on the coconut. It was way to sweet. For a dish that is called bang bang chickent, i wasnt expecting for it to have shrimp.<br>Tiramisu Cheesecake - the best dessert in the world!!! Only reason we come here. Not too rich and not too sweet.

My Husband and I have been fans of The Cheesecake Factory for years.  But this was the first time visiting the Arcadia location.  It was just as wonderful as all of the other locations we&#39;ve been to.  The food was delicious as expected served with generous portions... I had the Steak Diane/Salmon combo and he had the Jambalaya.  The atmosphere was great and our waitress Ana was the best!  We&#39;re definitely going to be new customers of the Arcadia location.  And, yes we just had to take a piece of Banana Cheesecake home to share.  It was amazing!

Been wanting to go to the Cheesecake Factory for awhile now and I finally came tonight. Our server Christian was so generous and attentive. he made my bf and I feel welcome and comfortable. I love how he got our leftover food and boxed it for us. Idk if that&#39;s what they do there but I really did appreciate that. Food was whatever&#39;s, but I would come back only if he was our waiter again and to try the cheese cakes, I was too full to get any! Lol

Had a gift card from Christmas that we decided to use. Place was super crowded but we opted to sit outside and got seated right away. We ordered buffalo blasts that were pretty much life changing! They were really good. But of course like most restaurants, a little skimpy with the sauce... So ordered extra. We decided to order off the skinny menu. I ordered Tuscan chicken and was very surprised with not only how good it tasted but the portion size. My fiancée ordered the Asian chicken salad which was large and in charge as well. Our waitress was nice and informative but took just a little too long in checking on us. We understood, they were busy. Would go back, at least for those buffalo blasts.

This review is about their reservation policy.<br><br>Tried to book a reservation for my family since we have guests visiting from out of the country.<br>Called to book a reservation and they said they don&#39;t have reservations on the weekend after 6.  I understand it&#39;s the busiest time and they don&#39;t want to loose potential customers if a large table is already reserved and that party is late.<br>So I rescheduled with all my family to try a weekday reservation, called back and they said they still could not make my reservation as I didn&#39;t have the right number of people!<br><br>What?!
This place blows ! Screwed up our dinner and took 20 min to get the check. Should of just walked out.
hostess very rude and condescending.  Not a  good start for a visit to the Cheese Cake Factory..

Food is delicious but is on the expensive. I think it is perfect for a dinner date. <br><br>Service was friendly. Lighting is a bit on the dim side.<br><br>If you plan to go, try to make a reservation or go early to beat the crowds.

Manager John was very rude! I just asked for my order of 2 cheesecakes cause i was seeing that every one was getting theirs before me and I been waiting longer. He turned around and said you need to still wait. I waiting anotger 20 minutes and nothing. Thanks to the cashier she helped me right away! I know it was busy but he didn&#39;t bother aaking or looking for my order.

Went for a family members birthday, and we went early on a Sunday, so the wait was not bad at all. Our server was good, but they said there was a &#34;kitchen mixup&#34; and one of our dishes did not come out. But we had to ask twice for someone to actually go check on it. They gave us a bowl of soup while we waited, but by the time the dish came out everyone else was already done.

If you want to wait 2 hours to be seated for a party of 10, then this place is for you. We even called ahead of time to let them know a party of 10 will be dinning in and still waiting that long. <br>When I received my food other food was mixed in with it that wasn&#39;t suppose to be in there. I asked what it was &amp; they were kind of enough to take it back &amp; make me a whole new plate. I also got my meal paid as well. Overall the experience was ok but not great. <br><br>Thank you

There is one thing the Cheesecake Factory has that I cannot seem to find anywhere else. And for that, they can have all the stars in the Yelptrum because I cannot perfect this fish on my own. (Also, service has always been great in this location). <br><br>MISO SALMON! Come for lunch and get the lunch portion which is more than enough at a cheaper cost but this is the dish to get. Choice of white or brown rice cooked in Miso sauce and then over the amazing sake butter sauce. Garnished with some snow peas, this is really one of the best dishes I have ever eaten. <br><br>The wait can be a dread at this location especially during weekends and dinner time. Parking can also be hard to find as it is in a mall. Good luck with that!

I think over the years, Cheesecake factory is trying to reinvent itself to be more health conscious so that is why they creates the light menu? But let&#39;s face it, when you decide to go there you know you are adding another hour to your gym routine the next day to weight-lift off the calories from that 2 pound Alfredo pasta or New York Steak.<br><br>It&#39;s a great place for group of friends or family. We always do family style and I love all the appetizers. The sliders are cheezy good and the nacho plate with the same gratuitous amount of melted cheese is equally delicious. <br><br>The interior decoration at the Santa Anita mall probably has a more beautiful interior decoration than some of the other locations. But still it has the same gold and yellow art-deco-esque theme, which to me is beginning to get a little old. They might consider to update the look of the restaurant if they want to appeal to the younger or hip crowds. But we mostly do not come here for a posh dining experience. It&#39;s a great place for fun gatherings.

My favorite restaurant.  I wouldn&#39;t go if they didn&#39;t have the bread and the seasonal gift cards they offer to get two pieces of cheesecake for 25 spent.  I buy a few hundred bucks every year.  It&#39;s rare to find a restaurant that does so many dishes excellent.  Really upset that they decided to go even skimpier in pasta portions.  This is why one star.  I pay 20 bucks for pasta shrimp bistro and it is so little pasta that it is gone in 2 minutes.  Also I get spaghetti and meatballs the week before in Rancho.  Even worse.  Will never understand this.  For another 25 cents of pasta they could double the amount.  They keep putting less and less.  Going to lose customers over pennies.  All food is top notch though.  Great if you are a wimpy eater and don&#39;t care about portions. The dark atmosphere is very inviting and gives a sense of privacy also.

Dear Cheesecake Factory,<br><br>First of all let me just say I am a big fan of you! I think your food and service are awesome and consider every single visit to your restaurant a privilege. My last visit, however, was not my typical positive experience with your restaurant. <br><br>We ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and I asked for no peanuts. There was no follow up question from my server. When we were eating I noticed that the salad had almonds in it, I assumed that if I say no peanuts it&#39;s probably safe to not put any kinds of nuts. Anyway I raised my concern and my server was apologetic. She offered me a new salad but we were almost full by that time. The manager then came by and said &#34;there&#39;s no peanuts you&#39;re good to go,&#34; Then I responded it has these nuts, he said they&#39;re not nuts they&#39;re almonds so you&#39;re fine. I said no thanks and he took the food away. Common restaurant courtesy, if you&#39;re going to take someone&#39;s food away you should not charge them! Needless to say we were charged for the stupid salad. I am not complaining over the $15 salad, it is more the courtesy. I am disappointed.
Bad service, manager just ignored customer complaint. Need a manager that take care of issues. No a manager that comes to collect his pay check.<br>Food no so great, used to to be great food.

I Found a small sized cockroach in the water and told one of the waiters. The manager came and instead of offering any compensation for this unsanitary situation, he offered to cancel my order and give me more free cockroach-infested water.

Just had the best service and dinner thanks to Brenda and Gibran. <br>Brought my mother in law, my grandma, my two toddler boys, and my husband for a late Mother&#39;s Day dinner and the experience was just so amazing.<br>Thank you for having such amazing and happy professionals in your work place. Gibran and Brenda - you made my grandmas night a night she won&#39;t forget. She doesn&#39;t get the opportunity to get out let alone a chance to have such a wonderful meal and desert so her smile and full belly really melts my heart. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. <br>Brenda- your professionalism, smile, body language, and eagerness to serve us was everything and more.<br><br>The egg roll sampler, ahi tartare, and tater tots were so delicious.<br>Looking forward to trying our cheese cake: 30th anniversary, strawberry cheesecake, and Godiva cheesecake. <br>I ordered the spicy chipotle pasta ( my favorite) <br>Grandma had the macaroni burger <br>Mother in law had the chicken Marsala <br>Kids shared spaghetti and meatball<br>And my husband has the chicken belagio ( his favorite)

I love the Cheesecake Factory! They always have so many options on the menu (almost too many), but there is truly something for everyone. I went here with 2 of my friends and one of them got the chicken picatta, and another ordered their sausage and shrimp pasta (which looked so good!) I really enjoyed the flat bread and the soup and would def order them again!

My dinner was superb! The ahi carpaccio is delicious!!! My favorite by far! Unfortunately I heard it&#39;s being taken off the menu. Please don&#39;t! The crusted ahi with wasabi was my favorite and then it was removed from the menu. Please bring it back! I might have to give The Cheesecake a one star if they keep removing my favorite dishes off the menu.

My husband and I loved the food and service! Very friendly and kind. Yes, it&#39;s busy but we waited and got our seats. Desserts are amazing! For a father&#39;s day weekend it wasn&#39;t so bad. They got it! Thank you cheesecake factory!

We came here last night for dinner, the vibe was nice and fancy-like. Our waiter Katelynn Z was on it, took our drink and appetizer orders quick, and she kept our table clean of used plates and our drinks never went empty food was delicious, we will return for sure. Great customer service *****

The service i received here TWICE! Was rude inconsiderate and unprofessional and OBVIOUSLY untrained!!!!  I used my replacement ID here my first visit no problem have used it at other places to buy alcohol now they are saying i cant?? The waitress was rude and sarcastic and rolled her eyes as if im a problem! We left because if your staff cant get it together then maybe you shouldn&#39;t be a manager either.

Just had the worst experience at this place tonight, a month a ago my friend and I came here and had okay service from a servier named Juan, and what i usually do when its great service is i doodle a caricature of the waiter, but doodle a different thing with the line saying &#34;do better&#34; to motivate them since the character that is drawn is a character that works hard. Tonight we had the same waiter and he remembered us which was rad, but he leans forward to my and says he remembers the doodle and the writing and said &#34;its been on my mind, what did you mean by that&#34; so he seemed very offended by it, but seemed like whatever i was going to say would make him want to do something to me or my friend and she felt incredibly uncomfortable and as was i because i never had a stranger or in this case a waiter thinking its okay to do such a thing and not get in trouble. I chose to say &#34;it says what it says&#34; while looking at my friend and making sure she is fine but clearly wasnt. He then takes our orders and then tells us that we have a different waiter which was odd because if he didnt feel comfortable in the first place he should of done that, but instead acted like he runs the place and can get away making customers uncomfortable. Really dig the restaurant because its close to where i work and my friend loves the place and we are not sure to come back and get him or someone else who thinks its high school and wants to start something.

I&#39;ve been coming here since this Santa Anita Mall location opened, at least once a year after Christmas with my family.  The service has always been 5-star at the restaurant and the bar area (happy hour on Monday-Friday b/t 4-6 has great deals on apps and drinks) with friendly, courteous and competent servers.  The food is always tasty; however, as other reviews have pointed out, the portions have been less and less lately.  The prices stay the same or have gone slightly higher with reduced amounts of food.  Before yesterday, I would have given this place 4 stars based on the above, but another star has been taken off due to my visit to the cheesecake counter last night.  There were two people in front of me, and about three people came after me.  The server who took my order was not friendly and looked like she had just gotten out of bed with unruly hair.  I ordered a strawberry cheesecake, and was courteous even if she wasn&#39;t.  I then saw the two people before me get their orders, and the three people that ordered after me also got their cheesecakes.  After about 12 minutes (I was keeping track of my time bc I had parked in the 15-minute zone), there was no one else in line or waiting except me, so I asked if there was a wait for strawberry cheesecake. The server didn&#39;t say a word, she just turned around, got the cheesecake and gave me the bag with a &#34;here you go.&#34;  No apologies nor explanation as to why I didn&#39;t get my order until I asked.  Hopefully she was having a bad day and is not normally like this, but to be safe I may just order my cheesecake from the bar area next time she is working the counter.
Cheesecake is usually good. Not always on point, but a classic spot that&#39;s been around for ages. I usually go for the meatloaf, pastas and definitely save room for the cheesecake!

What a joke, I went here and had a cheesecake which was actually good but then I ordered a Chinese chicken salad and there was a moving black bug in it. Our waiting, who was actually nice, told the manager who apologized robotically and asked if we wanted dessert in the type of way that you would think is complementary but we declined since we already had a cheesecake. They took the salad off the bill but then we asked the waiter if they could take the cheesecake off as well because the manager offered us complimentary dessert but he declines and said it was a misunderstanding.  I just don&#39;t think David, the manager, cares very much about customer service.
Has a huge variety of pastas, pizzas, cheesecakes, and sides!

Normally I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to review a huge international corporate chain restaurant but this location in particular is off the hook. I don&#39;t know who the managers are but they really trained the servers how to give excellent service. Everyone has a smile on their face and they go out of their way to make all your needs are met. The last time I was there, I left my credit card behind but luckily when I called them they said they had it for safekeeping. I went back to pick it up and they were so nice about it. The food here is also way better than other factory locations. The  LA Grove location has the worst food by far.

This is easily me and my boyfriend&#39;s favorite restaurant at the Santa Anita Mall.  The lunch specials are awesome, and the food is so amazing and well prepared.  I envy their seafood vendors- because I am telling you, they have the most tender juicy salmon- everytime.  I just love their food and desserts!  Try their salad or any of their seafood dishes, yum!  :)<br><br>Also the service here is always top-notch.  They are very attentive to your experience as a guest.

Saturday night - we had a group of 15.  They do not take phone reservations. We planned to have dinner at 6:30 and we just wanted to have someone in our group to get there early and hope everyone else was on time at 6:30 so we could get seated in a timely manner, we were trying to watch a movie afterwards as well.<br>There was a table of 17 after us so we didn&#39;t want to lose our table but we only had 5 out of the 15 in the restaurant at the time.<br>The problem was the parking. There must have been some event but one car in our group had to leave to get gas because they had been idling too long in the parking lot to get a spot. <br>We urged the host that our group was just looking for parking and tried to get as many people in the door to secure our table. <br>I was one of the first to get there so I had some time t take in the large screens with their menu items cycling through them.<br>I didn&#39;t see the photo but I heard my group talking about the chicken bellagio. <br>....<br>I wrote this review over a year ago.<br>I can&#39;t remember what I wanted to say but the food was great and I&#39;ve been wanting to go back ever since.

Place is great. Can&#39;t complain. Servers here is a hit or miss. You&#39;ll get one person that loves there job and one day you&#39;ll get one that shouldn&#39;t be a server. Food wise its still there. Flavors still rock&#39;n and you just can&#39;t get enough of there choices of cheese cakes. Steak Dianes, pork chop, and miso salmon is a must try. I know Im missing something else, but you cant go wrong with this place.

The food is not amazing but our server was great which is why I&#39;m giving a 3 star review!!! I guess it&#39;s not the same quality as years ago but at least the server we had was great and very accommodating. Basic food nothing fancy at all!!

Always a good visit here! Got seated quickly and our waitress was beyond attentive! She was on it!! It was pretty busy but she made us seem like we were the only table she had! My boyfriend and I were very impressive! We were soooo happy with her service it made our dinner even more enjoyable! The food was delclious ands well and we didn&#39;t even have to ask for refills on our drinks because she was constantly refilling it up! This is our favorite Cheesecake around the area, super close to us so it&#39;s always a good experience when we go! Thanks for making my dinner dates great Cheesecake! See ya next time!

Always pretty busy (no reservations available) so come with patience and a little in your stomach. Service is pretty solid considering the inside traffic. Their food is great! So much to choose from. I&#39;m a big fan of their Kobe Burger which comes with nicely sautéed mushrooms and this killer spicy sauce. <br><br>Keep in mind the parking is ridiculous! People get pretty aggressive too so use caution when parking, but don&#39;t let the boneheads keep you away from a great meal.

On Oct. 12, 2017 around 6:30pm, we ordered 2 set of shrimp angel hair, however they were super salty so we requested to change the meals since it will really hurt our health. <br>The manager, named Kenny came to our table without any apology, but started to count how many shrimps we ate and insisted we need to pay the super salty shrimps.<br>I actually felt very happy for Cheesecake Factory, since you have such a wonderful and talented manager who I have never seen in my life. The manager, Kenny is super capable for any position in your company. I really think you should promote him at least to CEO and also show his counting shrimp skill to all of your employee.
Dinner was awesome as usual, I had the BAM-BAM CHICKEN AND SHRIMP and Donna had the BAR-B-QUE  BURGER and now topping it off with strawberry cheesecake

This is a go to for my family when we want a good meal but my only complaint is that their customer service has really become hit and miss lately, it has ranged from great to terrible, I have a feeling the manager is really lacking and it&#39;s reflected in the staff but at least the kitchen is always on point and the food is good
Always a great choice! Always good food! Great portions! Love their cheesecake!! <br> <br>Top 10 fave restaurants!!

Writing a bad review to get the attention. To all managers, you have an ongoing problem that you have never addressed properly. <br>  Your paging system doesn&#39;t work inside the mall, and you all know this. So why don&#39;t you label the pagers to state that it doesn&#39;t work in the mall. That&#39;s it, it&#39;s that easy. We went in yesterday evening and was given a 50 to 65 minute wait. We&#39;re at the mall, why wouldn&#39;t we take a little walk. Came back early only to be told, we paged you already. Sorry the pagers don&#39;t work in the mall, that would have been nice to know before we left the restaurant. If course another 15 minutes and we were seated. Besides getting water spilt on my son, the rest was average.

It&#39;s all about.. you.. family.. and good food. Went with family for lunch on a Sunday, after shopping at the Westfield Mall. When walking in, I was handed a mobile, vibrating device that would call upon thee when thy seating was ready. It was very busy, but tranquil at the same time... with three-yo&#39;s crying and yelling for cheesecake and other foods. <br><br>After being seated, our server came promptly and I ordered a salmon plate, and it was very scrumptious. The portions are very generous, so you&#39;d be filled up before the plate is half way through. Not only that, the fish is actually fresh and did not induce any allergic reactions.<br><br> All the while we were there, I  could&#39;t help but feel I was actually sitting within the caesar palace buffet at Las Vegas. The decor of the factory exudes  a richness that was.. very much flamboyant, and a bit overwhelming. I was full before they could serve the meal.. just by people watching and becoming one with the hectic-ness of the surrounding. <br><br>Overall, a good, clean, and entertaining place to have food; but definitely not on weekends.

I came here with my coworkers after work. We wait about 5-10 minutes before seated. Nice waiter gave us extra bread. We got 3 dishes and 1 appetizer. We had our favorite avocado egg roll first. The main dishes takes a bit long, but they worth the wait. We end up give more than 20% tips because we think this restaurant is good quality food and nice service. We want to order some dessert, but we don&#39;t have any room for it. Nice after work meal.

Food:  We ordered the tamales with chips, salasa and gucamole as appetizers.  My entry meal was a chicken dish - I can&#39;t remember the name but it was served with mash potatoes and some veggies.  The chicken was grilled with a lemon/citrus taste to it.<br><br>Food rating:  3.5/5<br><br>Service:  Service here is good with plenty of helpful servers and waitress.<br><br>Service rating:  4/5<br><br>Overall:  I think my overall experience was decent.  I just haven&#39;t found a go to food in this place.

Host should not tell customers that it&#39;s 1/2 hour wait when wait time is a lot longer. <br>Poor management= lots of empty tables, dirty tables with dirty dishes but not enough waiters/waitresses. Food took along time. Suppose to be 1 to 1-1/2 hour lunch end up being there 3-1/2+ hours due to poor service...

Waitress was slow. My son got his dinner first and then I had to wait for my dish to arrive. No apology and she seemed distracted and like she didn&#39;t care! Silverware was dirty and the whole dinner sucked! Not returning to this location! The drinks were good though.

The bf and I decided to come here for lunch since we saw that they had lunch specials until 5pm. We came here on Columbus Day so there were quite a bit of people here and at the mall. Since it is connected to the Santa Anita Mall, the parking lot was pretty busy so we had to circle around a few times until we found a parking spot. <br><br>We decided not to go with the lunch special and we went with their combination meals with Herb crusted salmon and shrimp scampi for around $20. The dish came with mashed potatoes which were good, nothing special. The salmon was delicious! It was moist and flaky with lots of flavor. I was hesitant to get this because I hate when salmon is over cooked, but not here! It was cooked perfect! Their shrimp scampi was also DELICIOUS with lots of garlic and butter burnt onto the shrimp giving it lots of flavor! There were 3 shrimps so the bf and I split 1 1/5 shrimps for each person. :)  The dish also came with three asparagus as well for veggies. <br><br>Overall this is a great choice if you like salmon and shrimp! They&#39;re a must try! I wished the dish came with more veggies rather than only three thin asparagus.<br><br>Service was great! Our waiter was attentive even though he had lots of tables to wait on. He was also able to pronounce the bf&#39;s Thai name which is super long! :)

BRENDA was the best server I ever had I recommend anyone going to her she&#39;s very sweet she made our night pleasant , I&#39;m defiantly getting her again, the food was great she got everything we wanted done.

Great waitstaff and tasty selections save the day!<br>-----------<br>This was a last minute choice, after our original plans for dumplings was stymied by obscene waits of over an hour. <br><br>I&#39;m glad we ended up here, since we had an awesome waitress. <br>Not only did she automatically offer to substitute brown rice in for the pasta that normally comes with their Jambalaya offering (seriously, who orders Jambalaya pasta?), but also she suggested making the dish &#34;heavy&#34;, aka extra crushed tomatoes.  The chicken was tender; the sauce, zesty; and the tomatoes, bursting with flavor. <br>She saw to it that the lady&#39;s grilled salmon was cooked by the head line chef - meaning, it was moist and flavorful, subtly seasoned with whipping creme and fresh Rosemary, versus a dried piece of cardboard that is often the case when ordering seafood at a mega chain. <br><br>She definitely earned her 20%.<br>Worth coming back next time we&#39;re in the mood for a mega chain.

I love going to this place to eat. It is one of the best restaurants around Arcadia. Sometimes you will have to wait but it&#39;s also kind of worth it. To me, they have the best Cheesecakes EVER. They also have a lot of creative cheesecakes that you can choose from and sometimes it&#39;s hard to decided which one you wanna get.Their food is truly delicious too. My favorite meal from cheesecake is probably the pastas.

I like Cheesecake Factory. I usually HATE chain restaurants like Chili&#39;s, Black Angus, or stupid ass f*king Claim Jumper. But Cheesecake is not like those restaurants. It&#39;s a lot classier (in terms of menu, service, and decor), and the food is actually good.<br><br>Oh but I don&#39;t like their cheesecake. Tried a bunch of different flavors, but meh. Their cheesecakes are too creamy and not cheesy enough. I like my cheesecakes a little crumbly (think cheesy crumbly) and light, but rich. I don&#39;t want no soft ass, overly creamy cheesecake. <br><br>My favorite dish is probably the cajun jambalaya pasta. I loooove cajun seasoning, and this pasta has got it down right. It&#39;s a little spicy, flavorful, and packed up with plump shrimps and tender chicken. Actually, Cheesecake Factory has really good pastas. I&#39;ve tried a bunch, including the angel hair pasta, da vinci something, and a few other ones (can&#39;t remember the names), and haven&#39;t ran into a bad pasta dish yet.<br><br>I also liked the &#34;chicken littles&#34; dish, which I think is basically just chicken tenders? The fried mac and cheese is always a winner (what diet, right?). Also tried a couple salads and they were good.<br><br>Overall, it&#39;s not the most gourmet food, but definitely consistent and a bit above average. Except their cheesecakes. They blow.

Depending on the day you come, your server, and where you sit, this place is a hit or miss! I come to this location at least four times a month because I live and work across the street. <br><br>Suggestions: Come on a week day and do not sit outside! Sitting outside is basically asking to be ignored by the servers and weekends are so hectic you won&#39;t even be able to ask for more butter for your bread!<br><br>Nonetheless, the food is decent, but the lunch specials are what makes it worth coming! There is also a new addition to the menu called &#34;superfoods&#34; which is great for vegans and vegetarians like myself!<br><br>I recommend the falafel salad (extra dressing on the side since kale is a little bitter), french country salad, herb chicken, and da vinci pasta. They recently redid their herb chicken so it&#39;s a little crispier which I like and the da vinci pasta I always ask for bowtie pasta since I think it tastes better!<br><br>Careful with the cheesecakes because the chocolate ones are EXTREMELY sweet! Definitely share!

I&#39;ve been coming here since they opened at the Santa Anita Mall and let me just say, they never seem to disappoint. Maybe it&#39;s because I have awesome servers who make the experience great or maybe it&#39;s the large portions of food every time I&#39;m here! My mom and I don&#39;t usually go out to eat together a lot but when we do, we somehow always end up at cheesecake factory! <br><br>We went on a Saturday Night around 8:45PM thinking there&#39;s not going to be a lot of people since it was late but were we wrong! We waited about 20 minutes for our table because it was so packed! When we got seated, my favorite part comes out. THE BREAD. so good &amp; for some reason my mom thinks they give the best butter in the world. I don&#39;t know, that&#39;s her opinion. All Butter tastes the same to me. <br><br>We ordered off the Skinnylicious menu. My mom got the lemon-garlic shrimp with angel hair pasta which in my opinion looked amazing but for the price is was at, I think the portions were on the smaller side. I guess it makes sense though since every entree on the Skinnylicious menu is supposed to be under 590 calories. I got the chicken pasta from the same menu and mine I think was more worth it. Yes, 590 calories worth of delicious tomato sauce &amp; a little pesto rigatoni with chicken bits. I could only eat half before I got way too full. <br><br>Nice compliment to my meal though is their strawberry lemonade. YUM! <br><br>Too bad we were too full to get cheesecake afterwards though ): definitely getting it next time though!

This place it&#39;s become all about getting you in and out!! Paid about $14.00 for two oily eggs a toast and burnt greasy potatoes!! Overrated! Service is horrible!! You are lucky if you get a nice caring waitress or waiter.  They are all frustrated! It&#39;s a Mac house in here!!

It&#39;s always packed here during the weekend. Service is decent as your server will come back to check up on you. They will serve you additional bread upon request. The food served will be in small portions but the delicious cakes will fill you up. I&#39;d recommend the Red Velvet.

For some inexplicable reason, Cheescake Factory has always done it right...I mean the interior is mismatched and randomly themed - there&#39;s an Egyptian pharaohs face sculptures and garden wallpaper for goodness&#39; sake - it just doesn&#39;t make sense. Anyways, ordered onion strings, chicken fingers, cajun shrimp pasta, habachi steak, and meatloaf. Needless to say, portions were huge, and of course we were already half-full off of the addictive wheat bread they serve at the beginning so prepared to be full and have leftovers. Food was good, service was good, heck the water was good. I don&#39;t even know why I&#39;m writing a review. I&#39;m pretty sure anybody who uses Yelp has been to Cheescake Factory before. You already formed your opinions and you know it&#39;s good or at least not bad. Enjoy your birthday or whatever you&#39;re celebrating.

Worst service I have experienced. I when with my family and asked for a party of 15. I was told it would be an 1 1/2 to 2hr. When the two hour mark past. I asked about my table they said I had to wait for a party to leave. That party was still eating and celebrating. I believe is unacceptable to rush other people eating and having a good time. I also believe that the staff had enough time to make arrangements for my party. When I spoke to the manager her excuse was &#34;that&#39;s how our system is&#34; not an apology or try to make different accommodations. I waited 30 more minutes and the table was still not ready. I had to leave because all the kids where very hungry. Also I was not the only one asking to speak to the manager. It happened an hour ago

Overall excellent first experience dining at The Cheesecake Factory tonight. Dim lighting and high ceilings was lovely. Loved the cheesecake with ice cream a la mode and enjoyed ordering off the skinnylicious menu and I ordered chicken tacos with veggies on the side and strawberry lemonade found it a bit too sweet added some of my water and was alright and still was fun to try some of my sister&#39;s chicken Fettuccine (; I hope to come back soon (-:
I fell in love with cheese cake <br>I love going to dis restaurant <br>Neat &amp; clean<br>Satisfied with food, service. <br>Loved it.

We always come here for lunch or dinner, but this time we came for Sunday Brunch.  I insisted on coming here instead of IHOP.  I&#39;m so glad I did. We were seated right away at 10 am.  I had the Fried Chicken and Waffle Benedict.  It was delicious!  I had to share the other half with my husband or I would have been stuffed.  The dish came with yummy fried potatoes.  Everyone was eating them off my plate.  The kids had their pancakes, which they enjoyed.  My husband had the brunch combo.  He said &#34;it was better then average.&#34;  Our waitress was attentive and friendly.  We enjoyed our Sunday brunch here and will definitely come back for brunch again soon.

Located in the Santa Anita Westfield Mall, outside between Benihana and Woodranch.<br><br>Chicken Madiera ($17.95)<br>That&#39;s ALL you need to know when you come to Cheesecake Factory. EVERY time I order it, the waiter (whoever it is) gets so excited! It is to DIE for. It comes with 2 pieces of chicken breast, topped with CHEESE, mushroom, and some asparagus. As if that weren&#39;t enough; it also comes with a huge side of mashed potatoes. There is NEVER a need for to-go boxes, as I demolish this dish every. single. time.<br><br>Chicken Lettuce Wrap Taco ($6.95)<br>This is on the healthy menu. It was actually surprisingly not-bad. I just automatically assume everything on that menu is going to be gross, but this was pretty good. Probably wouldn&#39;t get it personally, but didn&#39;t mind having a bite or two.<br><br>SkinnyLiscous Grilled Artichoke ($6.95)<br>Okay, so this was NOT ordered by me. I had one bite, and I was done. This is way too SkinnyLiscous for me. It literally is an entire artichoke heart that&#39;s grilled with a side of aioli. PASS.

I was really excited to come here for my birthday and then we wait over half an hour to get seated. We finally get seated and they take forever to get our drinks and order and we wait AN HOUR for our food. We get our food I ordered the burger well done and it&#39;s red inside then my boneless wings weren&#39;t boneless ! What the heck I waited an hour for disappointment and on my birthday.

Very disappointed with their service today . We got here at five pm, they told us that we have to wait to have at least 15 people to be seated. We got 15 people around 5:30. The front desk lady keeps telling us that they are putting tables together for our group . We waited &amp; waited .... Until 6:23, the customer who was eating at the other table finally left &amp; they did &#34; put the table together&#34; for our group after an hour waiting. <br>If they are waiting for the other customers to leave , at least should be upfront with us. Not keeps saying putting tables together.

I don&#39;t recommend this place for to go orders, they take forever. The funny thing is that they always appear to be over staffed with about 5 employees waiting to greet you,  which never do by the way. And the manager, some guy in a blue shirt walks around avoiding everybody. It&#39;s sad to see as a consumer and a business man.

It was a toss up between Cheesecake Factory or Woodranch.  Figured I&#39;d take my chances and see how long the wait would be for a party of 2.  It wasn&#39;t that busy for a Sunday so we were able to get seats pretty fast.  One of the plates was so dirty I don&#39;t know how it was placed on our table in the first place.  Upon request our server got us a clean one.  We both ordered and just to make sure there isn&#39;t confusion I always try to point on the menu what I&#39;m ordering.  Unfortunately, after an unusually long wait I&#39;m brought the incorrect order.  At this point my wife&#39;s food is cold as she&#39;s been waiting for mine to come out and we&#39;ve been here for almost an hour.  Finally with my wife&#39;s salmon ice cold, my correct order comes out.  I ask for the server to just take it off my bill so I can pay and leave.  The manager comes out to tell me that I can still have my order even though it&#39;s been taken off the bill.  I decline and just pay for my wife&#39;s frozen salmon.  I think next time I&#39;m just going to go to the West Covina mall and eat at Lucille&#39;s or Lazy Dog.  It&#39;s pretty ridiculous to wait more than an hour just to get your correct order, while the person your with politely waits as their food gets cold.

Came here to celebrate a birthday (usually you won&#39;t find me stepping into a Cheesecake Factory on my own). <br><br>Service: Guy was nice however cannot be found. We were done with our meal and we sat waiting for the guy to appear.<br><br>Food: I got the Shrimp Angel Hair Pasta. DO NOT get this. This dish literally had no marinara in it. And the pasta had been sitting in that bowl for awhile now. When I took my fork to it, the entire pasta came up in one piece.. It was so dried! And even after the waiter got me a bowl of marinara, the pasta was barely passable..<br><br>Don&#39;t be fooled by the long wait. Mediocre/subpar food is all that is in store for you!

Just to let you know that they don&#39;t allow dogs on the patio unless they are certifed Service Dogs. I brought my certified Therapy Dog and was told they would make an exception this one time but that he was not allowed back.<br>I ordered their $27.95 Ribeye steak and a plain hamburger patty for my dog. I was asked how I wanted both items cooked. I had requested that both cooked medium.<br>The wait time was not bad. Once the brought my order I was suprised at the siza of the steak. It was small and thin. The hamburger patty was thicker than the steak. (See photo-steak on left of photo). I cut into the steak and it was cooked well done instead of medium. <br>The steak had no flavor and was dry. <br>Service was good and our waitress was great. She is the reason I gave 2 stars instead of one. <br>I got the bill and they charge $5.95 for a single hamburger patty.<br>You are better off going next door to Wood Ranch Grill.

This service that they provide is amazing, not only to us but all customers coming in around us as well. All waiters and waitress have big smiles on their face and try to make their customers feel as comfortable as possible, this male waiter was trying his best for another man to hear the Super Bowl game tv louder. I&#39;m not sure if he did but he kept him updated that he&#39;s figuring out a way to. My waitress was extremely nice to us and made my mood rise up, I do always come here and everyone always makes me remember why every time. <br><br>I recommend that you come to this Cheesecake Factory because they&#39;re extremely quick to seat you and have amazing customer service, besides the fact that their food and drinks are mind blowing! Definitely going to come back again soon!

This place was the go-to place for birthday dinners when I was in high school. It satisfies everyone&#39;s food cravings and the lighting makes the environment very intimate. I absolutely love their breads. The sweet brown whole wheat  bread is my absolute favorite. It&#39;s not too hard and crispy so it feels great against your palate, unlike the sourdough one they give you. I always end up asking for at least two more baskets of the brown bread. <br><br>Whenever I go here, I usually order the same thing, which is the Spicy Chicken Chipote Pasta. If you like creamy sauces with a kick of spiciness, this dish is for you! It goes extremely well with the parmasean that they grate in front of you. If you are in the mood for something to drink besides water, the strawberry lemonade tastes great too! <br><br>Cheesecake factory will always be a favorite restaurant of mine. The location of this place makes it even better.

You can&#39;t go wrong with Cheesecake Factory. One thing I really love about this location is that they are super accommodating about strollers. <br><br>Why the 3 stars? Because our server SUCKED... Only came by to get our order, once our food got there he asked how was our food... Ok, we haven&#39;t even tried it yet... And to give us our check... Needless to say... Didn&#39;t get a tip...

I came around 6:00 pm - 30th of July in Arcadia to try some of their cheesecakes.<br>While waiting for my name to be called, I checked their cheesecakes on the counter &amp; noticed this gentleman with a black shirt and tie on the corner on the counter helping with the cheesecake orders. He used his bare fingers to place the cookie on top of the cheese cakes orders, My daughter noticed him too , I observed him doing it  4 times with few minutes interval and during that time he dropped a receipt on the floor  then picked it up with his hand, then he scooped with his two hands ( like a shovel ) the cookies from a brown box to refill the cookie container. After that I just told my daughter to leave the place. I&#39;m being generous giving this place One Star rating .

Variety. Variety. Variety!<br><br>I love their outdoor seating, its perfect for a saturaday or sunday lunch. I ordered the miso salmon, it was good! Please order the AVOCADO eggrolls! Im not a fan of avocada in general... but their avocado eggrolls is worth every bite!<br><br>Their ribeye steak was mehhh... nothing special. I can taste the quality of the meat but the seasoning just average. The garlic pasta was actually pretty good. I love their cheesecake! There is so much to choose from.<br><br>Overall cheesecake factory always have that nice ambience feeling and there is so many different kind of food to choose from. Its definitly good for a big party. Also the bread and butter is to die for!

I have to say that the service here is always good, food has always been great every time as well. There are about 20min. waits on the weekends, but that&#39;s to expect at a busy mall restaurant. Cheesecakes are always delish as well. Happy hour food and drinks are the best. Huge (regular) sized portions for half price. Some areas of the restaurant have tables seated SO close, so that would be my only negative. But they have been cool with switching to a booth last minute every time.

I give three stars because it is a really crowded area. There was a long wait to get seated. This location is attached to a mall which makes it more busy. <br>I enjoy the macaroni cheese balls the most and the bread. The problem I find with cheesecake is that their menu is like a book! And some of their platters are meant for a bird! <br>They have really good mojitos here but lack on other mixed drinks.<br>The service was excellent at this location and our waiter was very friendly and efficient.

We eat here usually once a week and have our favorites like the chopped salad or vegan Cobb as well as the skinnylicious pastas.  My vegetarian guy loves the choices  this place offers.  As a weight watcher leader I love that they have an entire menu dedicated to healthy eating. Finally the service is terrific from the front desk to our servers and manager , Paul, who always seems to be nearby.<br>Keep up the good work !<br><br>Update....still eating here once a week...and they are so consistent that they never disappoint.  The staff has changed but always five star.  Last night Justin waited on us with a terrific attitude like we were all that mattered.<br>Front desk, Dominic, greeted me by name with a big smile.  What an asset he is!  Should be promoted to management.

Yes, we did we did we did!!  We did stop at the Cheesecake Factory after a full steak lunch at Front Runner at Santa Anita, and a bout of shoe shopping.  A girl has to keep her carbs in control.... by having more of them.<br><br>This Cheesecake Factory is SOOOOO overdone, Las Vegas style, but the servers and hostess are sooo friendly and the desserts are soooo delicious.<br><br>Lucy Y. and I were only going to have a taste of something, but while Lucy was in the bathroom I ordered a third dessert just to taste.<br><br>So we had red velvet cake cheesecake, pineapple upside down cheesecake and a hot fudge sundae.  Are you saying &#34;sugar coma&#34; ?  Yes, indeed, that&#39;s how we felt afterwards, even though we only ate a little of each.  I am not a red velvet cake fan but the cheesecake was just deee-licious.  Layers of red velvet cake AND cheesecake.  OMG.  <br><br>The pineapple upside down cake was the best of all three desserts.  Have always been a fan of regular pineapple upside down cake, and this one was a double treat.  Chewy juicy pineapple upside down cake with a thick layer of cheesecake and a graham cracker crust.  Oh my, just the best.<br><br>And how can you ruin a hot fudge sundae?  Well, I guess if you&#39;re Baskin Robbins 31 flavors you can ruin it by cutting down on the amount of chocolate you put in the fudge.  If you&#39;re the Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia, you make your own hot fudge!!!  It tasted like See&#39;s Candy melted.  I asked for a second little boatful but then we couldn&#39;t finish it all for fear of upchucking in a public place.<br><br>Their decaf iced coffee was FABULOUS!  Trying to cut down on caffeine and sometimes that means cutting down on flavor, but this was super!!<br><br>So we went to the track, shopped for shoes, and then finished with a sugar feast.  On the ride home, Lucy looked groggy and I was giddy.  Why, I may not have to eat until tomorrow morning....<br><br>What a fun filled day!!

I had eggs Benedict which was average, and the potatoes were way over fried.  I couldn&#39;t eat the potatoes.  I still gave a four star because hubby got a fantastic lemon roasted chicken.  I&#39;d try that next time.

Absolutely worst service I&#39;ve ever experienced! They served my child and never brought my salad out. I had to wait for over 30 minutes for a salad! They didn&#39;t even care! Good luck eating here!

If this is your first time at CF, read the menu before you go, like the night before if possible. They make pretty much everything. Hopefully this gives you enough time for you to figure out what you want. I have this problem in many places, but especially here.<br><br>Fortunately I have found my dish: the Spicy Chicken Chipotle Pasta (lunch portion is plenty for the average appetite). Not as spicy as the Jambalaya Pasta, and thus more enjoyable. <br><br>And by all means get a slice of cheesecake, whether you eat it in or take it home. I go for the Snickers Bar Chunks and Cheesecake. Chris&#39; Outrageous Cheesecake, a cross between cheesecake, a brownie, and a German chocolate cake, is my wife&#39;s pick.

I&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake Factory for years, usually for brunch or dinner. My server Amanda recommended the Renee lunch special for $10.95. Comes with fresh tossed salad, soup, and choice of turkey or chicken almond salad sandwich. Since it is Cheesecake, the portions were more than enough. Nice to see that the restaurant includes budget conscious lunch menu items.

I ordered the crab dip. I took a bite and it was cold. I told my waitress about that first bite, and she asked me if I WANTED it warm. Like it was ME who was wrong. I explained that yes, it should be warm. She took it away, brought it back after it surely spent 20 more seconds in the microwave, and never offered an apology. Certainly didn&#39;t deduct it from my bill. <br><br>I know that&#39;s just one plate of food at one Cheesecake Factory, but I see that whole anecdote as an example of the entire Cheesecake Factory system. Which is: A customer comes in wanting a shovel of food, and the staff is eager to put whatever they want on that shovel. Presentation isn&#39;t important. Not even taste. It&#39;s just calories go in, money goes out. This is why it is called Cheesecake FACTORY and not Cheesecake RESTAURANT. <br><br>If what you&#39;re looking for in a meal is high efficiency and minimal shame from the wait staff, CF is your jam. Otherwise, come on--you can do so much better.

First time here on a Sunday morning to celebrate my cousin&#39;s B&#39;Day It happens to be Father&#39;s Day today. They open at 10am and by 9:45, line is already 30 deep. Good thing we r first in line !<br>Food is good as expected.

Had lunch their yesterday and I had the club sandwich to go. I was encouraged to try the tortilla soup and I&#39;m so glad I did! It was really good!! Lots of veggies, rice and chicken. <br>I want to thank Ian who took my order and got it perfect since I always ask for extra sauces. Everything was in my bag including napkins and utensils...thank you. The staff is amazing! John is really nice too!!

Sat down during happy hour and 40 mins in no food. Pretty disappointed . Asked for refill on water 20 mins and counting . This is sad lol . Table next to us sat down same time as us and had the food came in less than 10 mins. I got so hungry I ate all the butter.

I can&#39;t believe I have never wrote a review for this place! I come here every week with friends and family. Service is always great. I tend to come here Monday through Thursday because there usually isn&#39;t a wait, Friday through Sunday though there is always a wait during dinner time, usually averages around 30 min or so. My usual favorites are; Appetizers: stuffed mushrooms, avocado egg rolls, and the spinach dip Entrees: chipotle chicken pasta, kale salad, Asian chicken salad, the miso salmon, chicken fettuccine with added Sun dried or oven tomatoes. My favorite cheesecakes are Ghirardelli chocolate, Oreo, banana cream and the Reese &#39;s peanut butter cup chocolate cheesecake.  The carrot cake is also yummy. I can&#39;t wait till my next visit.

Came here with my family for dinner, the food was good and so was the service. Now why the one star? Well I don&#39;t like bugs in my cheesecake! I ordered a cheesecake slice to go. Half way through the cheesecake I noticed a bug the size of a grain of rice crawling out of my cheesecake. Fml! I wish I would of noticed sooner who knows how many if any I ate. It&#39;s disappointing to know this location has these kind of standards where they allow bugs to breed in their food. Never going back again.

I celebrated my daughter&#39;s birthday here on 5/26/15. I came in at 6:00p.m with about 9 adults and 12 children. We were seated promptly (I did give them a heads up two hours before) and treated with the utmost kindness and respect, despite the fact that we had a group of very rambunctious children. Everyone - from hostess to waiters and bus people - was very accomodating and had a smile on their face. I had asked them to refrigerate my daughters birthday cake and they even brought the cake out with the candles lit and sung happy birthday! Everyone thoroughly enjoyed their dinners (except for some of the kids, for some reason, who didnt like the pizza). The best part? I was extremely pleased with the reasonable bill. Thank you, Cheesecake Factory for helping to make my daughter&#39;s birthday an awesome experience for her.

Love coming here for the awesome happy hour! 4pm to 4:45pm is the best time to come to beat the bar and dinner crowds. It&#39;s all about those Buffalo blasts, sweet corn tamale cakes, fried cream cheese wontons, avocado egg rolls, and deep fried mac and cheese balls! Get a side salad for less guilt LOL! Each platter was 5.50 or less... What a steal! I do come here for dinner too, ( love their chicken and dumplings platter) just prefer happy hour. Will most definitely be back!

What happen to your Chinese Chicken Salad? Tasted like salad dressing was mixed with water and zero taste. Suggest management go to the small Nordstrom restaurant in the mall and the there Chinese  Chicken Salad. Waaaay tastier....5 stars for waitress in bar area...

Can never blame the food....seems to always be on par or above! What made me downgrade tonite is the host! Standing at the check-in and just being ignored for 45 seconds as if we weren&#39;t visible was just rude! <br><br>With about 4 peeps working the check-in, the host could have acknowledged us and ask us to wait a few more.....but that didn&#39;t happen! <br><br>It&#39;s about the front end.....if they don&#39;t take care of the customer.....don&#39;t matter how good the back end is!

I have high expectations from this restaurant but had a disappointing experience yesterday. One of my orders included breakfast potatoes. But they looked like they were left over from the day before. They were way overcooked with most of them too hard to eat. Made a complaint and they offered to make another batch. We declined. However, they brought out another one... and it looked exactly the same! They tried to justify that the breakfast potatoes always look like that. We go to Cheesecake Factory quite often and have had breakfast potatoes before. And they look nothing like these! <br><br>To me, the manager has no knowledge of food at this location and that is why the server doesn&#39;t either. There are 3 different things that could have been wrong: the oil is old, they were cooked too long, or cooked in the wrong equipment. I never knew breakfast potatoes were so deeply fried like these were.

I LOVE this cheesecake factory!!!!!<br>Everything is absolutely amazing, from the food to the service! <br>Kids menus have a great variety of choices. <br>the wait is usually no more then 30 min on a weekend. (at least when I&#39;ve gone)<br>Servers and hostess are always polite and helpful.

We are a house divided!  We went to the Cheesecake Factory for our anniversary - the  wife says +5 stars - I say 4.  While I thought the food was just ok, the cheesecake was excellent!  I had the Shepherds Pie and with wife had Chicken and Biscuits.  My Shepherds Pie could have used a little more gravy, but was ok.  The wife&#39;s chicken and biscuits was very good.  I had the Lemon Raspberry Cheesecake and the wife had Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Cheesecake.  A little less of the cookie dough would have been better - it was overpowering and very dense.

Been here a couple of times but never wrote a review. The first time I tried Cheesecake Factory was three years ago and I got a shrimp bistro pasta, it was sooo delicious! Two days later found out I devoured 2,000 calories in one setting. HOLY MOLY! Never getting it again<br>The last time I was here it was national cheesecake day for every customer a cheesecake is half off! My man and I got a dulce de leche and a white truffle raspberry cheesecake. Both were tooooo sweet so gonna try another flavor next time. <br>I&#39;ve also tried tiramisu cheesecake and by far it is my favorite. Service is generally good but it does do down hill in the night because of more and more people with bigger groups. I&#39;d come back again for their healthier options.

It&#39;s a chain, and it&#39;s ALWAYS very busy, which I think partly explains the bad reviews. We went on Sunday around 2:30 pm and it took us almost 15 minutes to find parking. Not their fault, but something you should consider before coming here. They don&#39;t take reservations and they told our party of 8 it&#39;s going to be 45 min wait, which ended up being around 15 min. Awesome! <br>I&#39;ve always had good service and great food here. The waiters don&#39;t check up on you often, but that&#39;s understandable for a restaurant this busy. For the most part our waitress did a great job refilling our waters and bread basket. <br>Some of my faves are: miso salmon, avocado egg rolls, shrimp and chicken gumbo, and chicken bellagio. Yeah, most items are a little overpriced but the portions are huge. The extensive menu makes them an easy option whenever we have a big group.

The service is a hit or miss but my kids love the food. Most of the time it&#39;s a miss. We frequent this location because it&#39;s convenient and affordable. The portions are huge. We always have leftovers. The last time we were there we found a worm inside of our artichoke after we&#39;ve eaten it half way. It scared my children because it&#39;s dark in the restaurant so they might have eaten a worm without knowing. We showed our waiter and she told her manager. The manager was a really nice guy who was apologetic. We were not upset because it was out of their control. We appreciated that he came over and apologized. Some of the restaurants nowadays does not give a crap. He took the artichoke off the bill and gave us a comp appetizer. Now only if their waiters were better they would have received five stars.
This is one of the best places Ive ever been. Good atmosphere, nice staff and most importantly perfectly tasting food of high quality!

My problem is I don&#39;t like change and always want to stick with what I know will taste good but seems like whatever I order here is always really good! Sometimes restaurants with huge menus can have mediocre food because there&#39;s just so much to choose from, but the Cheesecake Factory does a good job making sure all their food is top notch.<br><br>I&#39;m not much of a cheesecake fan, but here at Cheesecake Factory is pretty much the only place I eat cheesecake at. I don&#39;t like how they can get too rich and thick and overwhelming tasting but here their cheesecakes are delicious! I just stick with a simple strawberry cheesecake, plain cheesecake with some strawberries and syrup. Yum.<br><br>Tip, DO NOT SIT OUTSIDE. At least around nighttime. There are SOO many flies out there it&#39;s disgusting. I understand it&#39;s near the racetrack so maybe that&#39;s why. But honestly, there were about 50+ flies just sitting on the bar window. On the ground about 20+ just sitting there till someone walks by and they fly everywhere. I could care less about flies but when they start flying into your face and on your food, that bothers me. Cheesecake Factory should really invest in those scented bug off candles or some sort of repellant.

Of all the big chains, I think Cheesecake Factory gets the most venom directed toward it, but I&#39;m always a little unsure why.  For a family dining place, the menu is big, the bread is nice (hands off the squaw bread!  that&#39;s mine!) and the prices are fair.  Mrs. C and I sat down to a nice lunch, and decisions were made quickly.  Me: pizza + caesar salad lunch.  Her: lunch size pasta da vinci.  Wow was her dish good.  If you had the time to cook down Marsala wine, mushrooms and chicken, you could probably make it this good, but this is a very respectable dish.  The penne pasta even has little ridges to hold the sauce.  My pizza and salad are equally good.  I almost got the BBQ chicken, but I decided to get the everything pizza.<br><br>I&#39;ve seen some amazing servers at Cheesecake Factory.  Once I was with a group of 20, and the server didn&#39;t write anything down.  Not a thing.  And this person nailed everyone&#39;s entree.  Impressive.  Anyway, we sat in Tiffany&#39;s section and while we didn&#39;t have a large group to test her memory skills, I will say that I was in a position to observe her section fill up as the hostess kept seating tables, and she STILL managed to check on us every 8 or 10 mins.  Grabbed my iced tea without me even having to ask.  &#34;How&#39;s everything tasting so far?&#34;  &#34;Oh, you need a box?&#34;   Just very polite, attentive service all the way around.<br><br>I think this may anger some chain haters, but I actually look forward to eating here.  Take a piece of Kahula cocoa almond fudge cheesecake to go.  You only live once!  You may have to spend an extra hour at the workout club, but I&#39;m pretty sure it&#39;s worth it.

I can here on a Saturday with my father in for brunch. I ordered a Filet Mignon and my father ordered a Hibachi Steak. Our waitress was nice. However, our order took a long time and I asked for a medium-well, but the inside was not cooked thoroughly. The outside was grilled too much. I believe I did not get my money&#39;s worth.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory for family dinners, catching up with friends, dates and also holding annual cheesecake (semi)formal dinners with my loves but I never get tired of coming to this chain. This place has great food and good service. The servers tend to you and makes sure you&#39;re enjoying your brunch, lunch and dinner.<br><br>Recently, I came here with my girlfriend to catch up and updating me on her wedding plans for a nice day out for brunch. When we walk in, we were immediately welcomed and were seated in less than 5 minutes with outdoor seating due to the nice warm weather on December. My girlfriend, Brittany, ordered the lemon-ricotta pancakes with fresh strawberries with coffee and I ordered an eggs benedict with Canadian bacon, hollandaise sauce and hash browns with a glass of mimosa. Awesome brunch with my best friend. <br><br>Only thing I&#39;ll take away from this was that my girlfriend didn&#39;t much like her pancakes cause it wasn&#39;t lemony enough and knowing Sundays are family days, parking will be bad whether you self parked or chose to do valet, it&#39;s horrible parking no matter what. Other than that, great place to eat some delicious food. Everything on their menu is good, especially their baked salmon and spinach. One last thing, their complimentary breads are so yummy! :)

Another review about great customer service provided by our server name Lou. From the minute that we walked in and we were seated he was on top of his game from the service you provided to the food that he got tour table in the amount of times he checking on us. He asked us for food was if there was anything we needed and just his all-around customer service was top notch. If you guys come to this location I recommend that you ask for him and you will not be disappointed guaranteed. Thank you Lou for the customer service you provided today

Great food for a restaurant chain. Came on a Monday night and there was no wait. Our server was nice and attentive and our food came out at a reasonable pace. I ordered the Pasta Carbonara and it was very tasty. Only regret is that I didn&#39;t order dessert.
Slow service at lunchtime. I was disappointed because they drenched my tacos in too much sauce I could barely eat them. My waitress was sweet, but was disappointed in the overall service.

Soo... I was wondering why the food came out so fast wen I ordered for pick up. And it was cuz I ordered the chicken bellagio and it was missing literally half the ingredients (missing the arugula and prosciutto) and they packaged the chicken in with the pasta so wen I went to go eat it 10-15 min later the chicken got all soggy... thanks cheesecake... and I also got gipped on the crab cakes, like hell I know I get more than just 3 tiny lil patties.

Never had an issue with this location before and the food&#39;s great, what I don&#39;t appreciate is the long wait to get seated. We were promised a 35-45 minutes wait, but waited over an hour to be seated. We had asked twice how much longer we had to wait &amp; they would tell us we were next or they&#39;re setting up the table. They had offered to seat us outside right away, but what I don&#39;t understand is why that wasn&#39;t offered when we had first put our name down. Our waiter, Lee was great, but after speaking to the manager about the ridiculous wait, I will probably never come back.

Came here for Mother&#39;s Day and it was horrible. First of all we arrived at 3 and were seated at 6. Then I asked what kind of soups they had because it wasn&#39;t on the menu. Only to find out they only have one! What a disappointment. I ended up ordering the one soup they had which I believe was chicken artichoke with mushrooms and it was ok, I didn&#39;t even finish it. I then wished I never ate it. My boyfriend ordered the steak and was as well disappointed. Someone else order the chicken enchiladas and they said it tastes nothing like enchiladas but pure onions . I could have had something to eat from the food court in the mall and would have been happier with the food than at this place. Never again will I come here. Worst Mother&#39;s Day dinner .

The 2 stars is mainly based on the service. Came in today after walking the arboretum sat down and waited for a good 10min and no waiter in sight to offer us drinks or anything, after another minute or so we decided to get up and walk out when we approached the front we mentioned to the host about the waiting issue and how we were going to be leaving to where he took no initiative to even apologize nor try to sit us anywhere else or even being in a manager, his only response was &#34;OK&#34; seriously, no customer service skills whatsoever.

My son and I came for lunch here on a weekday. We were one of the first customers. I ordered chicken and vegetables with biscuits. When our food came. The chicken was cold, which was gross. For being one of the first customers our food should have been warm. I will never come again to this establishment. Very disappointing being a big chain restaurant. I have had better food from places that are more reasonable in price.
The service is quite good. We ate bread, 4 dishes of pasta, and spring rolls which are my favorite and the kids love too. Cheesecake is delicious, of course.

Stopped by to pick up a bite and dessert to go. Took 10 min for someone to take my order . Kale salad and a slice of Oreo cheesecake . How hard ????<br><br>40 min later , still waiting ....<br><br>I asked ... &amp; answer was: &#39; oh , what order ?&#39;<br><br>Wtf? Mind you... I&#39;ve been sitting in lobby All this time ! <br><br>I asked for the manager , when he came up.. I explained situation &amp; caught him checking out another customer who was bent over putting her kid in the stroller . I lost it, folks . <br><br>I flipped him off and walked away. As I walked away, I in passing told the mom ... &#39;The guy at the desk is stroking off while staring at your ass behind the desk .&#39;<br><br>The look she gave him was well worth my F up ordeal ! <br><br>If I want CF ... I&#39;d visit the one in old town ! Least they got their sh!t together .
Nice service (5/5) helpful staff/<br>Ambience (5/5)/<br>Food (4.5/5) best for cheesecake i am not sure about other menu...

I am not typically one to complain to management however today was an exception and a disappointment. We first were told it was going to be a 30-40 min wait for our party of 8. That was fine and we decided to sit down in the bar area and order a drink. Right after we put our order in with the waitress we were called that our table was ready. We immediately told the waitress and she said it wouldn&#39;t be a problem she would just send the drinks to our table. She walked up with us to the hostess table to find out what table we were going to be at so she could send the drinks there. Our entire party of 8 was up and ready to be seated since they called us, however the table wasn&#39;t ready and they were waiting for the table to be set up. Not sure why they called us as we could have been enjoying our drink? Anyhow we finally got seated in the same section in the bar we were already at with the same waitress we ordered our drinks from. First they were out of Coronas, okay no big deal. Then we put in our order for 8 and our menus were taken only to be told a few mins later that they were out of the steak we ordered AND the Lasagna. Umm okay... they ordered a different dish and my mother in law specifically asked the waitress gave them cook her steak medium. We get our meals for 7 and were told my daughters hamburger was given to another table and they had to remake hers. About 10 min later she finally got her meal. My mother in laws steak was over cooked and was well done and we told the waitress. The waitress was apologetic and said she would tell the manager. Typically a manager would come over and make sure to regain our business, but no manager came. I finally asked to speak to him/her and he came to our table. We told him our issues and he apologized and said they have different people in the kitchen and offered no more than that. As we were finishing our drinks and waiting for the boxes for our meals, a bus boy leans over our table without saying &#34;excuse me&#34; and picks up the 3 candles on our table because it was 10pm. Umm why couldn&#39;t this have waited until they cleared our table? 0 stars for the management and 1 star only because our waitress was dealing with the cards she was dealt by the failures of the entire team around her.

Great lunch today in Arcadia. Try the bang bang chicken and shrimp, not too spicy though. Our waiter Duncan was the best in this location. He&#39;s all over our visit with more ice tea, ice to go? Ask for Duncan&#39;s station--great meal, even better service!

Zero wait time at 11:20am!  Came in for lunch after shopping today ...sweet and friendly hostess. Excellent and professional waitress. Shepard&#39;s pie ($11-ish lunch) is hearty and good. Pork chop is normally really good but a little over cooked today.

For a chain restaurant, not a bad value and menu selection. The staff are always friendly and the food always comes out fast. My only critique is that they have poor timing. The appetizers and the entree come out too close together and my main dish always gets cold.

When I like something, I tend to go back over and over.  Cheesecake Factory has been one of those standby, good restaurants.  It can be fairly healthy depending on what you order.  <br><br>My latest discovery at Cheesecake Factory is the Turkey Burger!  I tried it for the first time the last time I ate at CF.  It was very good, so I had it again this visit.  It comes with french fries.  $10.95.<br><br>Service is normally excellent at Cheesecake Factory and this time was no exception.  Like I mentioned in a previous review, I like their sourdough with butter.  Yummy!<br><br>I like this location better than the one in Pasadena because the wait is normally shorter.  Our wait was about 10 minutes on a Saturday evening around 8pm.<br><br>Cheers!

It is one of my favorite places to eat at! From lunch to dinner. Flying gorilla is delicious, artichoke dip, fried macaroni, flat breads, pastas, brunch is all good thus far!!! And the cheesecake, well, I love cheesecake and it is very good here!!!
3 out of 3 times Ive been to this location, the service is terribly slow and the servers always blame it on the kitchen. Avoid this location if possible.
Love the happy hour but food quality has definitely decreased over the years. Seems cleanliness has as well. Two spoons on our table, not wrapped in a napkin, just open laid out. Yummay!
Delicious taste to salmon, lettuce wrap tacos and yummy bread and butter. The strawberry lemonade is so good. The service is great, the prices are ok.

Great food! But service is just the worst Emmalee work on being more attentive to your customers! We waited and waited we would ask for things and just never got! I had to settle for the service! We shouldn&#39;t have to since we are paying for service! I love the food but just not sure if visiting again! Maybe a different location

After my dining experience here last night.. I told myself never again!<br><br>The WAITING GAME: <br>Came here for a quick dinner with my momma and we had to wait about 30 minutes for our table. Once we were buzzed on our device, I just assumed that we would  be seated immediately right after .. WRONG. I went up to the hostess to return the device to her and then she said please line up to the right of the counter. It took another 5-10 minutes on top of the 30  to even get seated at our table. NOT A HAPPY CAMPER!<br><br>Service: <br>Horrible and nonexistent. At one point, another server even had to step in to help me box my food. <br><br>Ambiance: <br>I did not even remember this place being so loud. We were blessed by the presence of  a group of young men that were very rowdy and obnoxious! After they were seated, we just decided to ask for the check because they were that bad. <br>**Story time: The guys belched so loud, that my mom thought that it was coming from me and began to scold me to be more ladylike. Thanks mom -_-&#34;, but you have trained me well on my table manners!<br><br>Food: GROSS and OVERPRICED!<br><br>Steak Diane ($19.95): <br>The only thing I enjoyed on the plate was the mashed potatoes! The steak and sauce were both too salty. I would think that American restaurants would know how to cook their steak right.. WRONG! I ordered a medium rare and got medium! <br><br>BBQ chicken pizza ($12.95):<br>Pathetic. The pizza was drenched in sauce and had no signs of chicken on it! <br>For your information, I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and not lunchables!<br><br>Final Verdict: <br>NEVER COMING BACK!
Very bad service, the front staff was very lazy and skipped over us many times. Receptionist is a liar and will not own up to her mistakes.

I love Cheesecake Factory!  But this particular location has awful take out service. My husband and I came on a Friday evening and the line wasn&#39;t particularly long for take out before I went to use the restroom.  I came out from the restroom and the line didn&#39;t move at all.  Usually it takes us less than five minutes to order a slice of cheesecake to go.  I&#39;m not sure if they were understaffed, but there was a lot of people behind the counter.  After 15 minutes, we got our slice of red velvet cheesecake.  The cheesecake was superb.  Service was not.

My favorite dishes are the avocado eggrolls and the sweet corn tamale cakes. The avocado eggrolls come with 6 eggrolls with tangy and creamy fillings held together by crispy eggroll shells, and a sweet gingery sauce on the side, altogether a very refreshing dish. The sweet corn tamale cakes are sweet and thick, with diced avocados, fresh tomato salsa, and cream cheese on top. It&#39;s a hot dish so best to eat it right when it&#39;s served. Both dishes are appetizers. If you don&#39;t have a big stomach, those appetizers are perfect with a main entrée for two or three people. Servers are always polite and respectful.

The food here is good, however a bit overpriced considering other non-franchised options that offer better food quality. However, Cheesecake Factory offers a wide selection of items on their menu, making it a good restaurant to go to if you and your friends are having difficulties coming to an agreement on where to eat. <br><br>Besides the food, the service here is a hit or miss. From my most recent visit, the service was terrible. The hostess did not acknowledge us and took a while to get us seated on a weekday during the least busiest time of day. The servers here are chatty amongst themselves and often neglected us. They definitely need to implement procedural fairness into their service.

Here&#39;s the thing, if you order food to be picked up you should expect your order to be messed up in some way. This goes for the pasadena location as well. I&#39;ve ordered food 3 times from here in the past month and each time the order wasn&#39;t good. First order they didn&#39;t give me 3 of the 6 items I ordered. Second time the food was cold. And just now I got an incorrect dressing for my salad. I would give this review a 3 star but the food is very good so I&#39;ll give it a 4 star. I highly recommend getting all the staff to do some sort of training in terms of duplicating orders because there seems to be an issue with that.

We ordered breakfast &amp; It took 45 min. to receive food. My food was cold, but they definitely made up for it by making it again &amp; bringing it hot. It was delicious! Manager, David, was so kind &amp; generous--he comped my breakfast &amp; sent me home with a slice of Cheesecake. You can&#39;t get better customer service than that. Thanks to our server Ashley, who brought it to his attention.

Love it here, we came in with no reservations and the front check in desk seated us asap...AWESOME!!! Our server Jen was awesome, she catered to our every need. The best time to come to this Cheesecake Factory would be between 4pm - 5pm. Will come back here definitely when we&#39;re in town.

Original cheesecake-good. Smooth texture and gentle taste. <br>Red velvet cheesecake-perhaps shouldn&#39;t have ordered two cheesecakes in a row. This doesn&#39;t taste as good probably because I&#39;m getting very full after the first one.
My family always have a good time here. Recommendations: Dynamite Shrimp, HH Burger, Spinach Dip, Spaghetti with Meatballs and the Sweet Corn Tamales

We ate at Cheesecake Factory on a Saturday, and it was so busy that whenever we called our server, he always replied with &#34;Just a sec.&#34; Obviously, it was more than a sec or a minute. But that aside, I had the best eggplant parmesan! You get three massive slices of fried eggplant (coated with parmesan breadcrumbs) and topped with mozzarella, fontina, and marinara. They also serve it with pesto pasta, which was perfectly cooked and way better than what they serve at Olive Garden. The eggplant and pesto pasta combination was a winner. I ended my meal with a slice of Chocolate Tuxedo Cream™ Cheesecake--layers of their fudge cake, chocolate cheesecake, vanilla mascarpone mousse, and chocolate. It was the bomb, and I don&#39;t even remember the last time I said that cringe-worthy word.
Only good things to say about this location. Went out of  my comfort  zone and ordered the fish and chips and they were delicious. My kids loved it too. Their first time at CCF ...

The food never disappoints...but today we had one of he best waiters in the world. Nope! I am not exaggerating not one bit, our waiter Louis B. was the bomb. You will be super lucky if you come here to enjoy a great meal, some crazy loud ambiance, which I love, and a super friendly and fast waiter. A+ for Lou, as he calls himself!
