Came to celebrate my nephews birthday on a Saturday evening.  It was one of the hottest day of the year so far.  Seems like everyone took refuge at the mall. Parking lot was extremely full. Arrived at 5:30pm &amp; estimated wait time 30min. Not bad considering all the factors.  The interior was Mediterranean Vegas style decorated. They have a large menu selection. We had Davinci pasta, jambalaya, Chicken Madeira, kids cheese pizza, kids beef slider.  Everyone was pleased with their meal &amp; the adult even took home left overs.  We didn&#39;t have enough room for dessert. Our birthday boy got a birthday song from the staff and a cup of hot fudge ice cream. Our meal came to $97.  Not bad for good food but slow service. They just need more help on the weekends.

I&#39;ve been coming here for years and I never had a bad experience here. Food is always good and customer service is good. I love the cheesecakes! It never disappoints me! They have Happy Hour here from Monday to Friday at 4-6pm. It&#39;s cheap during happy hour and you can get a good amount of food for $25!

I try avoiding Cheesecake Factory as much as possible cause i&#39;m obsessed with the wheat bread + butter combination here. Carb overload! All the food weighs me down and will take me forever to work off but once in a while, it&#39;s nice to indulge here :) Every server I&#39;ve had here has always been attentive and friendly. Inside of the Santa Anita mall. Often is busy - especially on holidays! No reservations =(<br><br>LOVE THE HAPPY HOUR!! From 4pm-6pm. GREAT GREAT GREAT portion for many of the food dishes. There is a section of appetizers for only $5!!!! Other selections range up to $7-$8 depending on what you like. I&#39;ve tried a couple happy hour selections but my favorite stand at the tex-mex eggrolls. Drink specials are a hit as well too. Hard pink lemonade, mojito, well drinks - etc. are $5 and tap beer is $4! The fried mac n cheese was decent. Interesting combo with the marinara they had underneath. One of my favorite happy hour locations.<br><br>I&#39;ll be back .. soon!

I&#39;ve been coming to Cheesecake Factory for more years than I can imagine! During my high school years was when they opened (10+ years now) I never cared for their food because I never knew what to order. I always stuck with the same food. It wasn&#39;t only until recently I started trying out some new dishes like the Chicken Madeira, Pasta DiVinci (along with all the other flavorful pastas they have) , and the most appealing dish to me was their Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo. I&#39;ve never had gumbo before (I&#39;ve only heard about on TV shows) so I thought I&#39;d give it a try. And the minute I tasted a few bites I fell in love. Their Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo is extremely flavorful, so full of different spices all mixed together in a thick, soupy texture mixed with rice that gets your mouth watering with every bite you take. I&#39;ll definitely be coming back for more of that Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo for sure! However, it is on the little more spicy side, so if u can&#39;t handle mild spicy, I suggest u ask the server to make it less to non-spicy. Other than that, their Chicken and Shrimp Gumbo is extremely delicious! It&#39;s a must try!

Going to the cheescake factory is great but don&#39;t use them with Doordash delivery or you will miss out on half your dinner. We use doordash and normally get good food delivered with no issue but NOT TODAY. Half our order showed up and when we called the Arcadia, CA Cheesecake factory the young women who answered the phone said &#34;what do you want me to do?&#34; like we should not be compensated or have the reminder of our order sent out. When then asked for a manager and she just put on hold and left us there. So we called back and we transferred to the bakery.  SO DISAPPOINTED. It&#39;s expensive and to receive half you meal without the willingness to fix it not acceptable for such a large establishment. Will not order from here again. So Arcadia, CA Cheesecake Factory shame on you, half an order, cold food and no willingness to help or be respectful when we called to fix the problem.

Brought my grandma here for her birthday and she loved it. Let me start with the restroom, it was really clean and fancy. Everyone was very polite and friendly. We came during lunch time so it was empty. The food was great, except the mushroom soup. I&#39;m not a mushroom fan, so I did not eat mine. Our server was great. He convinced us on ordering dessert, and knew exactly how to describe/explain the questions we had regarding the food. Would I come here again, yes! I&#39;ve been to other Cheese Cake Factory&#39;s and haven&#39;t had good service like I did here.
My favorites are the Chinese chicken salad, the orange chicken and their glazed salmon plate
cheesecake is very good, great location, spacious mall parking, very good staff, great cakes. What more can you ask for?

I have been coming here for 10 years! They have the best pasta!!  The service was really good too either if you buy food to go or dine in. It gets pretty crowded in the weekend tho because it&#39;s located by the mall.

Hands down the best Orange Chicken ever. Lightly battered white meat chicken pieces, mostly large with a light delicate sauce of orange with thin slices of orange peel. The vegetables with the sauce that it comes with are so good. I wish I could make vegetables like that at home. I wonder what sauce it is. I know I can definitely taste hints of sesame oil. The wait here is like any other Cheesecake Factory on peak hours &amp; days. Their Chicken Bellagio is also one of my Ultimate favorites. The chicken is lightly breaded &amp; tender. Topped with Prosciutto, parmesan &amp; butter leafy Arugula. It comes with this delicious basil pesto spaghetti. Their mixed drinks are pretty well made. I prefer wine but their wine selection is mostly California wines which I hate.  Try their Dulce De Leche Cheesecake it&#39;s pretty sinful.

I love cheesecake factory I ain&#39;t going to lie lets get that out the way.... Now what went down this past weekend was bad,horrible and sucked donkey balls.<br><br>all I wanted was a booth for the misses and I who were both looking forward to breakfast but it turned into a nightmare that the GREETER took care of for me.10 minute wait is what he said 25 minutes later nothing got worked out till I asked for the manager because the GREETER has the worst attitude on planet earth,The GREETER looked like he didn&#39;t even I want to be there the by way his uniform was on.<br><br>I got the manager  who promised the world all because her employees were running late I do understand people run late but let me know that way I can say put me in a table and lets get my breakfast going. Manager walks me to my booth and says &#34;ILL BE RIGHT BACK WITH YOUR WARM BREAD&#34;she never came back and neither did the bread,We finally order our drinks arnold palmer and an oj TA DAAAAA when he comes back with the drinks my oj is missing because the machine is broken.Now is it me or did they just say lets just make his experience even worse maybe he&#39;ll leave because that&#39;s what I did.From the GREETER to the MANAGER bad customer care from jump street. Manager doesn&#39;t care if I stay or not she gets paid and the greeter he can give two @#$%^ about me staying or leaving but its not about them two its about the waiter who loses  out on his tip that he works for but the manager and the greeter can care less about his tips.
Good Cheesecake Factory. Great fast service. Cheesecake is delicious. Will come here for overpriced pasta again lol.

We had received a gift card for the Cheesecake Factory so we decided to check it out last Friday. We had never been to this location before.<br><br>As we entered we were greeted and seated right away. I liked the decor here and it&#39;s very open and spacious inside. There is also a patio for those who would prefer to eat outdoors.<br><br>Our server was very nice, she even came back to our table after she was off work to check to see how we liked our food.<br><br>As has been previously mentioned in other reviews, the menu here is enormous!<br>We finally decided on the Everything Pizza , the mushroom burger, and the Cuban sandwich. All of the entrees came with a salad. The salad that came with the pizza was huge! Needless to say we ended up taking most of it boxed home with us.<br>And of course, we did order cheesecake for dessert but had to get it to go, as our tummies were too full by the time dessert came around.

Cheesecake Factory has the best salads ever! I really enjoyed their Barbecue Chicken Salad, everything paired perfectly with each other. The guac and chips were delicious but not spicy enough for my taste. Our server, Sean was excellent, kind, and fast to bring everything out. Thank you for your awesome service. Also, the carrot cheesecake is to die for.
This place never disappoints but is also loaded with calories. I just found out my favorite pasta has over 3000 calories :( but otherwise the food is really good and they have a giant variety.

The service was great, food was solid. Went there on an afternoon and there was no wait. The waiter constantly asked if we wanted more bread. The price is a little bit expensive but it was worth the quality.
You can never go wrong at this place.  They have decent prices and decent quantity.  Their Hawaiian Salad is awesome.  The crispy wonton chips in the salad made is super crunchy.

I&#39;ve been to this Cheesecake Factory a few times, and I&#39;ve always had to wait in order to be seated. It&#39;s usually crowded on the weekends, especially during dinner time and if you have a pretty big party, it&#39;s wise to make a reservation. <br><br>I really like the Miso Salmon. My friends recommended it to me, and it tastes every bit as good as the name. The fish is not only tender, but soft to a point that it basically melts in your mouth. The rice ... is not as comparable. Since I eat rice almost every night, I wished the rice was softer and less grainy. The sauce was really nice and added a nice touch to the fish. <br><br>I&#39;ve also ordered the Grilled Chicken and Avocado Club twice, and it&#39;s good. Nothing too special, but I have been told that I should order something more &#34;upscale&#34; if I&#39;m going to eat here. Which is the reason I ordered the Miso Salmon the next time I came. <br><br>I&#39;ve also tried their Chicken Alfredo which was good and creamy. <br><br>As for the cheesecakes, yes they are super delicious but a bit on the expensive side. When they have their deal of &#34;half off a slice of cheesecake when dining in&#34; ... that&#39;s the only time I would order it. <br><br>Overall, it&#39;s an okay restaurant. The food is average, but the prices are a bit on the more expensive side. It&#39;s a bit too dim for my liking, and sometimes the waiters and waitresses seem to be so tired or too caught up chit-chatting with each other than wanting to help their tables. And if you go with a big group ... just don&#39;t. They weren&#39;t willing to split the checks or were really annoyed at how long we took to gather up the money. Going with a small group is a lot better and the waiters are usually nicer.

There are really a few times that one could complain about the service at such established restaurant. <br>It was busy, so we sat at the&#34; full service bar&#34;, once we ordered the bar tender was becoming and did numerous times apologize. 40 minutes after we ordered, the bar tender was letting me know that the manager was called, 10 minutes later the manager showed up, all he did was apologize, comp or drinks, and we left to go next door. I mean we were hungry you know? Next door we eating 15 minutes after we ordered our food. Lousy service, nothing really done about it in return. Hey this is the cheese cake factory, what&#39;s up?

They always mess up on our order in this branch  -_- and we come to Cheesecake Factory a lot! They messed up on firecracker salmon appetizer serving us a small plate. Which we payed good money for. And they skim us off. They waitress apparently said they changed their menus every 6 months but we said we went to the Cheesecake Factory 2 months ago in Pasadena and it was completely fine. Then in the beginning they gave us two sourdough breads instead of one brown one and one sourdough one. Then after they knew they were accountable for our Firecracker salmon appetizer they gave us a new batch which was good. But after that they served me Carbonara pasta without the sauce and I was like ok I&#39;m done. I&#39;m not gonna keep complaining cause this is just too much. The whole experience sucked and it New Year&#39;s Eve. And the funny thing about the restaurant is it wasn&#39;t even pack. We only waited 9 minutes. Not coming back here again.

Let me say service was quick and fast! Considering it was Sunday (super bowl). We were able to get a table less then 5 mins. We got our food pretty fast. And it was ok. However the waitress was very inattentive. She kept passing by more to look if we were done to clear the table. I felt like they were trying to rush us out. She wasn&#39;t very friendly and wouldn&#39;t come around much to ask if we needed anything or if we wanted more water or drinks. I&#39;ve gone to other smaller chain restaurants and was catered to more then here. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s all waitresses who are like this or just this particular girl. I left a tip regardless but I wish they would train all waitresses to attend their tables more. I&#39;ll be back because I did enjoy the environment.

We brought a large group (12 people) with us to Happy Hour  (4-6pm) prior to my eldest son&#39;s graduation.  It was a great place to begin the celebration.  The appetizers and drinks were amazing.  Many choices to choose from and everyone was happy.  Our waiter could not have been more accomodating and pleasant.  I would highly recommend their Happy Hour!

The two stars are for the food and should give negative for the service. Very rude people and have no words for Manager..we were waited 40 mins for appetizers and then 1 hr 10 mins for the entrees to come ..our waiter is a no show all the time and asked at least 4 other to inform him..no luck..finally the manager came and we explained situation..he simply said..let me check and get back..but now his turn for no show..we went with a family for a celebration and our evening is spoiled here..in total the service is worse..!!

Been waiting over 45mins. Told 30 mins. Asked for a table, gave us a booth. Wanted a table took us outside, and no tables available. Terrible service!!!!! Rude workers.  Seems like we are the only Mexicans here, can feel the catering to Asians and Caucasian.

Pretty good service and environment here. Had to take out one star because I remember used to get 6 pcs of shrimps for my &#34;shrimps with angel hair&#34;. I checked with the waiter, and at the beginning he said 6 pcs too, but he then went in to check with the chef and came back to tell me it&#39;s suppose to be only 5 shrimps instead of 6. I always count my shrimps when I order this dish, but not sure if this location only serve 5 pcs of shrimps for this dish...???

My family and I will never return to The Cheesecake Factory.  We arrived around 8pm on Thursday night party of 5 20 to 25 min wait. No problem. They gave me a pager and said it would let us know when our table was ready. We wait at the bar. 40 min later I hear the calling out party names. So I ask. Have you called my party (yes) ok my pager didn&#39;t go off &#34; oh well we don&#39;t always use the pager&#34;. Ok why did you give it to me? ( crickets) they seat us and remove 2 of the five menus that were on the table leaving us with 3 for a party of 5. 10 min later the server arrives she&#39;s nice you can tell she&#39;s overwhelmed (understaffed) drinks come in a timely manner. Food order took 45 min salad came out last. All plates were extremely hot from sitting under a heat lamp. Mashed potatoes had a crust on them and my medium steak was like leather. Again our server did her best I thought. This was the second such experience here. I&#39;m done. Poorly run.

Worst experience ever.  To the point where I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll go to another cheesecake factory anywhere.  We walk in, I smile and greet the young hostess girls with a warm and cheery, &#39;hello.&#39;  As that is my normal disposition.  These two grungy looking kids literally just stare at me like I&#39;m a damn alien.  Then when they go to seat my friend and I, still without any acknowledgement whatsoever, they put is right next to, two of the server stations where they type in their tickets and directly in line with the kitchen, where there is high traffic.  Needless to say, I didn&#39;t come out to eat, to stare at people&#39;s behinds and watch food come in and out.  I kindly ask the very portly girl, &#39;do you have any other seating not by the kitchen.&#39;  She looks at me like I requested a fucking private jet...and then proceeds, loudly, to gesture wildly, asking &#39;well where would you like to sit?&#39;  I respond, &#39;how about anywhere not near asses, the kitchen, or the restroom?&#39;  My God.  smh.  And the place was empty!  She then takes us to a table and loudly/rudely asks, &#39;is THIS going to be OK for you?&#39;  <br><br>The young brown skinned kid who was our initial waiter, seemed completely slow...all of the young kids working there look dirty, unkempt and quite honestly disgusting.  They&#39;re either grossly overweight, disheveled, dirty nails, and generally people I would not want near my food, let alone carrying it.   <br><br>The young white kid who ended up being our server, who looks like the father from American Pie, ended up being &#39;ok.&#39;  Nice enough kid.  Until, he referred to my friend and I (who are both brown skinned) as COLORED.  WHAT THE FUCKKKKKKK.  I felt like we had fallen into a damn time warp and gone back to the 1950&#39;s.  <br><br>Food was mediocre.  Service was appalling.  My friend who is in her mid 40&#39;s told me I should ask to speak to the manager, b/c everything was so terrible.  I didn&#39;t.  And still left a 20% tip!  smh.  In hindsight I should have asked for a manager and called out every single one of those snot nosed, dirty kids with the bad attitudes.  <br><br>They really take the respectability of the restaurant to a McDonalds  level.  Cheesecake isn&#39;t 5 star by any means, and I don&#39;t even eat fast food, but patronizing this establishment made me feel like I would have ran the risk and eaten Taco Bell instead.  <br><br>If any employees read this or management.  You guys are terrible.  And will probably not amount to much in life beyond &#39;hostess&#39; or waiter (and not the good kind in the nice establishments) :/ why? B/c you lack focus, respect, cleanliness, and customer service orientation.  You also lack basic communication skills, service skills and have ZERO personalities.  You all have a hard reality set in front of you when you get from out of mom and dad&#39;s house and thrust into the real world.

Cynthia&#39;s customer service was so bad i wish i could take 10% off my bill and pay it with her tips.. we been here for almost an hour and a half and were only able to order an appetizer because she was so slow and she didn&#39;t come and check on us we had to ask all the servers around us for things. She needs more training.

I am literally sitting at the curbside waiting for my food that I ordered online 3 hours ago for pick up at a later time. I arrived a few minutes late so you think that it&#39;s to their benefit but nope, still waiting with the sun beating on me. I ordered at 2 pm for pickup at 5:15 waited till 5:45. Did not do anything to make up for this. Oh well as long as they&#39;re not inconvenienced by a paying customer like me everything else is just dandy. Give me a break. Tons of other restaurants around. There&#39;s a reason why people choose tge curbside pickup. Maybe they didn&#39;t get the memo. BTW, there&#39;s no curbside pickup signage for this location which is Santa Anita Mall.  There is a 15min parking space right in front of restaurant right next to valet parking,fyi.

We went there for the first time after taking the kids to the Jumpin place next door. Our meal was good, but the service at the time was extremely slow. We had to ask random people for help, and instead of helping us, they would find our waiter. Don&#39;t get me wrong... I get it, we&#39;re not your table. I ordered a meal to go and we paid our bill and waited at the table. That&#39;s when we saw it! A WORM/CATERPILLAR thing climbing out of the broccoli stem. My son hates cooked vegetables so we ordered his broccoli raw. His food even came out last because the said they had to cut his fresh. The manager was super nice about it and comped our meal. He asked that we give them a second chance and return and a few weeks later we did. He assured me that he had sent the incident to corporate but that the isolated worm incident was a risk with any raw vegetables... except for salad which was triple washed. Personally, I think they should have the same washing standards all around, but that&#39;s just me. He said to ask for him, and I did. He said he would come check in us and make sure the experience was better, but I never saw him again after being seated. The food was the average Cheesecake standard, nothing super special and the waiter was much more attentive this time.<br><br>I give them 2 stars for the food and the improved staff the second time around, but when a manager invites you back and promises to make sure you had a good experience, but never returns... well that just solidified our not returning to this location. I think we prefer the Americana or the Spectrum locations... even Canoga Park was better than what we&#39;ve experienced here.

I used to love this place, it was so disappointing!! Burnt to a rock pizza, hard pasta with no sauce &amp; when the manager Amber Nicoles came to speak to my family she called the pizza rustic &amp; charged us for 2 after our waiter order another since the first one was hard as a rock! This was after we waited 45mins to eat! Never again! I won&#39;t ever be going back!

the wait for a table was the worst experience. Our pager went off meaning it was our turn to be seated. They don&#39;t sit you right away you just wait a side with other parties who pagers went off. We notice that the other parties got seated and not us. My name never got call and yet they call out other names who seem to not be there?! It was a crowded but yet they A group of host in front but they seem to not communicate and skip us. We waited longer than others and keep in mind it was hot! Finally, we got our table. Our server STEPHEN S. Made us happy. As busy as it was he still pass by took our order well carrying other dishes. Got all orders correct and on time. The food was good and the service at the table was excellent. I suggest not going on a crowded night because they can&#39;t keep track of pagers and name.
They set the silverware straight onto the table..uncovered and exposed. Really disgusting. My wheat toast was so burnt, I couldn&#39;t even bite into it.

Why does it get 3 stars if most people like this place? Price? <br><br>Well, this is the closest to me and I love it! I hate the wait area though, but at least it is bigger than Pasadena where even if  cold you have to wait outside since the seating inside is so limited and everyone hovers by the cake display.  This one at least is more spacious and you can eve bring stroller in..that is how much space there is. <br><br>For cheesecake factory: (1) Why not make wait area bigger since cake displays hog up a good amount of space and (2) why don&#39;t you have automatic / revolving doors? Your doors are TOO heavy!! <br><br>Ok, enough complaining.  Price I don&#39;t mind since really it is a 2 portion food you are ordering. I think they are use to boxing things up for you.  The cocktails are good. Mojitos awesome, rasberry martini strong (ask for top shelf if u want stronger), but the flying gorilla, oh my, that is a meal in itself! I would stay away from that or you will need 2 boxes to go.  The regular coffee not good at all. Not strong for price. Specialty coffee like lattes served in huge glass instead of cup. Not bad :D The hot chocolate is heaven!!<br><br>Meals i love Bang Bang Chicken and Jamaican Black Pepper Shrimp (waiter forgot my plaintains and came back with a huge bowl).  Pastas are usually safe and good. I cannot write too much since most food don&#39;t stick out as bad. Personally, though, I think their Small Plates and Snacks Menu is a rip off. The cost is high considering the small bites they give. Go for the huge one! Get the full appetizer and take them home too. <br><br>For kids, it is wonderful since they give them warm plate of bread and sliced bananas. Thanks!<br><br>I just had 2 bad experience here where we were seated and when we had to leave unexpectedly after we placed order, the waiter was so mad at boxing up our items since he thought we will not tip him. That attitude served him a fat bagel from us.  The other one was new and was so rude. Did not box our items and worse off, I had no idea how to use their new box and after he smirked at me, he snapped the lid and stared me down like I am stupid as he said, &#34;there u go. easy as that.&#34; What a f. jerk my husband and I said.  His tip suffered too.  <br><br>This joint has great and friendly servers overall besides these 2 that are probably not there anymore.  I have no problem with wait time since I go off hours. Love their curb side service although I think they need a better system in locating your car. I had to roll window down in rain and flag her down since she could not see where my car was...in front of her.

This place has super bad customer service.. from the first time u walk in the receptionist is hella rude and for a party of 10 we waited over 2 hours to get seated.... unless your Asian u will wait along time to get a seat in this restraunt....

Since cheesecakes were 50% off on National Cheesecake Day, I decide to treat the family for lunch. To start we had the Fried Calamari &amp; Chinese Chicken Salad.  Both perfectly prepared like always. Calamari batter was light &amp; crispy and the salad was well dressed with all the toppings. Chicken Parmesan Sandwich was filling. It had crispy chicken with a delicious marinara to dip in. Wild Mushroom Burger was juicy with lots of grilled onions, however lacked mushrooms. Sliced mushrooms were equivalent to half or one whole mushroom.  Factory Burrito Grande was huge, but had very little chicken. It was mostly white rice. Portion sizes are huge. You&#39;ll have plenty to take home. <br>As for dessert, we got the Oreo Dream Extreme, Red Velvet Cake Cheesecake, &amp; <br>Adam&#39;s Peanut Butter Cup Fudge Ripple to go. All were yummy!<br><br>Overall, my experience here has been the same as my last few visits.  Ambiance always nice. Service just okay. This time around would have been nice to be greeted upon arrival &amp; acknowledge when leaving. To my surprise restaurant wasn&#39;t too busy. Just had to wait less than five minutes to be seated. Cheesecake Factory is your typical chain restaurant that you&#39;ll always go back to.

Ordered the crab cake. I&#39;m never coming back again. I came here on a Sunday with my sisters trying to enjoy our weekend together as we are usually busy with our individual lives. I ordered the crab cake and there were barely any crabs on my plate. My plate consisted of: greasy, overly-salted, BURNED potatoes; two eggs; a sauce that didn&#39;t have much role in the meal other than coloring my food; and very few pieces of crab meats here and there. I didn&#39;t expect to get a full crab leg or anything close to it, but the amount of crab meat I got was just ridiculous. Overall, I was just stuffing down the burned potatoes the whole time. ($13.9x not including tax and tips for burned potatoes? No thanks) <br><br>Now for the service...<br>First of all, one of our orders never came, but that wasn&#39;t a big deal as I understand that waiters have a lot on their plates and can forget some things here and there. However, the service my waiter provided was just unbelievable. Okay now, one of my sisters arrived late and when she got here, the waiter LITERALLY gave gave her an eye-roll!!! Yes, she may be panting a little due to the fact that she was trying to hurry up as she was late, but an eye-roll? Really??? Now, this is not all. Later on, we had to consistently ask some other waiters for water or extra orders as our waiter was no where in sight. Guess what? The waiter we asked told us that he is not our waiter and ask us to wait for our waiter to come. He did not inform our waiter that we were looking for her and  our waiter did not come until the very end, when we were all done with our food.<br><br>The Cheesecake Factory- that the the first time I&#39;ve paid you a visit and that would be my last.

I&#39;d recommend coming for the lunch specials or happy hour (Mon - Fri: 4 - 6pm)<br><br>Parking: On the weekends, the mall is always super packed and it&#39;s tough to find parking, especially in the shaded areas. I usually have to circle the lot a good 5-10 minutes before actually finding parking.<br><br>Service: I usually experience pretty good service at Cheesecake Factory. The staff is always friendly and helpful, although they may not be attentive when you need them. Sometimes, the food isn&#39;t cooked to my liking, and they&#39;re always willing to remake it (I&#39;m hoping no one has ever spat in my food).<br><br>Food: My favorite thing to order here is the Ahi Tartare small bites. The tuna is probably not the freshest, but with the avocados and sauce, it really doesn&#39;t matter. Next favorite is the avocado eggrolls. The tamarind salsa is so yummy that we always ask for an extra. Also, there is so much avocado inside! Try to catch happy hour so that you can get the avocado eggrolls for $5 (normally $10)! As for the entree, I normally order the Pasta da Vinci. I&#39;m not a fan of mushrooms, but I enjoy the pasta. Sometimes, it&#39;s made too salty for me, so it just depends on the day - some days are good while others are not. For lunch, I like to also order the Pizza &amp; Salad combo. I think it&#39;s a pretty good deal for the amount of food you get, but the size of the pizza might have gotten smaller. I am not a fan of their other pastas/entrees.<br><br>Make sure to save room for dessert! You can&#39;t go to Cheesecake Factory and not try one of their cheesecakes! Most of the chocolate based cakes are too rich and heavy for me. My favorite cheesecake is Vanilla Bean, Original, and the Tiramisu. The Vanilla Bean is my all-time favorite and is probably the only one I can finish an entire order of without feeling sick. It&#39;s not too sweet and is delicious!
Had a good pepperoni pizza and a mango crush drink...and I was seated outside, loved it.

The food here is always consistent but the service is horrible ! I had to wait 10 mins after being seated just to have someone come and ask me for a drink! Then another 10 mins for someone to return and take my order ! I was with my kids who were getting impatient and hungry!  The servers and service at this location gets slower every time !

Really excellent service.  I think it help that the place wasn&#39;t pack.  Food for lunch was great.  Reasonably price with big portion.  Very kid friendly.  Had the Everything Pizza and salad for lunch.  Really yummy.  Friend had the Louisiana Chicken Pasta.  Love coming to the Cheesecake and will be coming back.  Always great food no matter the location.         <br><br>Need to come back for happy hour because reading the review below, it seems like a great place for drinks and variety of appetizer.  Can&#39;t wait to come back to try there happy hour.

we went yesterday the wait wasnt that long during dinner time. we went for my birthday. our waiter was nice and he was a great waiter. my wife and I ordered the steak Diane with shrimp scampi. it was the most perfect dish. the steak was so tender, the mushrooms and onion were so flavorful from the sauce they put, best steak I&#39;ve had. the shrimp scampi was declious with the cream sauce. the mashed potatoes with flavorful as well. we also ordered the avocado egg rolls. those were the best egg rolls I&#39;ve had. the sauce it comes with is sweet. we also got 2 cheesecakes to go. excellent food and service.

Eatin at Cheesecake Factory used to be the &#34;in&#34; thing to do in high school. But now that me and my friends are all older now, Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t all that great anymore. I don&#39;t know if it&#39;s because the quality of their food went down, or we were just naive dumb kids back then who used to get dropped off at the mall lol I just went with my girlfriends and their service isn&#39;t that good, their food is whatever&#39;s and the line was just not worth it ! It was national cheesecake day tho so that&#39;s why it was prolly super packed. Just come for the cheesecake, don&#39;t even bother getting a food dish! It&#39;s overpriced (way overpriced for what they give you), the service and food is slow and I&#39;ve eaten better American food that this place ! the pasta dish that I always get is pasta da Vinci! Just get that one when you come and it should kinda satisfy you!

Placed an order for curbside pick up, expecting an quick quality meal to go. WRONG. I made the poor assumption that my order would be correct, I guess lesson learned. Ordered a side of fries along with my burger, which I was charged for but did not receive, I asked for my salmon to come with the lemon sauce on the side, was not done, very specifically asked for ranch on the side, was also not included. Salmon was cold, I guess it was sitting out for the extra 20 minutes I was sitting outside. I called and spoke to Kenneth the manager on duty, but got no empathy and a partial refund. I usually have decent experiences with this Cheesecake Factory, not sure why today was different.

I have never written a review, but this time I was so upset I decided to let everyone know what horrible service this location has! First they told us our wait would be 45min. After an hour we asked if our table was almost ready and they said it would be another 10 min. We waited an hour in a half and that&#39;s when I went up and asked again they were so rude and wouldn&#39;t give us a time or wouldn&#39;t do anything for us having to wait that long. We went next door to wood ranch and they said they could put some tables together for us right away so we left. The people at the reception desk including the manager were so rude and said they couldn&#39;t do anything. People that got there at the same time as us were done eating and we were still waiting. I will never go back. My daughters birthday lunch was ruined as she asked to go there on her special day.

Service Is Always Outstanding. Sergio Was out Waiter &amp; He&#39;s Very Attentive &amp; Made Sure We Were Taken Cared Of When He Took His Break. Valerie Filled In &amp; Did A Great Job. Food Is So Tasteful &amp; Overall A Must To Eat At When Visiting The Area. Been Going Here For Over 10+ Years &amp; Will Continue To.

It&#39;s ridiculous that the chefs are required to wear a hat in the kitchen,---yet they are allowed to have a beard! We had a clear view of the kitchen from our table. This place is very inconsistent with service and quality compared to Pasadena location which is always on point. One guy kept sneezing in the kitchen too!!! Guess he couldn&#39;t take a sick day off...

Came here for my dad&#39;s birthday celebration around 530. I was told the wait would be up to 45 minutes for a party of 9. We expected to wait a long time for such a long party but got irritated when we saw multiple parties of 8, who arrived later, get seated before us. When I went to inquire after waiting an hour, the poor attitude from the guy at the host stand was unacceptable. First, insensitively saying we were only there 10 minutes longer then the quoted time - when obviously we had waited for over an hour and not having any reason why at least 3 other later large parties were seated ahead of us. With 3 young kids, waiting an hour is hard enough without dealing with seeing other later parties being seated first and a poor attitude. My husband went to confront the host, who threatened &#34;I&#39;ll take you off this list right now!&#34; At that point the manager came over to diffuse the situation. We were seated at a table for 8 in the front of the restaurant that stood empty for at at least 15 minutes. I have no problem with waiting but the poor attitude and threat of being taken off the wait list after having been there for an hour was totally inappropriate. How do you normally train your staff to interact with customers? The manager never came back to check on us. Overall, very disappointed.
Great food, great service, great desserts. One of the best restaurants locally...from the salads, to the burgers to the salmon you just can&#39;t go wrong!

Best service that I&#39;ve had in a long time, the food was very good and the waiter I had was very attentive to our needs.  So much that I even asked to speak to the manager so I could express my gratitude.<br><br>We also took a cheesecake home with us and I will certainly return.<br><br>Needless to say, we tipped around 28% of the meal cost, my theory is that my server has earned 20% even before I sit down, they can lose that or gain more as we go.<br><br>Thank you Cheesecake Factory for the experience!

This is probably a biased opinion since I just love this restaurant. However while visiting here this afternoon, we had the pleasure of having Steven Moreno. Serve us. What a delightful human to encounter. Super helpful, super patient, and very efficient! Thank you!

The food here is always consistently good. I keep coming back.<br><br>I really like the Chicken Madeira and the Avocado Eggrolls. I also frequently order the Orange Chicken, which has a lot of meat in it, unlike many Chinese restaurants, where there is a little meat and mostly breading and sauce.<br><br>Some people are complaining it is a little pricey, but the portion size is huge on many dishes. I think it&#39;s worth it for the quality and amount of food.<br><br>Of course all of their Cheesecakes are good.

There&#39;s probably not much to say about Cheesecake Factory that someone doesn&#39;t already know, but this one has been consistent at least and every visit has been satisfactory at least. Free bread is always nice, and the waiters are always nice enough to bring more if I run out (yay take home free bread, the wheat bread is better btw) They recently redid their burger menus (now &#34;glamburgers&#34;) and the mushroom and swiss burger is pretty tasty. Honestly when I come I usually get a burger because it is cheaper and tastes good, simple as that. Other good choices are the chicken bellagio, chicken marsala, and garlic noodles. Usually leave with a good portion of leftovers so that&#39;s always a plus.<br><br>Also, if you are ever planning on coming here and watching your weight, get the low carb cheesecake! Its tastes like the real thing and sort of healthy. Sort of, hahaha! :D

You must try Linda&#39;s fudge cake.<br>The pasta dishes are great!! I am addicted to the louisiana pasta, four cheese pasta, garlic farfalle, and the chicken romano.<br>My boyfriend loves the chicken bellagio!<br><br>Peach Bellini&#39;s mmmmmm :)<br><br>Service is good on some days, okay on others.

was here yesterday about 11pm it was a  Friday night. We were told that we needed to come back in 15 for a table.  We went out to smoke and came back after 5 minutes ...because we are Asians. I sat there and saw an couple went in Before us.  Another group of people came in and were told the restaurant was going to close soon. Ok then why the hell tell us to come back in 15. During the whole time the blonde recieptionist was chatting with a waiter behind the counter and we didn&#39;t went in until the other person came back and brought us to our shitty little table that was probably not occupied by anyone when we first here. So fk that. <br>I went to the restroom and saw a lot of empty seats in other areas. I haven&#39;t been feeling being treated so shitty since high school.<br>Our waiter (the one chatting behind the desk ealier) was so funny. He asked me what I ordered which was fine but gosh it was the first thing I ordered and I swear I saw he was writing something on that little piece of paper. He was probably just drawing the food I guess and forgot about the first one he drew.   Sent the wrong drinks to us (the 3 drinks was ordered by those people sitting behind us on the bar table. and we don&#39;t even have 3 people.    He looks old but not that old okay.<br><br>Had such a shitty night and will probably return since it&#39;s so close to my place.
The ambiance of this place is outstanding but what will keep me coming back is Dustins incredible customer service. Such a great guy with a great sense of humor. Thank you Dustin!

I have always loved eating here until recently. We were a party of 7 &amp; waited a good 50+ minutes when we were told that it was a 45min wait from the time we arrived at 5:45pm on a Sunday night. Not sure why but they were super packed that night. Once we sat down, it took another 5-10min for service. We decided to put in the kids orders first since they were already a bit antsy from the long wait and waited on our orders...boy, that was a big mistake...our waiter was all over the place that night and didn&#39;t come back to take our orders until 20-25min later n by that time, our kids have already gotten their food and finished it before our orders were even taken. So then, another 30min wait after our orders were taken and put through to the kitchen. By then, it was already 7:45pm and our food was finally brought to us but not hot anymore. I ordered the herb crusted salmon with asparagus and mash potatoes...to my surprise my fish was only slightly warm and had so much bones in it..it was hard to eat without having to stop to spit out the bones that were still left in the filet after ever bite. Mind you, the restaurant had dim lighting so I can barely see what I was eating. So, I ended up with leftovers for today and to my surprise...more bones...l pulled out 5bones and then decided I had enough.,I&#39;m sure there were more bones in the salmon cuz I still had a quarter piece left...I&#39;m thinking I&#39;ll avoid ordering fish here from now on...this was not the first time that I found multiple bones in my salmon. Yeah, what a huge disappointment! We came here to celebrate my son&#39;s birthday and did not have such a great experience...long wait for everything from getting the table, to getting service from the waiters to getting our food...I felt like I was at an amusement park where the wait was kind of expected but yeah....not happy..

They don&#39;t take reservations... Walked in and ask for a table for a party of 11. The lady at the front desk was very kind! I was told the wait is going to be around 55-60 mins. However, when we walked out to continue shopping, I was called and she said the table will be available in about 5-10 mins at the Patio. I told her that only half our party was here and she said that is okay! I was really shocked that our table was ready so fast! We got to our table and our waiter was Katelynn Z. She was very kind and got our drink orders quickly. She gave us time to order and the food came at a good time. The food was delicious. I also got a birthday sundae! Katelynn was a great waiter! Would really recommend her!

Normally I don&#39;t waste my time reviewing chain restaurants because you know what you&#39;re getting when you come to these sort of places. Generic menus with generic food. I don&#39;t even like eating at these sort of places but the other week a couple of friends and I were around the area and didn&#39;t know where we could grab a quick bite. We went on our foursquare app and found out this Cheesecake Factory was offering a 20% off $50 discount so why not. Their pastas are decent right?<br><br>Our dinner took longer than originally planned. It was the weekend so it was packed. We waited 30 minutes before we were seated but that&#39;s fine, the hostess told us this when we asked to be put on the waiting list. But seriously, do people not have better places to eat at? I started off with their sour apple martini. I&#39;m a sucker for appletinis. This had to be the worst appletini I&#39;ve ever had in my life. It tasted decent enough, like their strawberry lemonade. But I ordered a martini. Where was the alcohol in here? I can understand them forgetting the vermouth but where was the vodka to the schnapp? Not to mention it was $12. I normally do not complain about drinks but seriously, a simple cocktail for that much? Especially when it&#39;s obviously watered down? And the server had the audacity to ask if I wanted another one. Shakes my head.<br><br>Moving on to the food. Started off with their avocado eggrolls. That dish is pretty darn good. Much better than their crab cakes. Then we had our entrees. I had the shrimp scampi with their diane steak combination. The shrimp scampi and mashed potatoes were decent enough I suppose. I actually like the scampi without the capellini. However the steak medallions was terrible. What wine sauce do they use to cook it with here? It clashed with the meat terribly. It was like they put an asian oyster sauce in hopes of marinating the beef but it came out as a fail. And the cooks here needs to learn what a medium steak looks like. It seems they have trouble with all types of meat because my friend&#39;s meat loaf didn&#39;t come out so great too.<br><br>In summary, we were so dissatisfied we even bother trying one of their cheesecakes for desserts. You can come here if you want. But my experience here this past week reminded me why I wouldn&#39;t. There are a lot of other places in the area one can eat at that would have better food and drinks.

tjia experience is starting off as 1 star. So far service has been very unorganized and horrible. We waited to be called for 30 mins as told when we went to inquire how much longer the wait the lady I uploaded photo of stated they were calling my name but never did especially since been present waiting in front of the door. They ended seating is outside on a cold day and we requested to have the heaters turned on as well as the party in the table next to us and it took the manager 34 mins exactly to finally have someone come and turn them on, not to mention had to walk out and ask a 2nd time b4 they could do so. Overall service is mediocre definitely not what I expected from this place supposed to been here before very disappointing experience hopefully when is a good follow-up and create a better experience in future

Cheesecake factory&#39;s food is on the side of mediocre, but their cheesecake is to die for!<br><br>The environment is good for a romantic dinner for two at the booths. The ambient noise level is a bit high though. The tables are placed too close to each other so it&#39;s a bit hard to talk to your group of friends when another party beside you are talking. <br><br>Service is whatever&#39;s, they&#39;re attentive for the first minutes while taking your order, but after your food is out, the servers run off and leave you.<br><br>My wheat bread that came with my entree was burnt compared to the complementary breads they provided to us with.<br><br>I tried their garlic pasta with peas, shitake mushrooms, tomatoes, &amp; the  omelettes.<br><br>Don&#39;t try the shitake mushrooms, it made my tummy ache ):<br><br>their dishes are on the heavy side,  even with their low calorie menu , come eat for lunch, so you&#39;re able to walk it  off, or come in for an early dinner, but nothing late or you find yourself regretting your indulgence.

I am very happy with tonite&#39;s dining experience. My fish was good and my service was A+. Caris and Katie were outstanding and very courteous. The new dish Crispy pineapple chicken and shrimp is really good and recommended.

This is just like any other Cheesecake Factory. Food is good, drinks are yummy.<br>I always order the avocado egg rolls. I love that tamarind dip!<br>They are SUPER kid friendly too!<br>I know they are known for their cheesecake, but you gotta try the Lemoncello Cream Torte. That is just so GOOD!<br>Pineapple upside down chessecake is pretty darn good too.<br>Since this is in the mall, parking can be a hassle on the weekends and holiday shopping times.

They took away the Thai chicken pasta from the menu :(<br>I&#39;m not a big fan of cheesecake, the food is almost like PF Chang&#39;s. I usually get the thai chicken pasta or the chicken tenders. Nothing else really is appealing. <br><br>Wheat bread was warm and fresh.<br><br>Firecracker salmon was good. The sauce was very good. I don&#39;t like cabbage, I usually pick it out if everything but with this sauce I actually ate half the cabbage on this plate! What a way to get me to eat cabbage!<br><br>Garlic Noodles - eh, not very flavorful, I didn&#39;t really taste the garlic either. It was pasta in a very light light plain butter sauce. It tasted like everything was blanched then thrown together in the sauce. <br><br>Shepherd&#39;s Pie - Did not taste like shepherd&#39;s pie. Lacking flavor all around. <br><br>All the food presentation looked great, but lacking a lot of flavor. Service was good.

Came to the Cheesecake Factory on a rainy Tuesday with my mom. <br><br>The hostess at the front was helpful and friendly. A waitress started to lead us to our table, but then, for some reason, she ended up walking away without giving us a table...<br><br>So I turned to one of the waiters and asked about our seating, and he gave me a mean look and said &#34;-__- go to the front.&#34;<br><br>I was a little bit surprised, because usually Cheesecake Factory servers are really friendly, but we all have bad days...<br><br>So my mom and I, both of us a little bit pissed off, went back to the front to again ask for a seat. We were instantly given a table by another friendly host and our waiter was Cody.<br><br>Cody was friendly, helpful and attentive. He frequently came back to check up on us. <br><br>Good portion sizes, but the food was a little bland. The spaghetti and meatballs tasted like something out of a can, or maybe my taste buds have just been spoiled by Di Pillas (so good!! if you&#39;re in the SGV area I highly recommend Di Pillas) <br><br>Waiters and waitresses are friendly but it&#39;s hard to get their attention sometimes because they&#39;re so rushed. <br><br>The food here is a bit pricey, but it&#39;s Cheesecake Factory so there&#39;s no surprise about that!

I recently celebrated my anniversary the service started fine with no problem but after our was taken it took an hour and half, if not longer, before we got our other. The manager came over to apologize ans gave us free cheese cake. When it came to pay the bill I handed the server two gift cards and my atm but instead of letting us know that one card didn&#39;t go through she took the liberty to run the remaing balance. The gift card still had a balance and the manager corrected the issue. The manager was  very polite and apologetic and if it wasn&#39;t for that i would of given less stars.

My rating isn&#39;t necessarily for the restaurant but for a couple of servers I had there. I go here on occasion the food is consistent with all other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s. The service I got from two particular servers was outstanding. Cindy and Antonio aka Antwon. The service was a few weeks apart but both exceeded my expectations. (I&#39;m pretty hard to impress) They simple did their jobs with flare, kindness and joy. I have gone back and sat with other but the service fell short. If I could only dine with them I would. The cutest is, they happy to be a couple. It only figures they both would be awesome sauce.

Good steak. I always order the rib eye. It is cooked in its own juices and is very flavorful. I eat the same thing almost every other week. Not too much fat which is probably why I can enjoy it so often. When I am not so ambitious, I will go for their hamburgers. Nice tasting hamburger, not like those that is soaking in butter.<br><br>I have tried steak at other places in the Mall including California Pizza Kitchen. They do have a great steak but they cannot maintain a constant level of quality. Maybe a little on the fatty size.

The service is best at the bar. It&#39;s good at the tables not great and worst at the take out. I have sat at the bar and the bartender are always attentive. I have also come in with my family and had two different experiences. One was good and the other my five year old was last to be served at out of four Adults. I went to take out recently and stood in front of the girl well she continued a conversation with co-worker. I said Hello after not being greet as I stood in front of her for a few minutes. I expect the same service at ever area of the restaurant but I prefer the bar. The four stars is really just because I have to consider the restaurant as a whole.
Great location, fantastic food, amazing service. I wish all restaurants could have an Edna and Natalie.

So we&#39;re  told 15 minute wait which is acceptable. Waiting comfortably and sitting since it is better medically to sit. Pager goes off and I expect to be seated within a reasonable time. However we now have to stand and wait another 14 minutes. Over promise under deliver right from the start. Sadly no one makes eye contact or acknowledges you to say just a couple of minutes or something. <br>You wait the wait and the bread is warm not hot. If it wasn&#39;t for the Erica D  I wouldn&#39;t give this place another try. Pasadena restaurant blows this place out of the water.<br><br>Your server  Erica D. saved a customer. OR YOU WOULD OF GOT NO STARS.

Although I did not eat at the restaurant, I ordered DoorDash instead. At first I was going to order through phone and pick it up myself but instead I thought it would be much easier to have it delivered. I ended up spending around $32 dollars for only two things, Fried Chicken and Waffles Benedict and the Oreo Extreme Cheesecake, which is quite a lot. However, I decided to order from The Cheesecake Factory solely due to the fact that I have been craving their complimentary bread. Otherwise, I would have no reason to order from a fairly expensive restaurant for it&#39;s mediocre food and service that I could get anywhere else. I made sure to select &#39;Yes&#39; to both wanting the complimentary bread and utensils when I made my order. However, I received neither or and instead got insanely dry chicken and barely any Hollandaise sauce on my eggs. My potatoes were also very dried and burnt. I also requested for extra whip cream for my cheesecake in the special instructions section but didn&#39;t get that either. I really love The Cheesecake Factory for their bread and cheesecakes but I am extremely upset with this order.
My sister and I took our mother here for her birthday  and it was great. The grilled  pork chops were fantastic. My muslim  friends don&#39;t know what their missing.

I love the Cheesecake Factory, the food is consistently good, the menu is expansive, and the service is impeccable, there is nothing I can complain about except for the long wait when it&#39;s gets busy.  <br><br>I also really love their skinnilicious (spelling is off) menu that gives great lower calorie choices for the calorie counter patron like myself and ice cold drinks that complements their large menu.  I usually order the tuna tataki salad or shrimp soft taco which always comes out delicious and fresh.  Their cheesecake is rich and smooth, and good for sharing.  Overall it&#39;s a great option when dining out.
Their wheat bread always up to par. I got a steak Diane medium rare. Never disappointed. Service is excellent.

NEVER EAT HERE!!!!!!!<br> <br>Today we went for my aunt birthday now this was the worse experience EVER so we get here and they told us the wait was only an hour maybe an hour  and fifteen not bad for a Friday. We waited 2 hours and 20mins before we get seated the man who was in the front was rude  when we asked how much longer he gave us an attitude I believe his name is jebron . Well we finally get seated and our waitress Ivette was amazing. We ordered and  my mom order her favorite chicken while we are waiting for our food the people who were sat after us got there food before us. After waiting literally an hour for our food YES AN HOUR FOR OUR FOOD we started to eat. While eating my mom found a hair in her food. we told the manager David that she found a hair. David did not seem to care at all that it made my mom sick she didn&#39;t want to eat or drink anything else and threw up.  David I felt dismissed how we felt and that my mom found a hair in her food because my family is very diverse we were treated like crap sad to say that it&#39;s 2016 and just because a family has black, Salvadorian and Mexican in there family we are treated like we aren&#39;t good enough. I&#39;m soooooooo disappointed with this experience never thought it would be like this. On top of my mom finding hair in her food my little cousin who  order only chicken tenders had to wait an extra 20 minutes after we all revived our food to get just chicken tenders. NEVER EAT HERE <br>Go to the one in old town it&#39;s better and the managers aren&#39;t buttholes.

I had the grilled salmon lunch special. It was great. The salmon was juicy.  The broccoli was crunchy and not too salty. I didn&#39;t feel too full despite eating all that mash potatoes.  I usually like to enjoy warm fresh bread but this location gave us cold bread twice.  =(

I rarely write reviews but this time I would like to write it towards the waitress Katelyn we had yesterday for me and my sis birthday. (Yes we are twins!) She is very attentive and also gives us the service better than we expected! The food was great and it is not expensive considering the portion of the food.
My boyfriend and I go really often. I like the food and service. The only bad thing is the wait time
This Cheesecake Factory has pretty ambiance. <br><br>The food was great!<br><br>Boom goes the dynamite!

We were here for dinner on a Tuesday night, so we didn&#39;t have to wait long to be seated. On a weekend,however; you would have to wait in crowded lobby with customers who are there to just pick up cheesecakes, customers for carryout and servers who are trying to carry food to customers at the bar. It&#39;s chaos to wait, plus there are limited seating (one bench). I suggest waiting outside or take short walk in the mall. <br>Food is always CONSISTENTLY amazing.<br>Generous portions. My son and husband always order the bacon avocado burger that they called heaven. My daughter and I shared the chicken Bellagio, that is also served with pancetta and arugula salad. They ran out of arugula but it still tasted fabulous.<br>We had the world best waiter, Cody OMG superb manner, he got down to eye level with my kids to take their orders. He got us everything we needed without having to ask. Very well spoken! Super professional! I&#39;m super impressed!

Nice and convenient location. Very busy on a Friday night but we had no problem getting seated in less than 10 minutes. Friendly hostess and servers. This place is buzzing with activity and makes use of the corner space of the building in a very efficient way.  Romantically lit but the music is kind of loud and with all the crashing dishes and peeps talking. Not a good place for quiet conversation or a large group event. Food/drink/cheesecake choices are PLENTY and the menu (book) provides something for everyone. Prices are fair and service quick and friendly.

I really enjoy Cheese Cake Factory and their menu.  I went to the Arcadia location yesterday evening with my 2 granddaughters. We had been inside the mall and went in and gave our name. It was a 30 minute wait so we said we would sit outside to be seated right away.<br>We did not know that the ashes from the terrible fires were blowing and going into our water, in our hair etc. and making plates dirty. When we asked to be moved ( willing to wait) our waiter Caesar became very annoyed making an uncomfortable situation for us.  I was ready to leave the restaurant because of his poor attitude.<br>I was told they were no longer seating outside because of that issue.<br>Luckily Gabby moved us and was very polite.  There is nothing like good customer service and Gabby made sure we were well taken care of. She made a negative experience into a good one. <br><br>She saved the day, that is why I am giving to 4 stars.

Came here with a big party for a 21st birthday and had an awesome experience! Lou was such a sweetheart and made our dinner fantastic! Everyone ate every bite of the food or took theirs home, hats off to the chefs on duty. Thanks Cheesecake Factory!

This is pretty much our go-to happy hour place. Pretty extensive HH menu with a few good options for cocktails, really can&#39;t go wrong. I always order the fresh roasted artichoke because I love artichokes but am too lazy to steam/grill them myself. Plus I feel good choosing the fresh veggie option amongst all the other fried appetizers. With that said though, we recently discovered the fried avocado, portabella and zucchini fries (listed under the small plates section), and those are pretty amazing not gonna lie. All the other options (i.e. sliders, mini chicken sandwiches, etc) are okay if you&#39;re looking for more substantial bar food. I had the HH burger once and immediately, I was in bloat city. It&#39;s still a huge burger that&#39;s a great value, but really detrimental to anyone&#39;s (digestive) health. We ordered a mojito once and it was one of the best mojitos I&#39;ve ever had.. and another time we ordered it again, and it was not so good. It depends on the bartender I guess.

I decided to give Cheesecake Factory another try since my last review. Instead of ordering over the phone, I order to go in store. This time I ordered the Pasta Da Vinci, since it was highly recommended for a pasta dish. Once again, disappointed. This time it&#39;s not about the service, it&#39;s about the food. The pasta, sauce, and everything in this dish was flavorless and extremely oily. The chicken was also extremely dry and also flavorless. This restaurant branch is honestly a hit or miss. Once in a while it&#39;ll be a hit and everything is perfect and other times; well... you get my drift. I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll be coming back to this Cheesecake Factory anytime soon. 2 stars because decent service today, my order came out in a reasonable waiting time, and they even packed me some bread.

And just to follow up to the manager: Why waste your time trying to ban a loyal customer?  I not only didn&#39;t pay for the sandwich, but they were kind enough to comp me for at least two more sandwiches, meaning you lost $30 plus the sandwich, plus the money (usually c. $40) you would have made in two weeks back from me, just because you were being a jerk?  It doesn&#39;t make any sense.  Be good to your customers, they are good to your company and staff.

The Cheesecake Factory is probably one of the few chain restaurants I actually enjoy going to. Their food is USUALLY good and the service is good!<br><br>I&#39;ve gotten their factory nachos and the last two times I got it I was a little sad because they use the liquidy cheese instead of just all shredded cheese and it doesn&#39;t create the same ooey gooey-ness it used to. They have a HUGE menu and they have some good inexpensive small plates from some delicious fried cheese triangles to a roasted beet salad. Their calamari is also pretty good too...and I rarely ever eat calamari...the breading was delicious and I LOVE their dipping sauce.<br><br>I usually get a pasta dish when I go there and 95% of time it&#39;s always good. The other 5% accounts for the times I&#39;ve ordered something and it was quite bland. I either the pasta carbonara, five cheese pasta (and add mushrooms), the bistro shrimp pasta (the shrimp is fried so it gets a little greasy), or the crusted chicken romano which is  GIANT plate of panko breaded chicken and pasta. I like to mix in alfredo sauce in the pasta to make a creamy marinara mix and add mushrooms and spinach. It&#39;s absolutely delicious. They put so much on there I have enough for two meals.<br><br>&amp; who can go to The Cheesecake Factory without trying their cheesecake? I haven&#39;t tried many of them but a couple of my favorites are the vanilla bean if you like a simple cheesecake or the raspberry/lemon cheesecake...SOOO scrumptious.

Even though it&#39;s a franchise American restaurant, their quality and services are better than you other ordinary franchise restaurant. <br><br>The services are great; tho they accidentally sat our table to another party.... I do not know how they screwed that up, but they fixed us a table right after we told them we haven&#39;t been seated yet. <br><br>Food was delicious!<br>I always get Pasta Da Vinci when i come here; penne pasta stir fried with mushroom and chicken; this dish is a bit sweet because of the onion they have in there, i love it :)<br>Besides that, I have also tried Miso Salmon, Pasta Jambalaya, and their seafood gumble; none of those dishes had disappointed me! <br><br>I love coming to Cheesecake Factory!

This place is always busy so I usually sit at the bar. Had my skinnylicious veggie salad and coffee! The bartender was great and food was wonderful!<br><br>The ambiance and lighting are always consistent. The bar is a great place for a quick bite.

We went to dinner with 14 people since it was my sister&#39;s birthday. Our server was very slow &amp; I had to ask her for a straw 4 times before I actually got one, since water doesn&#39;t come with a straw. I ordered Crispy Fried Cheese as an appetizer, and they were pretty good. For dinner I ordered Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo, the chicken was over cooked &amp; rubbery. It seemed boiled. They made my dads beef dip wrong &amp; didnt bring the condiments we asked for when we ordered. Over all, the food is very mediocre. Nothing to brag about, which is unfortunate since we&#39;ve been wanting to go there. I also think it&#39;s WAY too dark in there during dinner time.

The first time I came to cheescake factory, I ordered the Tomato Basil Pasta. It had chicken but there was too much garlic in there for me. I even had a garlic after-breath -.- The next time I came here, I ordered the Fettucini Alfredo. SUPER DELCIOUS. Nice creamy and cheesy meal. Pasta was just right. Afterwards, I ordered the Kahlua Cocoa Coffee Cheesecake. I LOVED IT. but i got a sugar rush halfway through the slice so I brought it home and put it in the freezer. It tastes like ice cream after taken out of the fridge! :) My brother got the Wild Blueberry White Chocolate Cheescake and that was delish too.

So I went to have dinner with my family at 5:34pm.<br>They ask if we wanted to sit outside, we said, &#34;sure&#34;<br>Little did I know they were going to seat us right where a family of flies were swarming. My daughter started to freak out and cry.  Finally after what felt like 10min of waiting, the waitress came around after another group of people sat next to us, took our drink order. Then she took the order of the other table at the same time. <br>Another 5 min past until she came back with our drinks, and took our food order, but I wasn&#39;t able to speak because my daughter kept having meltdowns due the flies, so my husband gave her the order. <br>As we waited, with only our drink to quench our thirst, she the waitress (Ashely) finally came out with some bread. Yay!!! At least my kids can eat something, while waiting for the food. During the time of waiting for the food, my poor daughter continued to have meltdowns, by ever passing of a fly, yet we were still not offered a different area to sit. Finally, after 30 min passed, our food came and I was tired of hearing my daughter cry while others were trying to eat, I told the waitress we will be leaving. <br>I waited another 5 min for to go bags. While we were waiting, I told my hubby to take the kids and I will wait. <br>Ashely the waitress, finally gave me the check, after waiting again for 5 min, where I almost wanted to walk out.
Good food waiter Steven was awesome gave us good advice on food and dessert be back soon

I got only 5 medium sized shrimp on an almost $19 shrimp pasta dish!... That&#39;s being extremely stingy. Extremely disappointing. For comparison we ate at a Mexican place for lunch and a $6 shrimp tostada there had 3-4x as many shrimp of the same size/quality. Our service was good, otherwise I&#39;d give 2 stars.

Parking can be a pain as it&#39;s at the mall esp on major nights. <br><br>It&#39;s always a hit or mess with this place. Service can be attentive and quick sometimes it can be slow and disappointing. <br><br>But on top of that, food quality makes everything up. And their cheesecakes are to die for! :)

This place is really expensive but if you come with the right people and get the right server, the price is completely worth it. I got the shepherd&#39;s pie and my boyfriend got the spicy cashew chicken. The spicy chicken was amazing with sriracha and the shepherd&#39;s pie was amazing. We also got the cucumber lemonade which is divine. Our server, Emily made the experience. She was super sweet and very helpful. She is the whole reason I&#39;m writing this review. GREAT JOB!

terrible service.<br><br>I came here at around 9:45 pm on a Sunday. I went up to the waiter and asked if I would still be able to get &#34;to-go&#34; and she says yes and hands me a menu.. with NO warning that they close in 15 minutes. (THANKS ALOT!) I assumed this place would close at 11 since other CF close at 11pm (Pasadena? Glendale?)<br><br>After trying to decide what to eat, another waiter comes up and says &#34;our kitchen is closed, I should&#39;ve told you earlier&#34; So WTF? You stood there watching us decide for 10-15 minutes only to tell us after you close?<br><br>There is never anything wrong with the food.<br><br>But the service is just terrible.<br>I am never coming back to this location.<br><br>To the dumb worker: instead of looking at my boyfriend and saying &#34;Hey! You&#39;re _____ right? I know you!&#34; We&#39;re here as CUSTOMERS, not FRIENDS. Because if you were a FRIEND, you&#39;d tell us you&#39;re closing, not WATCH us waste our time.

My gf and I have been here a few times for dinner mostly. I&#39;m kind of torn between 3 and 4 stars but I&#39;m going with 3 because I feel this place is a little overpriced. <br><br>The pros:<br>The kitchen is always on point with our food. They prepare it just the way you order it. I am a sucker for masked potatoes and they make the best!!!! I mean really the 3 stars I&#39;m giving is all based on the food. The food alone would be 5 stars but we all know that the review is about the entire restaurant. <br><br>The cons: <br>On more than one occasion we have been sat at a table that still had dirty utensils. Once seems reasonable we all make mistakes but more than a couple times let&#39;s me know that they don&#39;t pay much attention to cleaning up. The drinks selection isn&#39;t very good. A lot of wines but my gf and I aren&#39;t wine ppl so maybe this is just distasteful for us. The menu seems a tad bit over priced. The look they try to give this place will make you think the price is fair but let&#39;s be honest this just another franchise  restaurant. <br><br>Overall, the food is good. It&#39;s not a must go place but those damn mashed potatoes are too good to pass up. Try it for yourself you might find you like it better than I do.

My wife and I plus two friends went to the Arcadia location last weekend.  I ordered a pasta dish with shrimp and sausage that had a spicy sauce.  I asked if it could be made with a milder sauce, to tone down the spices, and the waitress said that they could easily do exactly that.  <br><br>When my dish was delivered it looked great, but, on further examination, there was no shrimp in the dish!  I had already taken a few bites with sausage before the waitress returned and found that the sauce was extremely spicy and inedible.  I pointed out the problems to her and she took the dish away.  When she finally returned my compatriots had almost finished their dinners while I had only had a small dinner salad.  The waitress told me that the Manager would be dropping by to talk to me shortly.  When he came he asked me if my meal was OK and then left!!!  We love The cheesecake factory near our home, in Mission Viejo, but were EXTREMELY disappointed in this location and will not be returning.  Poor form and service. How do you leave out one of the key ingredients from one of your dishes?

Everyone always raves how good Cheesecake Factory is. My fiancé and I visited this location. It took me forever to decide what I wanted. When I did decide, I got the orange chicken. Aesthetically, it was pleasing to look at. The taste on the other hand was sub par. The chicken was perfectly cooked, but it was bland. It was like eating an orange rind. Bitter. As a side, I ordered the brown rice. So dry &amp; tasteless. Not worth the money.  The only reason I gave it it two stars is because our waitress was polite &amp; knowledgeable.  If I go here again, it won&#39;t be by choice.
It&#39;s just typical Cheesecake. They have better menu though, comparing to before. It&#39;s called Skinnylicious Menu. Service is nice, nothing is spectacular.
Food was good but service wasn&#39;t all that. Luckily gratuity is optional. Our server was polite and did the best he could with what was available for him

Such great service!! Dim lit environment feels so romantic and calm for date night. Staff was so friendly, they helped me get a drink not on the menu (ginger ale for my upset stomach) with a lime to squeeze for flavor. Staff is attentive when needed. Clean environment. I tried foods I didnt think id like and loved them!! The bread is so fresh. The mashed potatoes are a little too sweet and raw for my tastes. Every thing else tasted so good. The to go boxes come in a nice bag. And tastes just as good reheated. The cheese cakes are delicious and unique. The wait time doesn&#39;t take long. We will be back!!

This is by far my favorite Cheesecake Factory in all of Southern Los Angeles. It&#39;s larger compared to the Pasadena and The Grove locations, and if you don&#39;t come during the lunch/dinner rush, there is ample free parking. I&#39;m a creature of habit when it comes to this place, so I tend to order between the meatloaf, chicken marsala, chicken madeira, or the spicy chipotle chicken pasta. Every single time I have come here, the food is always perfect. Nothing is bland, or too cold. The meat is always flavorful, tender, and juicy. You can&#39;t go wrong. <br><br>Cheesecakes: I can never come here without having at least one for here, and one to go. My favorites are the banana cheesecake, pumpkin cheesecake (seasonal), cherry cheesecake, and the red velvet. Some of the other ones like the key lime, Snickers, etc. are a bit too sweet for me. <br><br>Downside: They have one burrito dish, they don&#39;t tell you on the menu, but it comes with white rice which I find odd. I didn&#39;t like that at all. Another downside is the wait. If you come during the lunch/dinner rush, especially on the weekend, be prepared to wait about an hour or longer. <br><br>Service here has always been great. Warm and friendly.

My experience for this particular visit is a 3. What pissed me off was I ordered a Salmon and Shrimp combo and I got a snack. The serving is Half Size of regular. 3 short pieces of asparagus, 3 Medium battered shrimp, a piece if Salmon the size of half the size of my iphone and mashed potatoes the size of the salmon. Cost $20. I feel pretty ripped off. Didn&#39;t complain though, kept my class and composure but here&#39;s the yelp. Oh place is pretty dead for a Sunday, perhaps this is a sign of what happens to all the restaurants around here!<br><br>Oh I don&#39;t like how you order pasta and automatically ad the $6.95 for chicken and throw it at you! At least ask me what my options are instead of hiding fine print! WTH!

Worst service I have ever received! Went here with a party of 7, they sat us in an empty section and completely forgot about us. We had to get up and hunt down someone to take our drink order. She took our drink order and food order and then, to our surprise, told us she wasn&#39;t even our server.... Some guy standing behind her not saying a word was our server. This guy must of had some type of magical power to disappear because it was hard to find him for anything. It took him twenty minutes to get us bread (4 pieces for 7 people). When we finally got all our food, we all were in desperate need of refills on our drinks. It took him ten more minutes to get our drinks refilled. <br>In conclusion, the service was horrible and we were forced to give a good tip because of gratuity.... When clearly it was a half-assed serving job.

Two only because our food took longer than usual to arrive.  When I say usual, usual is at the Glendale location.  On top of that, the bread that the waiter said he was going to get? Never came!!!!  But with the appetizer we ordered, it was enough, but I didn&#39;t like the fact that he did not follow through.  I don&#39;t think this location will be first on my list next time I&#39;m at the mall and want a dine in.  There are a huge  selection of eateries nearby and this place will not be on my list next time.  I&#39;ll stick to the Glendale location if I want me some Cheesecake Factory because they never forget the breads.

Death by chocolate or death by cheesecake? Seriously though, if you try to eat a single portion of cheesecake by yourself you will probably die. The portions here are enormous. Do not try to tackle any dish by yourself. Bring a few friends.<br><br>I like to split a Thai chicken pasta with my friend. Or chicken and dumplings. Or a pizza. Honestly, I have never ordered something here I didn&#39;t like.

Tried to call in an order for two desserts and after waiting 15 minutes on hold I abandoned that strategy and just drove over. I then waited in line for a few minutes and when I asked the guy about the wait on the phone he was completely unapologetic, and just blamed it on the receptionist. I then had to wait 5 minutes for them to package up the two desserts which could have all been avoided if I wasn&#39;t on hold for so long. It would be far more understandable on a weekend but on a Monday night at 8:45 I&#39;m not sure what could have been keeping them all so busy. Very disappointed. Don&#39;t bother trying to phone your order in, you&#39;re better off going just about anywhere else for dessert.

Yummy, good food and good service. It&#39;s been along time since we had dinner here and I&#39;m not sure why that is. We have a location just around the corner from the house and I think it&#39;s time to stop in for some more good stuff.
