The food was great as always and the server brought us extra brown bread (yummy). <br><br>The place, surprisingly, was empty. Our server was great at first but then disappeared for a while. Some other server came around and asked if we needed anything. We were confused because we were not sure if their shifts changed. We then asked another server to have our server bring over the check. <br><br>Bottom line service was not so horrible and no matter what I will be back be the food is delish.
Great service, great food, consistently delicious food.  Large portions reasonable price. Nice atmosphere. One of my favorites!<br><br>5 Stars!

I&#39;ve only been here once. I usually go to the one in old town. This location isn&#39;t the better one in my opinion. <br><br>I came in for happy hour.  It&#39;s $5 for a margarita which has a good flavor and not too strong. I don&#39;t drink too heavy. They have something called the ultimately margarita. Not sure what&#39;s that all about. <br><br>I ordered the Salisbury steak. The plate had mashed potatoes and some green beans. The sauce on the steak had only a few mushrooms but plenty of onions. Supposedly there was garlic in it. I couldn&#39;t really taste it. <br><br>Just like any other Cheesdcake Factory, they&#39;ll give you bread and butter. It just didn&#39;t taste very fresh here like the one in old town. It was harder than what I expected. Especially with the brown bread, it was harder then usual. <br><br>The dishes were not cleaned very well. I had to ask the bartender for another fork, but it was still dirty. It looked like it was soaked in water without soap.  I could&#39;ve gotten sick.
Food is ok, service is bad, won&#39;t come back! Our waitress left during the middle of meal, no one serve us. I have to ask several people before order our dessert.
Great food, best customer service, big portions! Out favorite is the steak Diane and the chicken madera!
I think I like this one more than the one in Brea. Food is always bomb! Staff was nice, we had a good time.

I came here to takeout some cakes for me and my family. The lady working behind the counter looked mad and didn&#39;t even listen to my order correctly. I had ordered one chocolate cake, one oreo cheesecake and one carrot cake but when I came back home to eat it, i noticed that she gave me the Godiva cake instead of the carrot

I was here last week Tuesday ..Cashier Amanda behind the Cheesecake slice area was awesome..attitude was energetic and upbeat..obviously the service was exceptional ..!! This was my first time in 8 years going back to CheeseCake Factory..and she made my experience truly wonderful..The Manager I was able to speak with was great as well.. Thank all of you..I will be back soon.. I got 3 different slices of cheesecake..all excellent..! I wish people that go out to eat learn to understand that giving great service to people who don&#39;t deserve it is very hard... It&#39;s truly an art form..
We had the best server (Jan 8, celebrating a birthday) - he was patient, attentive, courteous and FAST!
Good food. Came for half off on cheesecakes. Ordered garlic noodles.....delicious.

Avocado Eggrolls -- soooooooo good !! <br>Artichoke with garlic dip -- its good but not that much too eat, dont order this when you are hungry. <br>Chicken Madeira -- Best dish !<br>Steak Diane -- steak with mushrooms are very good, dont like the Mashed Potatoes that much. <br><br>Recommend Factory Combinations, so you can have two great dishes at the same time, and the potion is good too. I had Herb Crusted Salmon and Shrimp Scampi, they both REALLY good but the mashed potato is massive. i only took 2 bites. <br><br>and..... cheesecakes! you cant come here without taking their cheesecakes. My favorite is Tiramisu Cheesecake, cant get enough of it!! White Chocolate Raspberry Truffle is also good. <br><br>If you come here on your birthday, they will write &#34;Happy birthday&#34; and put a candle on your cheesecake, and the waiters and waitresses will sing &#34;Happy birthday&#34; song. <br><br>Nothing is better than having a cheesecake for birthday cake :)

For the most part the Cheesecake factory is pretty consistent. My husband and I came here to grab a bite to eat after watching a movie. I had steak and shrimp in mind and couldn&#39;t wait. To my surprise, our waiter Ebony advised use they were all out of steak Diane. Stuff happens but I was a bit disappointed when Ebony told us they were unwilling to substitute it for any other cut of steak. I don&#39;t see that as being my problem. So yeah... That&#39;s why they received 3 stars and I&#39;m being nice because I considered giving them 2.

Love this place!!! Excellent service and attentive and friendly! The chicken tortilla soup is the BEST!! I ordered the Stuffed Chicken Tortillas and I gotta admit it was delicious and plentiful!! My husband had the Southwestern Chicken salad which came with a very good side salad! Of course you can&#39;t leave without ordering the best cheesecake in the world! We will definitely be back!!

Great service, good food, huge selection of food and cheese cakes. One of the best rib eye steaks I tasted. Very tender, juicy,  and flavorful. <br><br>Restaurant is a bit on the noisy because of the super tall ceilings. However, the ceilings give the space a very dramatic look.<br><br>King Julian Rules!

I rarely do chain restaurants but The Cheesecake Factory is one of the exceptions, especially right before a movie next door.  The food is always tasty and consistent but I am most impressed with the staff here.  They are always courteous and if there&#39;s some sort of misunderstanding, they not only correct it, they always seem go one step further.  This place truly has a &#34;customer is always right&#34; vibe to it.  I&#39;ll keep coming back.

I came here to pick up some dessert to-go, and the place was so quiet that I thought they were closed, but I was assured that they were not and was able to breathe a sigh of relief!  If I couldn&#39;t have my dessert fix, I would have been very disappointed!<br><br>I love the way the Cheesecake Factory chain displays their desserts right at the entrance for hungry people waiting to be seated. They simply can&#39;t help gazing at the display case full of cheesecakes and delicious things.<br><br>I know it&#39;s odd to give a review about the dessert counter, but that was my sole reason for being inside. I&#39;ve been here during normal daylight hours and when it&#39;s packed, and it&#39;s just like most other Cheesecake Factory restaurants - but I was really just tickled to talk with Alyssa about our favourite desserts, and she was very helpful and very evil, showing my dessert cohort the different cheesecakes by pulling them out so he could get a closer look.<br><br>She turned what could&#39;ve been a very boring non-conversation while dealing with the evening slow into something a bit more entertaining.<br><br>Mmm, sweet tooth? Satisfied.

Love cheesecake. Never had any problems with any location of The Cheesecake Factory. I just wish it was shorter wait times on the weekends, but it&#39;s worth the wait. Try out the lemon meringue cheesecake; it very good. Aside from that; the waiters and host are very quick and curtious. They explain the menu in detail for items not familiar with. Food is great. Place is very clean. I will be coming back.

I&#39;m beyond disgusted. I went with 3 siblings and our wait time wasn&#39;t bad, but we get seated, our waitress was rude, and kept giving me in particular dirty looks whenever I requested something. Then my brothers first ordered drink came, with LIPSTICKS on the rim. We were grossed out and asked for a replacement drink, which they tried charging us for. Then, my sisters knife in her set was dirty. Never coming back. They need to clean their utensils and glasses thoroughly!

I went to Cheesecake factory last night after a long day of continuing education . I got there around 8 PM. Parking is a big issue.. it took me about twenty to 30 minutes to get a parking. When I got inside; place was busy...I went to the bar to wait for our table. I ordered a passion fruit mojito at the bar..it was more like a passion fruit slush cause I only taste the passion  fruit. For 10 dollars.. this is too weak.<br><br>BY the time we get to our table.. we immmediately ordered. It takes a long time to get our food. I ordered the jamaican pepper shrimps. It comes with rice, black bean and mango. food was ok..it is spicey. my friend ordered some pasta dish. For the quality of food and the portion; it is overpriced.<br><br>The dessert cheecake with strawberry was good. Will go back for the cheesecake.

Cheesecake Factory is Cheesecake Factory. With this location, I usually don&#39;t wait long, service is good, and we just do drinks and appetizers. We got the sampler or whatever that was and it was HUGE! Don&#39;t ever get that for 2 people. <br><br>MUST<br><br>ORDER<br><br>PEACH<br><br>BELLINIS!<br><br>OH<br><br>SO<br><br>ORGASMIC!<br><br>MMM<br><br>MM<br><br>M<br><br>MMM<br><br>MMMM<br><br>MMMMMM<br><br>:)
Been here before , never had such a bad experience .First off , our silver ware were dirty , then I found a hair on my plate....

Ate here this evening with family.  It was a large order during a busy time.  The kitchen had a problem getting everything out in sync, so we spoke to Ryan, the manager on duty, about it.  He and Amanda, our server, immediately fixed the issues and wound up &#34;comping&#34; a couple of our items.  We so appreciated the great service, and the financial consideration!  This is what good service is all about!  The food was delicious, too.  We&#39;ll be back, for sure.  Thanks, Ryan and Amanda!

Hmm.. The food here is the same as any other Cheesecake Factory, so it&#39;s nothing to rave about.<br><br>But THIS place is definitely operated by bitches. I&#39;ve eaten here three times already and I always get those cold, rude gestures. They&#39;re mainly the female workers that gives such horrible service - the guys are a different thing, though - maybe it&#39;s because I&#39;m a girl?<br><br>Don&#39;t know, but whatever it is, service is trash here. I usually come when it&#39;s empty - so there&#39;s no excuse for such treatment!
In short... <br><br>RED VELVET CHEESECAKE = 5 stars!!<br><br>PS. Everything else is &#34;Eh.&#34;
The location is decent.<br><br>The ambiance is added into the cost.<br><br>Corporate look, corporate food. <br><br>It was better in the old days.

There are just some restaurant battles you cannot win.<br><br>When my friends wanted to go to lunch, the initial suggestion was Sizzler. You can imagine the &#34;debate&#34; that ensued. <br><br>Just when I thought I was going to burst into tears with despair, I gave in to Cheesecake Factory. I figured they can&#39;t eff up a salad, right?<br><br>When we arrived, there wasn&#39;t a wait. And they accommodated our request to lower the shade. This meant all the shades had to be lowered so the entire dining area went dim. Hm, what a &#34;romantic&#34; lunch with my friends and their baby. <br><br>Our server was nice enough. She went on break for a while and another took over. They brought out all the things we needed fairly quickly though I questioned why they needed to bring salad dressing 25 minutes before our meals arrived. <br><br>I ordered the avocado rolls for an appetizer. I can&#39;t help but love those things. This Cheesecake Factory didn&#39;t fry them enough for me as the wrapper wasn&#39;t that crispy but then again, I appreciated the avocado wasn&#39;t a burning hot oozing mess. <br><br>I also had the chopped vegetable salad with chicken. There wasn&#39;t too much chicken but I didn&#39;t realize this salad would come with cheese so there ended up being enough protein after all. The pom dressing wasn&#39;t too tart. <br><br>I also snagged a couple of bites of chicken tenders from my friend&#39;s plate.<br><br>My friends liked their cheesecake but I&#39;m a cheesecake purist. I don&#39;t like fancy cheesecakes and will not eat them (with the exception of pumpkin cheesecake during the holidays).<br><br>Overall, if I had to eat at the mall and between the choices of the food court, Todai, Woodranch or Cheesecake, I guess I might come back. Only if there wasn&#39;t a wait though.<br><br>2.5- the menu was extremely sticky. Ick.

Cheesecake Factories are known to have atrocious wait times, but this one wasn&#39;t as bad. Plus, it is right in front of the Santa Anita mall so it makes waiting more bearable. Once you get it there, the atmosphere is not the best. Like the other locations, this places is really dark, like they don&#39;t want you to see your food. God knows what is in there.<br><br>The food is pretty good, but for waiting 30 minutes and them charging $20 a dish in this economy, I expected more. One good pick is the Shrimp scampi and the chicken sandwich was delicious. Do not get a salad here. Why get a salad at this place? Go for the seafood and end your night with a cheesecake. The cheesecake is flavorful, but buy the whole cake instead of the slice (it is not worth it).<br><br>Pretty much, the worst part of Cheesecake is the wait. It is really painful to wait here. Last time, it took me 30 minutes to drive there, drove around for 15 minutes for parking, waited 45 minutes for a table, and 30 minutes for my food to come. So pretty much it took my whole night. Two hours dedicated to getting warm food, and a $100 plus for 4 adults. Anything should taste good at this point. However, it was still not as bad as the Grove location, because I waited there for 75 minutes. With so many food choices in this area, I recommend the barbeque house next to it if you are as impatient as me.

I am kind of biased because I have always loved Cheesecake Factory restaurants!  BUT we went on Easter Sunday and sort of hesitated because there were lots of people, but we were seated immediately and they were all so friendly! Hostess, waitress, water boy, drink guy, all of them were above and beyond pleasant.  We are all vegetarian, so easy to order, and we had caesar salad, veggie burger and the summer rolls, all generous and all super tasty.  Even the lemonades were awesome, raspberry and a strawberry, yummy!  Topped it off with chocolate ice cream for dessert and we were all happy.  The bill came to almost fifty bucks, but the drinks were each over five bucks, kind of pricey, otherwise our meals were reasonably priced. We tipped twenty percent as they were way above the top and happy, very pleasant and so nice!!  Will definately be back!
CF is elegant, busy, pricy and great for special occasions.

LOVE the Red Velvet Cheesecake and the Key Lime Mango Cheesecake.<br><br>Favorite Appetizers: Avocado Eggrolls and Fried Calamari<br><br>I love the pastas here too.  I always order the Bistro Shrimp Pasta or the Farfalle with Chicken and Roasted Garlic.  It&#39;s so good!  My favorite burger is the Kobe Burger.

This is my second bad experience at a Cheesecake location. I can&#39;t believe that a chain this large has associates that practice horrible customer service. The problem was a so-called manager. She was rude from the beginning of our dining experience all the way to the end. She used improper hand gestures to maneuver me to the other side of the counter to talk to her. She pounded on the counter to get my attention. I didn&#39;t appreciate that one bit. <br><br>We had a large party of about 25 people. Many people in our party were in disbelief that a woman in her position was so unprofessional. She walked over to our table asking how dinner was going . She had no intention in helping us to our needs. She gave us a dirty look like, &#34;Hello!  Do I look like your server???!!&#34;  She waved down our waiter and told him to get us what we needed in a this-is-your-job-not-mine kind of attitude.  Instead, she gave us a lecture about splitting the bill. I&#39;ve been to several Cheesecake locations and they all are capable of splitting the bill. She talked to us like we were children. She told us it would take an hour before the bill would be given to us if we split the bill. I&#39;ve never experience such horrible service from any restaurant in my life! <br><br>My friends and I didn&#39;t appreciate her attitude and lack of customer service. I believe that she needs to be trained on professionalism and needs to understand the meaning of respect to her guests and her associates.
Long wait, expensive but good food &amp; good free breads ! Good service &amp; dark as hell like Hollister but it&#39;s romantic you know (;

Came here for lunch to meet some family. Anticipated that it would be to the same standards as the many other CCF that I have visited numerous times. I was correct.  Friendly staff, and food prepared to my expectations.
Good food, good drinks, good staff. You really can&#39;t go too wrong with the Cheesecake Factory unless you come on a really busy day/time then your waiting a while. Worth it though.

5 stars for the BEST RED VELVET CHEESCAKE ever!!!!<br><br>OMG JUICY RED VELVET CHEESCAKE. I already love red velvet and cheescake and when you put it together comes out this awesome best ever dessert you will ever taste. I usually don&#39;t like cheescake factory&#39;s cheescake since it&#39;s either too sweet or too rich or too something. BUT, I am so confident anyone who tries this cheescake will love it. It&#39;s not too sweet and not too rich, it&#39;s just right and perfect and the red velvet is so soft and perfect. Anyway, the food here is always pretty good anyway but this dessert makes this place stand out a lot more than it used to. I never understood the hype and the long lines for this place before but I will definitely be coming back even just to get a TOGO of the cheescake. My partner got me a whole red velvet cheescake CAKE for my bday party which cost a lot hahah but it was sooooooooooooo good!!

This was by far the WORST CHEESECAKE FACTORY I HAVE EVER been too!!!  The food wasn&#39;t seasoned!  The request for well done salmon came back seared!  The service was horrible!!<br><br>I talked to a friend who went about a week before me and before I said anything, told me they would never go there again!!<br><br>Get a new Chef!

I realize I&#39;ve been writing way too many 4 star reviews lately, so I&#39;m going to reach into that part of my eating history I&#39;ve long since tried to forget and bring up some of the not-so-fabulous memories.<br><br>Ah, The Cheesecake Factory. You know, I actually used to like this place. Their appetizers are tasty, and there&#39;s such great variety in the menu that everyone can be satisfied even if they want very different cuisines.  Or so I thought.<br><br>I came to the Arcadia branch not long after it opened because I was craving cheesecake and the jambalaya pasta. My favorite dish here, by far.  I remembered the pasta to have such an abundance of flavor and just the right amount of spice to make me fall in love after one bite, the first time around. (this was at the Grove location fyi)<br><br>But I ordered it here and it was BLAND.  I couldn&#39;t believe it.  My favorite dish, stripped of its aroma, became just another untouched dish of pasta.  It was so bad that finally we bit the bullet and asked the waitress to take it back and fix it.  The chef was nice enough to concoct some more of the jambalaya sauce and brought that out to us to mix into the pasta, after which it started tasting more like it should.  But I do NOT have dulled taste buds!  In fact, most of the time I think there&#39;s too much salt in things.  I was definitely not imagining the subpar rendition of the Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu here at this so-called restaurant.  To top it off, the fries were bad too!<br><br>At least the Kahlua cheesecake was every bit as good as I remembered.  Thank goodness for small favors.  Needless to say, I never came back here again.

Gotta love the gluttonous menu that Cheesecake offers!  My fav is the fish and chips... surprisingly good here!<br><br>Banana cheesecake is a must if you have room for dessert!  The whipped cream served on the side is light and not overwhelming at all.

Finally, I don&#39;t have to drive to congested Pasadena anymore for this place, now I just have to drive to a congested mall parking lot!<br>The Cheesecake Factory is always a default option for a nice dinner with your girl.  They have every type of food, but I tend to stick with 2 or 3 dishes.  You get some bread with your drinks, a white bread and some nutty brown bread that I always leave alone. <br>You get huge portions here and if you somehow have room left over, try a slice of cheesecake.  There are around 30 types to choose from and I haven&#39;t bitten into a bad one yet.

So, after much internal debate, i&#39;ve come to a simple one-sentence review:<br><br>THE BEST AVERAGE RESTAURANT. <br><br>Right???? It&#39;s not deliciously amazing, but it&#39;s not horribly bad. That pretty much sums up the Cheesecake Factory in a nutshell! But if you do eat here, i&#39;ve scoped (and eaten) much of the menu over the years, and here&#39;s what you should order: Luau Salad (ask for LIGHT dressing, since they seem to drench it every time), Pasta Jambalaya (slightly spicy, but pretty good), Kobe Burger, and that&#39;s about it. Oh, and the vanilla bean cheesecake is super delicious -- when you&#39;re NOT counting your caloric intake. It&#39;s good, not great (...and we all know that)
My sister ordered their cheesecake to go and I tried it. The place is quite expensive. However, their service is great. Very friendly and welcoming.

1.16.07: I had a really packed day. I got off work around 6:30pm and my friend wanted to have dinner. For some reason he wouldn&#39;t back down on all the excuses I gave him. I needed to shop to get a dress for the Elevate event. I didn&#39;t want to come in board shorts, although I would definitely prefer that first. <br> Since I was already at the mall the first place I thought of was Cheesecake factory. I have gone to the Pasadena locations plenty of times. But it was my first time visiting Cheesecake in Arcadia. So as i walked in we were greeted with two smiling faces. We were seated immediately in the tinyest booth in the world. I hate those booths that cheesecake has. I&#39;m not a big girl and well I felt like I was playing elbow games with the wall. Not feeling too comfortable we asked our waitress if we could switch booth and well she was really nice about it. So we went to the regular size booths and we sat comfortably. YEAH! <br> I wasn&#39;t really too hungry. I had the blt salad. I really like that for some reason. And we had bread. My friend had a salad as well. Oh how can I forget ordering soup. I ordered clam chowder. I have been craving for that lately. It tasted like any other clam chowder. I really love canned clam chowder it does not do me wrong. ha ha. That&#39;s the beauty of clam chowder. <br> No matter where I get my BLT salad its always going to be the same right? Of course how can you go wrong with lettuce, bacon and tomatoes? That&#39;s so simple right? YUP and that&#39;s exactly what I got. Simple just the way I like things.<br> Ended the meal well. Just sit and chit chat about the day. Bought a dress wasn&#39;t really too excited about it but its a dress at least. I reallly like this cheesecake though. Its not as crowded and its nice to enjoy a meal not feeling like your table is practically connected with some stranger. <br>  4 stars for the service and the cleaniness. O and for the awesome salad. I tasted my friends chicken salad and that was good too. The chicken suprising was not dry. I&#39;m picky with my chicken and this was a good chicken. ha ha.<br>  <br>4 stars!

I came on a Friday night at about 8PM or so and it was only a 5 minute wait. Surprising!<br><br>Also, I saw that one slice of their cheesecakes has over 1200+ calories! Wow!<br><br>Okay, back on topic.<br><br>On this visit to this particular Cheesecake Factory, I got to try the Sangria with white wine, the Pasta Da Vinci, and the Chinese Chicken Salad.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had Sangria with white wine before and it wasn&#39;t bad.  It wasted a little bitter but it is probably because of the fruit that is in it.  I think it tastes like grapefruit juice.  It wasn&#39;t very strong either.  I didn&#39;t really feel it in my face and I&#39;m a lightweight!  Whether or not my face got red, that&#39;s a different story.<br><br>Pasta Da Vinci.  No relation to Leonardo. (stupid joke).  The penne pasta was an okay combination with the rest of the ingredients.  I prefer long pasta, like angel hair or spaghetti, but penne works alright.  It came with cup up chicken breast and button mushrooms.  The mushrooms were probably my favorite part of the dish.  The size was adequate.  Not too much and not too little.<br><br>Chinese Chicken Salad.  It tasted similar to the salad you&#39;d find at Souplantation, at least the dressing.  The portion is pretty large and I figure if you&#39;re one person eating all of it, you&#39;ll get sick of it before you can finish all of it.  But if two people share it, it&#39;d make a good size as an appetizer.  The dressing wasn&#39;t too sweet but if you order dressing on the side and pour it on, well, then it gets a bit sweet, but still good!<br><br>The service wasn&#39;t as great as what I experienced at the Cheesecake Factory at Americana.  I think during the entire dinner, the guy only checked in on us 2 or 3 times.  But the guy was busy anyway with a lot of tables to cover.  Four stars.

usually when i come here, everything is great. however, today my wife and i came for lunch and our experience was less than satisfactory so much so that i feel the need to write a review. we werent given a waiter/waitress to help serve us 15 minutes. we observed that the waiter in the area was actually debating who to choose to serve us. when Someone finally came to take our order we took care to order all of our meal at Once in case they would take longer to get our meal order. we waited patiently for 15 minutes only for the manager to come out that our order was made wrong. when our food came another 15 minutes it came cold. i wont take the time to write my opinion. by now yall should understand what i was feeling but form your own opinion of this matter. im just sharing what happened

Came in for lunch today. I had the herb salmon with red skin mashed potatos assparagus in a creamy sause. It was delucious. Our server was great she was real informative and her recomendation were fabulous. We had the carat cake for dessert.

My experience here has been excellent....I have been to a lot of the other CF restaurants, and this one seems to be very consistent for food quality and service....The portions are huge, and the best value is during lunch....<br><br>I agree with some of the reviewers regarding the interior ( a little too much pomp) but the high ceilings do make it more relaxing than say, a bomb shelter pub.....<br><br>The pasta (Da Vinci) is great, and the Seafood Gumbo was good and spicy..<br><br>If your not completely satisfied with your server, just politely go to the front desk and ask for a replacement...some of the personalities of the younger staff can be a little aggressive.....but the typical experience is usually quite good!!!

Honestly, Cheesecake Factory (almost every location I have been to in the past year) has consistently disappointed. The quality of food and service has been awful. I went to this location for brunch today and almost everything went wrong. No one came to our table for about 15 minutes and we didn&#39;t get out drink orders for an additional 10 minutes. I ordered an omelet and my fiancé ordered an item off of the brunch menu. Literally EVERYTHING was wrong when they brought it out. They tried their best to correct the wrong,  but again, failed. The only positive thing I can say is that the manager was very polite and tried his very best to make sure we left happy....that is the ONLY reason I gave the additional star. They didn&#39;t charge us for our incorrect orders. I will never be returning to Cheesecake Factory after my experience today.

I&#39;ve been going to this Cheesecake Factory for years &amp; i always heard that the customer service here wasn&#39;t as good as the other ones. I didn&#39;t really understand that. I thought the service was fine, that was...until I went to other Cheesecake Factorys. This one has terrible service compared to the other ones. <br><br>My most recent experience was about 3 weeks ago. My server was really a chatty cathy. We would order something, and she would start a conversation on what we were ordering &amp; then tangent. It&#39;s kind of like....wtf? She flirted with one of the members of my party...who was sitting next to his girlfriend. She also started telling us about how she was glad that the party next to us had left because the little kids had been whiney and loud with none of us prompting her to talk about it. Although, the food was good.<br><br>My previous experience before that, the waiter was really good. I was really difficult &amp; he pulled through fine but he looked really tired &amp; exhausted and I felt bad for him. Also, my chicken in my Pasta Di Vinci was past serving times because it was hard, as though it had been sitting around for longer than it should have been (I know this because I work at a fast food place that serves the same type of chicken).<br><br>There are better Cheesecake Factorys out there. Go to those.

It&#39;s so dark in here (at 7:00 pm). You can barely see the menu, much less the food. If I had known I was going to eat in a cave I would have worn a loincloth.<br><br>Other than that, typical Cheesecake Factory fare.

Ehhh. It&#39;s okay, not great, but okay. Two words = Very Packed. <br><br>They don&#39;t take reservations because they like it when people wait outside. <br><br>I like the complimentary bread. The rest of the food was okay:<br><br>1. Chicken Bellagio = very salty<br>2. Memphis Burger = dry<br>3. Kobe Burger = yum<br>4. Shrimp pasta in white wine sauce = good<br>5. Cheesecakes = yum<br><br>Our order came out late, but the waitress gave us complimentary soup, so that was nice. <br><br>It&#39;s very dark inside. Parking is a hassle especially since it&#39;s holiday shopping season, so I recommend you go at odd hours, if you can. The smaller your party, the easier it is to seat.

I&#39;ve only been to the Cheesecake Factory three times: once in the Pasadena one with my mom and aunt, once in the Americana in Glendale with a few co-workers after the hoilday rush, and recently with a friend whom I haven&#39;t seen in a long time.<br><br>The main reason why I don&#39;t like going to Cheesecake is the prices; it&#39;s kind on the steep side, where a basket of 5 fish and chips is like 10 bucks, but there&#39;s a HUGE helping of coleslaw. Kind of fishy, literally.<br><br>My friend ordered the Santa Fe salad, lunch portion, but he said that the portion seemed WAY too big for lunch.<br><br>The location of this place isn&#39;t too bad, on the outskirts of the Westfield Mall of Santa Anita, which is located right next to the race tracks. Service was great, even though after the bartender checked on us twice, my friend had to go to the bar to place the order.<br><br>Restroom was kind of freaky, how there&#39;s a full-length mirror RIGHT when you enter the Men&#39;s room. Nice to check yourself before leaving, but still, kind of freaky.

vietnamese tacos (sounds gross but SO GOOD - the meat is so bomb) and passionfruit mojito. end of story.<br><br>I hate the awkward servers though...they need more of a personality...everytime I go there I get a weird one.

I like Cheesecake Factory. All places me and my BF went were good, but Arcadia one. <br><br>After finishing my work, me and my BF went to Arcadia Cheesecake Factory. It was around 9pm. They said they would be closed at 10pm.<br><br>We asked our server if we could get bread nicely, she said &#34;No, you guys came too late, the bakery has been closed already.&#34;  <br><br>What&#39;s more, she brought entree and dessert at the same time. After we had one bite of the food, she brought the bill and said &#34;If you don&#39;t mind, will you check out?&#34; No drink riffles and any  good services were done.<br><br>When we were leaving the restaurant, customers who came after us were served fresh bread. We had a terrible experience!<br><br>We talked to her boss, who is the floor manager. We got all money back, but we are still upset.... it is not the money problem, the problem is the unprofessional server. She did not apologize us.<br><br>Never go back there.

I hate to say it, but this is the WORST place to eat in Old Town Pasadena. I&#39;d rather split a ham sandwich in an alley with the homeless man who always has his cat with him!<br><br>I&#39;ve patroned Cheesecake Factory on colorado three times, each experience worse than the one before. The last two times I didn&#39;t even get my food it took so long. The last time I even asked &#34;I need to get back to work in a hour and will need my food within 30 minutes, is that OK?&#34; 50 minutes later I was out the door with a bill for food I never got. If you have less than two hours to wait JUST TO GET YOUR FOOD, then don&#39;t waste your time. Hell don&#39;t waste your time at all with all the great choices to eat at in Pasadena! <br><br>There is no reason to patron a place who doesn&#39;t respect their customers enough to give polite or timely service! Neither myelf nor my coworkers will ever visit this location again and I won&#39;t be sorry to see your doors close forever!

You&#39;re probably wondering...why am I reviewing the Cheesecake Factory? In fact, why am I reviewing the Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia when I, a HB resident, live near one only two minutes away? This one, that one, they&#39;re all the same...so...without further ado:<br><br>I only stopped by for a martini, apparently a martini that even the Abbey, the manufacturer of all things -tini, can&#39;t get quite right. It was the key lime!<br><br>I couldn&#39;t taste the martini at all, extra fruity is always a plus for an alcohol-loving but sensitve to the taste kind of guy like myself. Just the wonderful fruitiness burning my nose! Yum! I was pleasantly surprised as you could tell. And their chocolate mousse cheesecake was great, too. Very rich. I just wanted to let any Cheesecake Factory loving Yelper know that if you&#39;re feeling the thirst for a nice cocktail while dining here, order the key lime! Maybe you like stronger taste in alcohol, but for those with a sensitive appreciation for alcohol (aka lightweights), try it. Actually, everyone try it.

I haven&#39;t really been to Cheesecake in a few years (up until recently), though I did come a lot when I was in middle school. This place is pretty good, and it brings back a lot of memories. <br><br>The service here is great. The waiters and waitresses are always nice. I used to go with 15-20 of my friends back when we were a bit younger, rowdier, and more annoying, and even then, they treated us well. Though there is usually a wait for tables, particularly during mealtimes, they would provide us with a vibrating notifier, which shakes when a table is available. It lets us roam around the mall while we wait, so we will not be bored.<br><br>The food here is delicious as well. I usually order a four-cheese pasta and share it with one or two other people. The portions are large, so even when two or three people are splitting an entree, we get pretty filled up. The appetizers here are wonderful as well.<br><br>However, eating here is a little pricey. Expect to pay at least $15 for lunch per entree, including tax and tip. They used to include tip in the total bill, but now they don&#39;t. Though it&#39;s a bit expensive, I think the portion size makes up for how much it costs.<br><br>Their food and service are great, so I&#39;ll give it 5-stars, even though it&#39;s a little expensive. This is a nice place to go for an occasional treat, and I would definitely return.

Love their pasta carbonara and Boston house salad.  Service is consustantly pleasant.  Food is good and very consistent.  Long waits on weekends and evenings is my only complaint.  Great brunch on Sundays but just get there before 1130.

There was this fat bitch that I knew from high school that worked as a hostess here at this location, it&#39;s a good thing I don&#39;t see her there anymore whenever I&#39;m back in town from SF.<br><br>Look at the 5 stars I dished out, that&#39;s how happy I am.

I go to Cheesecake Factory all the time. By far, this Cheesecake Factory had the worst tasting food ever!! After coming off a great win at Santa Anita race track, we decided to try this Cheesecake Factory. Needless to say, bad choice. My daughter&#39;s noodles were overcooked and had burnt butter on top. She left her pasta there and went to the bathroom because she got sick. My husband ordered pasta as well. His was dry. My salad tasted old. Wood Ranch is right next door. Should have spent my money there!

Yes, I have been to this cheesecake probably 30 times, but just on this trip, I had to yelp!<br><br>what i ordered:<br><br>Renee&#39;s Special (Turkey, Mexican Tortilla Soup, and Caesar Salad!)<br>          Everything was pretty great, except for the soup, it was on the salty side, but the sandwich and salad were perfect!<br><br>My friend ordered the Everything Pizza which was huge and was filled with toppings.<br><br>For dessert:<br>Reeses Peanut Butter Cheesecake!<br>This one is really good, but sweet. I would advise you to share. This one is my favorite, kinda. <br><br>OK. so the reason I had to yelp this trip was because of the service. My waitress was Katie and she IS MY ALL TIME FAVORITE. She was so helpful and funny, and actually had a conversation with us! Now everytime I go, I&#39;ll be searching for Katie. The service from her was SUPER. hehe

Terrible prices and mediocre quality. The young bar tender had a bit of a bitter attitude, which was fine as she might have had a bad day (early in the afternoon btw) but what ticked me off was that she was extremely stingy with the alcohol, which would be fine if only they didn&#39;t charge 15.00 a drink for what felt and tasted like apple juice. The food is not bad but we were there for drinks. I tried to talk to the manager about the drinks and he replied by saying that there is only a specific amount they are required to pour, which I assume is not even an ounce of liqour. For 15 dollars I&#39;d red flag this place. Rip off!!! Not recommended

everytime i dine at cheesecake factory (any of their locations) i have a good time. yes it gets pretty loud and you can barely hear your friends talking and end up shouting across table, but overall it&#39;s a comfortable place. <br><br>my all time favorites are as follows:<br>their brown bread - i usually just tell them to only bring out their brown bread.<br>santa fe salad<br>chipotle chicken pasta<br>vanilla bean cheesecake - it&#39;s light. not too sweet and heavy like....for example... the godiva one, that one, i literally need milk to eat w/ it. <br><br>try to avoid fri / sat nights.. if u do come on those nights.. come early!

Got myself the LUAU salad. Crispy wontons with a great crunch and their soup of the day the Broccoli and Cheese. The soup tasted soo good. Very thick yes but it felt like you were eating pure broccoli so its more healthy. Tasted soo yummy, I wanted to lick the bowl. Did i?? NOOOOOO! I said wanted to ...haah<br><br>Not as much cheese and water like some places I have been to. Some places are pretty watered down. Tasted more like broccoli and a hint of cheese. Man it was soo good! ORDER IT! <br><br>Waitress was super nice. Too bad i don&#39;t know her name. She didn&#39;t introduce herself. They were very accommodating and helpful when ordering. GOOD FOOD thank you!

Dude - 2.5 stars?? Whats up with the rating.. Cheesecake factory is BOMB ~<br><br>Anyway.. besides the waiters sometimes effin up my order.. everything else is pretty gravy. Waiters are always super polite - the food is always yummy.. and it has a great atmosphere. Not exactly worth going to on the weekends - Lines just are not my thing,<br>But definitely after work.. on a weeknight is great. Portions are huge.. so no need to worry about lunch tomorrow :]<br><br>I recommend -<br>Appetizer <br>Avacodo eggrolls<br>Ahi Tuna carpaccio - omg .. it feels like heaven

Forgot my wallet, was asked for my id, was rejected a drink. All well and good no problem. Went to the bar, got a drink with out ID. Sat down at my table, 5 min later the manager asked for my id, when I couldn&#39;t present it she took my beer from me and didn&#39;t refund it. Despicable service. Would rather harass you over semantics than allow you to enjoy a meal.  Will never return.

We have been coming here forever for dinner but it is our first time for happy hours. Silly me, I thought it was only for adults and didn&#39;t know children are allowed. 4 stars  for these appetizers 1) buffalo chicken stuffed with cheese for $5 dollars. It was yummy and the portion is perfect. 2)Tex Mex roll . 3 stars for sliders. The small dishes are expensive and small 1)crab bite , 2) beet salad, 3)flat bread is a joke. $6 for smaller than a slice of pizza! can not imagine why anybody would pay regular price. I like the deep fried combo; avocado, mushroom and zucchini but at $7 for happy hours is still not cheap.I wish they offer deep fried calamari, onion rings, chicken wings and soup for appetizer&#39;s (Yard house). drinks  for $5 is good. 3 # stars rating is for happy hours only.

I don&#39;t have good experiences at Cheesecake Factory already but this location just made me realized I shouldn&#39;t return under any circumstances. The server was rude and the foods are terrible. She kept coming back to rush us to order the drinks, appetizers, then entrees so you can get out of there ASAP. If you are in a rush and don&#39;t care what you are eating then this is a place for you.<br><br>We went as party of 8, to celebrate a friend&#39;s birthday. We ordered 3 appetizer and 5 entree to share. 3 out 5 entree are pasta, the pasta are very salty. We told our waitress about it then she came back with an attitudes and said the pasta are perfectly fine. She offered us to order something else on the menu but the foods are so salty so we asked for the check. We waited 15-25 mins wondering where was our check then realized she left the check on our table without notifying any of us. We left Cheesecake Factory and went somewhere else to finished our dinner.

Came here with my honey this past weekend.<br><br>My knife looked dirty. The waiter had to replace my utensils.<br><br>I asked for green tea and the waiter brought me mint tea. At least he was not color blind but can&#39;t read.<br><br>Service was ok. For some reason, it was not crowded at all, Where did everyone go? Maybe it has something to do with the Full moon! Ha! Ha!<br><br>I had Tiramisu again. The next day, I got sick again. I really think the cream is spoiled. I never have problem with tiramisu from Olive Gardens.<br><br>Come to think of it, maybe it was the claim chowder that got me sick.

The service is excellent (: The food is yummy, of course and the bread they serve first is soft and hot.<br><br>I usually order Thai Chicken Pasta which always makes me full at the end xD I don&#39;t know why everyone&#39;s giving this a bad review o.o This place is realllly good! The only thing is that it cost a lot, but overall it&#39;s pretty good and they have a lot of varieties of food (: There&#39;s rice, pasta, soups, and more!<br><br>This place is a good place to chill and relax with your family (: I usually go with my family once a month or if we have time. Even though it&#39;s really good, it cost a lot for somethign you would usually go. Good food and service (:

What is there to say about a Cheesecake Factory? There are a ton of options on the menu, most all of which contain a zillion calories and are safe/bland. The decor is welcoming and clean. The prices are not too bad. The cheesecake is really the only reason to come. It is as corporate and plain as chain restaurants get, but is slightly better than its competition.

Sat down during happy hour and 40 mins in no food. Pretty disappointed . Asked for refill on water 20 mins and counting . This is sad lol . Table next to us sat down same time as us and had the food came in less than 10 mins.

This is one of the better Cheesecake Factory locations out there.  It is located on the south side, near the east end of the Santa Anita Mall.<br><br>The restaurant has a grandiose facade, with a modern, trendy front end.  The furniture were new and clean.  The lighting is perfectly dim, and the table that I was at offered lots of privacy, where I can&#39;t hear the conversation from the table next to mine.<br><br>The food was good.  The Santa Fe Salad was fresh and crispy, and the endless strawberry lemonade that I got had the perfect blend of sweet and sour.  The complimentary bread and butter were nice and fresh as well.<br><br>Service by Natalie was top-notch.  The bread kept on coming because my coworkers were hogs.  I had a couple of strawberry lemonade refills, but I never had to ask because the server was always near my table and very attentive.

Talk about worse of the worse after eating here it ruined my whole day! Had lunch here the other day and ordered a Cuban sandwich the bread was so hard I had to rip most of it off. I complained to the waiter and then the manager came over also, all they did was apologize and offer to make me another sandwich. Really u want me to wait here and have another crappy sandwich and and risk u probably doing something to my food? Uhh no thanks but what really ticked me off was I was charged still full price no discount or anything else on the bill. Never coming here again.

This place is excellent, they treat me and my boyfriend with awesome food. I love ordering a blue moon and eating their delicious shepherds pie. The portions are huge and it&#39;s worth the money. You can eat outside, they have outdoor heating lamps that keep you warm and toasty in the winter. The bar is awesome and I love that they have a tv if you want to watch a game. I love this place! The staff is so sweet, kind, and friendly. I recommend coming to this place, but be sure to call in advance because it&#39;s always busy. After all, they not only make good food, they make excellent desserts.

Great happy hour menu from yummy appetizers and delicious drinks!!! Great place to meet up with friends after a long day of shopping. I love there southern fried chicken sliders, fried macaroni, factory nachos, crispy cab wontons, and buffalo blasts!!!mmmm yummy and for drinks cosmopolitan, lemonade margarita, long island ice tea. How could i forget the cheescake the best cheescakes are made here they are orgasmic!!!Also the service is always great always feel welcomed and they check up on us to see if were doing ok need anything else...A+ great place to watch sports games in bar area great vibes recommend this place!!!

Three stars because this place is always packed! The waiting time is always about 30 mins. And the customer service is bad!!!!!!!!!! <br><br>Besides that, the food is good. Loved their salmon with rice, it was tender and juicy..just the way I like it. I also love their chicken sandwich with avocado its perfect! Also the wheat bread they give u, its pretty good also. Love their cheesecakes they are made to perfection!

This Cheesecake Factory always has great service and good food.  Like all Cheesecake Factory locations, the portions are big and filling. <br><br>My wife and I had dinner at The Cheesecake Factory in Arcadia, CA on a Friday night.  We got there around 7pm.  There was still plenty of parking and we did not have to wait long to be seated. <br><br>Every staff member was friendly and polite. <br><br>Our server was a nice young lady named Taylor.  She was extremely courteous and considerate.  She was very patient.  <br><br>My wife ordered the pasta carbonara.  It was very delicious.  <br><br>I ordered the hibachi steak.  I thought it was a little sweet, but the meat was tender and the mashed potatoes tasted wonderfully.  I especially liked the tempura asparagus. <br><br>For dessert we ordered the 30th anniversary cheesecake.  It was rich and heavenly.  <br><br>More customers were showing up later in the night and it got a little noisy, but nothing too bad considering it was a Friday night.  <br><br>I highly recommend this Cheesecake Factory.  You&#39;ll never leave hungry.

the food is good although they&#39;re very.....bad for you hahaha<br>the waitress I had was great! sorry I forgot her name...but she was super friendly and very efficient! usually they&#39;re pretty slow....so 4 stars!

Cheesecake factory is a good restaurant for a not-too-expensive first date. The food is nicely plated. Patio seating is good during summer time. They invested a lot of money in the interior decoration of the restaurant giving it an upscale ambience. Food is above average, generally NOT healthy. The dishes I recommend are: <br><br>Cobb salad, Luau Salad: these are entree salad that will fill you up! With the dressing, calorie count is almost the same as a burger with fries. Have dressing on the side and go easy, so you won&#39;t ruin a week&#39;s workout with one meal. <br><br>Shrimp Scampi: good and buttery. Usually served with mash potato or linguini, subsitute for veggies as a healthier option. <br><br>Steak Diane: It&#39;s served with Madeira wine sauce with mushrooms, sweet and savory. sauce can be greasy some times, but flavor is good. <br><br>New Orlean Shrimp: good cajun flavor, light and not greasy. It&#39;s one of my favorites!<br><br>Gumbo with Chicken and Shrimp: simillar to New Orlean shrimp, but it has heavy cream. Recommended if you are in for something hearty. <br><br>I can go on and on because their menu is so big. I love the brunch menu. Recommend the Baja Chicken Hash, Egg&#39;s Benedict. <br><br>Of course, don&#39;t forget Cheesecake. They are yummy but each slice has  800 to 1200 calories!! Remember to get a slice to share and not to over eat! Remember a moment on the lips, forever on the hips!!

4 stars for the food, 2 stars for the service, so I give it three stars to go in between.<br><br>First off, I&#39;d like to talk about the service.  After my entree was served, the waiter forgot to give me my steak knife.  No big deal, right?  I let that slide.  However, while giving our food to the waiter to pack in togo boxes, he gave us the wrong box and mixed ours up with another table...  so we had to wait awhile to get it fixed.<br><br>So enough of my whining about the service.  The food was good. <br>-Filet mignon was a good size and very soft.  It cut like butter.  <br>-Fish tacos were okay...  the tortilla was a little stale.<br>-Avocado Egg Rolls are ALWAYS amazing here.<br>-The Roasted Vegetable Pizza was really good for a vegetarian pizza.<br><br>Overall, this place gets 3 stars because of the &#39;meh&#39; service and good food.

I would just like to say that the sauce that goes with the avocado egg rolls...is the best thing that ever happened to my LIFE I asked the waiter to let me take some home. It is THAT GOOD. <br><br>I also love the TURTLE cheesecake. <br><br>That is all I have to say about that.

My family and I went to the Cheesecake Factory last night, there were FIVE of us.  We sat on the patio, Jeff was our server.  The funny thing was we really enjoyed Jeff, he was polite and prompt and got all our food right, which can be an inconsistency there. My family and I are playful with our servers, my brother and I are servers ourselves so we want to make the experience enjoyable for everyone. Well, we thanked Jeff for everything and said we had great service, however, when he brings the bill gratuity was added.  It clearly states it is added for parties of SIX or more. So Jeff and apparently the manager agreed to add gratuity.  This is hugely disappointing, for some reason Jeff and the manager judged my family and thinking we would not tip.  We did not say anything, nor want anything for the disappointment, we just will not go back.  We are great tippers and would have actually tipped a lot more than what was added, but the principle of the matter is he did not deserve it after all.  That shows poor character on JEFF and the restaurant.<br> Being the industry for a long time I have heard that this Cheesecake Factory Location is the one of the SLOWEST and now I know why, with attitudes like this no one will trust them. Who wants to give their hard earned money to people that are ungrateful? NOT ME!!!

Never went to a dine in restaurant with over 10 plus flys flying around and just crawling around the mirrors where the food would come out. Found it quite disgusting having to hit away flys while trying to eat and conversate all at the same time. When telling the waiter he was already aware of the situation. Cheesecake Factory should get rid of the situation because that is really unsanitary and can cause poor reviews.

More and more I&#39;m seeing restaurants jack up the prices and give less food for it. On 8/31/2015 we went  to the Arcadia Cheesecake Factory for dinner and I ordered the Pit Beef Dip sandwich. I chose the salad over the fries. I asked if I can have iceberg lettuce instead of the typical bitter lettuce they serve. The waitress brought a very small bowl of just iceberg lettuce. No cucumber, no tomato, no croutons, or anything else! To top it off, I noticed the very, very small sandwich on my plate. We&#39;re talking Mac Donald&#39;s small cheeseburger size with a little bit of meat and onions, and a small 1oz saucer of the dip. I&#39;m not kidding. I&#39;ve had roast beef sandwiches, but this was a joke. I wish I was joking for paying $14!  I informed the waitress that this was not at all what I was expecting.  She said well our normal greens come with the vegetables you want, but you ordered iceberg sir. Yes, I replied, I asked for a iceberg &#34;Salad&#34;. Not a small bowl for a turtle to feed off of lettuce only. Wow! The manager delivered the same size bowl of lettuce with the addition of vegetables this time. I informed him right off that I was not trying to be rude, but for $14 this was a very small portion of food. The manager had a smug look on his face acting like this was actually normal. He was NOT apologetic and asked if there was something else I wanted. I said no thank you, and told him that I was giving feedback only. Now I know it&#39;s not the manager&#39;s fault, and not the waitresses fault regarding the serving of food we get. But the fact that the waitress got smart and brought me iceberg lettuce only, with the addition of the manger&#39;s smug attitude. We&#39;re talking triple FAIL at this Cheesecake Factory. NO THANK YOU...NOT AGAIN!

Ordered steak dinner; gf had some pasta dish.  For ~$50 I expected much better.<br><br>Also the bread was delivered after our food arrived--we had to remind our waitress when she was the one who asked us if we wanted any in the first place.

I go to Cheesecake Factory locations when I am in the area of one. I tried this particular one. It was the worst. The server was not professional. Our food was &#34;to go&#34; but when I inspected it the fries were old and cold, as was the burger.  I waited too long for that so I requested my money back and did not even take the food. Would you believe they refused to refund all the money and kept $1??? Wrong on so many levels. The manager didn&#39;t help so we left and tell anyone we can not to go there.

I&#39;ve always enjoyed going to Cheesecake Factory since I was living back home in Chicago.  Then when I moved out here to CA, I still enjoy going to eat at one.  I&#39;ve been to the one in Huntington Beach, Old Town Pasadena and this one in Arcadia at the Santa Anita Westfield Mall.  Tonight, my hubby and I went during dinner time and like we expected it, there was a long wait of people hovering around once we opened the door.  Everyone standing around with their table buzzer in hand.  The front desk girl informed my hubby, the wait would be about 30min.  But since we said we are open for the 1st available table, we got a table right away and didn&#39;t have to wait instead we got a table at their outdoor seating area.  Even though it was cold outside tonight, we were willing to sit outside since they have the large heater lamps.  Our server, was a sweet blondie name Danielle.  She was very nice and good at her job.  She always made sure my hubby and I were doing good, and kept on coming back to check up on us and refilled our bread and his drink.  Our yummy chicken samosas came out nice and warm, and was quite tasty as we&#39;ve never had it there before.  It was under their &#34;small plate &amp; snack&#34; section for just $5.95, more inexpensive than their appetizer section by far and just enough for the two of us.  Eating too much appetizer can fill you up fast, and then you won&#39;t have room for your entrees.  We both ended up having a pasta dish, I stuck with my usual which was the crusted chicken romano with a side of spaghetti and he got the Louisiana chicken dish with bowtie pasta.  We both enjoyed our dinner and our customer service by the front desk staff and our server Danielle was awesome.  Two thumbs up, and we&#39;ll continue being customers with Cheesecake Factory!

Used to be better. Food is barely average now. Food taste old and bread taste stale. If you want mediocre food, this is the spot. There&#39;s nothing outstanding. I usually come here and get the pear/cranberry salad (forgot the name) and my friends would order form their breakfast menu. Although food and service is just OK, I would come here for the ambiance. I like how it feels on a Sunday morning eating outdoors or indoors at this location.

A lot of good stuff and variety here, but a couple issues. They have an entire page of pasta dishes but NO whole wheat option? Not even one kind for a substitution, in SoCal, no less? Please, join the 21st century, how much trouble can it be? But the larger issue is - when I asked for a comment card to make a suggestion the waitress told me I can go home and go to their website! So no method for customer input in the actually restaurant tells me that they don&#39;t really care what customers think. There are plenty of competitors who DO care about customers, sorry !

Before you all think I&#39;m just hating, please read the whole review. <br><br>In my opinion, this is one of the best chains (and it seems like one of the most successful) of restaurants out there. I&#39;ve always loved Cheesecake factory! The food, especially considering the ridiculously and maybe even overly exaggerated menu selections usually always taste fantastic, and their consistently the same, any location you go to!<br><br>Amazing ambiance, usually good service and again, awesome food. With all that being said...the last time my girlfriend and I went, we were seated outside and waited for at LEAST 30 minutes until we finally just got up and left. I&#39;m sorry, service (and very rarely...food) comes first! How many times have you frequented a business with excellent service but with only mediocre products? Bad service leaves a bad taste in my mouth, sorry.<br><br>Ironically, I think the fact that Cheesecake Factory prides themselves on good service it maybe the very reason I give them 2 stars. I mean I may give McDonalds five stars even if I get bad service...because I don&#39;t goto McDonalds for them to smile at me...I go for the fries!!!

Sometime I come here on the weekend, it&#39;s always crowded.<br><br>The food is pretty good. Cheesecakes are awesome, esp. the keylime and coconut... yummie!!!<br><br>It&#39;s right by the mall, so shop and dine at the same place... hehe.. <br><br>me like!!!

Well the first thing im gonna say is this isn&#39;t called the cheesecake factory for their salads, lmao.. so when you come here get the cheesecake! <br><br>All of them are good, so take a wild pick, cause theres easily 25 different kind of cheesecake. I know, how to make a decision?!<br><br>The menu here is just way too big, but that makes it easier when your in the mood for something specific.<br><br>I&#39;ve tried the burgers. theyre okay. the salads are huge.  the fish tacos are very good for it not being a fish place. My favorite entree would have tot be theyre pastas. oh my are they delish. Especially the alfredo chicken. Mmm, mmm good. Easily two people can finish one entree. My favorite app would be the fried mac n cheese. Get it! I could eat those everyday. Too bad they are a heart attack on a plate.<br><br>Always iven great service, but theres something always missing. maybe the waitresses dont give it that extra umph, or aren&#39;t warm enough.. im not too sure but i always leave satisfied food wise but not service wise.<br><br>Its a beautiful building, that has tons of seating. Coming here on a weekend night, expect to wait 45 minutes or longer.
Good spot to bring the family, love the appetizers and the mizo salmon plate..

The service here was horrible. Working at a restaurant myself I was not satisfied with the service that they provided. The server was rude and looked like she hated her job. I shouldn&#39;t have tipped her the amount I did. Totally not worth the money spent !!!

Lets see, Cheesecake factory in Arcadia is not bad at all compared to the Old Town Pasadena location which is usually super crowded. <br><br>I had dinner there this past weekend and our server was great. Our party was seated outside patio and usually from my past experience, servers usually don&#39;t check up enough on the outdoor customers but not in this case. He was efficient at servicing drinks and entrees. <br><br>The food is pretty darn good and the cheesecake is another story (drool).. <br><br>Recommendations: <br>Miso Salmon<br>Renee&#39;s Special<br>Key Lime Cheesecake or Strawberry Cheesecake<br><br>TRUST!

Consistantly good food.  Chicken Madiera and Fettuccini with chicken and sun dried tomatoes especially good.  Caesar salad also good. Large portions- you&#39;ll have to  take half home.<br><br>Always good service.

My first visit here was so-so. I had the Chicken Madeira. First taste was great, but bite after bite i could taste the weird-alcohol tasting part of the dish. It made me a bit head-achey. However, i enjoyed eating the delicious mashed potatoes. <br><br>My next two visits here was actually very good! It&#39;s the type of dish you order is what makes the Cheesecake Factory worth the long wait! My first visit i got Farfalle and it was DELICIOUS! Its a rich-creamy white sauce with peas, bacon, bow-tie pasta, and more that i can&#39;t remember:) Talking about it makes me drool! <br><br>Third visit was great as well. I had Chicken Marsala and its very good! It has a light taste to it, but very pleasing. It had chicken over it which made it even more appetizing! The waiter was also very nice, connecting with us and getting our requests very fast. <br><br>AS FOR CHEESECAKES, THEY ARE THE BEST CHEESECAKES!!! MUST order one when you come here. I love the Vanilla bean cheesecake. I get it every time now.

Been coming here for a couple years now and have to say I enjoy alot of the food here, and the cheesecake is great especially the Adams peanut butter yum! .Try to come before everyone gets off work if not you&#39;ll be waiting for a bit and the parking sucks major, but the service is good and they give you bread while you wait&#34;white bread&#34; &#34;orowheat&#34; are the two which are good.

We came for a friend&#39;s birthday and the wait was relatively fast considering the large group we had.  The food is pretty pricey but they do have a lot of items on the special menu.  I ordered the Chicken Tostada Salad because of the amazing reviews from others.  To my amazement I was quiet happy with the dish.  <br><br>Then for dessert my friend ordered the red velvet cheesecake.  After the first bite I&#39;ve seriously become a huge fan of cheesecake factory&#39;s desserts.  It was a bit on the sweat side but the cheesecake packed a huge punch with sweetness and deliciousness.

I ordered the fettuccini Alfredo, which wasn&#39;t good to be honest, and half way through my meal there was a HAIR in my food!!! I was so disguised! They waiter AND manager had the nerve to ask me if it was mine! I have long blonde hair and the hair that I found was short and black! They brought out a new dish to apologize but they charged me for the new dish! It should have been free! This was my first and last time here!

Once in a while you get bad service but overall i love this location.  Food can also depend on which chef is working as ive had the same dish with different experiences.  They have a sunday brunch dish with pancakes and they were really good.  Highly recommend.

I have been going to this Cheesecake Factory for years and years and I&#39;ve never been disappointed. The wait time is never long, service is great, food is amazing, and portions are hearty.<br><br>I like to order burgers from them (smokehouse bbq burger, mmmm), although their pastas and other entrees are all delicious. I recommend their soups too, they are really thick, creamy and delicious. Love the portion size in this place, I am always filled up. Actually, I&#39;ve always been so full by the end of my meal that I&#39;ve never had enough room to actually order a cheesecake from them, haha.<br><br>They bring out food really quickly too and the waiters/waitresses are always very helpful. Although it&#39;s a little pricey (around $15 a plate), the quality and portion size totally make it worth it.<br><br>Not sure if other Cheesecake Factory&#39;s are this great, but I definitely love this place in particular and would recommend it to anyone.

I would love to give 5 stars because my server was amazing but the host group however was not. A 20min wait for two needed up a 45min to an hour wait. The host seated three parties of two or more who arrived after me. I had to ask where I was on the list and they proceeded to seat me on the patio that was empty the entire time. My servers name was Louis. He was GREAT! Never needed to ask for a refill or more bread he was on it!
The host was unpleasant and did not even try to get the table I requested when there were 3 empty tables. I am disappointed because I am a good customer.

First off, the décor is gorgeous. I don&#39;t know the correct term to describe it- very European and old-worldly. It kinda reminded me of some of those casinos in Vegas actually. This Cheesecake Factory is located adjacent to the Santa Anita mall and is much bigger than the one in Pasadena A bunch of co-workers and I came on a weekday for lunch so it wasn&#39;t busy at all and there was plenty of parking. The server was nice enough, even helping to pour the ketchup for us (the secret is to hit the &#34;57&#34; on the bottle). But since he already earned his 18% gratuity due to our large group, he probably wasn&#39;t as attentive as he could have been. <br><br>The menu is extensive, which is probably part of the appeal of the Cheesecake Factory, everything from pasta to comfort food to Asian dishes.  I&#39;ve been there many times and have yet to even try a quarter of the menu. But first came the bread and drinks. The strawberry lemonade is delicious - not as good as Red Robins (who puts actual strawberries in the drink). It was pricey at almost five dollars but still managed to hit the spot. And one of my favorite parts of the meal is the dark bread (rye?). I could pretty much live on that bread. One downside is that the food took awhile to come out so I filled up on the bread, lemonade and their free refills. I ended up getting a pizzette from their new small plate and snacks menu ($3.95 -$6.50), which are advertised as appetizers and I think just the right size if you want a light lunch. Or in my case, because I wanted to save room for cheesecake. The rest of the group got a variety of pastas and sandwiches off the lunch special menus. The portions are still ginormous and the presentation of the food was very nice too.  The pizzette was good - thin crust with sausage and ricotta cheese, not too oily with about 5 small slices. Then I ordered the 30th anniversary chocolate cake cheesecake. It was definitely rich with four layers of chocolate, fudge, cheese and heaven but so amazing. Yeah so much good food and I still ended up taking half of my pizza and cheesecake home. I also got to try the white chocolate macadamia nut cheesecake, which was yummy as well. Although I haven&#39;t eaten many kinds of cheesecake I haven&#39;t liked. <br><br>Overall, a pleasant lunch. And you must save room for their cheesecake. But probably only good for special events or an occasional lunch because it&#39;ll make a small dent in your wallet and a small bulge in your tummy.
My favorite place to eat lunch wasnt impressed with the crab artichoke dip but other than that Ive yet to be disapointed!

i have never had a bad experience at the Cheesecake Factory before, and in fact, we have dine here quite often.  last night, i went there for dinner with my boyfriend. i had no problem with my order but my boyfriend found a long white thick piece of paper in his fettuccine Alfredo with chicken. the paper was about 6inch long. we immediately sent the dish back and the manager came by to explain where the paper came from. she said, the pastas had those papers in between to keep them separated and sometimes those papers get stuck with the pasta and the cooks forget to remove them. my boyfriend did not want the same dish anymore so he switched his order to steak Dianne. when they delivered the dish, they didn&#39;t even bring a steak knife or offered him if he wanted steak sauce. <br>although the staffs were apologetic about this matter, we left the restaurant feeling unsatisfied. we were really nice about the whole matter and did not make a scene about it. although we were not charged for the fettuccine alfredo, we were charged for the steak he ordered. i felt as though, they should not even charged him for the steak because they had ruined our appetite.  they did not even offer us dessert on the house. thumbs down.

First off Cheesecake Factory, I&#39;d like to know if you hire your employees straight out of the circus ? Because I&#39;ve never met such a clown, as manger (Amber Knowles). Not only is she rude and inconsiderate but she&#39;s a liar. I placed an order three hours in advance for a happy birthday cheesecake with a happy birthday plaque (that I payed extra for) that should have said &#34;Happy 14th Birthday Meyance&#34; but when I got home it said &#34;Happy Bday Neyance&#34; with a horribly written &#34;14&#34; in the corner, honestly, it could of been mistaken for a 19. Who the hell they got writing on the cakes ? Because they need to get fired along with Amber. I repeated my order and the birthday girls name 3 times, you would think they would get it right and the most Amber can say is &#34;I understand&#34; like okay? I don&#39;t need you to understand I need you to make it right. I told her I was coming back even though I live 30 minutes away and wanted a full refund because I didn&#39;t touch that small ass 7-inch cheesecake that was 27 damn dollars. And she told me the most she can do is give me a gift card? I almost lost my damn mind. Like I said I live 30 minutes away, and I never come to Cheesecake Factory... How you gonna take my money, mess my order up and think you&#39;re not gonna refund my money? I have my receipt &amp; I will be getting my full refund, because a claim has been made with corporate. Overall horrible experience should of got zero stars.

Am I the only one that leaves Cheesecake Factory sleepy almost 100% of the time? I&#39;m sitting at my desk at work on the cusp of falling asleep... it just never fails. Anyway... this cheesecake factory was nothing special, same decor, same ads in the menu.... no variety and distinction whatsoever. What else can you expect from a chain?<br><br>I get the same thing all the time here: Passion Fruit Iced Tea and Shrimp Scampi. Taste is consistent amongst all CF&#39;s - so that&#39;s always good.<br><br>Not my favorite restaurant, but highly suggest for a random lunch or dinner. Although, seeing as to how they&#39;re next door to Woodranch, I think I would much rather go there. HAHA.. Sorry, Cheesecake Factory!

One of my favorite places to dine in when I&#39;m in the neighborhood. The staff is extremely friendly and I&#39;m still impressed by the little remotes they hand you in case there&#39;s a wait for a table on a busy night (especially on weekends). It vibrates and flashes when a table is ready for you and your party. Whether you come by yourself, with a date, or with a large group, the service is always impeccable and the atmosphere is classy but somewhat loud. The hostesses may not be warm, but every waitress/waiter I&#39;ve had were upbeat and helpful. <br><br>The food here is excellent and anything you order comes in VERY generous portions for the price you pay relative to other restaurants. I can never finish a plate of food by myself and neither can most of my friends. My usual (&amp; safe order) would be the Fettucini with Chicken and Sun-Dried Tomatoes. It&#39;s exactly what the name says but without the word &#34;delicious,&#34; but don&#39;t bite into the tomatoes expecting something sweet because they&#39;re pretty sour. I&#39;ve also had the Blackened Chicken Sandwich that comes with fries. It&#39;s served cut into two pieces and the sandwich itself is too big for me to take an actual bite out of it so it&#39;s a little messy to eat. I have to actually plan and work at eating it without getting pieces inside the sandwich from spewing out. Also, it&#39;s a very filling meal so it&#39;s probably best to share with a special someone or just a friend. If not, ask for the check and the waiter/waitress will happily box it up for you to-go! Just be careful with the sandwich though because the sauce soaks up into the bread really quickly, and before you know it, you&#39;ll have a soggy sandwich.

Went last night for a B-day dinner late:<br><br>Good: <br>-Food tasted great<br>-Dessert was amazing<br>-Friends where wonderful as usual<br>-Service was attentive (although not sure what she was saying and I am good with Asian accents)<br>-Got about $20 comp. (see bad)<br><br>Bad:<br>-Found a Hair (long hair not my own beard hair) in one of my slider burgers<br>-Long Island Ice Tea tasted like Lemonade and rather than make it stronger the bar tender insisted it has 2 shots of alcohol in it and wouldn&#39;t do anything to fix that<br><br>Felt bad for our server cause it was like the bartender and cooks where really working hard to F her over on her tip, none of that stuff was her fault so we gave her a nice tip anyway<br><br>Over all had fun, ate too much and had a funny hair reference to joke about all night...like Neil Patrick Harris Says, &#34; Yeah I want some burgers, Fur Burgers!!!!&#34;

Long lines. Good food. Worth it.<br><br>CF has always been one of my favorite restaurants, so I don&#39;t really mind the long waits. I came here on Thursday night and there was no line at all. <br><br>I usually just order some sort of pasta, but I probably tried all the pasta dishes on the menu.. so I decided to try something else. I got the Renee&#39;s Special and I am so happy with my decision! It comes with a cup of the soup of the day, salad, and a half of a sandwich. I have no complaints about the soup and the salad, but the turkey sandwich was a bit dry IMO. :\ <br><br>Some of my favorites at CF :<br>Louisana Ckn Pasta<br>Pasta Da Vinci <br>Buffalo Blasts<br>Fried Calamari<br>Factory Nachos<br>Shrimp Scampi <br>Spicy Ckn Chipotle Pasta<br><br>A+ on the environment &amp; service!

Food is overpriced. I&#39;d rather eat next door at woodranch. Then I&#39;d come over for their cheesecake. Anything with Oreos is bombayyyyy. Anyway. Just come for desserts. So good that it makes up for grrible food. Fish sucks steak sucks. Drinks are standard for a finer diner. Just desserts.

Cheesecake Factory is a little lackluster for me. I used to love this place... but recently, the food is just blah. Plus I got a mudpie dessert but sub&#39;d the pie with chris&#39;s crazy chocolate cake.... and there was something in there... like a foil or something.... ew. <br><br>The service is usually good. I like their large menu and portions. But really the only thing that I think is super yummy is their cheesecake.

A friend  ask me for lunch at this Arcadia location. Normally i wouldn&#39;t want to go  there because i seen how crowded they can get  and they dont except reservations. But this was Tuesday, around 1pm so i decided to go.<br><br>When i got there, i found the place to be pretty empty, which is a good thing because who wants to wait? we were seated by a hostess.given menus by a waitress then she told us another waitress will be taken over for her.  o.k no problem<br><br>On to the menu: it&#39;s like  reading a magazine, it went on and on and on.........had to tell   the waitress , i needed more time but i ordered a drink--The Ultimate Margarita ( sounds good right?) i get back to that<br><br>my friend ordered Lunch Special: 1/2 sandwich, salad.soup<br>i ordered: Kobe burger on Broiche bun with fries from under specialties..i ordered  the burger to be  cook medium, after she asked ...how i wanted done<br><br>Back to the Drink: It was small glass. too much ice, your basic water down weak drink. it was just WEAK.........<br><br>The Food:  My friend  seem happy with his food. it would be hard to F* up a  1/2 turkey sandwich, soup, salad.<br>My Food: well, the kobe burger on toasted broiche which they say on the menu came out on a  sesame bun. i didn&#39;t say anything to the food runner who brought  us the food or to the waitress . It&#39;s not their fault..it&#39;s the kitchen fault..<br><br>She never ask me if i wanted another drink--Which is fine by me , because who want to pay $$ for a slightly flavor water?<br><br>Overall: it was o.k food ,nothing special. Would i be thinking about   going there next time to eat or have a drink?  NO<br>Will i go and buy cheesecake at the counter? YES<br><br>I would have given this place 3 stars but i&#39;m only giving 2 because they serve me sesame bun, when it  printed broiche bun on the menu..and the Super WEAK drink

I usually come here for their lunch specials, and cheesecake of course.<br><br>When I&#39;m in a salad mood, I prefer the Luau Salad because it&#39;s like a fruity salad in your mouth-- it&#39;s filled with walnuts, sweet sauce, wonton chips(?), and some fruits. I really really really enjoy this cause it&#39;s absolutely delicious and huge.<br><br>When I&#39;m in a pasta mood, I prefer the Chicken Bellagio. It has two fried chicken breasts, some sort of yummy ham with spinach, and a whole lotta pasta. THIS DISH WILL DEFINITELY FILL YOU UP, cause when I&#39;m done with this dish I feel absolutely conquered.<br><br>As for their cheesecakes, I prefer the Craig&#39;s Crazy Carrot Cheesecake. It has some cheesecake and carrotcake mixed together. Out of most of the time, I prefer this cheesecake.<br><br>Overall, I do enjoy Cheesecake Factory for their lunch portions because it&#39;s not too expensive.
